title: Taxes, Sales - As introduced, extends existing law that allows persons receiving FEMA assistance from May 2010 flood damage to apply for sales tax refunds for certain residential purchases; permits refunds for eligible purchases made between October 1, 2010, and May 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Highway Signs - As enacted, designates "Benjamin C. "Pat" Hartman, Jr. Memorial Bridge" on S.R. 386 in Sumner County. -

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, requires the commissioner to study the feasibility of sunsetting sales exemptions on a staggered schedule to be followed by their reauthorization every 10 years. - Amends TCA Title 67.

Veterans' Affairs, Dept. of - As enacted, renames the "Tennessee distinguished service medal" as the "Tennessee fallen heroes medal". - Amends TCA Section 8-30-306; Section 49-7-102; Title 58, Chapter 7; Title 58, Chapter 3 and Section 67-5-704.

Workers Compensation - As introduced, increases the time in which the secretary of state has to return an application for a construction services provider's workers' compensation exemption from 10 to 14 days. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.

Campaigns and Campaign Finance - As introduced, increases contribution limits by 20% and then ties future increases to reflect change in the CPI; allows corporations to contribute to candidates. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

Campaigns and Campaign Finance - As enacted, increases contribution limits to reflect change in the CPI; allows corporations to contribute to candidates; revises certain other provisions regarding campaign funds. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

Salaries and Benefits - As introduced, authorizes an employer subject to certain state employment law penalties to send written notification of the employer's intention to challenge the assessment of penalties electronically to an e-mail address designated by the commissioner of labor and workforce development. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 50.
Salaries and Benefits - As introduced, requires employers to pay tipped employees wages at a rate of at least $6.55 per hour. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 2.
Education - As introduced, requires the commissioner of education to submit annual report as of each December 1, rather than November 1. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Traffic Safety - As enacted, broadens requirement that drivers exercise due care to apply to bicyclists; enhances penalty for certain traffic violations that cause serious bodily injury or death. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

Revenue, Dept. of - As enacted, authorizes the issuance of revenue or letter rulings on an expedited basis; allows the commissioner to determine a reasonable fee for such service, subject to certain specified maximum amounts. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 1.

Revenue, Dept. of - As enacted, allows taxpayers and the commissioner or the commissioner's delegate to enter into agreements extending the one-year statute of limitations period for filing suits in chancery court challenging denied claims for refund. - Amends TCA Section 67-1-1802.

Local Government, General - As enacted, adds a "family recreation center" to the list of establishments within 1,000 feet of which an adult-oriented establishment or adult cabaret is prohibited from locating. - Amends TCA Title 7.

Regional Authorities and Special Districts - As enacted, reconstitutes the board of directors for the Four Lake regional industrial development authority and makes certain other changes concerning the management of the authority.  - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29, Part 2 and Title 64, Chapter 5, Part 2.

Forfeiture of Assets - As introduced, provides that an officer making a lawful stop or detaining a person who violates certain traffic offenses shall cause the seizure of the person's vehicle if the person is unlawfully present in the United States. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55.

State Government - As introduced, inserts a statutory citation in regard to a reference to the board of claims in provisions regarding insurance for the state. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 8 and Title 12, Chapter 3, Part 9.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, enhances the penalty for abuse of corpse from a Class E felony to a Class C felony when the person causes the death of the person whose corpse is mistreated; adds enhancement factor by which a defendant's sentence can be increased within the appropriate range if the defendant is convicted of second degree murder and the defendant knowingly mutilates the body of the victim after death. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

Municipal Government - As enacted, provides that liability for legal and financial obligations pertaining to real property subject to a lease and payment in lieu of tax (PILOT) agreement remains with the person who transferred title to the municipality or corporation; provides immunity for the municipality or corporation. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 53, Part 3 and Title 48, Chapter 101, Part 3.
Lottery, Charitable - As introduced, extends deadline for applications for 2011-2012 annual events for five days after effective date of act. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 17, Part 1.

Estates - As enacted, revises various provisions relative to administration of estates; makes certain revisions in regard to jurisdiction in Greene County; conforms state law to extend the time period for certain disclaimers as authorized by the federal Tax Relief, Unemployment Insurance Reauthorization, and Job Creation Act. - Amends TCA Title 18; Title 30; Title 31 and Title 32.
Naming and Designating - As enacted, designates welcome center at Exit 9 on Interstate 26 in Unicoi County as the "Zane Whitson Welcome Center." -

Public Buildings - As introduced, increases from three to seven the number of persons/electors required for submission of an application for incorporation of a public building authority. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 10, Part 1.

Municipal Government - As introduced, requires municipalities to employ licensed engineers to prepare bid specifications and estimates for all street improvements over $25,000. - Amends TCA Section 54-4-204.

Education, Higher - As introduced, requires the board of trustees of the University of Tennessee system to submit its report to the governor on the number of students and the workings of the system 10 business days instead of 10 days before the general assembly convenes. - Amends TCA Title 49.
Local Education Agencies - As introduced, adds local education agencies to those able to sponsor a charter school. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Motor Vehicles, Titling and Registration - As introduced, requires licensed motor vehicle dismantlers and recyclers to maintain records of each vehicle purchased for seven years rather than three. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 1, Part 2; Title 55 and Title 62, Chapter 9, Part 1.

Juvenile Offenders - As introduced, clarifies that a juvenile court may order that a child be assigned a long-term mentor or receive counseling services if the child is found to be a delinquent child based on conduct involving the use of a firearm and adds any offense involving the use of a firearm to the list of offenses for which a juvenile court may transfer a juvenile to adult court. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 39 and Title 40.
Education - As enacted, enacts "The Virtual Public Schools Act." - Amends TCA Title 49.
Sentencing - As introduced, enhances the offense of aggravated assault where death results from Class C or D felony to Class B felony. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
District Attorneys - As introduced, creates 12 additional assistant district attorney general positions. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 16, Chapter 2.
Evidence - As introduced, creates a good faith exception to the exclusionary rule. - Amends TCA Title 40.

Environment and Conservation, Department of - As introduced, prohibits department from promulgating rules to impose fees on public safety agencies for the registration and inspection of x-ray machines. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 202, Part 5.

Special License Plates - As introduced, authorizes issuance of Tennessee Fraternal Order of Police new specialty earmarked license plates to members and associate members of organization without 1,000 plate minimum and allocates 50% of revenues derived from sale thereof to organization's charitable foundation; deletes authorization for National Fraternal Order of Police new specialty earmarked license plates. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, removes the requirement that a defendant have a BAC of .20 and a prior conviction to meet the requirements of aggravated vehicular homicide and includes, as a part of the offense, a BAC of .08 in addition to any amount of methamphetamine. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title  40.

Dentists and Dentistry - As introduced, provides for revocation of licenses or certificates of a dentist, dental hygienist, or dental assistant if the licensee or registrant fails to pay license or registration fee within 90 days, instead of 60 days, after such fee becomes due. - Amends TCA Title 63.
Taxes, Privilege - As introduced, imposes an occupational privilege tax on professional athletes and professional entertainers; establishes fund for juvenile court programs. - Amends TCA Title 67.
Physicians and Surgeons - As enacted, regulates pain management clinics and requires that such clinics apply for certification as such a clinic with the department of health.  - Amends TCA Title 63.

Revenue, Dept. of - As introduced, requires letter rulings and revenue rulings issued by the commissioner of revenue to be open to the public. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1 and Title 67, Chapter 4.

Workers Compensation - As introduced, allows an aggrieved party to appeal a workers' compensation specialist's order of future medicals in a workers' compensation case after judgment or settlement. - Amends TCA Title 50.
Wine & Wineries - As enacted, authorizes licensure and regulation of businesses where customers can make wine for personal, home consumption. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-703 and Title 57.
Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, requires licensure of independent insurance adjusters. - Amends TCA Title 56.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, changes the amount and time period within which a person can purchase base ephedrine and pseudoephedrine from a pharmacy and decreases the amount of base necessary for the offense of promoting the manufacture of methamphetamine. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, authorizes enhanced penalties for promoting the manufacture of methamphetamine or initiating the process of manufacture of methamphetamine in a school zone. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, divides lottery scholarship ASPIRE award into a grant and a required work-study program.   - Amends TCA Section 49-4-915.
Criminal Offenses - As introduced, specifies that knowingly exposing a child to the making of methamphetamine is aggravated child endangerment. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title  40.
Criminal Offenses - As enacted, enacts the "I Hate Meth Act." - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title  40.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, exempts from the sales and use tax diabetic testing supplies, including but not limited to lancets, test strips for blood glucose monitors and visual reading and urine test strips, sold pursuant to a prescription for human use. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
Pharmacy, Pharmacists - As enacted, enacts the "Pharmacy Benefit Integrity Act." - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 31.

Tobacco, Tobacco Products - As enacted, specifies that for purposes of the present tobacco tax law, "cigarette" includes any cigarette produced by a cigarette rolling machine at a retail establishment; adds various requirements regarding such cigarettes and rolling machines operators. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 43 and Title 67.

Tobacco, Tobacco Products - As enacted, requires licensed distributor reports filed with the department of revenue to be admitted into evidence as non-hearsay documents in all judicial and administrative proceedings. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 26.
Consumer Protection - As introduced, makes violations of the federal Fair Debt Collection Practices Act a violation of the Consumer Protection Act of 1977. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1.

Special License Plates - As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked license plates for Prince Hall Masons; allocates 50 percent of proceeds to Orange Mound Lodge, Free and Accepted Masons in Memphis. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Criminal Procedure - As introduced, directs that house and senate judiciary committees study application of death penalty in Tennessee; provides for moratorium on executions until study results are presented to the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 2.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, permits Tennessee HOPE scholarship recipient to maintain academic eligibility by maintaining good standing at the eligible postsecondary institution in which the student is enrolled; changes initial eligibility requirements for certain students to conform to the change in the continuing eligibility requirement. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

Traffic Safety - As introduced, increases penalty for speeding in marked school zone from Class C misdemeanor to Class B misdemeanor; designates $50.00 of such enhanced penalty to be used by TDOT for grants for safe pathways for students. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

Death - As introduced, authorizes a county mayor, when disposing of an unclaimed body at public expense where no relative or medical examiner claims the body, to do so by cremation or burial; cremated remains may be interred, entombed or inurned. - Amends TCA Section 68-4-103.

Tennessee Regulatory Authority - As introduced, revises annual report date to general assembly from first Monday of February each year to first Monday of March each year. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 3; Title 4; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 10; Title 12; Title 13; Title 35; Title 42; Title 47; Title 48; Title 64; Title 65; Title 67 and Title 68.
subjects: State Agencies|Federal, State, and Local Relations

title: Mobile Homes and Manufactured Buildings - As introduced, abolishes monitoring inspection fee levied on manufactured home manufacturers. - Amends TCA Title 55 and Title 68, Chapter 126.
Insurance, Health, Accident - As introduced, provides for TennCare and health insurance coverage of telemedicine services. - Amends TCA Title 56; Title 63 and Title 71.

Criminal Procedure - As enacted, permits the district attorney to apply for an order to wiretap if the interception may provide evidence of a criminal gang offense by a criminal gang member. - Amends TCA Title  39 and Title 40.

Highway Patrol - As enacted, authorizes certain retirees of the highway patrol to retain their badge and service weapon and require that such persons be issued a retired commission card.
 - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 7 and Title 8, Chapter 30.

Landlord and Tenant - As introduced, requires landlords of residential property to furnish an energy audit on any premises for rent before entering into a lease on such premises. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 28, Part 3.

Medical Occupations - As introduced, prohibits any board under the division of health related boards from issuing or renewing a license to a health care professional or applicant who might engage in direct patient care when that professional or applicant has been convicted of a felony. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 63 and Title 68.

Attorney General and Reporter - As introduced, creates the office of solicitor general of Tennessee in the executive branch, and beginning with the November 2012 election to be elected by the qualified voters of this state, with all current duties of the attorney general and reporter, other than activities associated with reporting functions, transferred to the office of solicitor general. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 6.

Attorney General and Reporter - As introduced, creates the office of solicitor general of Tennessee in the executive branch to be appointed by joint vote of the general assembly, with all current duties of the attorney general and reporter, other than activities associated with reporting functions, transferred to the office of solicitor general. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 6.

County Government - As enacted, authorizes the county legislative body of a county that has enacted county-wide zoning to create a design review committee (DRC). - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 1, Part 1.

Franklin County - As introduced, subject to local approval, increases the hotel motel tax from an amount not to exceed 5% to an amount not to exceed 7%. - Amends Chapter 219 of the Private Acts of 1988.

Water Pollution - As introduced, requires that notification of a regular or special meeting of the water quality control board shall be provided seven days instead of five in advance of the meeting. - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.
Juries and Jurors - As enacted, makes the jury coordinator law applicable to Rhea and Morgan counties, which were previously excluded from such law. - Amends TCA Title 22.

Education - As introduced, requires a city in which there is located a special school district with ADM of 10,000 or more and 75 percent of the district's students are eligible for free and reduced price lunch to maintain effort in funding such school system. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 3.
Computers and Electronic Processing - As introduced, excludes from sales and use tax certain information technology services. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
Election Laws - As enacted, revises provisions concerning voting by military and overseas citizens. - Amends TCA Title 2.

Codes - As introduced, places all responsibility for building standards and fire safety inspections on business occupancies and places of assembly in buildings less than three stories in height with certain local jurisdictions who have been approved by the state fire marshal to enforce codes inspections. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 120, Part 1.

Workers Compensation - As introduced, provides that failure of a drug and alcohol test, or refusing the test, in a drug-free workplace makes the injured employee ineligible for workers' compensation benefits related to an injury; removes requirement for proximate causation. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6 and Title 50, Chapter 9.
Consumer Protection - As introduced, enacts the "Consumer Civil Litigation Funding Act." - Amends TCA Title 47.

Education - As introduced, requires persons enrolling children for the first time in public schools to submit the student's social security number, a visa as issued by the United States, or certain birth certificates; requires schools to submit certain enrollment information to the department of education for inclusion in the department's annual report. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 49.

Alcoholic Beverages - As enacted, authorizes the city of Goodlettsville to conduct a referendum for the sale of alcoholic beverages at retail package stores only in that portion of the city located in Sumner County without affecting the sale of such beverages in Davidson County. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 3, Part 1.

Insurance, Health, Accident - As introduced, mandates that any insurer that provides health insurance coverage for cancer chemotherapy treatment must provide coverage for a prescribed, orally administered anticancer medication used to kill or slow the growth of cancerous cells. - Amends TCA Title 56.

Employees, Employers - As introduced, prohibits a local government from requiring a private employer to pay the employer's employees wages in excess of the amount required under state or federal law. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 2, Part 1.

Education - As introduced, requires a city in which there is located a special school district whose boundaries are coterminous with the city's boundaries to maintain effort in funding such school system.   - Amends TCA Title  49, Chapter 3, Part 3 and Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 2.

Codes - As enacted, reduces from three to one the number of copies of building and utility codes adopted by reference that must be maintained by county clerk for public use. - Amends TCA Section 5-20-102.

County Officers - As introduced, requires county trustees to return any commissions received over the amount required to operate the trustee's office to the school fund, provided the amount returned shall not exceed the amount received from the school fund. - Amends TCA Section 8-11-110.
Mental Illness - As introduced, authorizes assisted outpatient treatment as an alternative form of mandatory outpatient treatment. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.
Emergency Communications Districts - As enacted, allows district to purchase equipment under same terms of legal bid initiated by another district. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 86, Part 1.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, requires local board of education to maintain a record of dismissal and suspension hearings as well as the results of such hearings. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 5.
Charitable Institutions - As enacted, revises various provisions of the Charitable Gift Annuities Exemption Act. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 52.

Attorney General and Reporter - As introduced, requires attorney general to be available for hearing on pending legislation when time prevents issuance of a written opinion. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10; Title 8, Chapter 6; Title 38, Chapter 6 and Title 38, Chapter 5.
Railroads - As introduced, prohibits the blocking of a railroad crossing by a stopped train for more than 15 minutes. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 11, Part 1.

Students - As introduced, requires parents of truant students to attend counseling, mentoring, or parenting classes; requires truant students to receive counseling or mentoring; alters community service requirement for parents or guardians of truant students adjudicated unruly; creates task force on truancy. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 30.

Judges and Chancellors - As introduced, increases from two to four years period in which a former member of the judicial nominating commission may not be selected for judicial nomination. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 4, Chapter 29, Part 2; Title 16 and Title 17.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, adds University of Tennessee System and Board of Regents as recipients of THEC's annual report on scholarship and grant programs data. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 31; Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 8, Chapter 4; Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 49.

School Districts, Special - As introduced, requires submission of special school district board minutes to county board of education and department of education within five business days after affirmative administrative action for abolition of the special school district. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 13; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 5.
Board of Regents - As introduced, requests chancellor to study tenure and report to education committees. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, requires TSAC to annually prepare a status report for governor and general assembly on the Tennessee HOPE foster child tuition grant program. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Education - As enacted, requires local boards of education to develop and implement an evaluation plan to be used annually for the director of schools; authorizes certain municipalities to request county election commission to conduct a referendum regarding creation of new school in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 49.
Health Care - As introduced, clarifies that health care facilities regulated under the Cancer Reporting Act are facilities regulated under title 68, chapter 11, part 2. - Amends TCA Title 68.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, requires insurers to state in bold face type in an insurance policy whether an insured is entitled to assign benefits to a healthcare provider. - Amends TCA Section 56-7-120.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, requires the recipient or beneficiary to provide written notice to the state before initiating any legal proceeding to pursue recovery from a third party. - Amends TCA Section 71-5-117.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, allows a student who as an entering freshman meets all nonacademic requirements, but not the academic requirements for a HOPE scholarship, to qualify for the scholarship by meeting the collegiate grade point average continuation requirements after enrolling in an eligible postsecondary institution. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

Food and Food Products - As introduced, exempts the sale of certain nonpotentially hazardous foods at farmers' markets and church and community events from licensing and inspection requirements. - Amends TCA Title 53.
Agriculture - As introduced, enacts the "White-tailed Deer Breeding and Farming Act." - Amends TCA Title 44; Section 70-4-403 and Section 70-4-413.

Election Laws - As enacted, authorizes the coordinator of elections to review the county election commission in the administration of election laws; gives the coordinator certain powers in conducting an investigation or a review. - Amends TCA Section 2-11-202.
Election Laws - As introduced, places limitations on the hiring of certain relatives by county election commissions and administrators of elections. - Amends TCA Section 2-12-201 and Section 2-9-103.

Election Laws - As enacted, adds to current list of persons committing felonies or sexual offenses who are never eligible to register to vote, a violation containing the same elements and designated as a felony in any other state or federal court. - Amends TCA Section 40-29-204.

Election Laws - As introduced, expands where a person may go to early vote to include another polling place appropriately designated by the county election commission in addition to the county election commission office. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 6, Part 1.

Consumer Protection - As introduced, requires protective devices in shopping carts equipped with child seats; establishes that the failure to comply with such requirement violates the Tennessee Consumer Protection Act. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18.
Election Laws - As introduced, revises the definition of election official. - Amends TCA Section 2-1-104.

Election Laws - As introduced, requires additional $10.00 payment be made to election official that accompanies the officer of elections to the county election commission on election day. - Amends TCA Section 2-4-109.
Highways, Roads and Bridges - As enacted, designates segment of S.R. 19 in Haywood County as "Reverend Clay Evans Road". -
Game and Fish Laws - As introduced, authorizes hunting wild hogs at all times in Overton County. - Amends TCA Section 70-4-116.
subjects: Agriculture and Food|Animal Rights and Wildlife Issues

title: Criminal Offenses - As introduced, changes the punishment for the offense of abuse of a corpse from a Class E felony to a Class D felony. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-312.
State Symbols - As enacted, adopts "Tennessee" by John R. Bean as an official state song. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 1, Part 3.

Education - As introduced, authorizes local boards of education to enter into capital leases and build-to-suit capital leases of real or personal property for the use, construction, repair or renovation of school buildings and facilities. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 9 and Title 49, Chapter 2.

Education, Dept. of - As introduced, requires that student performance data that is used to evaluate teachers or calculate students' final grades be reported to each school district by June 1 of the current school year. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Charitable Solicitations - As enacted, requires charitable organization that solicited and received contributions exceeding $25,000 related to a disaster occurring in this state on or after May 1, 2010, to file a quarterly financial report with the secretary of state. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 1, Part 5 and Title 48, Chapter 101, Part 5.

Business and Commerce - As introduced, requires employers to provide each employee who is a veteran with paid or unpaid holiday time off for Veterans' Day under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 50 and Title 58.

Boards and Commissions - As introduced, clarifies that one police officer member of the peace officer standards and training commission shall be the president of the state Fraternal Order of Police. - Amends TCA Section 38-8-102.
County Officers - As enacted, redesignates "county mayor" as "county executive" in Overton County. - Amends TCA Section 5-6-101.
Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As introduced, requires that state firefighters in non-supervisory and non-administrative positions must retire at age 60. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 36, Part 2.
Taxes, Income - As introduced, eliminates Hall Income Tax for tax years 2012 and thereafter. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.
subjects: Labor and Employment|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, increases exemptions from Hall Income Tax for single filers from $1,250 to $2,400 and for joint filers from $2,500 to $4,800. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.
Securities - As introduced, increases the penalty for a fraudulent act or practice in connection with the offer, sale or purchase of any security from $5,000 to $6,000. - Amends TCA Title 48.

TennCare - As introduced, requires commissioner of finance and administration to seek an amendment to the TennCare waiver to require TennCare enrollees to seek all of their nonemergent primary care from public health departments; requires MCOs to contract with public health departments; requires bureau of TennCare to provide certain financial assistance to local health departments. - Amends TCA Title 49; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

Ethics - As enacted, revises filing deadlines for employer disclosure reports from within 45 days of March 31 and September 30 to within 45 days of June 30 and December 31. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 6.
Uniform Laws - As introduced, enacts the "Uniform Military and Overseas Voters Act." - Amends TCA Title 2.

Tort Liability and Reform - As introduced, enacts various provisions relative to tort reform. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 20; Title 22; Title 24; Title 28; Title 29; Title 47; Title 50; Title 63 and Title 68.

Public Records - As introduced, authorizes local government entities to file motions to prevent litigation opponents from using the Public Records Act in lieu of discovery. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7.
Real Property - As introduced, revises various statutory provisions relevant to foreclosure. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 3 and Title 35, Chapter 5.

School Districts, Special - As introduced, specifies the date for a referendum by which a special school district board of education seeks to transfer administration of the district's schools to the county board of education; requires that, if the voters approve the transfer, the transfer shall occur on the second July 1 following the election. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-502.

Consumer Protection - As introduced, requires any gift card or prepaid card issued as payment of a rebate to contain an expiration date conspicuously printed on the card. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1.
Insurance, Health, Accident - As introduced, requires health insurance entities to reimburse certain costs to insured when coverage is unreasonably denied. - Amends TCA Title 56.
Taxes, Business - As introduced, returns collection of gross receipts tax to county clerks and designated city officials. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 7.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Harriman - As introduced, subject to local approval, permits the city of Harriman to raise its occupancy tax from a rate not to exceed 5 percent to a rate not to exceed 7 percent. - Amends Chapter 115 of the Private Acts of 1995.

General Assembly, Directed Studies - As introduced, changes the date on which the select committee on children and youth is to report its findings concerning its study on human sex trafficking from March 1, 2011 until June 1, 2011. - Amends Chapter 1023 of the Public Acts of 2010.

Sexual Offenders - As enacted, requires registered sex offenders to report to registering law enforcement agencies prior to traveling out of the United States. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2.

Animal Control - As introduced, requires owners, harborers, and keepers of dangerous, vicious, or wild animals to restrain or confine such animals, and to post visible notice; establishes certain penalties and defenses for violations. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 44.
Highway Signs -  As introduced, "Historic Rock Castle," I-65 at Vietnam Veterans Parkway and Exit 232 (Highway 109) on I-40. -

Alcoholic Beverages - As enacted, revises various provisions regarding alcoholic beverages, including provisions concerning tourism developments zones and certain alcohol sales in Monroe and Robertson counties. - Amends TCA Title 57.

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As enacted, prohibits a health care institution that treats drug abuse patients from being held liable for any damages resulting from the introduction of harmful substances into an indwelling catheter placed in the patient, provided that the health care institution informs the patient of such immunity. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 33, Chapter 10, Part 1; Title 63 and Title 68, Chapter 11.

Education, Higher - As enacted, removes authorization of graduate students in audiology at public institutions of higher education to evaluate, prescribe and dispense hearing aids; removes prohibition on employees of hearing centers at public institutions of higher education serving private-practice patients in publicly owned facilities or referring patients to their own private practices; permits state public colleges and universities to establish and operate clinical and dispensary programs in speech pathology, speech therapy and audiology for the purpose of educating students and generating financial support necessary to operate and make necessary improvements to those programs. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 27.

Education - As introduced, authorizes local boards of education to enter into capital leases and build-to-suit capital leases of real or personal property for the use, construction, repair or renovation of school buildings and facilities. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 9 and Title 49, Chapter 2.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, amends first degree murder statute to include felony murder, during a felony drug offense, of a law enforcement officer engaged in official duties. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13.

Law Enforcement - As enacted, allows law enforcement agencies to exchange confiscated firearms with other law enforcement agencies for body armor and ammunition as well as for other firearms. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

Sexual Offenders - As enacted, requires all sexual offenders who are incarcerated, but who have not yet registered as a sexual offender or violent sexual offender, to be registered in the institution in which they are incarcerated by no later than August 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, clarifies intent of PC 1004 of 2010, imposing $250 drug testing fee on convictions of or grants of diversion for violations of Tennessee Drug Control Act, to apply statewide and not be limited to certain counties. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-420.

Schools, Charter - As introduced, expands student population eligible to attend charter schools to include certain children who have been in foster care.  - Amends TCA Section 49-13-106 and Section 49-13-113.

Tennessee Bureau of Investigation - As enacted, clarifies that $13.75 court costs for TBI are imposed upon the forfeiture of any cash bond or other surety entered as a result of a municipal traffic citation. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 6, Part 1 and Title 40, Chapter 11, Part 1.

Criminal Procedure - As introduced, allows a person convicted of a misdemeanor offense for the first time who is put on probation, successfully completes probation and does not commit another offense for three years, to have public records of misdemeanor conviction expunged. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 32, Part 1.

Public Records - As introduced, authorizes certain persons arrested for or charged with misdemeanor offenses, while protesting or challenging the legalization or performance of abortion procedures, to petition for destruction of public records pertaining to such arrests or charges. - Amends TCA Section 40-32-101.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As enacted, specifies that TCA titles 50 and 56 provide the sole and exclusive statutory remedies and sanctions applicable to an insurer, person, or entity licensed, permitted, or authorized to do business under title 56 for alleged breach of, or for alleged unfair or deceptive acts or practices in connection with, a contract of insurance.  - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 8, Part 1.

Sheriffs - As enacted, revises certain requirements which a person must meet in order to qualify for election or appointment to the office of sheriff; revises law regarding verification of POST certification of any person seeking the office of sheriff; and removes certain provisions regarding when a person runs for sheriff or is elected as sheriff and does not possess a current and valid peace officer certification. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 8, Part 1 and Title 38, Chapter 8, Part 1.

Workers Compensation - As introduced, clarifies that the general contractor of a commercial construction project shall select the three individual construction services providers who may be exempt from workers' compensation coverage while working on the commercial construction project. - Amends TCA Title 50 and Title 56.

Contractors - As introduced, requires a contract entered into between a developer or owner of property and a prime contractor to include specific information concerning the manner in which the developer or owner plans on financing the project; as a condition to the finalization of the contract, such information is subject to being verified by the prime contractor. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 45; Title 49; Title 62, Chapter 6 and Title 66.

Probation and Parole - As enacted, transfers supervision of the out of state parole and probation supervision registry from the TBI to the board of probation and parole. - Amends TCA Section 38-6-116 and Title 40, Chapter 28, Part 4.
Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, establishes the Tennessee HOPE prospective teacher's scholarship. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

Courts, Administrative Office of the - As introduced, provides that before submitting the annual budget for the state court system to department of finance and administration, the administrative director of the courts must first submit it to the executive committee of the judicial conference for approval. - Amends TCA Section 16-3-803.

Judges and Chancellors - As introduced, provides that if a party makes a timely recusal motion and judge denies it, the party has the right to have another judge sit by interchange or as special judge to hear and determine whether the motion should be granted or denied. - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 17 and Title 39, Chapter 16.

Ethics - As introduced, provides that if a complaint is filed against a judge who is or was a member of the court of the judiciary at the same time as the investigative counsel served as counsel for the court, the investigative counsel must retain a special counsel to investigate any such complaint. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 8; Title 16; Title 17, Chapter 5 and Title 39, Chapter 16.

Special License Plates - As introduced, authorizes the spouse of a deceased recipient of a Purple Heart memorial registration plate to receive two such registration plates for no cost. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 2.
Lottery,  Corporation - As introduced, allows Tennessee lottery tickets to be purchased with debit cards in addition to cash.  - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51, Part 1.

Cooperatives - As introduced, authorizes electric cooperatives to provide services anywhere such services are currently provided by wireless cable (microwave) systems. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 25, Part 2.

Health Care - As enacted, replaces "non-residential methadone treatment facility" with "nonresidential substitution-based treatment centers offering treatment for opiate addiction." - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11.

Redistricting, Congressional - As introduced, requires compliance with state and federal constitutions as well as judicial decisions in passing congressional redistricting plan. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Municipal and County Issues

title: Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As enacted, creates exemption from excise and franchise tax for entities owned by a branch of the U.S. armed forces that derive more than half of gross income from operation of facilities located on federally owned or leased property and operate primarily to benefit armed forces members. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2 and Title 67, Chapter 4.
Agriculture, Dept. of - As introduced, requires commissioner to appoint advisory council on pest plants and invasive species. - Amends TCA Title 43, Chapter 6.
Oneida - As introduced, authorizes Oneida Special School District to issue bonds. -

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, excepts insurance producers from continuing education requirements related to licenses if those producers meet certain exceptions. - Amends TCA Section 56-6-107.
Alcoholic Beverages - As enacted, allows Franklin Theatre to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, creates Class D felony aggravated assault offense of a person sentenced to confinement in an adult or juvenile facility throwing urine, blood or other bodily fluids upon an officer of the facility, intending the fluid to make contact with the officer and reasonably knowing the officer would find it offensive. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1.

Juvenile Offenders - As introduced, authorizes the transfer of a juvenile from juvenile to adult court if the juvenile commits an aggravated assault against an employee of a juvenile detention facility to which the juvenile has been committed or is confined. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 1, Part 1.
TennCare - As introduced, makes certain hospital provider reimbursement information involving the program a public record. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5, Part 1.

Income Tax - As introduced, increases amount of income exempt from Hall Income Tax; automatically increases amount of exempt income for inflation purposes beginning in 2012 and subsequent years; caps exemption at certain amounts. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.
subjects: Labor and Employment|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title:
Child Custody and Support - As introduced, allows a court to consider the reasonable preference of a child, who is 10 instead of 12, when determining whether to allow a custodial parent to move more than 100 miles from the noncustodial parent.
 - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6.
Criminal Procedure - As introduced, requires that a defendant pay $250 upfront prior to making an agreement with the prosecution to suspend prosecution. - Amends TCA Title 40.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, directs the proceeds of a sale of weapons confiscated by a judicial drug task force to the judicial drug task force for law enforcement purposes. - Amends TCA Title 39.

Child Custody and Support - As introduced, requires court to consider the behavior and attitude each parent has displayed with regard to familial obligations, including but not limited to any instances of adultery while married to the child's other parent, when making a custody determination. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 4 and Title 36, Chapter 6.

Criminal Procedure - As introduced, provides that no arrest warrant or criminal summons shall issue without the written approval of the applicable district attorney if the affiant knows the person to be arrested or summoned is a law enforcement officer. - Amends TCA Title 40.

Attorneys at Law - As introduced, provides that if an attorney, post-conviction defender or district public defender in a criminal case is found to have provided ineffective assistance of counsel, that attorney cannot receive any further state funds for legal services until the attorney obtains continuing education, counseling or training that addresses the reason for the attorney being ineffective. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 40.

Sexual Offenses - As introduced, makes a person who is charged with statutory rape by an authority figure ineligible for suspension of prosecution and pretrial diversion. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 15.
TennCare - As introduced, makes certified nurse assistant services for certain quadriplegics a covered medical service under TennCare. - Amends TCA Title 71.

Law Enforcement Training Academy - As introduced, provides that the law enforcement training academy curriculum requirements include materials on sexual assault and stalking of domestic abuse victims as well as materials on domestic violence. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 38 and Title 40.

Unemployment Compensation - As enacted, revises provisions governing eligibility for unemployment compensation for certain persons who provide certain services for an educational institution or its students. - Amends TCA Section 50-7-302.

Taxes, Gross Receipts - As introduced, requires annual report to governor and speakers concerning programs receiving funding from bottler's tax to be delivered by February 1 each year instead of by March 31 each year. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-402.

Taxes, Sales - As introduced, reduces from 90 to 75 days period in which dealer via signed statement can deduct on a return sales tax collected but not yet remitted to commissioner for refunded items. - Amends TCA Title 67.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Environmental Preservation - As introduced, codifies stream mitigation plan requirements in accordance with state and federal guidelines. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 68 and Title 69.

Zoning - As introduced, authorizes counties and municipalities to establish zoning districts or provisions for planned unit developments, overlay districts, mixed use developments, condominiums, and other types of sustainable design and development of property, and procedures for review and approval of such uses. - Amends TCA Section 13-7-201 and Section 13-7-101.
Pest Control - As enacted, revises the manner in which a person applying pesticides may be supervised. - Amends TCA Section 62-21-102.

State Government - As introduced, requires state departments, agencies and entities to reduce paper and paper products annually by 5 percent starting on July 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 1, Part 4.
Highway Signs - As enacted, designates segment of S.R. 68 in Monroe County as "Bob 'Single Wing' Harrill Memorial Highway."  -

Annexation - As introduced, deletes provision permitting municipalities to provide extraterritorial zoning and subdivision regulation beyond their corporate limits with the approval of county legislative body in counties without zoning. - Amends TCA Section 6-58-106.
Consumer Protection - As introduced, requires a retailer to disclose that instructions provided with a good are not in English. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1.
Education - As introduced, removes annual reporting requirement of the state board of education on the weight of textbooks. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Estates - As introduced, allows the clerk of probate court to enter an order dismissing without prejudice probate cases which have no order of disposition, have been open for at least 18 months, and administration of the estate remains incomplete. - Amends TCA Section 18-6-106.
Health Care - As introduced, creates a catastrophic trauma fund for persons with motorcycle-related injuries. - Amends TCA Title 55.

Medical Occupations - As introduced, establishes five-year statute of limitations for disciplinary actions against physicians by the board of medical examiners. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5; Title 28; Title 29, Chapter 26 and Title 63, Chapter 6.

County Government - As introduced, authorizes the Hamilton County legislative body to call for a special election if the next general election is more than 180 days from the time a vacancy in the office of county mayor occurs. - Amends TCA Section 5-1-104.

Zoning - As enacted, specifically authorizes municipal and county legislative bodies to adopt supplemental rules of procedure for their zoning boards of appeals that address the certain items. - Amends TCA Section 13-7-107 and Section 13-7-205.

County Government - As introduced, authorizes the county legislative body to call for a special election if the next general election is more than 180 days from the time a vacancy in the office of county mayor occurs. - Amends TCA Section 5-1-104.

Beer - As introduced, permits a temporary license or permit for beer to be issued for events sanctioned by a municipal or county government to be held in conjunction with a fair or on publicly owned municipal parks, streets or sidewalks where the event is held within the municipality and the streets are cordoned off to permit only foot traffic. - Amends TCA Title 57.

Economic and Community Development, Dept. of - As introduced, requires ECD to report annually to office of legislative budget analysis in addition to joint select committee on business taxes regarding Tennessee job skills program. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 6; Title 7, Chapter 53; Title 8, Chapter 23; Title 8, Chapter 24; Title 9, Chapter 16; Title 9, Chapter 3; Title 13, Chapter 3; Title 13, Chapter 16; Title 49, Chapter 7; Title 50, Chapter 7; Title 64, Chapter 6; Title 65, Chapter 5 and Title 67.
Personal Property - As enacted, revises various provisions of the Tennessee Self-Service Storage Facility Act. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 31.

County Officers - As introduced, creates special account in general fund from which the annual educational incentive payments will be made to certain eligible county officials; previously, the payments were made from the general fund. - Amends TCA Section 5-1-310 and Section 67-4-409.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As enacted, requires limited lines licensure for the sale or offer of coverage under a policy of portable electronics insurance. - Amends TCA Title 56.

Industrial Development - As introduced, increases from 30 to 50 years the maximum period of time that an economic impact plan can provide for allocating property taxes to a county industrial development corporation. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 53, Part 3.

Planning, Public - As enacted, authorizes the regulations or practice of planning commissions to provide for the "preliminary," rather than "tentative," approval of a plat prior to the developer making improvements. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 3, Part 4 and Title 13, Chapter 4, Part 3.

Sexual Offenders - As enacted, provides that the HIV test a sexual offender is required to undergo must be performed within 48 hours after the presentment of the indictment or information and with or without the request of the victim; adds aggravated rape of a child and statutory rape by an authority figure to the list of offenses requiring HIV testing of the alleged perpetrator. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 5.

Boards and Commissions - As introduced, removes requirement that council for licensing hearing instrument specialists be administratively attached to board of communication disorders and sciences; renames council the board for licensing hearing instrument specialists. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 63, Chapter 17.

Taxes, Real Property - As introduced, allows the municipality or county that conducted a sale for delinquent taxes to submit a report of findings of fact to the court that summarizes for each property sold at the sale for delinquent taxes the names of all parties with an interest in the real estate and such other facts relevant to the sale. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 25.
subjects: Housing and Property|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Taxes, Real Property - As introduced, clarifies that the chancery court has jurisdiction of cases involving the sale of property for delinquent taxes even though the amount sued for is less than $100, instead of $50.00. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.
subjects: Housing and Property|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Taxes, Real Property - As introduced, increases the number of weeks that the trustee is required to publish a notice of delinquent taxes in a newspaper prior to filing suit from two weeks to four weeks. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.
subjects: Housing and Property|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Telecommunications - As introduced, clarifies the responsibility of the Tennessee Regulatory Authority to preserve universal service consisting of basic local exchange telephone service at comparable rates and carrier of last resort obligations for rural incumbent local exchange telephone companies and telephone cooperatives. - Amends TCA Title 65.
Recycling - As introduced, creates grant program to assist processors of recycled plastic to be used as raw material in manufacturing. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211.

Tourism - As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Adventure Tourism and Rural Development Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 11; Title 54; Title 55; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 70.

Public Employees - As enacted, adds firefighters and certain emergency services personnel to statute permitting law enforcement officers and certain TBI employees to request that an arrestee's blood be tested for certain infectious diseases. - Amends TCA Title 41 and Title 68.

Safety - As enacted, removes requirement that alarm system monitoring companies perform alarm verifications prior to requesting law enforcement be dispatched to pharmacies. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 32, Part 3.
Business and Commerce - As introduced, requires businesses to show evidence of payment of personal property taxes prior to issuance of a business license. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-723.

Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As introduced, permits certain employees of Tennessee federally qualified health centers to participate in the Tennessee consolidated retirement system. - Amends TCA Title 8.
Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, requires that all property taxes be paid in full on any property subject to the Property Tax Freeze Act. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-705.

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As introduced, raises the threshold for a certificate of need for capital expenditures for nonhospital health care institutions from $2 million to $2.5 million; makes health care institutions responsible for attorneys' fees in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11.

Municipal Government - As introduced, redefines city governing body to include board of mayor and aldermen as it applies to the consolidation of certain governmental and corporate functions, and to the creation of metropolitan governments. - Amends TCA Section 7-1-101 and Section 68-211-835.

Welfare - As introduced, requires individuals applying for food stamp program benefits, unemployment benefits, and families first assistance to submit to drug testing; prohibits felons of certain drug crimes from receiving certain benefits. - Amends TCA Title 50 and Title 71.

Motor Vehicles - As enacted, changes the sunset date for the pilot program allowing golf carts on certain public roads to January 1, 2012; extends the pilot program to Eagleville, Englewood and Ripley; requires a person to have liability insurance on the golf cart in order to be authorized to operate it on the roadways. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8, Part 2.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, creates a separate criminal offense for selling or offering for sale drug paraphernalia. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3; Title 39, Chapter 13; Title 39, Chapter 17; Title 39, Chapter 11 and Title 40, Chapter 33.

Jails, Local Lock-ups - As introduced, authorizes the use of telemedicine to provide medical care to prisoners in a jail or workhouse. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 38; Title 41; Title 63 and Title 68.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Legal Issues

title: Financial Responsibility Law - As introduced, requires officers to ask for proof of insurance for any traffic violation, moving or otherwise. - Amends TCA Title 55.
Local Education Agencies - As introduced, requires that members of a school board have a bachelor's degree. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2.

Motor Vehicles - As introduced, requires that motor vehicle registration plate is illuminated at all times headlights are required to be displayed. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 1 and Title 55, Chapter 9, Part 4.
Taxes, Sales - As introduced, authorizes certain distribution of state sales tax revenues to municipalities within Madison County. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 1.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, changes high school academic requirements for initial receipt of the Tennessee HOPE scholarship. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 31; Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 8, Chapter 4; Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 49.
Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As enacted, enacts the "Professional Educators Collaborative Conferencing Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Section 5-23-107 and Title 49.

Workers Compensation - As introduced, changes references from "names" to "nominees" in regard to appointments to advisory council on workers' compensation. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 50 and Title 56.

Taxes, Sales - As introduced, removes additional state sales tax on single articles priced between $1,600 and $3,200; authorizes local sales tax on single articles priced up to $3,200 and requires the $3,200 limit be increased annually for inflation beginning July 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-202 and Section 67-6-702.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Election Laws - As introduced, enacts the "Agreement Among the States to Elect the President by National Popular Vote." - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 15.

Taxes, Gasoline, Petroleum Products - As introduced, requires commissioner of TDOT to provide status report on certain highway projects to the chairmen of the transportation committees of the house and senate by November 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 3.

Motor Vehicles - As introduced, rewrites present exemption to requirement that motor vehicle dismantlers must obtain copy of certificate of title before purchasing motor vehicle for scrap, to apply to motor vehicle manufactured in a year prior to issuance of certificates of title. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 17, Part 1 and Title 55, Chapter 3, Part 2.

Special License Plates - As introduced, extends time period for Habitat for Humanity new specialty earmarked plates to meet minimum issuance requirements until July 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Budget Procedures - As introduced, requires the general assembly to provide funding for unfunded mandates which place increased expenditures over certain amounts on local governments; prohibits an agency of state government from creating a new fee in any year in which the general state revenues to the agency have decreased from the previous year. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5, Part 2 and Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 53.

Local Government, General - As introduced, enacts the "Electronic Publication of Legal Notices Act of 2011"; applies only to Hamilton County and municipalities located in Hamilton County. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 54 and Title 8, Chapter 21.

Bond Issues - As introduced, authorizes the state of Tennessee, acting by resolution of its funding board, to issue and sell its interest-bearing bonds and bond anticipation notes for certain purposes. -

Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As introduced, increases cash amount higher education employee in an optional retirement program may withdraw upon terminating employment from 50% to 100% of such employee's accumulated account. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 35, Part 4.

Open Meetings - As introduced, enacts the "Telephone Cooperative Transparency Act of 2011," which requires telephone cooperatives to comply with open meetings and public records laws. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 44; Title 10, Chapter 7 and Title 65, Chapter 29.

Criminal Procedure - As introduced, removes the requirement that a court determine whether a defendant is a danger to the community prior to releasing the defendant on bail for being charged with vehicular assault, vehicular homicide or driving under the influence. - Amends TCA Section 40-11-118.

Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As introduced, allows certain individuals who meet certain criteria to transfer previous service from Group 1 to Group 3 of the retirement system if certain conditions are timely met. - Amends TCA Section 8-34-101(3); Title 8, Chapter 34, Part 6; Section 8-34-716 and Section 8-35-105.

Driver Licenses - As enacted, exempts persons holding a commercial driver license to perform transportation services as employee of federal or state government or political subdivision of the state or an agency established under compact between states and approved by Congress from the requirement that Tennessee commercial driver license holders must maintain valid medical card; exemption does not apply to passenger, school bus or hazardous material endorsement. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50.

Human Rights - As introduced, adds sexual orientation to the list of characteristics on which discrimination is prohibited in employment, public accommodations, and housing and financing. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21; Title 8 and Title 50.

Child Abuse - As introduced, requires law enforcement investigating child abuse or child sexual abuse to be trained in child protective investigations whenever possible and requires department of children's services to annually conduct such training. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 1, Part 4 and Title 37, Chapter 1, Part 6.

Education - As introduced, directs the commissioner of education to require all high schools to allow eligible students 18 to 20 years of age to voluntarily enroll and attend school. - Amends TCA Title 49.
Appropriations - As introduced, makes appropriations for the purpose of defraying the expenses of certain legislative enactments passed during the 2011 session of the 107th General Assembly. -

Child Custody and Support - As introduced, makes various changes to the requirements for parenting plans and allocation of parenting responsibilities in situations involving domestic violence or sexual abuse. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6, Part 4.

Child Abuse - As introduced, requires the district attorney general of each judicial district to report on child protective teams to the judiciary committees of the senate and house of representatives by February 15 of each year, rather than January 15. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-607.

Child Abuse - As introduced, requires a child advocacy center to perform the initial forensic interview with a child who is the victim of alleged child sexual abuse and any subsequent interviews found necessary by the child protective team to be conducted in a neutral setting whenever possible. - Amends TCA Title 37.

Welfare - As introduced, requires comptroller to conduct a performance audit of the implementation and impact of current law authorizing the commissioner of finance and administration to implement policies and processes to expedite the determination of medicaid categorical and financial eligibility and medical eligibility for home and community-based programs and services. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5.

Education, Higher - As introduced,  adds board of trustees for the University of Tennessee System and Board of Regents as recipients of THEC's annual report on scholarship and grant programs data. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Children's Services, Dept. of - As introduced, clarifies that confidential records and information maintained by the department of children's services that shall be disclosed to members of the general assembly includes information contained in any internal audit conducted by the department. - Amends TCA Title 37.

Foster Care - As introduced, clarifies that no preference shall be given a child's relatives when a child has resided in a foster home for at least one year prior to the filing of the foster parents' adoption petition. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 37, Chapter 1; Title 37, Chapter 2; Title 37, Chapter 3 and Title 37, Chapter 5.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, establishes a formula for determining restitution owed to a victim of involuntary servitude that is based on comparable wages paid for the labor performed. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-403 and Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 3.

Adoption - As introduced, extends from 10 to 20 days the time for a parent who has surrendered a child for adoption to revoke such surrender. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 1, Part 1; Title  37, Chapter 2, Part 4 and Section 40-14-103.

Child Abuse - As enacted, allows a court to prohibit any person convicted of child abuse or aggravated child abuse from contacting such person's victim if the person does not have any parental rights to such victim, including contact via electronic means. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, adds University of Tennessee System and Board of Regents as recipients of THEC's annual report on scholarship and grant programs data. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 31; Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 8, Chapter 4; Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 49.

Child Abuse - As introduced, changes from January 15 to February 1 annual deadline for district attorneys general to submit to the standing judiciary committees their reports on the progress of child protective teams. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 37 and Title 39, Chapter 15.

Children's Services, Dept. of - As introduced, requires the TBI to conduct any investigation into the department of children's services that is currently conducted by such department and requires TBI to maintain confidentiality of the department's records. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 37.

Child Abuse - As enacted, revises law regarding custody of abused children.

 - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6; Title 37 and Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 4.

Domestic Violence - As introduced, specifies that injuries to domestic violence victims and sexual assault victims shall not be reported to law enforcement unless the injured person consents to a report. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 1, Part 1.

Law Enforcement - As introduced, exempts information concerning adult victims of domestic abuse or sexual assault from being mandatorily reported by doctors and hospitals to law enforcement unless the patient consents to such reporting. - Amends TCA Section 38-1-101.

Domestic Violence - As introduced, requires health care practitioners to report patient injuries caused or suspected to be caused by domestic violence or abuse to the department of health within 15 days of the date the practitioner has knowledge or suspects the cause of such injuries are the result of such violence or abuse rather than on a monthly basis. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 39 and Title 40.

Education - As enacted, enacts the "Special Education Behavioral Supports Act," amending current restrictions on isolation and restraint in special education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 10, Part 13.
Environmental Preservation - As introduced, repeals Tennessee Petroleum Underground Storage Tank Act. - Amends TCA Title 68.

Appropriations - As introduced, assigns the state employee staff responsible for the administration of the group insurance for state officials and employees to the department of finance and administration; requires that grant payments under the grant assistance program for nursing home care be made monthly or quarterly instead of monthly. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 11; Title 12; Title 13; Title 16; Title 33; Title 36; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 42; Title 43; Title 44; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 50; Title 54; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 58; Title 59; Title 60; Title 61; Title 62; Title 63; Title 65; Title 66; Title 67; Title 68; Title 70 and Title 71.
Pharmacy, Pharmacists - As enacted, establishes procedures for pharmacies to transfer Schedule II prescriptions in accord with certain federal and state requirements. - Amends TCA Title 63.

Public Records - As introduced, designates, as confidential records, certain information submitted to local industrial development corporations by applicant seeking PILOT benefits. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, permits home school students to obtain HOPE scholarships as entering freshmen if such students achieve a high school GPA of 3.0 or an ACT score of 21. - Amends TCA Section 49-4-908.
Zoning - As introduced, prohibits rezoning of private property by local government without written consent of property owner. - Amends TCA Section 13-7-208.

Wine & Wineries - As introduced, allows winery to sell and transport up to 3,000 cases of wine to restaurants and hotels licensed to serve wine for on-premises consumption. - Amends TCA Section 57-3-207.

Appropriations - As introduced, requires federal economic recovery funds received during calendar year 2010 to be specifically appropriated by the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 9 and Title 67.

Local Government, General - As introduced, authorizes municipalities and counties, by resolution or ordinance, to prohibit landlords from leasing real property to persons unlawfully present in the United States; requires the attorney general and reporter to draft and defend such resolutions and ordinances upon written request. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8 and Title 66.
Taxes, Personal Property - As introduced, exempts from tangible personal property tax equipment used for harvesting timber. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.
subjects: Housing and Property|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Education, Curriculum - As introduced, implements an integrated sex education program in place of the family life curriculum and authorizes parents to maintain an action against an outside instructor or organization for teaching students about material prohibited by the curriculum guidelines. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title  49 and Title 68.

Dentists and Dentistry - As enacted, specifies that dental hygienists are authorized to perform stain removal on teeth in addition to performing those tasks that they are authorized to perform under present law. - Amends TCA Section 63-5-108.

Employees, Employers - As introduced, provides that in deciding any motion for summary judgment in any common law or statutory discrimination or retaliation action arising out of an employment relationship, courts must apply the burden-shifting methods available to the moving party when the moving party does not bear the burden of proof at trial that would be available to the moving party had the claim or cause of action been asserted in federal district court in Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 25 and Title 50.

Civil Procedure - As enacted, declares that a moving party prevails on a motion for summary judgment if it submits affirmative evidence negating an element of a nonmoving party's claim or demonstrates that the nonmoving party's evidence is insufficient to establish an essential element. - Amends TCA Title 20.
subjects: Legal Issues|Civil Liberties and Civil Rights

title: DNA and Genetic Testing - As introduced, allows court to infer that DNA obtained from exculpatory evidence does not match applicant's profile and that offense was committed solely by person whose DNA profile is derived from such evidence. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 30, Part 3.
Taxes, Sales - As introduced, deletes obsolete language for spring sales tax holiday. - Amends TCA Title 67.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Courts, Administrative Office of the - As introduced, provides that the executive committee of the judicial conference appoint and set the salary of the administrative director of the courts rather than the supreme court. - Amends TCA Section 16-3-802.

Public Records - As introduced, provides that all records filed with, created by or in the possession of the court of the judiciary or the office of investigative counsel be maintained by the administrative office of the courts for at least eight years from the date of creation or receipt and that maintenance of the records does not change their status as a public or confidential record. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 8; Title 16; Title 17, Chapter 5 and Title 39, Chapter 16.

Judges and Chancellors - As introduced, provides that if complaint filed against a judge and the judge is not reelected, resigns or retires before disposition of the complaint, the court of the judiciary must make the complaint and allegations contained therein public. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 8; Title 16; Title 17, Chapter 5 and Title 39, Chapter 16.

Court Rules - As introduced, provides that rules adopted by the court of the judiciary may not be inconsistent or in conflict with the statutory provisions establishing the court. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 8; Title 16; Title 17, Chapter 5 and Title 39, Chapter 16.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, provides that making a false statement on a declaration, such as under the Uniform Unsworn Foreign Declarations Act, is covered by the offense of perjury. - Amends TCA Section 39-16-702.

Criminal Procedure - As enacted, increases the amount of time a petitioner in a post-conviction relief action has to appeal the ruling of the trial court to the court of criminal appeals on a motion to reopen the petition from 10 to 30 days. - Amends TCA Section 40-30-117(c).

Courts - As introduced, changes burden of proof necessary to cause investigation of a judge for misconduct from a reasonable person believing there is a substantial probability that misconduct occurred to probable cause that the misconduct occurred. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 8; Title 16; Title 17, Chapter 5 and Title 39, Chapter 16.

Judges and Chancellors - As introduced, authorizes the investigative panel of the court of the judiciary to request that a judge file a written response to a complaint filed against the judge within 20, rather than 30, days after service of notice. - Amends TCA Title 17, Chapter 5.

Courts, Administrative Office of the - As introduced, reestablishes the judicial council with a sunset date of two years; requires judicial council to meet twice a year while legislature is in session. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29, Part 2 and Title 16, Chapter 21, Part 1.

Taxes - As enacted, removes the property tax on stocks for loan, investment, and cemetery companies; specifies the manner in which the excise tax on such companies would be allocated. - Amends TCA Title 67.
Annexation - As introduced, restores the right to trial by jury in quo warranto actions contesting the validity of municipal annexation. - Amends TCA Section 6-58-111.

Local Education Agencies - As introduced, requires that the salary of the director of schools not be higher in any given fiscal year than the salary paid to the county mayor for the same fiscal year. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-203 and Section 49-2-301.

County Government - As introduced, deletes the authority of the county legislative body to confirm appointments made by the county mayor to county boards and commissions and department heads. - Amends TCA Section 5-6-106.

County Government - As introduced, changes the required vote of the county legislative body to override the veto of the county mayor from a majority vote to a two-thirds vote. - Amends TCA Section 5-6-107.

Municipal Government - As enacted, revises the municipal gas system tax equivalent law. 

 - Amends TCA Title 7.
Special License Plates - As introduced, authorizes issuance of two memorial license plates to recipients of the Distinguished Flying Cross and the Air Medal. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Immigration - As enacted, enacts the Tennessee Lawful Employment Act; revises other provisions of law regarding employment of persons unlawfully present in the country. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 12; Title 39 and Title 50.
Immigration - As enacted, enacts the "Eligibility Verification for Entitlements Act." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 68 and Title 71.

DUI Offenses - As introduced, lowers the DUI enhancement that would require an ignition interlock from .15 percent to .08 percent and removes the DUI enhancements that would require an ignition interlock relative to implied consent. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55.

Business and Commerce - As introduced, removes repeated language in the provisions governing the qualifications for a barber instructor. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7; Title 8; Title 46; Title 47; Title 48; Title 50; Title 56; Title 62; Title 63 and Title 68.

Business and Commerce - As introduced, clarifies that renewal of contractor license must be effectuated 30 days prior to expiration. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 26, Chapter 7; Title 46; Title 47; Title 48; Title 50; Title 56; Title 62; Title 63 and Title 68.

Administrative Procedure (UAPA) - As enacted, specifies, with certain exceptions, that new fee or fee increase promulgated by state agency rule in accordance with UAPA will take effect on the July 1 following the expiration of the 90-days after filing with the secretary of state. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5, Part 2.
Public Funds and Financing - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Food Desert Relief Act." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 9; Title 13; Title 67, Chapter 5 and Title 68.
Game and Fish Laws - As introduced, authorizes hunting wild hogs at all times in Overton County. - Amends TCA Section 70-4-116.
subjects: Agriculture and Food|Animal Rights and Wildlife Issues
