title: Education - As introduced, authorizes the Knox County board of education to enter into capital leases and build-to-suit capital leases of real or personal property for the use, construction, repair or renovation of school buildings and facilities. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 9 and Title 49, Chapter 2.
Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, reforms system of K-12 teacher tenure. - Amends TCA Section 8-36-821 and Title 49.

Vocational Training and Rehabilitation - As introduced, requires state board of education to notify local school systems of specific prerequisite requirements and the courses of study for which the prerequisites apply at least one year prior to the effective date of any prerequisite courses for vocational technical education. - Amends TCA Title 49.

DUI Offenses - As introduced, lowers the DUI enhancement that would require an ignition interlock from .15 percent to .08 percent and removes the DUI enhancements that would require an ignition interlock relative to implied consent. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55.

Textbooks - As introduced, makes changes to the membership and terms of members on the textbook commission; provides that textbooks shall be available to any citizen at the citizen's expense; allows commission to appoint subject matter experts to advise the commission. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 22.
Lending Agencies - As enacted, revises various provisions of law regarding deferred presentment services. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 17.
Lending Agencies - As introduced, redefines check and defines payment instrument for the purposes of the Deferred Presentment Services Act. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 17.

Lending Agencies - As introduced, redefines check and defines payment instrument for the purposes of the Deferred Presentment Services Act. - Amends TCA Section 45-17-102; Section 45-17-103; Section 45-17-104; Section 45-17-105; Section 45-17-106; Section 45-17-107; Section 45-17-108; Section 45-17-109; Section 45-17-110; Section 45-17-111; Section 45-17-113; Section 45-17-114; Section 45-17-115; Section 45-17-116; Section 45-17-117; Section 45-17-118 and Section 45-17-119.

Short Term Loans and Lenders - As introduced, lowers the required amount of net assets that an applicant must have to be eligible for a pawnbroker's license from $75,000 to $50,000. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 6.
Lending Agencies - As introduced, requires reports concerning title pledge lenders to be submitted annually rather than biennially. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 15.
Taxes, Income - As introduced, establishes tax credit for angel investors who invest in qualified Tennessee businesses. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.
subjects: Labor and Employment|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Driver Licenses - As enacted, authorizes certain persons with a disability to obtain photo identification license upon proof of identity to the satisfaction of the commissioner of safety. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 3.

Domestic Violence - As introduced, requires law enforcement officer investigating an allegation of domestic abuse to file a report with the officer's supervisor within 48 hours of the initial investigation whenever possible. - Amends TCA Title 36 and Title 39.
Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, changes high school academic eligibility requirements for initial receipt of the HOPE scholarship. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

DUI Offenses - As enacted, clarifies various provisions of the ignition interlock requirements for certain DUI offenders. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 29; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 49; Title 55; Title 68 and Title 71.
Highways, Roads and Bridges - As introduced, decreases toll bridge rate for a four-horse wagon, loaded or unloaded, from 35 to 25. - Amends TCA Title 54.

Corporations, For Profit - As introduced, increases from 11 months to one year the period of time in which an appointment of proxy is effective by a shareholder in a for-profit corporation. - Amends TCA Title 48.

Uniform Commercial Code - As introduced, allows a warehouse to require payment from a person whose unfixed storage period has expired at least 45 days, instead of 30 days, after sending proper notice to the person. - Amends TCA Title 47.

Cemeteries - As introduced, permits commissioner of commerce and insurance to terminate temporary permit for operating cemetery by giving written notice of at least 20 days, instead of 10 days, before effective date of termination. - Amends TCA Title 46.

Banks and Financial Institutions - As introduced, increases from 90 to 100 calendar days the period of time in which application from bank without regulatory rating of one or two shall be deemed approved for branch facilities. - Amends TCA Title 45.

DUI Offenses - As introduced, increases the classification of the offense for DUI with a child in the car from a Class A misdemeanor to a Class E felony; requires the court to report to the department of children's services the name of any person convicted of DUI who, at the time of such violation, was accompanied by a child and the person was the parent or legal guardian of such child. - Amends TCA Title 55.
Livestock - As introduced, redefines dairy farm to include all milk-producing animals instead of limiting it to cows. - Amends TCA Title 44.

Agriculture, Dept. of - As introduced, deletes requirement that department prepare annual report concerning activities of the Tennessee agricultural museum board for approval by the governor. - Amends TCA Title 43.
Aircraft and Airports - As introduced, decreases from three to two the number of members necessary to constitute a quorum of the state aeronautics commission. - Amends TCA Title 42.
Prisoners and Inmates - As introduced, clarifies that inmates and their baggage are to be searched for all contraband, not just instruments of escape. - Amends TCA Title 41.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, creates felony offenses for concealing, harboring, shielding from detection, transporting, or any attempt thereof, certain persons in this state; provides that certain property utilized in committing such offenses be subject to forfeiture. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; and Title 50.

Mental Health and Developmental Disabilities, Dept. of - As introduced, requires department to report to general assembly following each meeting on transportation service for persons with developmental disabilities, mental illness, and serious emotional disturbance. - Amends TCA Title 33.
Children - As introduced,  limits number of children that may be accepted at a drop-in center on a snow day to 100. - Amends TCA Title 71.
Animal Control - As introduced, requires owners of dangerous and vicious dogs to secure minimal liability insurance. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 8.
Solid Waste Disposal - As introduced, increases from 30 to 45 days the time for filing appeal from final action of solid waste authority. - Amends TCA Title 68.
Laundries and Dry Cleaners - As introduced, increases from 180 to 200 days the minimum time required before a dry cleaner or launderer may dispose of unclaimed garments. - Amends TCA Title 66.
Public Utilities - As introduced, authorizes conductor to put off non-paying passenger at any regular station instead of any station or convenient point. - Amends TCA Title 65.

Regional Authorities and Special Districts - As enacted, authorizes the East Tennessee regional agribusiness marketing authority to plan, acquire, construct, improve, extend, furnish, equip, finance, own, operate and maintain a wastewater treatment and collection system within the region served by the authority. - Amends TCA Title 64.

Professions and Occupations - As introduced, increases from one to two years the expiration date of temporary permits the board may issue to dietitians, and increases the renewal period from six months to one year. - Amends TCA Title 63.
Private Protective Services - As introduced, assigns personal, civil, and criminal liability to private security guard using unauthorized deadly force. - Amends TCA Title 62.

Business Organizations - As introduced, increases from three to four months the period of time in which a person with a claim against a dissolved limited partnership may commence a proceeding to enforce the claim after receiving notice that the claim was rejected. - Amends TCA Title 61.

Education, Dept. of - As introduced, removes specific authority of department to request assistance from Tennessee Education Association with matters related to the Volunteer Public Education Trust Fund Act. - Amends TCA Section 49-3-404.
Natural Disasters - As introduced, redefines "natural emergency" to specifically include forest fires, hurricanes, and tornadoes. - Amends TCA Title 58.
Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, clarifies that the term "intoxicating liquors" does not apply to any beverage with alcohol content by weight of 5 percent or less. - Amends TCA Title 57.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As enacted, makes various changes and additions to present law concerning insurance, in regard to confidentiality and Risk-Based Capital for Insurers Act. - Amends TCA Title 56.

Driver Licenses - As enacted, provides for issuance of photo identification license free of charge to person who signs an affidavit stating the person: does not have a valid government issued photo identification; is a registered voter in this state; and needs the photo identification license for voting purposes. - Amends TCA Title 55.
Food and Food Products - As introduced, requires that bathrooms in food producing and distributing establishments supply both hot and cold running water. - Amends TCA Title 53.

Election Laws - As introduced, requires election officials to inspect filings for sufficiency and timeliness; establishes conclusive presumption that accepted filings are sufficient and timely filed. - Amends TCA Title 2.

Lottery, Charitable - As enacted, extends the period within which an annual event may be held during the annual event period beginning July 1, 2011, and ending June 30, 2012, from within 28 calendar days of the event date listed in the application to within 45 calendar days of the event date listed in the application; makes other various changes to provisions regarding filing deadlines and omnibus lists. - Amends TCA Title 3.

Administrative Procedure (UAPA) - As introduced, increases the number of interested persons necessary to petition an agency requesting the adoption, amendment, or repeal of a rule from five or more to 10 or more. - Amends TCA Title 4.

County Officers - As introduced, adds to the duties of the county attorney the duty to consult with and advise other elected county officials, their deputies and their employees as to the application and enforcement of federal and state laws pertinent to carrying out their official duties. - Amends TCA Title 5.

Education - As introduced, removes the Tennessee Education Association's recommendations from consideration by speaker of the house for appointment on the Tennessee financial literacy commission's board of directors. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 31.
Annexation - As introduced, increases from 30 days to 40 days time period prior to effectiveness of a municipal annexation ordinance. - Amends TCA Title 6.

Regional Authorities and Special Districts - As introduced, requires every railroad operating trains within the state to notify the commissioner of transportation of the telephone number of its registered agent for service of process. - Amends TCA Title 7.

State Employees - As introduced, requires development and periodical offering of seminars to state employees on financial planning and utilization of state benefits as part of such financial plan. - Amends TCA Title 8.

Public Records - As introduced, requires the chief administrative officer of each entity subject to public records to inform employees and appointees about the requirements of state law concerning public records and the entities' policies for administering public records statutes. - Amends TCA Title 10.
State Government - As introduced, requires that electronic copies of the state owned property inventory be provided to designated officials as well as paper copies. - Amends TCA Title 12.

Development Districts - As introduced, requires the county building commissioner to return by mail a copy of a certificate of insurance or workers' compensation policy within 15 working days, instead of 10 working days, to the person who obtained the permit. - Amends TCA Title 13.

Holidays and Days of Special Observance - As introduced, redesignates the second Monday in September each year as American Indian Day instead of the fourth Monday in September each year. - Amends TCA Title 15.

Education, Dept. of - As enacted, specifies that the commissioner may appoint to the state-level safety team a representative from "directors of schools, members of local boards of education, public school teachers, school counselors and psychologists, and parents of students enrolled in public schools" instead of from "the Tennessee organization of school superintendents, the Tennessee school boards association, the Tennessee education association, and the Tennessee state parent teacher association." - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 8.

Education - As introduced, removes specific reference to Tennessee Education Association in permissible requests for assistance from state board of education and for speaker of the house's appointment to Tennessee financial literacy commission. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 4 and Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 31.

Tobacco, Tobacco Products - As enacted, authorizes counties and cities to prohibit, by ordinance, smoking outside of hospitals or in the public areas immediately outside of a hospital building and its entrances, including public sidewalks. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 68.
Election Laws - As enacted, expands state election commission to seven members permanently. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 11, Part 1.

Mining and Quarrying - As enacted, prohibits an operator from engaging in rock harvesting without having first obtained a permit or a notice of coverage under a general permit from the commissioner of environment and conservation; imposes other requirements. - Amends TCA Title 59, Chapter 8, Part 2 and Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.

Public Contracts - As introduced, delays the implementation of last year's bill concerning the procurement commission and related topics; makes substantive changes in certain parts of last year's bill. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 56; Title 12, Chapter 3; Title 12, Chapter 4; Title 12, Chapter 2; Title 41, Chapter 22, Part 4; Title 71, Chapter 4, Part 7 and Chapter 1098 of the Public Acts of 2010.

Public Funds and Financing - As introduced, enacts the "Tax Increment Financing Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 53; Title 9; Title 13, Chapter 20 and Chapter 987 of the Public Acts of 1998.
Public Funds and Financing - As enacted, rewrites law regarding invalid obligations. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 21.

School Districts, Special - As enacted, specifies that before the board of education of special school district requests legislation to exceed the certified rate, it must first publish notice of its intent to exceed the certified rate in the manner required of cities and counties; specifies that present law regarding tax rates in special school districts would apply to all counties instead of only to counties with less than 50,000 people. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-1704.

Economic and Community Development - As introduced, prohibits the consideration of specified acts of local governments in economic and community development evaluations. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7 and Section 68-120-101.
County Government - As enacted, removes requirement that county legislative bodies must have typed or printed a description of the boundaries of county districts. - Amends TCA Section 5-1-110.

Public Funds and Financing - As enacted, requires that amendments to resolution that created a local government audit committee be submitted to the comptroller for review and comment in same manner as the creating resolution under present law; specifies that if audit committee was created by legislative body of a county whose charter requires charter changes to be approved in a referendum, and if such actions occurred and were approved in a referendum prior to January 1, 2011, then such an audit committee will be considered created pursuant to present law. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 3, Part 4.

Public Funds and Financing - As introduced, authorizes state funding board to require public entities to adopt the model finance transaction policies created by the board and clarifies that such policies would include budgeting and capital planning, finance transaction management, investment, and risk management. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8 and Title 9.

General Assembly - As enacted, changes time within which fiscal review committee must submit a fiscal note on legislation from within 7 days of introduction or request to within 10 days of introduction or request. - Amends TCA Title 3 and Title 8.
Taxes, Ad Valorem - As enacted, authorizes the acceptance of partial payment of delinquent property taxes by the county trustee under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-2001.
Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, allows theater in Knox County to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

Agriculture - As introduced, includes organic milk and milk products under the Dairy Industry Promotion Act, which authorizes producers of milk and milk products on a commercial basis to levy upon themselves an assessment on milk products for the purpose of financing or contributing to the financing of a program of promoting, advertising, researching and other methods designed to increase the consumption, use and sale of domestic milk and milk products.
 -

Congress - As introduced, creates joint congressional communications committee of general assembly; authorizes changing of congressional districts between apportionment. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 3.
Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, allows theater in Knox County to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.
Motor Vehicles - As introduced, exempts from window tinting restrictions motor vehicles owned or leased by members of the general assembly. - Amends TCA Section 55-9-107.

Special License Plates - As introduced, authorizes issuance of Stax Museum of American Soul Music new specialty earmarked license plates; allocates 50% of funds produced from sale thereof to the Stax Museum. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Transportation, Dept. of - As introduced, requires commissioner to file annual report as to projects receiving transportation enhancement grants. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 23; Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 51 and Title 54.

Special License Plates - As introduced, extends time period for meeting initial issuance requirements for Civil War Preservation new specialty earmarked license plates until July 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Special License Plates - As introduced, authorizes issuance of Tennessee Equine Association new specialty earmarked license plates; allocates 50% of funds produced from sale thereof to such association. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
Public Contracts - As enacted, enacts the "Freedom in Contracting Act." - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 4.

Tennessee Wildlife Resources Agency - As enacted, specifies that the county executive of Roane County may designate a person from the office of the county sheriff or from the county office of emergency management to accompany an agent of TWRA when inspecting a Class I wildlife facility in Roane County. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 4.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, changes the terminating events for receipt of the Tennessee HOPE scholarship beginning with the 2012-2013 academic year. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.
Traffic Safety - As enacted, revises enforcement provisions of unmanned traffic surveillance cameras. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.
Sexual Offenses - As introduced, makes a person who is charged with sexual exploitation of a minor ineligible for suspension of prosecution and pretrial diversion. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 15.

Taxes, Business - As introduced, returns administration and collection of the business privilege tax to county clerks and designated city officials in Shelby, Davidson, Knox, and Hamilton counties. - Amends TCA Section 50-6-904 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 7.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Election Laws - As introduced, delays implementation of the voter confidence act for two years. - Amends TCA Title 2, and Chapter 1108 of the Public Acts of 2008 as amended by Chapter 612 of the Public Acts of 2010.

Education, Higher - As introduced, authorizes state agencies to provide free and discounted services to Tennessee Intercollegiate State Legislature Foundation. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 20.

Workers Compensation - As introduced, requires local governments to participate in workers' compensation. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 8; Title 29, Chapter 20; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 50, Chapter 6.
Economic and Community Development - As enacted, revises law concerning submission of economic impact plans in Davidson County. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 53.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, provides that venue and territorial jurisdiction for the offense of identity theft may be where the victim resides or is located. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.

Law Enforcement - As introduced, prohibits law enforcement officers or agencies from collecting or maintaining information about political or religious views of an individual or group unless it directly relates to criminal investigation and subject of information is believed to be involved. - Amends TCA Title 38.

Taxes, Tobacco, Tobacco Products - As introduced, clarifies that authority for department of revenue's officers to enforce provisions of tobacco tax law does not limit attorney general's duty to enforce or defend Tobacco Master Settlement Agreement. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 10.

Taxes, Income - As introduced, increases annual Hall income tax exclusion from first $1,250 to $7,500 for individual returns and from first $2,500 to $15,000 for joint returns beginning January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2, Part 1.
subjects: Labor and Employment|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Sex Discrimination - As introduced, enacts the "Pay Equity in the Workplace Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 2, Part 2.

Unemployment Compensation - As introduced, authorizes unemployment insurance benefits to individual who leaves work or is discharged due to circumstances resulting from being victim of domestic violence. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.

Public Contracts - As introduced, prohibits any public employer from contracting with a private employer who fails to verify the legal status of the private employer's employees; creates penalties. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 12 and Title 50.

Campaigns and Campaign Finance - As introduced, prohibits the governor and members of the general assembly from creating or controlling multicandidate political campaign committees. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

Labor and Workforce Development, Dept. of - As introduced, requires the department of labor and workforce development to create an office of lawful employment enforcement, staffed by three persons, whereby random audits of employers shall be conducted for compliance with prohibitions under state law concerning the hiring of illegal aliens. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 12 and Title 50.

Education, Curriculum - As enacted, enacts the "Carmen Burnette Act of 2012," which requires cardiopulmonary resuscitation programs to implement hands-on practice and skills testing to support cognitive learning, as opposed to merely cognitive training. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 12.
Highway Signs - As enacted, designates bridge on U.S. Highway 64 in Lincoln County as "William R. Carter Memorial Bridge." -

Employees, Employers - As introduced, requires certain employers to use the federal work authorization system (e-verify) to verify the legal status of employees; subject to a hearing, authorizes license suspension or revocation for failure to comply. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 12 and Title 50.

Employees, Employers - As introduced, requires certain employers to use the federal work authorization system (e-verify) to verify the legal status of employees; creates penalties for failure to comply. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 12 and Title 50.

Banks and Financial Institutions - As introduced, requires mandatory mediation between a bank or other financial institution and a borrower before foreclosure proceedings may be instituted on a deed of trust, mortgage, or other lien securing the payment of money or other thing of value. - Amends TCA Title 35 and Title 45.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, requires companies locating in state to establish defined benefit plans and health insurance prior to receiving tax credits and state funding. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 12; Title 53 and Title 67.
Environmental Preservation - As introduced, requires native grasses to be used to cover landfill sites that have been filled or closed to further operations. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211.

Fire Prevention and Investigation - As introduced, requires that certain structures maintain or acquire photo-electric smoke detectors. - Amends TCA Section 37-2-412; Title 68, Chapter 102, Part 1; Title 68, Chapter 11 and Title 68, Chapter 120, Part 1.

Consumer Protection - As introduced, adds as a consumer protection violation representing that an Internet-based ticket sale price has increased after the sale is completed. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1.

Workers Compensation - As introduced, establishes a conclusive presumption that a beryllium employee, employee with cancer or silicosis, or other employee covered under the federal Energy Employees Occupational Illness Compensation Act has an occupational disease for the purposes of state workers' compensation claim. - Amends TCA Title 50.
Salaries and Benefits - As introduced, removes members of the general assembly as eligible participants in the state employees health care plan. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27.
Zoning - As introduced, urges municipalities and counties to develop grants to preserve and rehabilitate historic residential homes. - Amends TCA Title 13.

Mortgages - As introduced, extends time for foreclosure notice; requires notice be given to borrower of foreclosure counseling; requires mortgage loans be based upon ability of borrower to repay such loans. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 35; Title 45; Title 47 and Title 66.
Professions and Occupations - As introduced, enacts the "Ticket Broker Licensing Act." - Amends TCA Title 62.

Drugs, Over the Counter - As introduced, provides that nonexempt methamphetamine precursors may only be sold after pharmacist has consulted with prospective buyer and has no reason to believe that the person will use it in the illegal manufacture of methamphetamine. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
Emergency Communications Districts - As introduced, makes 911 calls and transmissions of such calls confidential. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 86, Part 1 and Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5.

Revenue, Dept. of - As introduced, transfers contested case hearings currently under jurisdiction of the department of revenue to the office of the secretary of state. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5 and Title 67.

Military - As introduced, requires the governor to proclaim a statewide day of mourning for any member of the armed services who dies as a result of injuries sustained from a service connected, combat-related cause. - Amends TCA Section 4-1-406.

Unclaimed Property - As introduced, revises various provisions of the Uniform Disposition of Unclaimed Property Act, including certain reporting requirements and minimum dollar values that must exist. - Amends TCA Section 66-29-113 and Section 66-29-115(f)(4).

Unclaimed Property - As introduced, corrects a code reference to clarify what conditions raising a presumption of abandonment must be satisfied in order for intangible property to be subject to the custody of this state as unclaimed property. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 29, Part 1.

Public Utilities - As introduced, clarifies a reference to the department of the treasury in provisions governing the public utility assistance program for small and minority-owned businesses. - Amends TCA Section 65-5-112 and Section 65-5-113.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, establishes that procedures for the certification, recertification and decertification of health benefit plans as qualified health plans shall be implemented. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 28.

Public Funds and Financing - As introduced, removes reference to security for public deposits task force, which no longer exists, in provisions governing collateral pool for public deposits. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4.

Taxes, Excise - As introduced, lowers the period of time from four to three years for extending the investment period for required capital investment for an excise tax credit based on the amount of capital investment in industrial machinery. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 20.

Banks and Financial Institutions - As introduced, excludes certain residential mortgage transactions from the application of the Tennessee Home Loan Protection Act; creates a pilot project in Shelby County for voluntary mediation prior to the foreclosure of loans entered into under such act. - Amends TCA Title 35 and Title 45, Chapter 20, Part 1.

Criminal Procedure - As enacted, directs the commissioner of commerce and insurance to determine whether there are impediments inhibiting insurance companies from underwriting coverage for situations where person uses force that is justified, including deadly force, in protecting self or person. - Amends TCA Section 39-11-622 and Title 56.

Short Term Loans and Lenders - As introduced, lowers the fees authorized to be charged for deferring the presentment of a check or for making a title loan and lowers the interest authorized to be charged for making a title loan. - Amends TCA Title 45.
Short Term Loans and Lenders - As introduced, revises the Tennessee Title Pledge Act. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 15.
Short Term Loans and Lenders - As introduced, makes various changes to the Tennessee Title Pledge Act. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 15.

Motor Vehicles - As enacted, specifies, in certain situations, that if the owner of the vehicle is not present, then prior to any person, firm or entity towing a vehicle, such person, firm or entity must notify local law enforcement of the vehicle identification number (VIN), registration information, license plate number and description of the vehicle; local law enforcement must keep a record of all such information which would be available for public inspection. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 16; Title 55, Chapter 21, Part 1; Title 66, Chapter 19, Part 1 and Title 66, Chapter 28, Part 5.

Industrial Development - As enacted, authorizes industrial development corporations located in municipalities in which urban brownfield redevelopment projects are located to prepare and submit economic impact plans for the development of such projects. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 53.
Redistricting, Legislative - As enacted, establishes state house of representatives districts. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.
Redistricting, Legislative - As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.
Redistricting, Legislative - As enacted, establishes state senate districts. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-102.
Redistricting, Congressional - As enacted, establishes the state's congressional districts. - Amends TCA Section 2-16-103.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Municipal and County Issues

title: Redistricting, Congressional - As introduced, requires compliance with state and federal constitutions as well as judicial decisions in passing congressional redistricting plan. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Municipal and County Issues

title: Public Officials - As introduced, allows the governor to employ special counsel in certain situations and adds additional duties for the attorney general and reporter. - Amends TCA Title 8.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, requires the commissioner of commerce and insurance to convene a working group of representatives from the insurance industry and the medical professions to study recent trends concerning various issues affecting the health insurance industry and the medical professions. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 57; Title 56 and Title 68.

Consumer Protection - As introduced, prohibits an award of exemplary or punitive damages for an unfair or deceptive practice that is a willful or knowing violation of consumer protection law if the court has already awarded three times the actual damages sustained. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18.

Child Abuse - As introduced, decreases the time in which the district attorney is required to notify the child protective team of whether prosecution is justified or appropriate in view of the circumstances from 15 to 14 days. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 36; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55.

Gambling - As enacted, specifies that it is not an offense for a manufacturer of gambling devices to knowingly own, manufacture, assemble, design, possess, buy, sell, rent, lease, store, repair, transport, print or make any gambling device or record solely intended for gambling outside of Tennessee and in compliance with federal law.  - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

Drug and Alcohol Rehabilitation - As introduced, establishes licensure process for drug and alcohol counselors; grandfathers in certain drug and alcohol counselors. - Amends TCA Title 33, Chapter 10 and Title 68, Chapter 24, Part 6.
Short Term Loans and Lenders - As enacted, rewrites law regarding the disposition of stolen property that is in the possession of a pawnbroker.  - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 6, Part 2.
Fire Prevention and Investigation - As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Prescribed Burning Act." - Amends TCA Title 11, Chapter 4, Part 8 and Title 68.

Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, clarifies that alcoholic beverages may be served in any structure, location, open air or dining facility located on Blackberry Farm property. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102(20)(F)(iii) and Section 57-4-203.

Eminent Domain - As introduced, restates authority for counties, cities and towns to take property by eminent domain for a public purpose; revises the procedure for resolving just compensation issues when counties, cities and towns take property by eminent domain for a public purpose. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 31; Title 13, Chapter 20; Title 29, Chapter 17 and Title 29, Chapter 16.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, creates the Class A misdemeanor offense of sexual contact by an authority figure which is defined as an adult with supervisory or disciplinary power over a minor, unlawfully kissing the minor for the purpose of sexual arousal or gratification. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 5 and Title 40, Chapter 39.

Education - As introduced, requires director of schools' acceptable Internet use policy to include provisions that encourage the use and understanding of the Internet as an educational tool in preparing students for college and career readiness. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Immigration - As introduced, enacts the "Lawful Presence Enforcement Act." - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 29; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 49; Title 50; Title 55; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.
Solid Waste Disposal - As introduced, increases maximum number of members who may serve on certain solid waste authority boards from 15 to 17. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211, Part 9.

Education - As introduced, requires the department of education to devise an additional alternative assessment for certain students with disabilities. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 6; Title 49, Chapter 10 and Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 60.

Public Employees - As introduced, prohibits public employees from having a payroll deduction to a political action committee or for dues for membership organizations that use funds for political activities. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 7 and Title 8.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, designates American Baptist College as an eligible independent postsecondary institution for purposes of lottery scholarships. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

Election Laws - As enacted, requires any county election commission desiring to use ballot-on-demand technology to have approval by the coordinator of elections 60 days before any election; requires the coordinator of elections and the state election commission to provide an approved list of available ballot-on-demand technology vendors from which the county election commission must select for use. - Amends TCA Section 2-5-209.

Election Laws - As introduced, permits polling places to close one hour later and requires that the county election commission give 30 instead of 15 days' notice as to the time at which polling places will open. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 3.

Taxes - As introduced, prohibits courts from hindering the collection of taxes administered by the commissioner of revenue, except as provided in present law regarding taxpayer remedies for disputed taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 18.

Public Funds and Financing - As introduced, clarifies that bonds to refund outstanding obligations will be sold and state bonds will be issued consistent with adopted finance transaction policies. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 21 and Title 9, Chapter 9.

Traffic Safety - As enacted, broadens application of lighting requirements for vehicles or trailers transporting certain loads at night to apply to such loads projecting three and one-half feet or more, rather than four feet or more, beyond rear of vehicle's body. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 9, Part 4 and Title 65, Chapter 15.

Intellectual & Developmental Disabilities - As introduced, provides for additional notice to legislative committees, lengthens certain reporting deadlines and authorizes additional assistance to the commissioner of intellectual and developmental disabilities concerning determining the fiscal impact of certain changes impacting certain licensees of the department of mental health. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 63 and Title 68.
Campaigns and Campaign Finance - As introduced, creates Class C misdemeanor for labor organization to contribute to candidates. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

Public Health - As introduced, requires commissioner of health to report on or before January 31, 2012, with legislative recommendations to legislative committees after consulting with the commissioner of environment and conservation concerning issues involved in the disposing of needles. - Amends TCA Title 68.
Safety - As introduced, prohibits a local government from establishing a magazine or gun powder storage facility within one mile of a daycare facility or school. - Amends TCA Title 68.
Business Organizations - As introduced, requires that LLPs list partnership interests in the partnership agreement. - Amends TCA Title 48 and Title 61.

Education, Higher - As enacted, allows state agencies to provide free and discounted services to the Tennessee Intercollegiate State Legislature Foundation; requires that the Tennessee Intercollegiate State Legislature Foundation bear any costs associated with the operation of the general assembly's chambers. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 20.

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As introduced, provides for discounted rates to certain uninsured persons for emergency, inpatient or outpatient care at licensed healthcare facilities. - Amends TCA Title 56; Title 63 and Title 68.

Education - As introduced, requires the re-establishment of elected office of school superintendent for counties or municipalities operating school systems; provides for qualifications of candidates. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-203 and Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 3.
Contractors - As introduced, exempts certain persons or entities from requirement to obtain a license as a general contractor or home improvement contractor. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 6.
Highway Signs - As enacted, designates segment of State Highway 109 in Sumner County as "Tommy Marlin Highway." -
Education - As introduced, establishes criteria for evaluations of certified employees of LEAs and grievance of such evaluations by teachers. - Amends TCA Title 49.
Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, exempts from sales tax any over-the-counter drug for human use dispensed without a prescription. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

Solid Waste Disposal - As enacted, requires any proposed landfill owner to provide notice to persons owning property within a three-mile radius of such landfill at least 15 days in advance of any public hearing scheduled regarding applications for the construction of the proposed landfill by having signs erected on all roads leading directly to the proposed landfill site.  - Amends TCA Title 13 and Title 68, Chapter 211.

Codes - As introduced, removes the fee that the state fire marshal charges for review and approval of plans and specifications prior to construction or alteration of certain types of buildings or structures. - Amends TCA Title 68.

Forfeiture of Assets - As introduced, expands when real property may be forfeited for conviction of certain drug offenses and offense of promoting prostitution, from three or more acts within 60 days to three or more acts within 120 days. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 2 and Title 39, Chapter 11.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, excludes principals, assistant principals and system-wide supervisors from membership on negotiating units for purposes of the Education Professional Negotiation Act. - Amends TCA Section 49-5-602.

Intellectual & Developmental Disabilities - As introduced, requires the statewide policy council for the department of intellectual and developmental disabilities to attend to identifying issues relating to delivering health care to the department's service recipients with particular attention to issues involving TennCare and health care facilities regulated by the department of health. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 33; Title 68 and Title 71.
Charitable Solicitations - As introduced, exempts food banks from meeting the requirements concerning solicitation of charitable funds. - Amends TCA Section 48-101-502.

Utilities, Utility Districts - As introduced, requires a board of public utilities to meet within 14 days of appointment to elect a chair instead of 10 and requires notice of meetings to be posted on the board's Web site. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 34; Title 7, Chapter 52; Title 7, Chapter 82 and Title 68, Chapter 221, Part 10.
Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As introduced, revises retirement provisions for general sessions judges, from Group 1 to Group 4 level. - Amends TCA Title 8.
Public Defenders - As introduced, removes certain responsibilities of the executive director of the district public defenders conference. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 14 and Title 9, Chapter 4.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, provides that offenses of wiretapping and electronic surveillance do not apply to person who installs software on a computer the person owns if such software is intended solely to monitor and record the use of the Internet by a minor child of whom such person is a parent or legal guardian. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 6.

Education, Curriculum - As enacted, requires the state board of education, in consultation with the department of education, to review the current elementary and secondary curriculum standards for the subject of United States and Tennessee government. - Amends TCA Title 49.
Budget Procedures - As introduced, prohibits budgetary expenditures on programs enacted by congress without constitutional authority or funding. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 51.

Business and Commerce - As introduced, removes repeated language in the provisions governing the qualifications for a barber instructor. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7; Title 8; Title 46; Title 47; Title 48; Title 50; Title 56; Title 62; Title 63 and Title 68.
Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, revises licensing requirements for surplus lines agents. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 14 and Title 56, Chapter 6.

Intellectual & Developmental Disabilities - As enacted, requires organizations that supply mental health and developmental disability services to check the registry that contains the names of any persons who have been determined to have abused, neglected, misappropriated or exploited the property of vulnerable individuals and not hire or use as a volunteer any individual listed on the registry; requirements apply to organizations that contract with the division of intellectual disabilities services for residential services, day services or supported employment services.

 - Amends TCA Title 33.

Workers Compensation - As introduced, removes the restriction prohibiting an affiliate of a construction services provider who has obtained a workers' compensation exemption from obtaining a workers' compensation exemption. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.
Election Laws - As introduced, requires the coordinator of elections to keep on file the certifications for electronic voting systems. - Amends TCA Section 2-20-104.
Schools, Home - As enacted, makes various changes to home school requirements. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-3050.
Immigration - As enacted, enacts the "Refugee Absorptive Capacity Act." - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 45 and Title 71.

Education - As enacted, requires the first AED received by a school to be placed in a location that can be readily accessed, which may include those areas used for physical education or activity. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-122.

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As introduced, specifies that no managed care entity is exempt from antitrust law, regardless of whether or not such entity contracts with a private act hospital authority that has such an exemption. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 56 and Title 68.

Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, adds to description of a premier type tourist resort in Blount County that the resort maintains a rock climbing facility. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102 and Section 57-4-101.

Boards and Commissions - As introduced, authorizes the board for licensing health care facilities to establish rules and regulations concerning the operation and licensing of pain management facilities. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11.

Highways, Roads and Bridges - As introduced, provides that the chief administrative officer of the highway department in Decatur County must have four years of experience in the use of construction equipment used for highway construction or maintenance. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 7.

Firearms and Ammunition - As introduced, requires notice of sales of confiscated firearms to be placed on Web site of county or municipality conducting such sale; requires such notice state that members of the public are invited to the sale. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-1317.
Public Works Projects - As introduced, enacts the "Public Improvement District Act." - Amends TCA Title 7.
Real Property - As enacted, enacts the "Prohibition of Covenants Providing for Transfer Fees Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 66.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, adds to the offense of perjury any false statement made, not under oath, but in a declaration stating on its face that it is made under penalty of perjury. - Amends TCA Section 39-16-702.

Appeal and Review - As introduced, increases the number of days that a petitioner has to appeal after a motion to reopen a post-conviction petition is denied from 10 days to 30 days; increases the number of days that the state has to respond from 10 days to 30 days. - Amends TCA Section 40-30-117(c).

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As introduced, provides that any private act hospitals authority's records shall be open to public inspection, except as otherwise provided by state statute or federal law. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 56 and Title 68.
Criminal Offenses - As introduced, increases maximum fine imposed for disorderly conduct at funerals and other similar services from $50.00 to $500. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-317.

Highways, Roads and Bridges - As introduced, transfers responsibility for mowing of rights-of-way and litter collection on state highways from department of transportation to department of correction; requires TDOT to pay TDOC for use of necessary prison labor. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 5, Part 1.

Utilities, Utility Districts - As introduced, establishes circumstances in which a nonutility may be regulated by the Tennessee Regulatory Authority following a sale or lease to the nonutility by a public utility. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 4.
Highway Signs - As enacted, designates bridge on U.S. Highway 64 in Giles County as "J. Marlin Goodman Memorial Bridge." -
Highway Signs - As enacted, designates bridge on U.S. Highway 64 in Giles County as "William B. Long Memorial Bridge." -
Sheriffs - As introduced, changes qualifications for the office of sheriff for all persons running for sheriff on and after July 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 8, Part 1.

Municipal Government - As enacted, authorizes certain municipality located in a tier 3 enhancement county, acting through the authorization of the board of public utilities or other board or supervisory body having responsibility for the gas department or electric department, to loan funds from the gas department or electric department to an eligible industrial development corporation for the purpose of economic development or industrial development, or both, in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 54.

Utilities, Utility Districts - As enacted, requires approaching vehicles to move into other lane from a stationary utility vehicle with flashing lights if such lane change can be safely made. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8, Part 1.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, revises various criminal provisions relative to the use of any bank, savings and loan association, savings bank or subsidiary's trade name or trademark. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 45; Title 47 and Title 56.
Taxes, Tobacco, Tobacco Products - As introduced, deletes current statutory language which states that the tobacco tax is levied on the consumer, who is liable for the tax. - Amends TCA Title 67.

Tennessee Regulatory Authority - As enacted, clarifies that exemption from TRA regulation applies to any cooperative organization not organized or doing business for profit, cooperative association not organized or doing business for profit, or cooperative corporation not organized or doing business for profit; exempts from public utility regulation by TRA any 501(c)(4) corporation that owns or operates a wastewater system primarily for the use of the members of the corporation and that has received a written statement of exemption from regulation as a public utility from TRA prior to January 1, 2009. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 4.
subjects: State Agencies|Federal, State, and Local Relations

title: Taxes, Privilege - As introduced, states that an employer may remit the professional privilege tax on behalf of an employee but the employee shall remain liable for the tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.
Motor Vehicles - As introduced, requires for-hire limousine passenger services to be regulated by the Tennessee regulatory authority. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 65.

Remedies and Special Proceedings - As introduced, creates a statutory physical invasion of privacy and constructive invasion of privacy cause of action; creates a fund where half of any civil penalties collected are deposited, with the other half going to prosecuting counties and cities. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 66.

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As introduced, directs that no hospital that is a subsidiary or an affiliate of a private act hospital is exempt from antitrust law, federal or state, otherwise applicable to private hospitals. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 56 and Title 68.

Boats, Boating - As introduced, increases from 30 to 45 days the period of time in which a person cited for not wearing flotation device must provide proof of legal age; extends from 30 to 45 days time for proving age may be extended at discretion of officer. - Amends TCA Title 69.
Firearms and Ammunition - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Gun Owners Improvement Act." - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40; Title 49, Chapter 6 and Title 70.
Food and Food Products - As introduced, provides for the regulation of the sale and identification of honey products. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 15 and Title 53.

Sentencing - As introduced, adds to definition of first degree murder the killing of another while committing domestic abuse against victim where defendant has pattern of domestic abuse against victim or another family member. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 2.
Agriculture, Dept. of - As introduced, authorizes the state apiarist to place certain registration and safety requirements on beekeepers. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 15.

Animal Control - As enacted, provides that no county, municipality, consolidated government, or other political subdivision of this state may adopt or continue in effect any ordinance or resolution prohibiting the establishment or maintenance of honeybees in hives, provided that such establishment or maintenance is in compliance with the Tennessee Apiary Act of 1995. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 15.

Firearms and Ammunition - As introduced, clarifies that there are circumstances in which a firearm can be carried in a public park and clarifies that it is firearms, clubs and knives that are prohibited in parks and not weapons already regulated such as machine guns and explosive weapons. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13; Title 40, Chapter 14; Title 40, Chapter 35; Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 34 and Title 70.
Motor Vehicles - As introduced, authorizes persons to ride a motorcycle without a helmet if they are 21 and have at least $15,000 of medical insurance coverage. - Amends TCA Section 55-9-302.

Transportation, Dept. of - As introduced, requires the department of transportation to award a safe routes to schools grant to the Tennessee contractor with the lowest bid, unless such contractor's bid is more than 10% greater than the lowest bidder. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 23; Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 21; Title 54, Chapter 1, Part 1; Title 54, Chapter 2, Part 1; Title 54, Chapter 4 and Title 55, Chapter 20.

General Assembly, Directed Studies - As introduced, creates special joint committee to study the feasibility and recommend ways and means of establishing incentives including tax credits by local governments and the state to encourage people to conserve land. -

Economic and Community Development, Dept. of - As introduced, requires the department of economic and community development to award a community development block grant to the Tennessee contractor with the lowest bid, unless such contractor's bid is more than 10% greater than the lowest bidder. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7; Title 6; Title 13 and Title 68.

General Assembly - As introduced, requires any amount of postal and printing allowance allocated to a member who has $20,000 in such allowance to revert back to the general fund. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 1.

General Assembly - As introduced, requires cost of any remodeling, paint, furniture or other improvements to a member's state office to be paid from such member's postal and printing allowance. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.

General Assembly - As introduced, requires any amount of postal and printing allowance of more than $10,000 not be transferred to a new member when the former member retires, loses an election, resigns or is otherwise removed from office but revert back to the general fund. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.

Sentencing - As introduced, increases punishment for fourth or subsequent domestic assault or criminal violation or order of protection from Class A misdemeanor to Class E felony. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1.

Health Care - As introduced, clarifies that certain private act hospital authorities are not exempt from antitrust law, federal or state, otherwise applicable to private hospitals. - Amends TCA Section 7-57-501 and Section 7-57-502.
Safety - As enacted, revises various provisions regarding high-voltage lines. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 103.

Driver Licenses - As introduced, provides that photo identification licenses issued by the department of safety to persons 18 and over will be free to recipients. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 3.
State Employees - As introduced, establishes manner for determining years of service under certain voluntary separation plans. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 51.

School Districts, Special - As enacted, permits a city and a special school district with coterminous boundaries to specify by contract that city funding for the district shall be used half for district operations and half for issuance of bonds and, upon agreement of the city legislative body and the school board at the time that the bonds are issued, proceeds of any such bond issue shall be used for maintenance and construction at schools existing at the time the bonds are issued. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 3.

Human Services, Dept. of - As introduced, requires the department to promulgate as a rule by means of cross-reference the manual relating to the child care certificate program and requires administrative hearings in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 71.

Election Laws - As introduced, allows homeless person to vote at county election commission office; requires such person to execute affidavit of identity prior to voting. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 2 and Title 2, Chapter 7.

Sexual Offenders - As introduced, revokes outgoing mail privileges of inmates convicted of sexual offenses and not registered as sexual offenders for contact by mail with victims and victims' families. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2 and Title 41.
Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, allows a credit against franchise and excise taxes for the purchase of Tennessee goods or services. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 21.

Sentencing - As introduced, elevates killing of another while committing aggravated assault against a victim who has an order of protection or restraining order against the defendant to first degree murder under felony murder provision of first degree murder statute. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 2.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, creates a sales tax holiday for the first weekend of March and October of each year for senior citizens; exempts certain items. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
General Assembly - As introduced, restricts amount of per diem and mileage reimbursement to amounts set in 2010 beginning with the next general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.

Campaigns and Campaign Finance - As introduced, requires records of statements filed with registry of election finance be kept for length of candidate's term of office or two years whichever is later. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

Education, Higher - As introduced, requires THEC to develop a tuition waiver program for students within four courses of completing a baccalaureate degree who have been out of school for at least five years. - Amends TCA Title 49.
Redistricting, Congressional - Enacts "Tennessee Congressional Redistricting Commission Act." - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16; Title 4, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Title 8, Chapter 4.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Municipal and County Issues

title: Schools, Charter - As introduced, requires the task force on charter schools to study the personnel requirements that result from the creation of charter schools and make recommendations to the general assembly about the impact of charter school expansion in the future by January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, permits Tennessee HOPE scholarships to be awarded during summer school, reduces the number of years in which the HOPE scholarships may be received from five to four and alters the dual enrollment grant program. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

Public Employees - As introduced, requires state insurance committee to establish a supplemental health insurance program that pays cash benefits for state employees. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27.
Child Custody and Support - As enacted, revises conditions under which grandparent visitation can be awarded. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6, Part 3.

Food and Food Products - As enacted, authorizes the sale of nonpotentially hazardous foods that are prepared in home based kitchens at a person's personal residence, a community or social event, including church bazaars and festivals, and flea markets, in addition to authorizing the sale of such foods at farmer's markets; establishes other requirements. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 1 and Title 53, Chapter 8, Part 1.

Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As introduced, under certain circumstances, allows members of the Tennessee consolidated retirement system to change from the optional form to the regular form of retirement in favor of a different beneficiary in the event of divorce. - Amends TCA Section 8-36-606.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, revises Tennessee HOPE scholarship program to permit payment of the scholarship award during summer school as well as during fall and spring semesters. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

Agriculture - As enacted, authorizes persons who are licensed to sell eggs to sell, offer, or expose for sale, or have in the person's possession for sale, all eggs produced by the person unless limited otherwise by federal law. - Amends TCA Title 53.

Education - As introduced, requires principal to consider best interests of child before permitting a child to delay entering school after reaching the mandatory age for beginning school; revises from 30 to 15 days when a child withdrawn from a public school must re-enter public school or be home-schooled. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-3001.
Constitutional Conventions - As introduced, requires delegates from Tennessee attending a federal constitutional convention to vote according to the demands of the Tennessee general assembly. -

General Assembly - As introduced, directs the general assembly to appoint a committee to review all federal laws and regulations for constitutionality; requires the committee to submit for a vote of the general assembly all federal laws and regulations it deems to be invalid under the Tennessee or federal constitutions. - Amends TCA Title 3.

Appropriations - As introduced, grants an across-the-board salary increase of $2,000 to each full-time employee and a proportionate share to each part-time employee of UT and TBR for the fiscal year that begins July 1, 2011, and ends on June 30, 2012. -

Forfeiture of Assets - As enacted, provides that real and personal property used in commission of human trafficking offenses is subject to judicial forfeiture seizure and provides for disposition of funds from forfeited assets. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 11, Part 7 and Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 3.

Agriculture - As introduced, adds "manufactures or produces Tennessee products, including agricultural products," to the definition of Tennessee-based business enterprise. - Amends TCA Title 1; Title 4; Title 43; Title 44; Title 47; Title 57; Title 59; Title 60 and Title 70.

Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As introduced, includes bomb and arson special agents among those persons in the TCRS engaged in law enforcement activities on a day-to-day basis having a mandatory retirement age. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 36, Part 2.
Safety - As enacted, revises certain provisions of law regarding electrical inspections and changes the date by which swimming pools have to be equipped with alarms. - Amends TCA Title 68.
Advertising - As introduced, revises various provisions governing billboard regulation and control. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 21.
Public Employees - As enacted, provides an unpaid leave of absence for members of the Tennessee state guard and civil air patrol. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 33, Part 1.

Education - As introduced, allows local boards of education to establish funds to accept donations from individuals, corporations or other entities to fund educational field trips and permits recognition of such donors within guidelines of the department of education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 6.
Criminal Offenses - As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Human Trafficking Resource Center Hotline Act." - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 3.
Education - As introduced, limits actions taken by students while at school or on school grounds that are grounds for criminal charges being filed. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
University of Tennessee - As introduced, requires certain civil service lay off provisions to apply to reductions in force of University of Tennessee employees. - Amends TCA Section 49-7-134.

Codes - As introduced, authorizes state fire marshal to exempt certain buildings from mandatory sprinkler requirements adopted by local governments. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 68, Chapter 120.

Election Laws - As introduced, allows person age 65 or older who is unable to obtain copy of such person's birth certificate to vote by executing affidavit of identity. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7.

Education, Higher - As introduced, prohibits public higher education employees from engaging in activities that do not constitute work stoppages, but disrupt or reduce the institution's educational services or impair the ability of the institution's employees or agents to perform their duties. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, prohibits LEAs from denying equal access to LEA employees to all domestic professional employees' organizations offering membership to all certificated personnel and removes prohibition against LEAs prohibiting communications on school premises. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 5.

Education - As introduced, permits city and special school district with boundaries contiguous with the city limits to specify by contract that funding from the city to the district shall be used half for operations of the district and half for bond issue for maintenance and construction at existing schools. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 3.
Election Laws - As enacted, clarifies certain provisions governing the casting of a provisional ballot. - Amends TCA Title 2.

Public Records - As introduced, prohibits governmental entities from denying access to records available for public inspection because a governmental entity is involved in civil litigation or a criminal proceeding or contemplating involvement in civil litigation or a criminal proceeding, provided that such records were in existence and available for public inspection prior to initiation or contemplation of the litigation or proceeding. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, makes possession of between 1/1000 and 1/8 of an ounce of marijuana a fine only $250 minimum Class A misdemeanor with the first $250 of the amount of the fine going to the drug court in the county of conviction. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
Aircraft and Airports - As introduced, subjects property and revenues of airport authorities to taxation and requires authority approval for vendor fee increases. - Amends TCA Title 42, Chapter 4.

Courts, Jurisdiction - As enacted, clarifies counties to which certain court jurisdictional provisions of the Governmental Tort Liability Act apply. - Amends TCA Section 29-20-305 and Section 29-20-307.
Malpractice - As introduced, establishes new requirements for medical malpractice actions in an emergency department of a hospital. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 26.

Municipal Government - As introduced, makes a lien filed by a municipality for the cost of maintaining real property that is not being maintained the same priority of lien as a lien for property taxes. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 54, Part 1.
Animal Cruelty and Abuse - As introduced, includes livestock and equine animals in the class of animals protected against aggravated cruelty to animals. - Amends TCA Section 39-14-212.
Animal Cruelty and Abuse - As introduced, enacts the Tennessee Animal Abuser Registry. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39.

Liens - As introduced, redefines owner for purposes of mechanics' and materialmen's liens to specify that an owner is an owner of real property that a lien claimant seeks to attach or sell under process. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 11.

Tennessee Regulatory Authority - As introduced, revises annual report date to general assembly from first Monday of February each year to first Monday of March each year. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 1.
subjects: State Agencies|Federal, State, and Local Relations

title: Administrative Procedure (UAPA) - As introduced, requires secretary of state to file copy of governor's statement concerning an agency exemption from provisions of UAPA due to federal funding conditions with chairs of the government operations committees. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5, Part 1.

Employees, Employers - As enacted, specifies that the right to a secret ballot in union certification elections will only apply to extent that secret ballots are permissible under state or federal law and that, in any such elections where secret ballots are permissible, no alternative means of designation may be used as convincing evidence of employee majority support; such right may not be waived by means of an agreement between a union and an employer; not applicable to union contracts entered into before July 1, 2011, or that involve both employees within and without Tennessee when the employer conducted business within Tennessee before July 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 50.

Alcoholic Beverages - As enacted, includes East Fork Stables in the definition of premier type tourist resort for purposes of the sale of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption; designates certain other facility as premier type tourist resort for purposes of sale of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

Redistricting, Congressional - As introduced, requires compliance with state and federal constitutions as well as judicial decisions in passing congressional redistricting plan. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Municipal and County Issues

title: Local Education Agencies - As introduced, allows LEAs to convert to a new form of school district to be known as an innovative school district. -

Redistricting, Legislative - As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography; clarifies provisions concerning districts, terms and vacancies prior to November 2012 elections; clarifies that house districts are not affected by reapportionment of county legislative bodies. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.

Education - As introduced, requires the state to assume the entire cost of any mandatory costs it imposes on local education agencies as its compliance with the constitutional duty to share in costs imposed on local governments. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 9 and Title 49.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, deletes the energy efficient schools initiative and transfers remaining amounts in the energy efficient schools council fund to the lottery for education account. - Amends TCA Title  4, Chapter 51, Part 1 and Title 49.

Insurance, Health, Accident - As enacted, clarifies provisions regarding additional information and follow-up utilization review for outpatient mental health and chemical dependency patients; specifies that exemptions from the utilization review standards for certain agents do not apply to the standards for outpatient mental health and chemical dependency care. - Amends TCA Section 56-6-705.

Economic and Community Development - As introduced, requires certain economic development contracts to be submitted to the chief executive officer of the affected jurisdiction and to the state treasurer within 15 days of the execution of such agreement rather than 10 days. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 17.

Workers Compensation - As introduced, extends authority of commissioner of labor and workforce development to enjoin operation of a business or to order monetary penalties to include workers' compensation premium fraud by an employer. - Amends TCA Title 50.
Employees, Employers - As introduced, adds certain enforcement responsibilities to the employee misclassification advisory task force. - Amends TCA Section 50-6-919.

Contractors - As introduced, reduces the time within which the board for licensing contractors is to post disciplinary actions on its Web site from 30 days to two business days; changes reference to an advertising campaign to a public information campaign about the board's disciplinary efforts. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 6.

Civil Service - As introduced, requires commissioner of human resources to develop criteria to distinguish applicants based on applicants' unique characteristics, history and abilities. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 30, Part 3.
Radio and Television - As introduced, revises certain provisions pertaining to cable television services. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-103 and Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2.

Landlord and Tenant - As introduced, applies the Uniform Residential Landlord and Tenant Act to all counties for rental or lease agreements entered into or renewed on or after July 1, 2011; currently the Act only applies to counties with a population of more than 68,000. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 28, Part 1.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Reemployment Act of 2011"; authorizes franchise and excise tax credit of $5,000 to employers for each newly hired employee previously receiving unemployment compensation. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 21.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Reemployment Act of 2011"; allows franchise and excise tax credit for employers equal to certain portion of wages paid to each new full-time employee who was previously unemployed. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 21.
Taxes, Sales - As introduced, exempts sale of water for certain agricultural purposes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Local Education Agencies - As introduced, establishes certain procedures to govern creation of municipal school systems related to transfers of administration under Section 49-2-502. - Amends Chapter 1 of the Public Acts of 2011.

Agriculture - As introduced, deletes requirement that department of agriculture prepare annual report concerning activities of the Tennessee agricultural museum board for approval by the governor. - Amends TCA Title 43 and Title 44.
Sentencing - As introduced, removes the jury's ability to sentence a defendant convicted of first degree murder to death. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title  40.

Labor - As introduced, creates a joint committee on the study of job creation in this state; provides that the committee shall report to the general assembly no later than January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 49 and Title 50.

Lobbying, Lobbyists - As enacted, allows lobbyist to attend annual ethics course provided for members of the general assembly to meet annual training requirement. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 6, Part 1.
subjects: Campaign Finance and Election Issues|Federal, State, and Local Relations

title: Taxes, Real Property - As introduced, specifies that only business days are to be counted for purposes of calculating 10-day period for acceptance of partial payments of property taxes prior to tax lien sale. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.
subjects: Housing and Property|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Real Property - As introduced, enacts the "Land Bank Authority Act." - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 65 and Title 66.
Probation and Parole - As enacted, clarifies that misdemeanor probation services may also be provided by a public company other than a municipality or county. - Amends TCA Section 40-35-302.

Dentists and Dentistry - As enacted, specifies that no contract offered by any insurer, dental service plan, third party administrator or other party that covers any dental services, and no contract or participating provider agreement with a dentist may require that a dentist who is a participating provider, provide services to an enrollee at a fee set by, or subject to the approval of, the dental service plan, insurer, third party administrator or other party that covers any dental plan services unless the dental services are covered services.  - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 10.

Bail, Bail Bonds - As introduced, creates the "Citizens' Right to Know: Pretrial Release Program" as a three-year pilot project in any county having a population in excess of 300,000. - Amends TCA Title 40.

School Districts, Special - As introduced, requires all meetings of transition planning commissions created to develop plans pursuant to the transfer of the administration of schools in special school districts to county boards of education be subject to the open meetings law. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, and Chapter __ of the Public Acts of 2011 (Senate Bill 25 / House Bill 51).

Remedies and Special Proceedings - As introduced, allows the attorney general to recover in a civil action property or proceeds obtained through or as a result of unlawful conduct. - Amends TCA Title 29 and Title 39.
