Criminal Offenses - As enacted, includes entertainment services in services the theft of which constitutes theft of services; specifies that a person commits theft of services by intentionally obtaining services by forgery or false statement, in addition to deception, fraud, coercion, false pretense or any other means, to avoid payment for the services; specifies that victims may report violations and testify. - Amends TCA Title 39.
Solid Waste Disposal - As introduced, adds various requirements for issuance of permit to dispose of coal combustion waste in landfills. - Amends TCA Title 68.
Capitol - As enacted, creates David Crockett commission to oversee erection of monument or statue honoring David Crockett. -

Local Government, General - As introduced, defines employee for purposes of adult-oriented establishments and prohibits employees from living on the same premises or in the same building as the establishment. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 51.

Local Education Agencies - As introduced, prohibits LEAs from denying equal access to LEA employees to all domestic professional employees' organizations offering membership to all certificated personnel. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2.

Basic Education Program (BEP) - As introduced, requires a city in which there is located a special school district whose boundaries are coterminous with the city's boundaries to maintain effort in funding such school system; requires automatic increase in maintenance of effort if there is an increase in the number of students in the school district or inflation occurs. - Amends TCA Title  49, Chapter 3, Part 3 and Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 2.

Energy - As introduced, requires comprehensive energy audits of state buildings, state-owned facilities and commercial buildings, with audit results to be conspicuously displayed in the buildings. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 13.

Local Education Agencies - As introduced, establishes certain procedures for creation of special school districts related to transfers of administration effectuated under Section 49-2-502. - Amends Chapter 1 of the Public Acts of 2011.
Local Education Agencies - As introduced, establishes certain procedures to govern creation of certain special school districts. - Amends amend Chapter 1 of the Public Acts of 2011.

School Districts, Special - As introduced, requires the comptroller to perform a financial audit of any school district seeking to convert to a special school district, if such conversion is permitted. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 5.
Local Education Agencies - As introduced, prescribes certain procedures to govern the abolition of city school districts. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2.

General Assembly, Directed Studies - As introduced, creates special joint committee to study the establishment of a rural infrastructure fund to assist economically distressed rural areas of the state. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 12; Title 13; Title 54 and Title 67.
Correctional Programs - As introduced, establishes a two-year adult offender re-entry demonstration pilot project. - Amends TCA Title 40 and Title 41.
Traffic Safety - As enacted, eliminates a minimum and maximum range of fines for obscene displays on motor vehicles and specifies that the fine is a flat $50.00. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-187.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, creates a Class D felony offense for possessing a prescription drug, which was acquired outside of Tennessee, with the intent to sell such drug. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 53, Chapter 10, Part 1.

Economic and Community Development - As introduced, requires the commissioners of economic and community development and revenue to conduct a joint study, to be presented to the general assembly on or before February 15, 2012, on the impact of the expiration of federal renewal community incentive programs on urban municipalities and the implementation of other economic development and tax incentive programs for urban communities. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 67.
Sheriffs - As introduced, clarifies that deputy sheriffs assigned to courthouse security may be POST certified but are not required to be. - Amends TCA Section 5-7-108.
Sheriffs - As introduced, revises qualifications for being elected or appointed to office of sheriff. - Amends TCA Section 8-8-102.

Education - As introduced, requires juvenile detention facilities to report annually to the department of education on the number of youth served, dates of entry and exit and demographic information. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 37; Title 41 and Title 49.

Education - As introduced, requires school year to begin no earlier than fourth Monday in August unless the department of education grants a waiver; requires department to create a timeline detailing how state will meet federal school choice notification requirements. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Law Enforcement - As introduced, prohibits law enforcement agencies and employees from practicing biased-based policing against persons residing unlawfully in the United States; provides penalties for such violations. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41 and Title 55.

Local Education Agencies - As introduced, encourages racial, gender and ethnic diversity among the appointed membership of a transitional planning commission created pursuant to a Section 49-2-502 transfer of a special school district to the county. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-502.

Purchasing - As introduced, specifies that state government's purchasing preference for Tennessee goods includes building materials and requires local governments to use the same purchasing priorities. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 12 and Title 49.

Controlled Substances - As introduced, makes materials containing any quantity of ephedrine  or pseudoephedrine a Schedule III controlled substance and exempts immediate methamphetamine precursors if they are not in form that can be used in manufacture of methamphetamine. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, requires law enforcement agencies seeking to conduct undercover investigations on school grounds to place certain authorities on notice prior to conducting such investigations. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39 and Title 49.
Correctional Programs - As introduced, establishes a two-year adult offender re-entry demonstration pilot project. - Amends TCA Title 40 and Title 41.

Professions and Occupations - As introduced, requires each person employed to work at an adult-oriented establishment or adult cabaret to be at least 21 years of age. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 57.

Economic and Community Development - As introduced, creates the Tennessee municipal government economic development and opportunity grant fund. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7 and Title 9, Chapter 4.

Salaries and Benefits - As enacted, allows an employer to offset an employee's wages if the employee owes the employer money that the employer loaned or advanced the employee, in certain situations. - Amends TCA Title 26 and Title 50.

Tort Liability and Reform - As enacted, provides immunity from civil liability for injuries to an ice skater for ice skating rink operators, in certain circumstances; does not limit the liability of an ice skating rink operator who engages in behavior that amounts to gross negligence, or willful or wanton conduct. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 22; Title 29 and Title 63.

Clerks, Court - As introduced, imposes $4.00 fee on each new case filed in all courts, instead of earmarking $2.00 out of all the general filing fees already charged by court clerks, for computer hardware purchases or replacement; in Knox County, makes same $4.00 fee mandatory instead of authorizing clerk to charge $2.00 data entry fee. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 21.
Regional Authorities and Special Districts - As enacted, enacts the "Border Region Retail Tourism Development District Act." - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title  67, Chapter 6.
Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As introduced, requires the comptroller to audit private act hospital authorities. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 56 and Title 68.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As enacted, allows substitute teachers to be employed by local education agency or third party public or private employer through agreement with the LEA; states that substitute teachers employed by third party shall be subject to same unemployment benefit eligibility conditions as those employed by LEAs. - Amends TCA Section 49-5-709.
Tort Liability and Reform - As introduced, enacts certain tort reforms. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 24; Title 29; Title 47 and Title 63.
Grand Juries - As introduced, enacts the "Grand Jury Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 22 and Title 40.
Juries and Jurors - As introduced, enacts the "Fully Informed Jury Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 17; Title 20; Title 22 and Title 40.
Highway Patrol - As introduced, changes name of Tennessee highway patrol to be Tennessee state patrol. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 16; Title 38, Chapter 8; Title 55; Title 57 and Title 68.

Municipal Government - As introduced, authorizes a municipal electric system to provide cable and Internet related services in an area 10 miles beyond the system's service area. - Amends TCA Title  7, Chapter 52, Part 1 and Title 7, Chapter 52, Part 6.

Fireworks - As enacted, adds "unmanned free-floating devices capable of producing an open flame, such as, but not limited to sky lanterns" to the definition of special fireworks.

 - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 104, Part 1.

Fire Prevention and Investigation - As introduced, deletes authority to transfer fund balance in the fire prevention fund to the state general fund at end of each fiscal year. - Amends TCA Section 68-102-142.

Education - As introduced, provides for re-establishment of elected office of school superintendent for counties or cities upon two-thirds vote of governing body; any such ordinance or resolution once approved is not operative until approved in an election; provides for qualifications of candidates. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-203 and Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 3.

Education, Dept. of - As introduced, requires department to impose statewide approval of any transitional license preparation program that has received, at a minimum, National Council for Accreditation of Teacher Education (NCATE) candidacy status. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1.
Public Utilities - As introduced, authorizes utilities to send notices of discontinued service by electronic mail for nonpayment of services. - Amends TCA Title 65.
Highway Signs - As introduced, defines "destroy" for purposes of the Billboard Regulation and Control Act of 1972. - Amends TCA Section 54-21-102.

Appropriations - Requires commissioner of economic and community development to report to finance chairs as to use of contingent FMAP funding appropriated to the department in the FY 2010-2011 annual appropriations act. - Amends Chapter 1108 of the Public Acts of 2010.

Education - As introduced, requires non-binding, advisory referendum on the performance of the director of schools to be held every four years in coordination with the election of governor. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 49.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As enacted, revises authority of commissioner of commerce and insurance to investigate insurance agents; revises rights of insurance agents under investigation; revises penalties imposed against insurance agents. - Amends TCA Section 56-6-112; Section 56-6-117; Section 56-6-120 and Section 56-8-107.
Firearms and Ammunition - As introduced, permits UT or TBR's farm employees to carry weapons on farms owned, used or operated by public higher education institutions. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-1309.

Fire Prevention and Investigation - As introduced, exempts mechanical or HVAC contractors installing duct detectors on HVAC systems from the alarm contractors licensing act. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 32.

Gas, Petroleum Products, Volatile Oils - As introduced, requires notice and opportunity to be heard, as well as appeals process, for issuance of permits for drilling oil and natural gas. - Amends TCA Title 60, Chapter 1 and Section 69-3-105.
Taxes, Sales - As introduced, removes the sales tax on retail sales of food and food ingredients. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Public Health - As enacted, requires hospitals to provide parents of newborns with certain information concerning Pertussis disease and immunizations. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 5, Part 1.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, requires health insurance entities to establish both internal and external grievance and appeals processes to permit review of coverage and payment determinations; corrects TCA cross-reference. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 32 and Title 56, Chapter 7.

Appeal and Review - As introduced, allows a reviewing court to award an appellee's attorneys' fees and related filing costs if the court determines that an appeal is frivolous or taken solely for delay. - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 25 and Title 27.

Courts, Circuit - As introduced, effective September 1, 2011, creates division V of circuit court of 21st judicial district with the judge to be appointed by the governor and serve until September 1, 2014; at August 2014 general election, a judge shall be elected for division V for a full 8-year term; district consists of Hickman, Lewis, Perry and Williamson counties. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 16, Chapter 2, Part 5.
Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee New Entrepreneur Tax Credit Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.

Business and Commerce - As introduced, renames the position of small business advocate the small business center and transfers the function from the office of the comptroller of the treasury to the department of economic and community development. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7; Title 8, Chapter 4, Part 7 and Section 12-3-813.
Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Small Business Job Tax Credit Act." - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 21.

Education, Higher - As introduced, allows children, up to 24 years of age, of retired teachers with 25 years service to receive a 25 percent discount at any state-operated area technical-vocational school or state-supported institution of higher learning. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.
Vital Records - As introduced, provides for amendment of birth certificate to reflect a change in gender. - Amends TCA Section 68-3-203.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, creates an annual sales tax holiday for eligible veterans on the Saturday and Sunday before Memorial Day; exempts certain property from sales tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

Health, Dept. of - As introduced, encourages the department of health to conduct a study concerning exposure to fluoride to the extent funds are specifically provided in the general appropriations act; any study conducted by the commissioner, to the greatest extent possible, should include utilizing the research personnel and tools available through the public and private teaching hospitals located in this state. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1; Title 53, Chapter 1, Part 1 and Title 68.

Safety, Dept. of - As introduced, prohibits Tennessee from participating in the implementation of the federal REAL ID Act of 2005, which mandates a national identification card for each citizen of the United States. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 55.

Public Records - As enacted, specifies that, under law regarding records open to public inspection, "public record" or "state record" does not include the device or equipment that may have been used to create or store a public or state record. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5.

Judgments - As enacted, provides for revocation of driver license for nonpayment of litigation taxes, court costs or fines in certain circumstances; provides payment plan option and hardship exemption. - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 40, Chapter 24, Part 1; Title 50 and Title 55.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, mandates that employees without a teaching license be hired on an at-will basis rather than on a yearly contract and specifies that the director may only dismiss nontenured, licensed employees for certain conduct. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-301.

Cooperatives - As introduced, clarifies that electric cooperatives have no authority to offer incentives that effectively exclude or limit the use of alternative fuel sources. - Amends TCA Section 65-25-205.

Criminal Procedure - As introduced, adds as an advisory enhancement factor to sentencing that defendant intentionally chose victim of crime based on gender identity or expression. - Amends TCA Section 40-35-114.

Trusts - As enacted, creates an exception to the general prohibition against assigning security interests in trust funds that are held for use in connection with the purchase of motor vehicles. - Amends TCA Title 35; Title 47 and Title 55.

Education - As introduced, vests control of Alvin C. York Institute in a board of trust composed of the governor, the commissioner of education and a citizen of Fentress County appointed by the governor. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 49.
Education - As introduced, establishes a report card for parents in order to encourage parental involvement and accountability in public schools. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Education, Curriculum - As enacted, directs the state board of education, in consultation with the department of education, to review the curriculum standards for civics education to determine whether the course of instruction in all public schools is designed to effectively and rigorously educate children in local, state and federal government.  - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1 and Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 10.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, revises offense of producing, manufacturing, distributing, or possessing with intent to produce, manufacture, or distribute the active chemical ingredient in the hallucinogenic plant salvia divinorum or the synthetic cannabinoids JWH-018, JWH-073, HU-210 and HU-211 to include other synthetic cannabinoids. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.
State Government - As enacted, creates the Tennessee interagency cash flow committee. - Amends TCA Section 4-29-234 and Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 6.

Beer - As introduced, redefines beer to include beverages with up to 12 percent alcoholic content; allows retail package stores to sell beer. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 2; Title 57, Chapter 3; Title 57, Chapter 4; Title 57, Chapter 5; Title 57, Chapter 6 and Title 57, Chapter 9.

Administrative Procedure (UAPA) - As introduced, requires agencies filing rules with the secretary of state provide a cost-benefit analysis on state and local governments of such rules. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5, Part 2.

DUI Offenses - As introduced, specifies, in regard to present requirement for an officer to cause a driver to submit to a test to determine the alcohol or drug content of the driver's blood if the officer has probable cause to believe that the driver was driving under the influence and such driving resulted in an accident causing injury or death to another, that the test be taken "immediately". - Amends TCA Title 55.

Alcohol Offenses, Motor Vehicles - As introduced, allows an officer to conduct a blood alcohol test upon reasonable suspicion, instead of probable cause, that a driver was intoxicated for any driver involved in an accident resulting in serious injury or death. - Amends TCA Section 55-10-406.

Physicians and Surgeons - As enacted, establishes requirements for the supervision of nurses and physician assistants by certain physicians when engaged in interventional pain management. - Amends TCA Title 63.

Textbooks - As introduced, makes changes to the membership of and terms of members on the textbook commission; provides that textbooks shall be available to any citizen at the citizen's expense; allows commission to appoint subject matter experts to advise the commission. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 22.

Local Education Agencies - As introduced, requires the local board of education to maintain a record of teacher dismissal and suspension hearings of tenured teachers in addition to the results of those hearings. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 5.

Senior Citizens - As introduced, modifies nursing facility diversion requirements at time of nursing home admission concerning home and community-based services. - Amends TCA Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

Consumer Protection - As introduced, requires homeowner's associations to provide and maintain insurance and report information quarterly or as requested in writing. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18.

Intellectual & Developmental Disabilities - As introduced, makes technical changes to remaining terms involving mental retardation and the division of intellectual disabilities services to reflect changes made by 2010 Public Chapters 734 and 1100. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 10; Title  12; Title 13; Title 33; Title 40; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

Intellectual & Developmental Disabilities - As introduced, authorizes code commission to make changes to effectuate Chapters 734 and 1100 of the Public Acts of 2010 with respect to references to mental retardation and similar terms and the creation of the department of intellectual and developmental disabilities. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 10; Title  12; Title 13; Title 33; Title 40; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

Intellectual & Developmental Disabilities - As introduced, provides for additional notice to legislative committees, lengthens certain reporting deadlines and authorizes additional assistance to the commissioner of intellectual and developmental disabilities concerning determining the fiscal impact of certain changes impacting certain licensees of the department of mental health; creates committee to examine fiscal notes and other costs associated with transferring the function of licensing services and facilities from the department of mental health to the department of intellectual and developmental disabilities. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 33; Title 63 and Title 68.
Mortgages - As introduced, extends publication of notice of any sale of land from 20 days to 30 days. - Amends TCA Title 35, Chapter 5.

Education - As enacted, specifies that temporary absence of a member of a county board of education to serve in the military does not constitute a vacancy in office and is not subject to provisions of the code requiring a temporary replacement. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-202.
Highway Signs - As enacted, designates segment of U.S. Highway 70 in metropolitan Nashville as "THP Col. Elmer V. Craig Memorial Highway." -

Short Term Loans and Lenders - As introduced, establishes a ceiling of 100 percent for interest rates on payday loans; defines "payday loan" as short-term cash loan or funds provided to an individual in anticipation of future receipt of wages. - Amends TCA Title 45.

Taxes, Sales - As introduced, creates presumption that person making sale of tangible personal property to persons in this state that have been solicited by independent contractors or other representatives in Tennessee is responsible for sales tax on such sale. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Taxes - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Small Business Protection Act" to require combined reporting for franchise and excise tax purposes; reduces sales tax on food from 5.5 percent to 4.5 percent. - Amends TCA Title 67.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, decreases the time an insurer of commercial risk insurance has to file rates, supplementary rate information, policy forms and endorsements with the commissioner from 15 days to 14 days. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 5, Part 3.
Alcoholic Beverage Commission - As enacted, allows commission to assess costs for administrative hearings; revises certain requirements for servers permit. - Amends TCA Title 57.
Revenue - As introduced, clarifies that any CD-ROMs or digital products sold with textbooks and workbooks shall be exempt from sales tax. - Amends TCA Title 67.

Courts, Juvenile - As introduced, authorizes juvenile court to hold a hearing and take evidence if necessary before determining whether a parent is indigent; states that indigent parent shall not be required to pay for child's nonsecure alternate accommodations. - Amends TCA Title 36 and Title 37.

Bond Issues - As introduced, authorizes the state of Tennessee, acting by resolution of its funding board, to issue and sell its interest-bearing bonds and bond anticipation notes for certain purposes. -
Courts - As enacted, deletes the provisions relating to the defense of unclean hands. - Amends TCA Title 16.
Food and Food Products - As introduced, enacts the "Genetically Engineered Food Labeling Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1 and Title 53, Chapter 1.

Driver Licenses - As introduced, increases period of denial of license due to withdrawal from secondary school from 18 to 21 years of age with certain exceptions. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 30 and Title 55, Chapter 50.

Special License Plates - As introduced, creates new specialty license plate for the Harpeth River Watershed Association; allocates funds from the sale of the plates to protection of the Harpeth River and clean water in Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, adds to Schedule I controlled substances: 3,4-Methlyenedioxymethcathinone (Methylone); 3,4-Methylenedioxypyrovalerone (MDPV); 4-Methylmethcathinone (Mephedrone); 3-Methoxymethcathinone; 3-Fluoromethcathinone; and 4-Fluoromethcathinone. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4 and Title  40.

Municipal Government - As introduced, requires a referendum be conducted before a publicly funded entity can be sold or leased; "sale or lease" means that more than 30 percent of the assets of the entity are subject to sale or lease. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 51.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, prohibits the sale of a catalytic converter to a junk yard if the seller fails to present either proof of ownership of the vehicle from which the converter was removed or a sales receipt for the converter; classifies the offense as a Class B misdemeanor, punishable only by fine of $500. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40; Title 47; Title 55 and Title 68.
State Inmates - As introduced, requires first or second term inmates without high school diplomas or GEDs to attend GED examination preparation classes. - Amends TCA Title 41, Chapter 21.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, makes it a criminal offense punishable by fine and community service only to knowingly wear pants below waistline to show underwear or buttocks; earmarks proceeds of fines to equipment for school activities. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 49.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, prohibits an insurance company from setting rates based upon the zip code of the applicant's place of residence or employment. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 5.
Traffic Safety - As introduced, removes all requirements or restrictions regarding traffic enforcement cameras. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, prohibits an insurer from taking an adverse action against a consumer based primarily on the consumer's insurance score, credit reports, or other credit information or based primarily on the fact the consumer does not have a credit account. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18 and Title 56.

Emergency Communications Districts - As introduced, decreases fine for making aggravated nonemergency 911 calls from $2,500 to $500; earmarks proceeds of fines to 911 call center in city where call originated. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 86; Title 39 and Title 40.

Education, Dept. of - As introduced, requires department to utilize scale of 100% when reporting progress in the Tennessee report card for schools beginning with the report for the 2012-2013 school year. - Amends TCA Title 49.
Trade Regulation - As introduced, declares certain goods that are made in Tennessee are not subject to the commerce clause of the federal constitution. - Amends TCA Title 4.

Education, Higher - As enacted, changes various requirements for registration of athlete agents, providing notice of athlete agent activities to higher education institutions and penalties for violations of Athlete Agent Reform Act of 2011. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 21.

Local Education Agencies - As introduced, modifies the membership of the transition planning commission established relative to certain transfers of administration effectuated pursuant to Section 49-2-502. - Amends Chapter 1 of the Public Acts of 2011.

Damages - As introduced, authorizes the cost of veterinary services and final disposal or burial expenses in determining the value of a police dog, fire dog, search and rescue dog, service animal or police horse knowingly and unlawfully killed without the owner's effective consent. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 50; Title 13; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 44; Title 50; Title 62 and Title 66.

Intellectual & Developmental Disabilities - As introduced, makes technical changes to remaining terms involving mental retardation and the division of intellectual disabilities services to reflect changes made by 2010 Public Chapters 734 and 1100. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 10; Title  12; Title 13; Title 33; Title 40; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.
Board of Regents - As introduced, removes obsolete language from provision on fiscal procedures used by institutions of the board of regents. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 8.

Board of Regents - As enacted, enacts the "Kristen Azevedo Act" regarding background checks on persons applying to work at higher education institution in housing facilities who will have access to student rooms or apartments. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, permits THEC, UT and TBR to provide information on lottery scholarships in the normal course of business and recruitment of Tennessee students on the annual lottery scholarship day. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

Driver Licenses - As introduced, extends authority for certain persons in Davidson County whose driver licenses have been suspended for failure to pay fines older than five years to pay outstanding judgment at reduced rate by payment plan over 10-month period. - Amends TCA Section 55-50-502.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, under certain circumstances, makes it a Class A misdemeanor to capture visual images of persons, except elected officials; increases penalties for assault, false imprisonment, criminal trespass, trespass by motor vehicle, unlawful observation, and reckless driving when done with intent to capture such images. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1; Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 3; Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 6; Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 4 and Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 2.

Motor Vehicles - As introduced, requires that a person be in full compliance with the Financial Responsibility Law of 1977 prior to having vehicle registration approved or renewed. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12 and Title 55, Chapter 4.
Local Education Agencies - As introduced, modifies the membership of the transition planning commission. - Amends Chapter 1 of the Public Acts of 2011.
Consumer Protection - As introduced, prohibits certain types of late fees from being charged in consumer contracts. - Amends TCA Title 47.

Short Term Loans and Lenders - As introduced, lowers the fees authorized to be charged for deferring the presentment of a check or for making a title loan and lowers the interest authorized to be charged for making a title loan. - Amends TCA Title 45.

Tennessee Higher Education Commission - As introduced, requires the Tennessee higher education commission to create common application and common financial aid application to be used by all higher education institutions within the state university and community college system and the University of Tennessee by the 2012-2013 academic year. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

Mortgages - As introduced, requires Tennessee housing development agency to study feasibility of establishing a Tennessee foreclosure mediation program. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 35; Title 45; Title 47 and Title 66.
Public Officials - As introduced, suspends annual and percentage pay increases to the minimum compensation for county officials for a period of five years. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 24.

Education - As introduced, requires nonprofit entities, that contract with the commissioner of education to manage schools or LEAs in the achievement school district, to be registered with the secretary of state or to be 501(c)(3) organizations; prohibits for-profit partnerships from managing such schools. - Amends TCA Section 49-1-614.

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As introduced, requires a minimum of four hours of daily direct care to nursing home resident with 3.2 hours of nursing assistant care and 0.8 hours of licensed nursing care. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11.

Schools, Charter - As enacted, authorizes an LEA to be the sponsor of a charter school; if an LEA seeks to sponsor a charter school, then the state board of education would serve as the chartering authority. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Election Laws - As introduced, removes requirement that a person must pay restitution to victims and be current on child support obligations and court costs to have right of suffrage restored. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 29, Part 2.
Safety - As introduced, increases fine for first offense of violating "Katie Beth's Law" from fine not to exceed $100 to fine not to exceed $250. - Amends TCA Title 47 and Title 68, Chapter 14.

Education - As enacted, requires a local board of education to allocate funding in an amount equal to the per pupil state and local funds received by the LEA to state licensed residential mental health facilities on a prorated daily basis for the student's length of stay, provided certain criteria have been met. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 37; Title 41 and Title 49.

Pharmacy, Pharmacists - As enacted, expands statute providing for a prescription drug label that indicates the condition for which the drug is prescribed from applying only to elder persons to apply to any patient. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 10 and Title 63, Chapter 10.

Schools, Charter - As enacted, requires LEAs to establish a transparent and uniform method of calculating all terms and costs related to any lease, lease-purchase agreement, or other contract or agreement executed between the LEA and a charter school for the use of the LEA's educational facilities; establishes certain requirements regarding underutilized and vacant property; specifies uses of capital outlay funds by charter schools. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.
Schools, Charter - As introduced, eliminates caps on the number of charter schools that can be formed. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Special License Plates -  As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked plates for the United States Green Building Council; allocates 50% of proceeds to the United States Green Building Council. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Workers Compensation - As introduced, requires contracting agents to be registered by the department of commerce and insurance and prohibits unauthorized access to services or discounts under a provider network contract. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6, Part 2.
Highway Signs - As introduced, designates segment of U.S. Highway 70 in metropolitan Nashville as "THP Col. Elmer V. Craig Memorial Highway." -
Taxes, Sales - As introduced, extends limited sales tax refund for certain appliances, furniture, and building supplies purchased in response to May 2010 flood. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-396.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Animal Cruelty and Abuse - As introduced, requires owners, harborers, and keepers of dogs to restrain or confine dogs; establishes certain penalties and defenses for violations. - Amends TCA Section 44-8-408.

Public Contracts - As enacted, delays the implementation of certain provisions concerning the procurement commission and related topics; makes substantive changes in certain parts of procurement commission legislation. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 56; Title 12, Chapter 3; Title 12, Chapter 4; Title 12, Chapter 2; Title 41, Chapter 22, Part 4; Title 71, Chapter 4, Part 7 and Chapter 1098 of the Public Acts of 2010.
Children - As introduced, limits number of children that may be accepted at a drop-in center on a snow day to 125. - Amends TCA Title 71.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, creates Class A misdemeanor punishable by mandatory 30 days in jail for a non-participant in a sports event to assault a sports official and Class E felony if more than five assemble to assault a sports official. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1.

Education, Dept. of - As introduced, authorizes department to request assistance, regarding matters related to the Volunteer Public Education Trust Fund Act, from any state-licensed classroom instructor instead of the Tennessee Education Association in general. - Amends TCA Section 49-3-404.

Financial Responsibility Law - As introduced, requires drivers to submit proof of compliance with the financial responsibility law prior to registering car; establishes fines for failure to comply with such law. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12 and Title 55, Chapter 4.

Handgun Permits - As introduced, permits employees with valid handgun carry permits to store firearm in employer parking lot provided it is in a locked vehicle and in a glove box or compartment not visible from outside the vehicle. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

Transportation, Dept. of - As introduced, authorizes commissioner of TDOT to contribute annually to fund ferries that substantially add to interstate commerce in the state. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 11, Part 3.

Local Government, General - As enacted, authorizes up to four special censuses in certain situations. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 51, Part 1; Title 6, Chapter 56, Part 1; Section 54-4-203; Section 57-5-205 and Section 67-6-103.

Financial Responsibility Law - As introduced, allows a court to dismiss a financial responsibility case if the defendant did not have financial responsibility at the time of certain violations. - Amends TCA Section 55-12-139.

Special License Plates - As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked plates for American Red Cross; allocates 50% of proceeds to Tennessee chapters of American Red Cross. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
Professions and Occupations - As introduced, authorizes the sale of air conditioner evaporator coils or condensers to scrap metal dealers. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 9.

Education - As introduced, requires school districts to pay education providers, contracting with the department of children's services to provide education to children in the department's custody, for each child from the district an amount equal to that paid by the district for children attending public schools. - Amends TCA Title 37 and Title 49.

Education - As introduced, replaces the Tennessee Education Association's recommendations with any state-licensed classroom instructor for consideration by speaker of the house for appointment on the Tennessee financial literacy commission's board of directors. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 31.

Health Care - As introduced, establishes requirements for home health companies to provide assistance with medication to clients; requires background checks of employees, recordkeeping, and waiver. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 7 and Title 68.

Building Commission, State - As introduced, establishes procedure for deducting from amount bid on state building commission project the estimated energy cost savings attributable to bidder's design modifications and proposals. - Amends TCA Title 4.
subjects: Housing and Property|Federal, State, and Local Relations

title: Energy - As introduced, requires that providers of services, material, and equipment in state and local building contracts meet energy efficiency standards. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 4.

Alcoholic Beverages - As enacted, adds Cocke County to those counties where distilleries may be located without conducting an additional referendum if within the boundaries of the county both retail package sales and liquor-by-the-drink have been approved through voter referendum. - Amends TCA Section 57-2-103.

Bond Issues - As introduced, authorizes the state of Tennessee, acting by resolution of its funding board, to issue and sell its interest-bearing bonds and bond anticipation notes for certain purposes. -

Basic Education Program (BEP) - As introduced, specifies that funds allocated in the classroom component of the BEP for textbooks must be expended for textbooks and other instructional materials. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Students - As enacted, specifies that beginning with the 2011-2012 school year, a student in the third grade may not be promoted to the next grade level unless the student has shown a basic understanding of curriculum and ability to perform the skills required in the subject of reading as demonstrated by the student's grades or standardized test results; such student may be promoted if the student participates in an LEA approved research-based intervention prior to the beginning of the next school year; act does not apply to any student who has an IEP pursuant to the federal Individuals with Disabilities Education Act. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Firearms and Ammunition - As enacted, authorizes any state court judge who possesses a valid handgun carry permit and who completes both 16 hours of POST court security training and eight hours per year of POST firearm training to possess a firearm in the courtroom. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.
Contractors - As introduced, adds a plumber representative to the state board for licensing contractors. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Section 62-6-104.
Highway Signs - As introduced, designates segment of State Route 143 in Carter County as "Sen. Robert "Bob" Burleson Parkway." -

Handgun Permits - As introduced, authorizes a judge at any level who has a handgun carry permit to possess a handgun at all times and in the same places as a law enforcement officer is authorized. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.
Utilities, Utility Districts - As introduced, alters various provisions regarding removal of a member of a utility management review board from office. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 82.

Day Care - As introduced, requires the department of human services to develop and administer a child care assistance program for low income and at risk children. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 3, Part 5.

Real Property - As introduced, provides civil and criminal immunity for person threatening or using lawful force to protect real property from severe environmental degradation caused by feral hogs; lawful force includes the use of dogs. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 11, Part 6 and Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 1.
Pharmacy, Pharmacists - As introduced, establishes certain requirements for electronic prescribing and electronic prescribing software. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 10.

Workers Compensation - As enacted, changes the evidence requirement from a preponderance of the evidence to clear and convincing evidence for rebutting the presumption that drugs or alcohol were the proximate cause of an injury from a drug test result or the refusal to submit to a drug test. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6 and Title 50, Chapter 9.

Public Records - As introduced, allows the next-of-kin of a patient in a state hospital to access the records of such patient if the patient has been deceased more than 10 years and the records are more than 50 years old. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, permits judge to donate a communication device or access device that is legal to own but was used in an unlawful manner to an LEA or not-for-profit organization in lieu of destroying the device as contraband. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 1.

Fire Prevention and Investigation - As introduced, permits the legislative body of Cheatham County to impose the fire tax as a flat fee to fund county-wide fire and emergency services. - Amends TCA Section 5-17-107.

Education - As introduced, requires county legislative bodies in a county in which the county school system converts to a special school district to continue to levy a countywide property tax for school purposes. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 6.
Highway Signs - As enacted, names flyover that connects Interstate 40 eastbound to Briley Parkway northbound in Nashville in honor of late Ralph M. Cohen.  -

Sports - As enacted, specifies that a person does not compromise their amateur status for purposes of the Tennessee Athletic Commission Act of 2008 by competing in an event held by a sanctioned olympic organization. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 115.

State Government - As introduced, grants state recognition to certain Indian tribes, bands, and groups; provides means for other Indian tribes, bands, and groups to receive state recognition. - Amends TCA Title 4.

Fees - As introduced, requires that clerks must state actual fee that is charged to use a credit card instead of stating either the percentage rate of the fee or the actual fee. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 21.

Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, creates a Class A misdemeanor offense for the manufacture, sale, offer for sale, advertisement, or distribution of any caffeinated alcohol drinks; defines caffeinated alcohol drink. - Amends TCA Title 57.

DNA and Genetic Testing - As introduced, allows TBI to perform familial DNA searches in order to locate biological relatives of an individual whose DNA profile was taken from a crime scene. - Amends TCA Title 38 and Title 40.

Finance and Administration, Dept. of - As introduced, requires department to develop and maintain Internet Web site to provide certain information on state revenue, expenses and opportunities for public involvement. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3.
Hazardous Materials - As introduced, creates new offenses involving motor fuel transporters offloading motor fuel at a retail station. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8 and Title 65, Chapter 15.

Election Laws - As introduced, allows a voter, who does not possess the required proof of identification, to appear in person at the county election commission office during the early voting period, sign an affidavit of identity, and pose for a digital photograph; thereupon, the voter would be allowed to vote in the election. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-112.
Election Laws - As introduced, clarifies that persons age 65 or older are not required to show identification with a photograph in order to vote. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7.

Newspapers and Publications - As introduced, authorizes the secretary of state to make a determination regarding whether or not a publication is a "newspaper of general circulation" for purposes of the publication of notices relative to foreclosures, land sales, transactions involving real property, or other legal notices required by statute. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 10; Title 11; Title 12; Title 13; Title 17; Title 18; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 42; Title 43; Title 44; Title 45; Title 46; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 54; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 59; Title 61; Title 63; Title 64; Title 65; Title 66; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69 and Title 70.

Lottery, Charitable - As introduced, requires annual event tickets to include either the mailing address or telephone number of the 501(c)(3) organization in addition to the name of the 501(c)(3) organization. - Amends TCA Title 3.

Public Property - As introduced, clarifies that facilities revolving fund may be used in support of routine maintenance expenditures including janitorial services at capitol and legislative complexes. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4 and Title 9.
Housing - As introduced, provides for the classification of certain property as affordable housing rental property. - Amends TCA Title 13 and Title 67.

Hawkins County - As introduced, subject to local approval, authorizes possession, storage, use, manufacture, transport, and sale of fireworks in Hawkins County. - Repeals Chapter 617 of the Private Acts of 1947.
Telecommunications - As introduced, enacts the "Broadband Infrastructure for Regional Economic Development Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 7.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, authorizes a tiered level credit against sales and use tax, and franchise and excise tax, for any qualified company that expands or relocates to counties with certain unemployment rates. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.

Planning, Public - As introduced, specifies subjects that may be addressed by a planning commission in regulations governing the subdivision of land; requires that notice of hearings be published on commission's Web site if the commission maintains a Web site. - Amends TCA Section 13-3-403 and Section 13-4-303.
Public Contracts - As introduced, authorizes certain allowances for Tennessee businesses in the evaluation of bids and proposals for state contracts. - Amends TCA Title 12 and Title 67.

Animal Control - As enacted, in regard to forfeited deposits to spay or neuter program, specifies that in Hawkins County forfeited deposits will be used to defray operational expenses of the programs, including, but not limited to, costs for purchasing food, medications, tests, upgrades for the animal housing areas, or any other supplies or products that would improve the quality of life for dogs or cats in such programs, but may not be used to pay salaries of persons employed by any agency located within the county. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 17, Part 5.

Economic and Community Development - As introduced, deletes provisions concerning Tennessee board for economic growth serving as an advisory commission to the commissioner of economic and community development as board was repealed in 2009; requires commissioner to report on job creation programs and opportunities to finance, ways and means committees. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 49; Title 50 and Title 67.
Education - As enacted, urges employers to develop programs under which their employees with children in school can take time off to volunteer in their children's schools. - Amends TCA Title 49.
Lottery, Charitable - As introduced, deletes requirement that members of charitable gaming oversight committee be from different grand divisions. - Amends TCA Title 3.

Lottery, Charitable - As introduced, requires annual event tickets to include either the mailing address or telephone number of the 501(c)(3) organization in addition to the name of the 501(c)(3) organization. - Amends TCA Title 3.
General Assembly - As introduced, specifies that expenses of members are paid in accordance with Article II, Section 23 of the Constitution of Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 3.

Campaigns and Campaign Finance - As introduced, prohibits multicandidate political campaign committee from contributing to candidate after the fourteenth day before an election instead of after the tenth day. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

Fiscal Review Committee - As introduced, adds to the content of fiscal notes a job implication statement to estimate if the measure would increase, decrease or not significantly impact jobs. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 2.

Taxes, Gasoline, Petroleum Products - As introduced, specifies the type of documentation a person may attach to the required statement filed in support of a refund claim for taxes paid on petroleum products. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 3.

Local Government, General - As introduced, includes "real property" in the definition of "equipment" and allows the Tennessee local development authority to enter into a loan agreement with a county for the fair market value of certain real property. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 31, Part 5.

Revenue - As introduced, permits the disclosure of confidential tax information or returns to state or federal authorities if the information or return is relevant to the authority's functions, regardless of the existence of any reciprocal agreements. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, exempts private land used as an easement or right of way by a governmental entity from property taxation during the period of use. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.

Banks and Financial Institutions - As introduced, changes from "not sooner than 30 days" to "not sooner than 40 days" time within which lessor must give notice regarding non-payment of rental fees. - Amends TCA Title 45.
Education - As introduced, specifies that students who are related by blood or marriage cannot be assigned to classes based only on the fact that they are related. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Education, State Board of - As introduced, requires the annual BEP report to be submitted on October 1 of each year to the governor, state board of education, select oversight committee on education, and education committees of the senate and house of representatives. -

Education, Higher - As introduced, requires the Tennessee higher education commission to report on the status of in-service training funds for higher education during certain fiscal years and requires the commission to include certain discounts in reports on the status of funding. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 49.
Taxes - As introduced, requires commissioner of revenue to post cost of living adjustment amounts on the department's Web site. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 10.

Taxes, Severance - As introduced, extends time between notification of department and collection of tax from first day of the month occurring 30 days from notice of legislative action to 45 days. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 7.
subjects: Labor and Employment|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Business and Commerce - As introduced, revises the prohibtion on an insurance company or affiliate of an insurance company owning 15 percent or more of the voting securities or other voting ownership interest of a TNInvestco to increase the allowable ownership interest to 25 percent. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 13; Title 64; Title 65 and Title 67.

Taxes, Sales - As introduced, requires report by the commissioner of revenue to the study committee to examine and make recommendations regarding fiscal policy on the issue of natural disasters concerning administration of the sales tax refund program enacted in response to the May 2010 natural disaster. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Child Custody and Support - As introduced, establishes the office of noncustodial parent advocacy. - Amends TCA Title 36 and Title 37.

Taxes, Privilege - As introduced, allows eligible financial institutions and qualified business enterprises to carry forward any unused amount of credits against franchise and excise tax liabilities beyond the tax years in which the applicable credits originated. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.
Taxes, Inheritance Gift - As introduced, extends time for filing a duplicate copy of an amended return from 30 days to 60 days. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8.
subjects: Family and Children Issues|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Public Contracts - As introduced, requires preference to services by Tennessee bidder if cost of service is not 10% greater than cost of other similar services of similar expected quality that are not offered by a Tennessee bidder. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 56 and Title 12.

Taxes - As introduced, requires annual report by the commissioner of revenue concerning payments in lieu of taxes from the Tennessee valley authority to the finance, ways, and means committees of the senate and house of representatives. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 9.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, requires that for purposes of determining the maximum dollar amount of an insurance policy when converting an insurance policy, the amount of such policy shall be rounded up to $20.00 instead of $10.00. - Amends TCA Title 56.

Employees, Employers - As introduced, requires all employers to register with the E-Verify system and verify the employment eligibility of all employees. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 12; Title 16; Title 38; Title 39; Title 45; Title 50 and Title 70.

Local Government, General - As introduced, prohibits any county, municipality or LEA from appropriating public funds generated from taxpayers to fund professional trade associations or associated public interest groups; removes authorization to use taxpayer funds for membership dues and traveling expenses incurred in attending meetings of Tennessee school boards association. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 1; Title 5, Chapter 7; Title 6, Chapter 54; Title 7, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 2.

Workers Compensation - As introduced, provides that the general contractor shall determine the three construction services providers that may be awarded exemptions from carrying workers' compensation insurance on themselves. - Amends TCA Section 50-6-914.

Public Contracts - As enacted, clarifies that purchases by and for the legislative department are exempt, subject to the policies of the board of standards, from the operation of the present law provisions governing public purchases. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3.
Game and Fish Laws - As introduced, makes it unlawful to hunt on private lands or waters within 100 yards of a visible dwelling house. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 1.
subjects: Agriculture and Food|Animal Rights and Wildlife Issues

title: Education, Curriculum - As enacted, requires LEAs to implement a project-based assessment in civics at least once in grades 4-8 and at least once in grades 9-12.  - Amends TCA Title 49.

Public Funds and Financing - As introduced, authorizes state funding board to require public entities to adopt the model finance transaction policies created by the board and clarifies that such policies would include budgeting and capital planning, finance transaction management, investment, and risk management. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 15; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8 and Title 9.
Highway Signs - As enacted, expresses intent to name certain bridge in Franklin County in honor of the late D. Alex Stephens. -
Highway Signs - As introduced, expresses intent to name appropriate bridge or section of highway in Warren County in honor of Joe DeLong. -
Highway Signs - As introduced, expresses intent to name appropriate bridge or section of highway in Warren County in honor of the late Jeremy Brown. -

Banks and Financial Institutions - As introduced, requires department of financial institutions, with assistance from state treasurer, to develop guide to enhance deposits of state funds into eligible community banks, and disseminate such information to banks across state. - Amends TCA Title 9 and Title 45.
Motor Vehicles - As introduced, requires animals be restrained while in the interior of a motor vehicle in motion. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8, Part 2.

Criminal Procedure - As introduced, states that law enforcement will be deemed to have probable cause to search any known member of a criminal gang or person wearing clothing or insignia indicating affiliation with a criminal gang if the gang has been implicated in the death of a U.S. law enforcement officer killed in the line of duty. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

Nurses, Nursing - As introduced, states that a person who provides personal support services to clients living in their own private residence must, prior to assisting the client with medication, have received training in medication assistance developed by a registered nurse. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 7, Part 1.

Boards and Commissions - As introduced, establishes five-year statute of limitations for disciplinary actions against physicians by the board of medical examiners, and against osteopathic physicians by the board of osteopathic examination. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5; Title 28; Title 29, Chapter 26; Title 63, Chapter 6 and Title 63, Chapter 9.
Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, authorizes a franchise and excise tax credit of $2,000 for each full-time employee job created by a qualified small business. - Amends TCA Title 67.
Naming and Designating - As introduced, names Tennessee National Guard Armory in Tullahoma in honor of Command Sergeant Major Howard Boswell. -

New Johnsonville - As introduced, subject to local approval, changes the term of office for mayor from two years to four years beginning with the August 2012 local election. - Amends Chapter 603 of the Private Acts of 1949; as amended.
Elkton - As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the due dates for property taxes in the City of Elkton. - Amends Chapter 431 of the Acts of 1907; as amended and rewritten.

Knox County - As introduced, subject to local approval, authorizes county mayor to nominate persons for membership on the board of commissioners of the Tennessee Technology Corridor Development Authority; authorizes board to review the environmental and developmental impact of medium and high density residential developments. - Amends Chapter 148 of the Private Acts of 1983; as amended.
Trenton - As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the charter. - Amends Chapter 551 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.

Baileyton - As introduced, subject to local approval, raises monetary limit on purchases that do not require prior approval of the board of mayor and aldermen, from $1,000 to $5,000; raises limit on purchases that do not require competitive bidding, from $5,000 to $10,000. - Amends Chapter 192 of the Private Acts of 1994.
Children's Services, Dept. of - As introduced, authorizes the commissioner to institute dog training programs in juvenile facilities. - Amends TCA Title 37.

Big Sandy - As introduced, subject to local approval, increases the mayoral term from two years to four years and alters the election cycle so that city elections are held in November in 2014, 2016, and every other year thereafter. -

Newbern - As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the charter to establish staggered terms for the aldermen, to eliminate the need for periodic reappointment of the recorder and revise the duties of the recorder, and to eliminate the need for periodic reappointment of the police chief. - Amends Chapter 450 of the Acts of 1901.

Franklin - As introduced, subject to local approval, designates the four at-large aldermanic positions as A,B,C, and D and requires that candidates select and designate the position being sought. - Amends Chapter 79 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.
Appropriations - As enacted, makes appropriations for fiscal year beginning July 1, 2010. -

Bond Issues - As enacted, authorizes the state to issue and sell bonds and anticipation notes of up to $106.4 million for purpose of grants to the Southeast Tennessee Development District and the Industrial Development Board of the City of Memphis and Shelby County. -
Bond Issues - As enacted, authorizes the state to issue and sell bonds of up to $273 million. -

Budget Procedures - As enacted, authorizes the index of appropriations from state tax revenues for 2010-2011 fiscal year to exceed the index of estimated growth in the state's economy by $250 million or 2.15 percent. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 52.

Orders of Protection - As introduced, requires a first time violator of an order of protection to attend mandatory counseling and pay for such counseling, in addition to optional counseling for the victim; imposes a $3,000 fine for each subsequent violation in addition to other penalties. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.

Camden - As introduced, subject to local approval, beginning with the 2014 city election, moves the election of the mayor and board of aldermen to coincide with the November general election. - Amends Chapter 350 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.
Fayetteville - As introduced, subject to local approval, rewrites the charter. - Amends Chapter 294 of the Acts of 1903.

Cheatham County - As introduced, subject to local approval, permits flexibility for the development tax to be collected at the time a building permit is issued or to defer collection until a certificate of occupancy is issued. - Amends Chapter 28 of the Private Acts of 1997.
Savannah - As introduced, subject to local approval, requires two readings for passage of an ordinance instead of three. - Amends Chapter 683 of the Private Acts of 1951.
Greene County - As introduced, subject to local approval, abolishes the position of road commissioner. - Amends Chapter 130 of the Private Acts of 1927; as amended.

Cookeville - As introduced, modifies requirements for membership on the board of trustees for the Cookeville Regional Medical Center Authority. - Amends Chapter 49 of the Private Acts of 1999, as amended.
Greene County - As introduced, subject to local approval, abolishes the position of road commissioner. - Amends Chapter 130 of the Private Acts of 1927; as amended.

Taxes, Ad Valorem - As introduced, requires county assessors to audit the value and levels of assessment of public utility property located in their respective counties. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 13.
Winchester - As introduced, subject to local approval, modernizes the city charter. -
Sparta - As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the charter. - Amends Chapter 99 of the Private Acts of 1973.

Orders of Protection - As introduced, allows a court to order electronic tracking devices for first time violators of orders of protection; requires a court to order such devices for second and subsequent violations; all costs to be paid by the defendant. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.

Lafayette - As introduced, subject to local approval, requires reading of ordinances on two different days, rather than three, prior to adoption; authorizes mayor to appoint a director of public works, subject to confirmation by the city council; increases salary of mayor. - Amends Chapter 235 of the Private Acts of 1945; as amended.
Winchester - As introduced, subject to local approval, modernizes the city charter. -
Jonesborough - As introduced, subject to local approval, modernizes the city charter. - Amends Chapter 135 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.

Humphreys County - As introduced, subject to local approval, rewrites county road law to conform with the Tennessee County Uniform Highway Law. - Amends Chapter 634 of the Private Acts of 1935; as amended.

Cumberland County - As introduced, subject to local approval, increases the hotel-motel tax from an amount not to exceed 5% to an amount not to exceed 7.5%. - Amends Chapter 145 of the Private Acts of 1979.

School Districts, Special - As introduced, changes method of electing the five members of the South Carroll County Special School District board of education from election of one member from each of five districts to election of all members on a district wide basis.   - Amends Chapter 278 of the Private Acts of 1955; as amended.

Rockwood - As introduced, subject to local approval, authorizes city to set criteria for awarding contracts by ordinance, rather than by charter provision, in accordance with the Municipal Purchasing Law. - Amends Chapter 327 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.
Bond Issues - As enacted, authorizes the state to issue and sell bonds of up to $150 million. -

Kingston - As introduced, subject to local approval, moves the date of the city election to coincide with the November general election; extends the four-year terms of office of the mayor and councilmen elected at the regular city election held in June 2009 or June 2011 to expire December 1, 2014 or 2016. - Amends Chapter 298 of the Private Acts of 1972.

Bail, Bail Bonds - As introduced, creates a special joint study committee to study this state's laws and amendments of such laws that affect persons released from incarceration. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40; Title 41 and Title 50.
Public Funds and Financing - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Linked Deposit Act." - Amends TCA Title 9 and Title 45.
Criminal Offenses - As introduced, enacts the "Caylee Anthony Act." - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.
Children - As introduced, penalizes a parent for failing to report a missing child. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.

Taxes, Sales - As introduced, directs the commissioner of revenue to reduce the state sales tax rate on food if there is a surplus of state revenue collected above budgeted estimates in a fiscal year; reserves one-half of such surplus for additional Tennessee student assistance awards. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, requires the state board of education to develop a weighted instrument for evaluation of applicants for teaching positions with LEAs. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Education - As enacted, requires that an interest inventory be available to all public middle schoolers or ninth graders and to all public college students beginning with their freshman year to assist the students in career decisions; requires the LEAs and post secondary institutions to annually send summary data obtained from the interest inventories and personality profiles administered under the bill to the state board of education.  - Amends TCA Title 49.

Education, Higher - As introduced, provides that combat veterans or current members of the United States armed forces that have been in combat who are not residents of Tennessee shall be classified as out-of-state students but shall not be charged out-of-state tuition rates. - Amends TCA Title 49.
Students - As introduced, requires the office of research and education accountability to perform a study of the effect of school day start time on academic performance.   - Amends TCA Title 49.

Budget Procedures - As introduced, requires the department of education to purchase uniform liability policy for the benefit of all professional employees.  - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 49 and Title 56.
Highway Signs - As enacted, designates segment of S.R. 374 in Clarksville as "Officers David Scott and Yamil Baez-Santiago Memorial Parkway." -

Schools, Home - As introduced, allows home school students, including those conducted by parents associated with an organization that conducts church-related schools, to participate in extracurricular athletics if the student meets the academic and conduct standards required of other participants. - Amends TCA Section 49-50-801 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

Election Laws - As introduced, adds to evidences of identification to vote, a valid photo identification card issued free of charge by the county election commission of the county in which a person is registered to vote, provided the person meets the current requirements to obtain a free photo ID to vote and signs an affidavit verifying such person's qualifications; equipment and training to be provided by the coordinator of elections. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-112.

Election Laws - As introduced, recognizes as evidence of identification to vote, a valid employee identification card issued by a Tennessee municipality or county, provided the identification card contains a photograph of the voter. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-112.

Budget Procedures - As introduced, requires the department of education to include in its budget estimates an amount sufficient to cover the cost of providing liability insurance for professional public school personnel.   - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 49 and Title 56.
Fireworks - As introduced, revises the current scheme of regulating the sale, possession, or use of consumer fireworks by local governments. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 104.
Redistricting, Legislative - As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.
Redistricting, Legislative - As introduced, clarifies that senate must comply with applicable federal statutes. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-102.
Redistricting, Legislative - As introduced, updates reference to 2010 TIGER system; clarifies contiguity by water is sufficient. - Amends TCA Section 2-16-103.

Redistricting, Legislative - As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography; clarifies provisions concerning districts, terms and vacancies prior to November 2012 elections; clarifies that house districts are not affected by reapportionment of county legislative bodies. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.

Redistricting, Legislative - As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography; clarifies provisions concerning districts, terms and vacancies prior to November 2012 elections; clarifies that contiguity by water is sufficient. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-102.

Redistricting, Congressional - As introduced, requires compliance with state and federal constitutions as well as judicial decisions in passing congressional redistricting plan. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16, Part 1.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Municipal and County Issues

title: Public Utilities - As introduced, establishes a standard, which excludes certain expenses, to be used by the authority for determining justness and reasonableness of water utility rates. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 4, Part 1 and Title 65, Chapter 5, Part 1.
Child Custody and Support - As enacted, clarifies definitions that apply to parents in the armed forces seeking modification of orders concerning parenting. - Amends TCA Title 36.
Naming and Designating - As enacted, names Murfreesboro National Guard Armory in honor of the late First Lieutenant William Eric Emmert. -

Fireworks - As enacted, authorizes the city of East Ridge to permit the possession and retail sale of Class C common fireworks; regulates the sale of such fireworks in the city of East Ridge according to the provisions of title 68, chapter 104, part 1. -

Election Laws - As introduced, exempts a person 65 years of age and older from the requirements of showing an identification with a photograph of the voter when signing an application for ballot to vote. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-112.

Immigration - As introduced, creates felony offenses for concealing, harboring, shielding from detection, transporting, or any attempt thereof, certain persons in this state; provides that certain property utilized in committing such offenses be subject to forfeiture. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41 and Title 50.

Unemployment Compensation - As enacted, specifies that a discharge from employment will be deemed to be a discharge for misconduct connected with the claimant's work, which disqualifies the discharged employee from eligibility for unemployment benefits in connection with the job from which the employee was discharged, when it results after a claimant entered into a written agreement with an employer to obtain a license or certification by a specified date as a condition of employment and subsequently the claimant willfully fails without good cause to obtain such license or certification by the specified date. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.

Election Laws - As introduced, prohibits a person convicted of an infamous crime from voting in person or by absentee ballot if the person is incarcerated on election day or for the period of time established by law for early voting. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 40.

Special License Plates - As introduced, authorizes issuance of National Council of Negro Women new specialty earmarked license plates; allocates 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to promote initiatives to maximize the personal, emotional and academic growth and development of African American children in Memphis and Shelby County. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Beer - As enacted, restores language to clarify that the governmental entity, committee or board that issues a beer permit or license is the governmental entity to revoke or suspend such permit or license. - Amends TCA Section 57-5-108.

Financial Responsibility Law - As introduced, requires a person with two or more convictions for driving under the influence to maintain double the amount of liability insurance, deposit of cash, or bond filed with the commissioner of safety in order to comply with financial responsibility laws. - Amends TCA Title 55.
Tattoos and Piercings - As enacted, revises and enacts provisions governing the tattooing of minors. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 4 and Title 62, Chapter 38.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, requires all contracts of insurance issued for delivery in Tennessee after July 1, 2012, to provide for a 10 percent premium reduction for any renewed insurance policy that has not had any claims filed against such policy that resulted in payment by the insurance company for the previous year. - Amends TCA Title 56.

Landlord and Tenant - As introduced, requires 24-hour notice of approximate time of removal pursuant to writ of possession and holds plaintiff liable for damages to defendant's removed personal property if notice requirements are not followed. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 15; Title 29, Chapter 18, Part 1 and Title 66, Chapter 28.

Highway Signs - As enacted, authorizes the department of transportation to erect suitable signs or markers at the new transportation management center in Chattanooga in honor of Steve Karas; requires non-state funding for signs. -

Education, Higher - As introduced, creates student athlete trust fund to provide one-time payments to public higher education Division 1 athletes upon graduation that are funded from athletic department revenue, does not apply if causes loss of revenue due to loss of membership in NCAA, requires THEC to direct requesting of a waiver from NCAA to allow implementation. - Amends TCA Title 49.
Sexual Offenses - As introduced, requires that persons convicted of rape or aggravated rape serve 100 percent of sentence. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 5 and Title 40, Chapter 35.
