Unemployment Compensation - As introduced, requires commissioner of labor and workforce development to appoint department attorney to indigent claimant in unemployment benefit appeal upon request when employer is represented by counsel at appeal; employer will pay costs of claimant's legal representation if claimant prevails, otherwise cost comes from department's existing resources. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 23 and Title 50.

Motor Vehicles - As introduced, requires demolishers to contact the police before destroying a vehicle that does not present with a certificate of title, auction sales receipt, or certificate of authority to demolish. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 55, Chapter 16.
General Assembly - As introduced, reduces from 12 to 10 the number of months that a former member's legislative email will be forwarded to a private email account on request. - Amends TCA Title 3.

Banks and Financial Institutions - As introduced, increases from $1,000 to $1,100 the maximum civil penalty that may be assessed administratively for violation of laws and rules concerning money transmitters. - Amends TCA Title 45.

Clerks, Court - As introduced, increases from 90 days to 120 days the notice period that clerks must provide to the state librarian and archivist before destroying books or records, in order that such documents may be examined for historical value. - Amends TCA Title 18.
Motor Vehicles - As introduced, clarifies that trailers used in the furtherance of a business are required to be registered. - Amends TCA Title 55.

Child Custody and Support - As introduced, increases from $400 to $450 the penalty for conspiring not to report a newly hired employee to the department of human services for purposes of checking for child support arrearages and establishing paternity. - Amends TCA Title 36.

Historical Sites and Preservation - As introduced, increases from two weeks to 17 days the minimum amount of time by which advance notice of a public hearing concerning adoption of a resolution establishing a grant program for revitalization of real estate in an older neighborhood must be given. - Amends TCA Title 13.
Gas, Petroleum Products, Volatile Oils - As introduced, requires hearing notices given to oil and gas surface owners to contain the date and nature of the hearing.  - Amends TCA Title 60.

Regional Authorities and Special Districts - As introduced, increases from two to three weeks the minimum period of time that notices of public hearings for proposed economic impact plans be made by the Tennessee Regional Megasite Authority. - Amends TCA Title 64.

Employees, Employers - As enacted, authorizes the department of labor and workforce development, in accordance with the federal treasury offset program, to set off any covered unemployment compensation debt due to the department against any federal income tax refund due to the claimant debtor and revises various provisions of present law regarding the recovering of unemployment benefit overpayments. - Amends TCA Title 50.

Education - As introduced, allows students to indicate that they do not wish to receive electronic advertisements and solicitations if students' e-mail addresses are used in campus directories.   - Amends TCA Title 49.

Interstate Compacts -  As introduced, removes Tennessee from the Interstate Compact for Supervision of Adult Offenders. - Repeals l TCA Title 40, Chapter 28, Part 4 and Chapter 805 of the Public Acts of 2002.

Tort Liability and Reform - As enacted, enacts "Jaclyn's Law," which, in certain circumstances, provides civil immunity for first responders when using forcible entry to enter premises to render emergency assistance when responding to 911 call. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 86; Title 29; Title 63, Chapter 6 and Title 68, Chapter 140.

Education - As introduced, changes from September 30 to July 31 the date by which children must reach age four in order to enter pre-K or age five to enter kindergarten. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
Motor Vehicles - As introduced, requires all tractor trailers to have a sign on the rear of the vehicle identifying the owner and the owner's business phone. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8, Part 2.

Drug and Alcohol Rehabilitation - As introduced, prohibits controlled substance analogues that have substantially same chemical structure as a controlled substance or have a similar effect on the central nervous system as a controlled substance and punishes the offense the same as the controlled substance to which it is similar. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
Election Laws - As introduced, authorizes an identification card from certain transit authorities to be used as valid identification when voting. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-112.
Highway Signs - As introduced, directs the department of transportation to erect signs designating the route to T.O. Fuller State Park from Graceland Mansion. -

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, makes it a Class A misdemeanor for a person 18 years of age or older to knowingly promote or organize a gathering of two or more minors in a public place with the intent to provide a location for such minors to engage in public indecency; any personal property used in the commission of a violation of this offense would, upon conviction, be subject to judicial forfeiture. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As enacted, requires the achievement school district to adopt an appropriate dress code for its professional employees. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6.
Statutes and Codification - As enacted, codifies the Acts of the 2011 legislative session. -

Banks and Financial Institutions - As introduced, enacts the "Main Street Recovery and Anti-Wall Street Corruption Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 28; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45 and Title 47.

Utilities, Utility Districts - As enacted, revises provisions governing the filling of vacancies occurring on the board of commissioners of certain multi-county utility districts. - Amends TCA Section 7-82-307 and Title 7, Chapter 82, Part 6.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, criminalizes possession, use, transfer or installation of software designed to manipulate retail records of transactions for evading payment of sales tax to the state.  - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 67.

Landlord and Tenant - As introduced, requires certain landlords to register with governmental entities, pay a registration fee and maintain certain identification on tenants; requires the comptroller to include certain information in its online database. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 39; Title 40; Title 66 and Title 67.

Motor Vehicles - As introduced, revises from 10,000 to 8,000 the size of a municipality that can enforce certain traffic violations on interstate and defense highways within their jurisdiction without the permission of the commissioner of safety. - Amends TCA Section 55-10-308.

Education - As enacted, requires high schools to forward vaccination records to higher education institution on behalf of dual enrollment student upon request of the student's parent or guardian; authorizes state board of education to promulgate rules to implement this act. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 68, Chapter 5.
Taxes, Sales - As introduced, changes date for annual sales tax holiday from the first weekend in August to the last weekend in July each year. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Public Funds and Financing - As enacted, enacts the "Uniformity in Tax Increment Financing Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 9 and Title 13.
Naming and Designating - As introduced, names new driver services center in Chattanooga in honor of Joe Glasscock. -

Drug and Alcohol Rehabilitation - As introduced, designates titles and related qualifications concerning interns and level I and II alcohol and drug abuse counselors under statute for licensing alcohol and drug abuse counselors. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 24, Part 6.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, requires LEAs to complete final teacher summative evaluation conferences no later than the last teacher work day of the school year using all data and information available by such time.   - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 3.
Education - As enacted, makes the Move on When Ready Act inapplicable in Williamson County.   - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 83.
Highway Signs - As enacted, names I-65 overpass in Williamson County in honor of late Lance Corporal Benjamin H. Gearheart. -
Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As enacted, revises certain provisions of present law regarding suspension of teachers. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 5.
Taxes, Sales - As introduced, reduces from 5.5 percent to 5 percent the tax rate levied on the retail sale of food and food ingredients. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Criminal Offenses - As introduced, specifies that unlawful possession of certain weapons on public housing property is a Class A misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.
Taxes, Sales - As introduced, changes the date of the sales tax holiday from the first Friday of August to the last Friday of July. - Amends TCA Title 67.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Election Laws - As introduced, permits a valid photo identification card issued by a county or city to its employee to be used as identification for verifying the person's identify on an application for ballot.   - Amends TCA Section 2-7-112.
Election Laws - As introduced, allows student identification cards, issued by institutions of higher education in the state, to verify a person's identification to vote. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-112.
State Inmates - As introduced, requires the department of correction to conduct a study on the number of inmates sentenced pursuant to the "Three Strikes Law." - Amends TCA Section 40-35-120.
Education - As introduced, limits to two years permits issued to teach a subject in public schools when qualified teachers for such subject are unavailable. - Amends TCA Section 49-5-106.

Civil Service - As introduced, requires employing authority or civil service commission to decide state employee grievance or appeal within same amount of time that employee is given to file grievance or appeal. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5 and Title 8, Chapter 30.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, provides that eligible disabled veteran home owners are not required to reapply for property tax relief in years following initial tax years in which they originally submitted applications. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 7.

State Employees - As introduced, specifies that state employees are subject to discipline, including dismissal, for advertising nongovernmental business on state property or in state media while on duty, exempts bulletin boards and newsletters that are designated by employer as being acceptable venue for such advertisements. - Amends TCA Title 8.

Election Laws - As introduced, requires that notice of change of polling place be mailed to voters at least 10 days before the election day, except in cases where polling place is changed within 10 days of the election day due to an emergency. - Amends TCA Title 2.

Criminal Procedure - As introduced, creates a sentencing enhancement factor for adult defendants who involve children under the age of 13 in the commission of an offense. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
General Assembly - As introduced, requires members of the general assembly to attend annual cultural awareness training. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 1.
Sentencing - As introduced, enacts the "Educate, Don't Incarcerate Act." - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 3; Title 40 and Title 49.

Child Custody and Support - As introduced, authorizes man who has paid child support for a child who is not his biological child to recover such child support from the biological father. - Amends TCA Section 24-7-112; Title 36, Chapter 2 and Title 36, Chapter 5.

Election Laws - As introduced, requires the coordinator of elections to create a program to enable each precinct registrar to search records of the coordinator that are linked to the department of safety database to retrieve a photographic image of the voter if the voter is unable to present evidence of identification that bears the name and photograph of the voter. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7.

Local Education Agencies - As introduced, authorizes change by county legislative body, with approval of the voters, in the number of members of the county board of education to any number no less than three nor more than 13. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 2.

Local Education Agencies - As introduced, requires transition planning for funding local maintenance of effort before a city or special school district may be abolished or dissolved or its administration transferred to another school system. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

Education - As introduced, requires the director of schools and the local board chair to prepare needs based budgets for the first, third, fifth, seventh and 10th school years beyond the next school year. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.

Education - As introduced, requires a local legislative body to make maintenance of effort payments according to a standard statewide payment schedule adopted by the commissioner of education; permits adoption by the LEA and the local legislative body, with the approval of the commissioner, of an alternate payment schedule.   - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.

Redistricting, Legislative - As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography; clarifies provisions concerning districts, terms and vacancies prior to November 2012 elections. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-102.
Redistricting, Congressional - As introduced, removes statutory provision prohibiting mid-census redistricting. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16, Part 1.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Municipal and County Issues

title: Redistricting, Congressional - As introduced, clarifies contiguity by water is sufficient for congressional districts. - Amends TCA Section 2-16-103.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Municipal and County Issues

title: Education, Curriculum - As introduced, effective July 1, 2010, requires each local board of education to adopt an AIDS education program for its high schools. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
Food and Food Products - As introduced, creates incentives for participation in community gardens. - Amends TCA Title 43; Title 49; Title 67 and Title 71.

Landlord and Tenant - As introduced, specifies that perpetrator of domestic violence remains liable for rent and damages under rental agreement even if the perpetrator is ordered to vacate the premises by protection order. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6 and Title 66.

Landlord and Tenant - As introduced, allows a victim of domestic abuse, sexual assault, or stalking to terminate a lease or rental agreement if notice and documentation that tenant is a victim are presented to landlord. - Amends TCA Title 66.

Consumer Protection - As introduced, requires motor vehicle dealers and automotive mobility dealers to receive, and maintain for a certain amount of time, certain documentation from consumers prior to facilitating an auto loan for the purchase of vehicles. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18 and Title 55.

Redistricting, Legislative - As introduced, clarifies provisions concerning districts, terms and vacancies prior to November 2012 elections; clarifies that house districts are not affected by reapportionment of county legislative bodies. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.

Taxes, Ad Valorem - As introduced, authorizes counties and cities to sell real estate acquired at delinquent tax sales to adjoining property owners at a 25 percent discount in exchange for sweat equity, under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 13 and Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 25.

Taxes, Real Property - As introduced, requires court clerks who are notified by persons having legal claims against property set for delinquent tax sale to notify such persons of the results of such delinquent tax sale. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.
subjects: Housing and Property|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Schools, Charter - As introduced, permits charter school use of LEA vacant land on same basis that LEA underutilized and vacant properties, other than vacant land, can currently be used; permits property obtained by local governments at tax sales to be conveyed to a charter school for use for its school purposes.   - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, requires any person, firm, or corporation engaged in the business of buying and selling used or scrap jewelry and precious metals through the Internet to register with the chief of police and sheriff of each city and county in which the person selling or buying such used or scrap jewelry and precious metals is located. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 1.

Education, Higher - As introduced, creates a civil cause of action for institutions of higher education for damages resulting from the actions of coaches and agents that result in sanctions or penalties being assessed against the institution or its athletes; creates a civil cause of action for student athletes for damages resulting from the actions of coaches, institutional agents, boosters, other student athletes and athlete agents that result in sanctions or penalties being assessed against the institution or its athletes.  - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, defines a restaurant located in a jurisdiction that has elected Tennessee River resort district status as having inside capacity of at least 40 and outside seating capacity of at least 75. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

Basic Education Program (BEP) - As introduced, defines maintenance of effort and requires local tax rate to be sufficient to fund maintenance of effort. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.

Public Records - As introduced, authorizes a local government's legislative body to designate certain records as proprietary information, and thereby not subject to public records law. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 10, Chapter 7.

Domestic Violence - As introduced, provides that alleged victim's termination of participation in global positioning monitoring system does not terminate defendant's obligation to participate as a condition of bail. - Amends TCA Section 40-11-152.

Schools, Charter - As introduced, requires LEA to use years of service acquired as a charter school teacher for tenure decisions upon return of the teacher to the LEA; permits public charter school teacher on leave of absence from an LEA to continue in the Tennessee consolidated retirement system. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.
Redistricting, Legislative - As introduced, clarifies that contiguity by water is sufficient for senatorial districts. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-102.
Redistricting, Legislative - As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.

Credit, Consumer - As introduced, implements system for regulating repossession agencies and collateral recovery agents. - Amends TCA Title 26; Title 45; Title 47; Title 55; Title 56; Title 62, Chapter 11 and Title 66.

Taxes, Gasoline, Petroleum Products - As introduced, increases tax on gasoline and diesel products one cent a year for the next five years; allocates funds from increase in tax to counties and cities. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 3, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 3, Part 9.

Criminal Procedure - As enacted, provides that a person may be prosecuted, tried and punished for producing obscene material, sexual exploitation of a minor, aggravated sexual exploitation of a minor or especially aggravated sexual exploitation of a minor, no later than 25 years from the date the child becomes 18 years of age. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 2.
Public Health - As introduced, restricts access to public restrooms and public dressing rooms designated by sex to members of that particular sex.  - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 15, Part 3.

Drugs, Over the Counter - As introduced, clarifies that it is not a defense to the unlawful possession of drug paraphernalia that the object alleged to be drug paraphernalia has not yet been used or did not contain a controlled substance. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 53; Title 63 and Title 68.

Sales - As introduced, requires persons who solicit orders for magazines or make contracts for the future delivery of magazines conditioned upon payment of a subscription fee for magazines to register their presence with municipal law enforcement authorities. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 7.

Home Improvement Contractors - As enacted, includes as an element of the offense of theft by a home improvement contractor failure to provide a current address to the residential owner until the work to be performed under the contract is completed; changes the requirements for establishing a violation of the Tennessee Consumer Protection Act against a home improvement services provider to enter into a contract for home improvement services without making certain disclosures.  - Amends TCA Section 39-14-154 and Section 47-18-104.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, creates requirements for issuance of certificates of insurance; clarifies the effect of such certificates; and authorizes oversight by the commissioner of commerce and insurance regarding regulation and assessing fines in relation thereto. - Amends TCA Title 56.
Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, enacts the NCOIL model "Unclaimed Life Insurance Benefits Act." - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 66, Chapter 29.
Criminal Offenses - As introduced, adds community service as punishment for simple possession or casual exchange of certain controlled substances. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-418.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, creates Class E felony of manufacturing or selling an imitation controlled substance and the Class A misdemeanors of ingesting an imitation controlled substance and possessing an imitation controlled substance for the purpose of ingesting it. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

Driver Licenses - As enacted, allows persons 60 years of age or older who elected to obtain a nonphoto bearing license prior to January 1, 2013, to retain and renew such license. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50.

Special License Plates - As introduced, authorizes each type of new specialty earmarked plates to be personalized so long as no duplicate registration numbers are issued to the same type of plate classification. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Business and Commerce - As introduced, authorizes the commissioner of revenue to revoke business licenses for the illegal sale of synthetic drugs and the local beer boards to revoke the beer license of a business selling such drugs. - Amends TCA Section 8-21-401; Section 39-17-452; Title 57, Chapter 5 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 7.

Forfeiture of Assets - As introduced, provides that proceeds from confiscations and seizures in drug cases may be used to provide emergency care for child who is removed from a home in which methamphetamine was being manufactured. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4; Title  40, Chapter 33, Part 2 and Title  53, Chapter 11.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, prohibits mere possession of a synthetic derivative or analogue of methcathinone rather than possession with intent to sell, produce or manufacture. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
Highway Signs - As enacted, names bridge on U.S. 127 in Cumberland County in honor of late Frederick A. Hassler, U.S. Army.  -

Taxes, Inheritance Gift - As introduced, allows an exemption against a net estate for inheritance tax purposes in an amount that includes exemption amount not applied against a deceased spouse's estate. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8.
subjects: Family and Children Issues|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Game and Fish Laws - As enacted, authorizes the issuance of hunting licenses to persons with intellectual disabilities, subject to their attending a hunter education course and hunting in the presence of persons who are hunter-education-certified and licensed to hunt. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 2, Part 1.
subjects: Agriculture and Food|Animal Rights and Wildlife Issues

title: Military - As enacted, clarifies that when persons are engaged in national guard active duties no private employment benefits may be curtailed or made ineligible due to such duties; specifies members to whom act applies and benefits to which act applies. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 33, Part 1.

Motor Vehicles - As enacted, authorizes the department of transportation to develop and assist in the implementation of the "yellow dot" motor vehicle medical information program. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 20.
Highway Signs - As introduced, designates a certain segment of State Highway 28 in Sequatchie and Marion counties as "Veterans' Memorial Highway." -
General Assembly - As introduced, limits general assembly members' terms to 12 years in the house and 12 years in the senate. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, defines "inefficiency" with respect to teachers to include falling below the level of "at expectations" on evaluations for two or more consecutive years and only after proof of attempts to improve the teacher's quality of instruction, attendance or other performance problems.  - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 5.

Real Property - As introduced, requires a residential property disclosure form to include information on the average utility cost for the property over the previous calendar year. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 5.
Insurance, Health, Accident - As introduced, revises statutes concerning preexisting condition exclusions to be consistent with federal law. - Amends TCA Title 56.

General Assembly - As introduced, enacts "Influence Disclosure Act," which requires model bill filed by member to be accompanied by form created by chief clerk stating the bill is a model bill and naming the organization the bill came from; requires forms to be posted on general assembly's web site. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 2.
Education - As introduced, modifies the scope of collaborative conferencing. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 6.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, allows teachers evaluated as "meeting expectations"  to be eligible for tenure on the same basis as those teachers evaluated as "above expectations" and "significantly above expectations." - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 5.
Education - As introduced, removes prohibition on collaborative conferencing concerning payroll deductions for political activities.   - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 6.

Election Laws - As introduced, adds to evidences of identification to vote, a valid photo identification card issued free of charge by the county election commission of the county in which a person is registered to vote, provided the person meets the current requirements to obtain a free photo ID to vote and signs an affidavit verifying such person's qualifications. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-112.
Schools, Charter - As introduced, clarifies that any public school is eligible to be converted to a charter school. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Sexual Offenses - As enacted, enacts "Kimberlee's Law," which requires that persons convicted of aggravated rape serve 100 percent of sentence. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 5 and Title 40, Chapter 35.
Education - As introduced, postpones the use of the new teacher evaluation system.   - Amends TCA Title 49.

Education - As introduced, changes the permissive authorization in current law and requires local boards of education to offer preschool programs; requires the commissioner of education to recommend sufficient funding for space for all students. - Amends TCA Title 49.
Education, Higher - As introduced, funds fully the planning, design, construction and equipping of a science building at MTSU. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7 and Title 49, Chapter 8.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, permits certain students, at their own option, to include grades from courses taken during summer semester 2011 in the cumulative grade point average for continuation of the Tennessee HOPE scholarship. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

Education - As introduced, declares it to be the intent of the general assembly to reduce the amount of state funds allocated per pre-kindergarten classroom by 25 percent for fiscal year 2012-2013, and such funds be reallocated to create additional voluntary pre-kindergarten classrooms. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 1.

Mental Health, Dept. of - As introduced, removes option for use of state licensed private investigation company by an employee subject to a background check for organization licensed under the Mental Health, Developmental Disability, and Personal Support Services Licensure Law. - Amends TCA Section 33-2-1202.
Insurance, Health, Accident - As introduced, changes age for termination of health insurance coverage for dependents from 24 to 26. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7.
State Government - As enacted, provides for the designation of the Tennessee Day of Prayer as the first Thursday in May of each calendar year. - Amends TCA Title 4.
Schools, Charter - As introduced, makes revisions to the Tennessee Public Charter Schools Act as amended. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 49.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, for tax years beginning July 1, 2012, creates a franchise and excise tax credit for employing unemployed persons under certain conditions. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 21.
Education - As introduced, postpones the use of the new teacher evaluations and their use for tenure decisions. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Local Government, General - As introduced, prohibits a local government from requiring a private employer to pay higher wages than required by state or federal law. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 2, Part 1.
Nuclear Materials, Transportation and Safety - As enacted, authorizes a nuclear security officer to employ deadly force in certain situations. - Amends TCA Section 38-3-120 and Section 39-11-611.

Child Abuse - As introduced, expands definition of aggravated child abuse to include abuse resulting from a mother's ingestion of illegal drugs during pregnancy.   - Amends TCA Title 37; Title  39, Chapter 15, Part 4 and Title  40.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As enacted, revises provisions regarding tenure for teachers transferring from one LEA to another; requires that teacher evaluation information be sent to the LEA to which a teacher is transferring. - Amends TCA Section 49-1-302 and Title 49, Chapter 5.

Highway Signs - As enacted, designates the segment of State Route 386, known as Vietnam Veterans Boulevard, that runs from the Sumner County line to Long Hollow Pike for the placement of signs on such highway denoting fallen soldiers from the Vietnam War. - Amends TCA Title 54.

Education, Higher - As enacted, requires public institutions of higher education that provide teacher training programs to allow equal access to any domestic professional educators' organization. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5; Title 49, Chapter 7; Title 49, Chapter 8 and Title 49, Chapter 9.

General Assembly - As introduced, requires fiscal notes for bills that criminalize activities, or enhance existing criminal penalties, to include a statement on the impact upon Tennessee if such bill does not become law. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 2, Part 1.

Election Laws - As introduced, requires the coordinator of elections, in conjunction with the commissioner of safety, to equip a mobile unit or units to travel throughout the state to issue photo identifications to those meeting the requirements to obtain a photo identification free of charge to vote. - Amends TCA Section 2-11-202; Section 2-7-112 and Section 55-50-336.

Game and Fish Laws - As introduced, provides that wildlife officers have the right to inspect the license of a person who is engaged in the taking or possessing of wildlife but are subject to same constitutional standards as law enforcement officers for other searches of persons or places. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 6, Part 1.
subjects: Agriculture and Food|Animal Rights and Wildlife Issues

title: Law Enforcement - As introduced, establishes the drug enforcement and education fund from forfeitures, seizures, confiscations sales and fines derived from the activities of judicial district drug task forces to be used for awarding grants to local law enforcement agencies for drug education, methamphetamine restoration and general law enforcement purposes. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17 and Title 40, Chapter 33.

Children's Services, Dept. of - As enacted, removes the 2012 repeal date for the Tennessee's Transitioning Youth Empowerment Act of 2010. - Amends TCA Section 37-2-417 and Chapter 1065 of the Public Acts of 2010.

Child Custody and Support - As introduced, revises provisions governing placement of child outside the care of the child's parent or guardian by a court order as grounds for the initiation of the termination of parental rights. - Amends TCA Section 36-1-113.

Commerce and Insurance, Dept. of - As introduced, revises provisions governing the department's reciprocity with other states' confidentiality requirements and confidentiality of NAIC information; adds to the definition of "company action level event" under the Risk-Based Capital for Insurers Act. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 2; Title 56, Chapter 22; Title 56, Chapter 44 and Title 56, Chapter 44.
Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As enacted, revises provisions governing deposit of securities in clearing corporation. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 2 and Title 56, Chapter 3.

Codes - As enacted, adopts the 2010 ADA Standards for Accessible Design as the standards to be followed to make a building accessible to those with physical disabilities when constructing or altering a public building. - Amends TCA Section 68-120-204(a)(1).

Law Enforcement - As enacted, extends provisions regarding employee compensation and indemnification for officers killed in the line of duty to police officers employed by the state. - Amends TCA Section 7-51-208(a)(2).

Correction, Dept. of - As enacted, revises provisions governing the exercise of police powers by department employees and governing the authority of certain department employees to carry firearms. - Amends TCA Section 4-3-609 and Section 39-17-1350.

Economic and Community Development - As enacted, clarifies purposes of FastTrack programs; requires certain reports be submitted to secretary of state; revises other provisions governing The Tennessee Job Growth Act of 2005. - Amends TCA Section 4-3-715; Section 4-3-716 and Section 4-3-717.

Public Records - As introduced, classifies as confidential the due diligence materials submitted by a company to the department of economic and community development; confidentiality applies until such time as the provider of the material no longer requires its confidentiality. - Amends TCA Section 4-3-730.
Education - As enacted, revises various provisions governing school accountability and achievement school district. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 6 and Title 49, Chapter 13.

Education - As introduced, removes prohibition on using records from students eligible for special education services under federal law as part of the value added assessment. - Amends TCA Section 49-1-606.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, revises various provisions governing pupil-teacher ratios and salaries. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 1; Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 3 and Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 4.

Water Pollution - As introduced, requires commissioner of environment and conservation to impose certain conditions to provide mitigation of impact when issuing a permit for an activity that will cause alteration of aquatic resources in waters. - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.

Taxes, Gasoline, Petroleum Products - As introduced, requires commissioner of TDOT to provide status report on certain highway projects to the chairmen of the transportation committees of the house and senate by November 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 3.

Public Employees - As enacted, requires the local government insurance committee and the local education insurance committee to provide for the financing of the health insurance plan for employees of local governments and quasi-governmental organizations and the group insurance plan for eligible employees of local education agencies, respectively, and determine premiums, co-payments, benefit levels, and the disposition of government grants and subsidies to assist in the funding and provision of health insurance for enrolled individuals. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27.

Taxes, Franchise - As enacted, revises various provisions regarding the job tax credit given for new full-time employee jobs filled by a person with disabilities who is receiving state services directly related to such disabilities. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-2109(f).
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Banks and Financial Institutions - As enacted, authorizes commissioner of financial institutions to establish a fee by rule for conducting off-site investigation or examination of any mortgage lender, mortgage loan broker, mortgage loan servicer, or mortgage loan originator.   - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 13.

Short Term Loans and Lenders - As enacted, revises various provisions governing deferred presentment services, including provisions regarding qualifications for licensure; authorizes commissioner of financial institutions to require persons subject to Deferred Presentment Services Act to be licensed through a multi-state automated licensing system. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 17.

Banks and Financial Institutions - As enacted, specifies that the limits on loans to any one borrower must take into consideration credit exposure arising from derivative transactions between the state bank and the person. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 2.

Surplus Property - As enacted, revises duties of the chief procurement officer relating to disposal of certain property; keeps administration of state surplus personal property within general services instead of with chief procurement officer; permits payment of state surplus personal property by credit card; specifies that disposal of surplus personal property in the possession of the general assembly would be exempt from the State Surplus Personal Property Act in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Section 4-56-105 and Title 12, Chapter 2, Part 4.

Public Contracts - As enacted, revises requirements for amounts of goods or services that may be procured without requisitioning through the department of general services or for contracts that may be entered into without approval of certain government officials; permits competitive negotiations on certain contracts upon approval by the chief procurement officer; revises other related provisions. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3 and Title 12, Chapter 4.

Building Commission, State - As introduced, authorizes commission to delegate its authority to review, approve and recommend any matter over which it has authority to the state architect, the commissioner of finance and adminstration or the commissioner of the general services in accordance with policies adopted by the commission. - Amends TCA Section 4-15-102.
subjects: Housing and Property|Federal, State, and Local Relations

title: Public Contracts - As enacted, increases from $75,000 to $150,000 the dollar amount of leases that require approval by the attorney general and state building commission; requires the state architect to post certain information on the state architect's web site, with regard to any proposed lease of property by or to the state that is less than five years or costs less than $150,000 per year or such other amount as determined by the state building commission. - Amends TCA Section 12-2-115.

Medical Occupations - As enacted, revises various provisions governing emergency medical services; requires licensure instead of certification. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 140, Part 3 and Title 68, Chapter 140, Part 4.
Traffic Safety - As introduced, imposes requirements on municipalities and counties for operation and new locations of traffic enforcement cameras. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As enacted, requires that licensure renewals for heath facilities licenses be due on the anniversary date of the license instead of June 30 of each year; authorizes, during transition period, issuance of renewals for terms of no less than five months and no more than 18 months or year to year. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.

Law Enforcement - As introduced, removes language in the qualifications for youth services officers, correction officers, police officers and sheriffs requiring such persons to be free of any apparent mental disorder. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 8; Title 37, Chapter 5; Title 38, Chapter 8 and Title 41, Chapter 1.

Welfare - As enacted, revises provisions governing eligibility for temporary assistance; makes provision of transportation assistance discretionary instead of mandatory. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 3, Part 1.

Intellectual & Developmental Disabilities - As enacted, revises various provisions governing the licensing of facilities and personal support services agencies for persons with intellectual and developmental disabilities. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 33.

Intellectual & Developmental Disabilities - As enacted, provides for a statewide admissions review committee in regard to developmental centers for persons with intellectual or development disabilities, instead of having a review board for each center; makes other various changes in regard to such center. - Amends TCA Title 33.

Intellectual & Developmental Disabilities, Dept. of - As enacted, authorizes department to allow unlicensed individuals employed by licensed facilities to follow universal "do not resuscitate" orders in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 68.
subjects: Legislative Affairs|Civil Liberties and Civil Rights

title: Unemployment Compensation - As introduced, allows the set off of covered unemployment compensation debt under certain circumstances; revises other provisions regarding recovering benefit overpayments. - Amends TCA Section 50-7-303(d)(3)(B); Section 50-7-304(b)(2); Section 50-7-501 and Section 50-7-715.

Mental Health, Dept. of - As enacted, changes the name of the department to the "department of mental health and substance abuse services." - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 3; Title 4; Title 8; Title 12; Title 33; Title 36; Title 37; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 45; Title 49; Title 50; Title 53; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 63; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.
Controlled Substances - As enacted, rewrites the provisions governing the scheduling of controlled substances. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
Holidays and Days of Special Observance - As enacted, designates March 3 of each year to be observed as "Tennessee National Guard Day." - Amends TCA Title 15, Chapter 2.

Dams - As introduced, requires the department of environment and conservation to conduct, or have conducted, a study of dams in this state that are currently exempt from regulation under the Safe Dams Act because they are diversion weirs, farm ponds or wastewater impoundment barriers. - Amends TCA Title 64, Chapter 1; Title 64, Chapter 3 and Title 69, Chapter 11.

Taxes, Sales - As enacted, establishes requirements for determining whether certain affiliates have physical presence in this state sufficient to establish nexus for sales and use tax purposes; provisions to be repealed January 1, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Revenue, Dept. of - As enacted, authorizes the commissioner to require documents or payments filed with the department to be submitted electronically; revises other various provisions regarding the electronic submission of documents and payments to the department. - Amends TCA Title 55; Title 57 and Title 67.

Taxes - As enacted, redefines "intangible expense" under the Excise Tax Law; revises present franchise tax law regarding elections of a member of an affiliated group or a financial institution affiliated group to compute its net worth on a consolidated basis, and revises various other provisions of present law regarding taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67.
Controlled Substances - As enacted, rewrites certains provisions regarding the sale and purchase of an immediate methamphetamine precursor. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-431.

Motor Vehicles - As enacted, removes the requirement that certain accident reports be in writing; revises other various provisions governing motor vehicle accident reports. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10.

Safety, Dept. of - As enacted, authorizes department to enter into partnership agreements with nonprofit organizations to promote and support the goals and objectives of the agency. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 20.

Driver Licenses - As enacted, establishes that the submission of certain documents is considered compliance with certain requirements for reinstatement of driver license. - Amends TCA Section 55-50-321(c).

Insurance, Health, Accident - As introduced, adds as a purpose under the Tennessee Small Employer Group Health Coverage Reform Act the promotion of the health and wellness of the citizens of this state. - Amends TCA Title 56.
TennCare - As enacted, revises various provisions of the Medicaid False Claims Act. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5.

Health, Dept. of - As enacted, redefines "evidence-based" for purposes of criteria for funding for in-home visitation programs; makes other changes to provisions governing in-home visitations. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 1, Part 1.
Hazardous Materials - As introduced, creates new offenses involving motor fuel transporters offloading motor fuel at a retail station. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8 and Title 65, Chapter 15.
Highways, Roads and Bridges - As enacted, revises provisions governing the distribution of utility relocation plans to utility owners. - Amends TCA Section 54-5-854.

Transportation, Dept. of - As enacted, authorizes, until June 30, 2016, the commissioner to enter into certain contracts with financial institutions to stabilize the net expense of the department in the purchase of gasoline, diesel, or other fuels for the department's own use. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 23.
Advertising - As enacted, revises provisions governing the annual renewal of outdoor advertising permits. - Amends TCA Section 54-21-104.
Appropriations - As enacted, makes appropriations for the purpose of funding certain rate and co-payment adjustments in the TennCare program. -
Civil Service - As enacted, enacts the Tennessee Excellence, Accountability, and Management (T.E.A.M.) Act of 2012. - Amends TCA Title 8.

Tennessee Regulatory Authority - As enacted, changes the membership of the authority to be five part-time directors instead of four full-time directors; sets the salaries of such directors; revises other provisions regarding the Authority. - Amends TCA Title 65.
subjects: State Agencies|Federal, State, and Local Relations

title: Probation and Parole - As enacted, transfers from board of probation and parole to department of correction certain functions relating to probation and parole services and the community correction grant program. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41 and Title 55.

State Government - As enacted, revises various provisions governing the structure of certain state agencies, committees, boards and commissions. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 11; Title 16; Title 37; Title 38; Title 41; Title 49; Title 60; Title 62; Title 63; Title 64; Title 68; Title 69 and Title 71.
Sentencing - As enacted, increases the punishment for unlawful possession of firearm by person with previous felony conviction. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
Sentencing - As enacted, revises punishment for convictions for domestic assault. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.
Sentencing - As enacted, establishes enhanced punishment for crimes of force or violence committed while acting in concert with two or more other persons. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

Drugs, Prescription - As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Prescription Safety Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 10, Part 3; Title 53, Chapter 11, Part 3; Title 53, Chapter 11, Part 4 and Title 63, Chapter 1, Part 3.

Child Custody and Support - As introduced, requires a parent desiring to relocate more than 100 miles from the other parent or outside the state to send notice of the move to the other parent no later than 90 days, rather than 60 days, before the move. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6, Part 1.
Beer - As enacted, requires beer boards to file annual reports with the alcoholic beverage commission concerning certain information. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 5.

County Officers - As enacted, authorizes any county, subject to appropriation by the county legislative body, to provide vehicles for the use of any salaried county official described above, or, in the alternative, to provide a monthly car allowance to such salaried county official. - Amends TCA Section 8-26-113.

Short Term Loans and Lenders - As introduced, adds Anderson County to list of counties requiring pawnshops to maintain computer records of all transactions of goods sold and pledged. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 6.

Capital Punishment - As enacted, requires the warden to permit three relatives or close friends of a victim to attend an execution where no surviving immediate family members of the victim over age 18 exist. - Amends TCA Section 40-23-116.
Taxes, Franchise - As enacted, revises provisions governing extensions of time to file francise and excise tax returns. - Amends TCA Section 67-1-804 and Section 67-4-2015.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Funeral Directors and Embalmers - As enacted, extends the date from December 31, 2010, to June 30, 2011, for apprentices and mortuary school students to complete all requirements to become licensed by the board as a funeral director or embalmer. - Amends TCA Section 62-5-312.

Unemployment Compensation - As enacted, conforms language under the employment security law concerning amount of retainage by a contractor entering into a contract with the state or local governments to conform to 5 percent as authorized generally for contractors.  - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7, Part 4.

Banks and Financial Institutions - As introduced, makes it a Class A misdemeanor, subject to a fine only, and a violation of the Consumer Protection Act, for a financial institution to fail to release funds received from an insurance company for repairs to a residence in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 45 and Title 47.

General Assembly - As introduced, requires the speakers of the house and senate to develop and implement a job applicant drug testing system for members and employees of the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 3 and Title 50.

Taxes, Sales - As introduced, reduces the state sales tax rate on food from 5.5 percent to .25 percent; increases the state sales tax rate on non-food goods and services from 7 percent to 7.5 percent. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Special License Plates - As introduced, extends the time to meet the minimum order requirements for the Donate Life new specialty earmarked plate by an additional year. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Education, Curriculum - As enacted, requires the office of research and education accountability and the department of health to do studies on HIV/AIDS prevention curricula; requires department to survey other state health departments' HIV/AIDS public outreach and education programs.   - Amends TCA Title 49.

Education - As enacted, continues the career and technical class size extension pilot project in the Metro Nashville public schools; provides that the pilot shall only be used in schools or programs implementing the career academy or small learning community model. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 1.
Education, Dept. of - As introduced, enacts the "Green Cleaning Schools Act." - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 50.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, requires that a law enforcement officer obtain a subpoena prior to placing an electronic tracking device on a vehicle for criminal investigation purposes. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

Alcohol Offenses, Motor Vehicles - As introduced, requires investigating officer of traffic accident that involves a fatality to forward copy of the accident report to the alcoholic beverage commission, if one of the drivers is suspected to have been driving under the influence. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 39; Title 40; Title 55 and Title 57.
Grand Juries - As introduced, requires that grand jury proceedings be recorded. - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 39 and Title 40.

Criminal Procedure - As introduced, increases expunction fee following the successful completion of diversion programs. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 6; Title  40, Chapter 32 and Title 40, Chapter 35.

Child Custody and Support - As introduced, requires that a parent ordered to pay medical bills for a child do so within 30 days of the order or have visitation rights suspended until the bills are paid along with any cost incurred by the other parent as a result of the delay. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 39 and Title 40.
Naming and Designating - As enacted, designates May 2012 as "Motorcycle Safety and Awareness Month."  -

Taxes, Ad Valorem - As introduced, exempts the state and local governmental entities from liability for homeowners' association fee, restrictive covenants and certain obligations when the governmental entity acquires real property to enforce its tax lien. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 24 and Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 25.
Criminal Procedure - As introduced, permits consideration of history of drug abuse that indicates diminished capacity may be considered as a mitigating factor. - Amends TCA Title 40.

Controlled Substances - As introduced, requires drug testing of elected officials; requests Tennessee supreme court to require drug testing of judges. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 17 and Title 50.
General Assembly - As introduced, requires drug testing of members of the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 3 and Title 50.

Wildlife Resources Commission - As introduced, creates a vacancy for death, resignation, removal, disqualification, change of residence or persistent absence from meetings without good cause; a vacancy shall be declared if a person fails to attend six or more meetings of the commission in any one year requiring replacement by the appointing authority. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 1, Part 2.

Game and Fish Laws - As introduced, creates fish hatcheries fund whereby all revenue collected from the sale of trout stamps will be used exclusively to operate and maintain fish hatcheries in Tennessee; in 2011, the cost of a trout stamp was $18.00. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 1.
subjects: Agriculture and Food|Animal Rights and Wildlife Issues

title: Motor Vehicles - As enacted, exempts motor vehicle dismantlers and recyclers or scrap metal processors from obtaining a copy of title before purchasing motor vehicle for scrap if the vehicle was manufactured more than 12 years ago; specifies that state law preempts any local regulation in regard to age of vehicle that may be purchased without title and in regard to waiting period for crushing. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 17, Part 1 and Title 55, Chapter 3, Part 2.

Criminal Procedure - As enacted, eliminates the 72-hour time period restriction on determinations concerning good cause where the surrender is based on a conditional or final judgment of forfeiture issued by the court. - Amends TCA Section 40-11-137.

Bail, Bail Bonds - As enacted, requires a person seeking to own a bonding company have two years of experience writing bail as a full-time agent with a professional bonding company in good standing. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 11, Part 3.
Election Laws - As introduced, requires all municipal and county elections to be nonpartisan. - Amends TCA Title 2.

Taxes, Income - As introduced, phases out the Hall income tax over a three-year period beginning in tax year 2013 and ending with tax year 2015; holds local governments harmless from the loss of revenue resulting from the incremental reduction and repeal of the tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2, Part 1.
subjects: Labor and Employment|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Taxes, Inheritance Gift - As introduced, phases out the inheritance tax over a three-year period beginning with tax year 2013 and ending with tax year 2015. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8.
subjects: Family and Children Issues|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, allows teachers who receive evaluations demonstrating an overall performance effectiveness level of "meets expectations" or above in the last two years of the five-year probationary period to receive tenure.   - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5.
Education - As introduced, creates a committee to study the teacher evaluation system known as the Tennessee teacher acceleration model (TEAM). - Amends TCA Title 49.
Education - As introduced, prohibits use of taxpayer generated funds for payment of membership dues to the Tennessee school boards association. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-2001.

Gambling - As enacted, exempts nonprofit corporations from paying gambling machine manufacturing fees if the nonprofit is licensed by the Tennessee department of mental health and certified by the Tennessee department of human services to provide vocational rehabilitation job training programs. - Amends TCA Title 39.

Special License Plates - As enacted, creates a "Tennessee Tennis" new specialty earmarked license plate; 50 percent of the proceeds from the sale of the plates earmarked for Tennessee Tennis Association to promote and develop the growth of tennis in Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
Guardianship - As enacted, authorizes a senior psychological examiner to provide an examination and sworn report to a court concerning conservatorship. - Amends TCA Title 34 and Title 63.

Real Property - As introduced, requires sellers of residential property to disclose to buyer, prior to entering into a contract, whether a wildlife management area is located within 300 feet of the property line. - Amends TCA Title 66 and Title 70.

Traffic Safety - As introduced, increases the fine for unauthorized parking in a space designated for individuals with physical disabilities to $500 and authorizes persons who are not disabled to park in parking spaces that are reserved for disabled persons so long as their vehicle bears the appropriate certificate, placard or a disabled veterans license plate.  - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 55.

Alcohol Offenses, Sales - As enacted, creates certain offenses and delinquent acts regarding entering into a retail package store when under age, visibly intoxicated or otherwise disruptive. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 4; Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 4 and Title 57, Chapter 3.

Education - As introduced, allows retired teachers' children who are under 24 years of age to receive a 25 percent discount at any state-operated institution of higher learning; provided, that the parent retired with 30 years of full-time creditable public school service. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, extends the current sales tax exemption on motor vehicles purchased by members of the armed forces to those who are stationed outside the United States, but who are permanent residents of Tennessee.  - Amends TCA Section 67-6-303.

Arrests - As enacted, enacts the "Ricky Otts Act" which requires an officer to arrest drivers involved in accidents resulting in serious bodily injury or death when such drivers lack a valid driver license and evidence of financial responsibility; prohibits the issuance of a citation in lieu of arrest in such circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40; Title 55, Chapter 10; Title 55, Chapter 12; Title 55, Chapter 50 and Title 55, Chapter 8.
Immigration - As enacted, clarifies that a tax form, as such term is used in the part, means any form issued by the United States internal revenue service. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 1, Part 7.

Registers of Deeds - As enacted, permits any county register of deeds instead of present limitation to county register of deeds in Shelby County to assume certain functions and duties if the register receives endorsement from the existing county records commission or county executive. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 13.
subjects: Housing and Property|Municipal and County Issues

title: Immigration - As introduced, requires certain jails and detention facilities to report annually to the department of correction the number of persons arrested, booked or confined who are not U.S. citizens or whose citizenship status cannot be determined; requires the department to report annually such information to the house and senate speakers and judiciary committees. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 40 and Title 41.
State Government - As introduced, increases the penalty to a qualified TNInvestco for certain noncompliance from $10,000 per day to $20,000 per day. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 28.

State Government - As introduced, requires the commissioner of economic and community development to release or disclose certain confidential documents within two years from such designation instead of five years. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7.

State Government - As introduced, increases the fine that can be assessed against a person convicted of divulging unauthorized tax information from $3,000 to $5,000. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 17.

State Government - As introduced, requires the commissioner of economic and community development to release or disclose certain confidential documents within two years from such designation instead of five years. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 17.
Highway Signs - As enacted, designates segment of State Route 235 in Dickson County to honor the late Deputy Sheriff Richard Keith Bellar. -
Juries and Jurors - As introduced, provides individuals age 65 and older with the option to decline jury duty service.  - Amends TCA Title 22.
Highway Signs - As enacted, names bridge in Dickson County in honor of the late Lt. Col. Malcolm Glenn Hicks, USAF. -
Open Meetings - As introduced, expands definition of governing body under open meetings law to include electric cooperatives. - Amends TCA Section 8-44-102.
Knox County - As introduced, repeals the office of legislative affairs. -

Clerks, Court - As enacted, specifies that the present law fees that generally apply throughout the state would apply for clerk services in the criminal court, fourth circuit and general sessions court-criminal division of Knox County, but the separate provision of law regarding Knox County would continue to apply for clerk services in all other courts of Knox County. - Amends TCA Section 8-21-401.

Special License Plates - As introduced, authorizes issuance of American Heart Association new specialty earmarked plates; allocates 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to the Tennessee chapters of the American Heart Association to reduce cardiovascular diseases and strokes.  - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Special License Plates - As introduced, authorizes issuance of Rolling Thunder new specialty earmarked plates; allocates 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to the Tennessee chapters of Rolling Thunder to increase awareness of POW-MIA issues.  - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Highway Signs - As enacted, changes description of Veterans Memorial Mile in Knox County to segment of S.R. 62 from Solway Bridge to intersection with S.R. 162. - Amends Chapter 85 of the Public Acts of 2011.

Motor Vehicles, Titling and Registration - As introduced, authorizes third party to contract with county clerks to perform titling and registration for companies with over 1,000 motor vehicles. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, requires the film, entertainment and music commission to notify any member of the general assembly who requests notification of a proposed production activity in the member's district; allows a county to qualify as an eligible enhancement county during a 36-month period instead of 24-month period for purposes of the job tax credit. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 49; Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 50; Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7; Section 67-4-2109 and Title 67, Chapter 6.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, requires the state board of education to develop an evaluation instrument to permit teachers to assess new teacher evaluation systems, including the Tennessee Educator Acceleration Model, and their implementation.  - Amends TCA Title 49.
Human Services, Dept. of - As enacted, directs the commissioner to develop a plan for Tennessee to assist in rehabilitating victims of human trafficking. - Amends TCA Title 38 and Title 71.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, clarifies that the offense of trafficking a person for a commercial sex act is Class A felony if the victim is a child under 15 years of age; adds that the offense is a Class A felony if the offense occurs on the grounds or facilities or within 1,000 feet of a public or private school, secondary school, preschool, child care agency, public library, recreational center or public park; adds Class C felony of advertising commercial sexual abuse of a minor; clarifies certain sex offender registry provisions. -

Insurance, Health, Accident - As introduced, authorizes insurers to offer individuals health insurance policies in Tennessee that have been approved for issuance in other states. - Amends TCA Title 56.
Financial Responsibility Law - As introduced, imposes certain financial responsibility requirements on drivers charged with DUI and on nonresidents. - Amends TCA Title 55.

Education, Curriculum - As introduced, requires public school curriculum to include content on energy conservation, including instructing students on how to perform an energy audit. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 10.

Graysville - As introduced, subject to local approval, requires the mayor of Graysville be elected on a ballot separate from that of candidates for commissioner. - Amends Chapter 230 of the Private Acts of 1992; as amended.

Boards and Commissions - As enacted, requires the commissioner of finance and administration by October 31 of each year to notify the division of regulatory boards and the division of health related boards the amount of board fees to be set for the subsequent fiscal year. - Amends TCA Section 4-29-121 and Section 4-3-1011.
Public Records - As introduced, specifically includes provider-specific prescribing data within the confidentiality granted to medical records. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 2.

Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the department of human services to June 30, 2014, and requires the division of state audit to send follow-up questions to the department of human services in 2013 regarding actions taken by the department to address the issues raised in the January 2012 performance audit report. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.
Driver Licenses - As enacted, requires visible full face color photograph of a licensee. - Amends TCA Title 55.

Education - As enacted, requires schools to notify parents, by way of student handbooks or policy guidebooks, of school-associated extracurricular activities and gives parents the opportunity to prohibit their child from participating. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
Physicians and Surgeons - As introduced, establishes requirements  on certain health care providers when engaged in interventional pain management. - Amends TCA Title 63.

Sheriffs - As enacted, decreases the amount of time that a sheriff must wait before disposing of certain unclaimed property in the sheriff's custody from six months to 90 days from the date of acquisition. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 8.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As enacted, extends the sales and use tax exemption for repair and refurbishment services with respect to airplanes and airplane components and parts that are situated outside Tennessee and removed from Tennessee within 15 days from the completion of the repair or refurbishment services with respect to the airplanes or airplane components are performed pursuant to and by an authorized service facility designated by an original equipment manufacturer for such service with respect to aircraft qualifying as "Transport Category Aircraft" under federal law. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

Public Funds and Financing - As introduced, requires funding for capital projects exceeding $1 million to be specified in detail in budget document; requires quarterly report of any changes to projects. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 51.

Appropriations - As introduced, authorizes the department of audit to require state and local governments to electronically file, report or store records of transactions dealing with public funds; requires that grant payments under the grant assistance program for nursing home care be made monthly or quarterly instead of monthly. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 11; Title 12; Title 13; Title 16; Title 33; Title 36; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 42; Title 43; Title 44; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 50; Title 54; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 58; Title 59; Title 60; Title 61; Title 62; Title 63; Title 65; Title 66; Title 67; Title 68; Title 70 and Title 71.

Taxes - As introduced, redefines the annual taxpayer's income for elderly low-income and disabled homeowners receiving tax relief by increasing the income from $24,000 to $26,500.  - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 16; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 61; Title 62; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.

Taxes, Sales - As introduced, reduces the sales tax on food and food ingredients for human consumption from 5.5 percent to 5 percent. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 16; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 61; Title 62; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Public Funds and Financing - As enacted, allows use of federally-insured deposits instead of certificate of deposit. - Amends TCA Section 9-1-118 and Section 9-4-504.
Health, Dept. of - As introduced, eliminates the state policy requirement to provide all medically acceptable contraception measures. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 68 and Title 71.

Deeds - As introduced, prohibits deeds registered in response to mistaken assessments by assessors of property from being properly acknowledged or proven. - Amends TCA Title 28, Chapter 2, Part 1 and Title 66, Chapter 26, Part 1.

Education - As introduced, requires notification to parents at the beginning of the school year and any time school fees are solicited or collected that payment of school fees is voluntary.   - Amends TCA Section 49-2-110.

Education - As enacted, with certain exceptions, requires that children entering kindergarten be five years of age on or before August 31 for the 2013-2014 school year and on or before August 15 for all school years thereafter; if the director of schools finds through evaluation and testing, at the request of the parent or legal guardian, that a child who is five years of age on or before September 30 is sufficiently mature emotionally and academically, then the child may be permitted to enter kindergarten. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
Drugs, Prescription - As enacted, requires the board of pharmacy to publish a list of opioid drugs incorporating tamper or abuse resistance properties.  - Amends TCA Title 53.
Administrative Procedure (UAPA) - As enacted, continues permanent rules filed with secretary of state after January 1, 2011. -

Election Laws - As introduced, requires secretary of state to publicize the photo identification requirement at least 30 days prior to early voting for the primary and general elections in 2012 via public service announcements on radio and television. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 8, Chapter 3.

Motor Vehicles - As introduced, authorizes any law enforcement official, instead of only highway patrol officers, to stop and test vehicles for noncompliance with headlamp requirements.   - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 9.

Education - As enacted, requires a special education diploma be awarded to students who have satisfactorily completed an IEP with satisfactory attendance and conduct, but who have not passed the proficiency tests required for graduation with a regular diploma.   - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 60.
Taxes, Sales - As introduced, changes sales tax holiday from the first weekend in August to the last weekend in July. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Taxes, Sales - As introduced, changes sales tax holiday from the first Friday in August through the following Sunday to the last Friday in July through the following Sunday. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-3004 and Section 67-6-393.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Education - As introduced, allows retired teachers' children who are under 24 years of age to receive a 25 percent discount at any state-operated institution of higher learning. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

Banks and Financial Institutions - As introduced, enforces the Financial Records Privacy Act by criminalizing an unauthorized disclosure by a financial institution or financial institution's agent. - Amends TCA Title 45 and Title 47.

Firearms and Ammunition - As introduced, creates various gun show offenses, including prohibiting any person who is not a licensed firearms dealer from transferring a firearm to another person if any part of the transfer takes place at a gun show or within 1,000 feet of a gun show. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

Emergency Communications Districts - As enacted, defines "Public Safety Answering Point" or "PSAP" to mean a facility that receives 911 calls and routes them to emergency services personnel.  - Amends TCA Section 7-86-103.

Financial Responsibility Law - As introduced, deletes provision that requires accident report if a person is injured or killed or the amount of damage is in excess of $400. - Amends TCA Section 55-12-104.

Economic and Community Development, Dept. of - As introduced, deletes provision regarding the appointing authority of the defunct Tennessee board for economic growth. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 70.
Banks and Financial Institutions - As enacted, alters and adds limits to acquisition and installment account handling charges for loans. - Amends TCA Section 45-5-403(b).

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, mandates a training session before the start of a school year that all evaluators in an LEA must attend in person before they can evaluate teachers and principals during the upcoming school year in order to promote consistency in evaluations. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 5.
TennCare - As introduced, requires the bureau of TennCare to use the same reimbursement methodologies for public and private providers of ICF/MR services. - Amends TCA Section 71-5-105.
Short Term Loans and Lenders - As introduced, requires certain pawnbrokers and scrap jewelry and metal dealers to be bonded. - Amends TCA Title 38 and Title 45.
Highway Signs - As enacted, names bridge in Sullivan County in honor of the late Richard Lee Edwards, Sr. -
Business and Commerce - As enacted, enacts the "Small Business Incentive Act." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 12; Title 48; Title 50 and Title 67.
Education, Higher - As enacted, revises various provisions regarding cooperative innovative programs. - Amends TCA Title 49.
Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, changes the annual sales tax holiday from the first weekend of August to the third weekend of July. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

Emergency Communications Districts - As enacted, designates unpublished telephone numbers as confidential when in the possession of the emergency communications board or its designated agent. - Amends TCA Section 10-7-504.

Criminal Procedure - As introduced, provides that a federal employee who is not designated as a Tennessee peace officer may not make an arrest or conduct a search and seizure in this state without the written permission of the sheriff of the county in which the arrest, search and seizure will take place except under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title  8, Chapter 7 and Title 38, Chapter 3, Part 1.

Child Custody and Support - As enacted, clarifies that in determining the willingness of each of the parents and caregivers to facilitate and encourage a close and continuing parent-child relationship between the child and both of the child's parents, the court must consider the likelihood of each parent and caregiver to honor and facilitate court ordered parenting arrangements and rights, and the court must further consider any history of either parent or any caregiver denying parenting time to either parent in violation of a court order. - Amends TCA Title  24, Chapter 7 and Title 36, Chapter 6.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, punishes shooting into a habitation or motor vehicle as reckless endangerment and defines the offense as a Class C felony without regard to the occupation of the habitation or motor vehicle.  - Amends TCA Section 39-13-103.
