Motor Vehicles - As introduced, directs the department of safety to ensure the liability insurance requirements are equally applied to all motor carriers. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 8; Title 7, Chapter 51; Title 55, Chapter 4; Title 55, Chapter 3; Title 56, Chapter 7; Title 65, Chapter 15 and Title 67, Chapter 4.

Open Meetings - As introduced, decreases from 30 to 20 days from receipt of plan, the time within which the office of open records counsel must report back to a governing body as to whether the governing body's plan for electronic communication between members complies with the open meetings laws. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 44.
Credit and Debit Cards - As introduced, redefines a qualifying organization to employ at least 200 Tennessee residents, instead of 100. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 2, Part 19.

Banks and Financial Institutions - As introduced, increases the work hours for a bona fide executive officer from 30 to 35 when determining whether a promissory note is considered an investment certificate. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 5.

DNA and Genetic Testing - As enacted, adds five homicide offenses to the list of violent offenses for which a DNA sample is taken and stored in the database upon arrest rather than conviction. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 35, Part 3.
Municipal Government - As introduced, enacts the "Courthouse Square Revitalization and Tourism Development Zone Act." - Amends TCA Title 6.

Special License Plates - As introduced, redesignates Masons and Tennessee Fraternal Order of Police license plates as specialty earmarked plates rather than new specialty earmarked plates and allocates revenues from such plates to such organizations. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As enacted, revises the requirements for a nursing home's certificate of need  for qualified partial relocation of certain nursing homes. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 16.

Clerks, Court - As enacted, increases by $2.00 the filing fee charged by clerks and data fee entry chargeable by clerks, except in certain cases brought by the state and state agencies; increase only effective until July 1, 2016, unless continued by general assembly. - Amends TCA Section 8-21-401 and Section 8-21-409.
Traffic Safety - As introduced, makes going faster than road conditions, weather and traffic patterns safely permit punishable as speeding. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8, Part 1.

Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, allows a member of the armed forces stationed overseas or a Tennessee resident who has been living outside the U.S. due to employment to ship wine into the state by getting a $100 permit and paying the appropriate taxes. - Amends TCA Title 57.

State Inmates - As introduced, establishes reimbursement rate for counties holding state inmates as adjusted based upon the percentage of change in the average consumer price index as published by the United States Department of Labor.  - Amends TCA Section 41-8-106.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, makes it a Class A misdemeanor for a person to engage in camping on property owned by the state knowing that the area on which the camping occurs is not specifically designated for use as a camping area by the department or agency responsible for such land. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 12; Title 29; Title 39 and Title 40.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, deletes portion of offense of harassment that is committed by communicating with or transmitting or displaying an image to another in a certain manner. - Amends TCA Title 39.
Criminal Offenses - As enacted, revises certain criminal provisions and requirements for schools in regard to bullying and harassment. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 49.

Physicians and Surgeons - As introduced, clarifies that physicians must report injuries or wounds arising out of methamphetamine laboratory incidents to law enforcement; provides immunity from liability for good faith reports. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 63 and Title 68.

State Employees - As introduced, revises provisions related to dues deductions if a certain percentage of members engage in a work stoppage; decreases amount of time for use of leave and benefits for chief elected officers of employee associations and other association members to attend association's annual meeting. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 23 and Title 8, Chapter 50.

Motor Vehicles - As enacted, authorizes towing trucks, while in the performance of duties involved with towing an abandoned, immobile, disabled or unattended motor vehicle, to display a white and amber light that is a strobe, flashing, oscillating or revolving system; clarifies use of similar lights on certain other vehicles. - Amends TCA Section 55-9-402.

Motor Vehicles, Titling and Registration - As introduced, prohibits county clerk from renewing owner's registration and registration plates if the owner has outstanding fines or fees owed to the county or any outstanding criminal warrants within the state. - Amends TCA Section 39-14-121 and Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 1.
Special License Plates - As introduced, authorizes until July 1, 2013, for sufficient number of applicants for Sigma Gamma Rho license plates. - Amends TCA Section 55-4-261.

Guardianship - As enacted, makes the charging of costs against the respondent's estate permissive rather than mandatory when a conservator is appointed; adds to the requirements for the information that must be included in a petition for the appointment of a conservator. - Amends TCA Title 30, Chapter 3; Title 33; Title 34 and Title 71.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, revises initial academic requirements for eligibility and the amount of the award of the Tennessee HOPE scholarship beginning with students entering college in 2015-2016; recommends use of net lottery proceeds for TSAA grants for 10 years beginning with 2015-2016.   - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4.

Lottery,  Corporation - As enacted, requires the general shortfall lottery subaccount to be maintained at $100 million instead of at $50 million; requires comptroller to make an annual report on the adequacy of reserves. - Amends TCA Section 4-51-111.

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As enacted, clarifies that endoscopy technicians are sufficient assistants for a physician performing an endoscopic procedure in an ambulatory surgical treatment center; specifies the scope of practice for endoscopy technicians. - Amends TCA Title  68, Chapter 57 and Title 68, Chapter 11.

Education - As enacted, specifies that an elementary school is any school serving any combination of kindergarten through grade "six," instead of "eight," and a middle school is any "school," instead of "elementary school," designed to serve grades 5 - 8 only, or any combination of grades 5 - 8; defines a "secondary school" as a school that provides secondary education and defines "secondary education" as education normally available and required by state standards to be taught to children enrolled in grades 7 - 12.  - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

Bail, Bail Bonds - As introduced, authorizes the suspension or withholding of approval of a professional bondsman if such bondsman was convicted of the equivalent of a Class A misdemeanor in any state. - Amends TCA Section 40-11-125.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, creates new Class A felony theft provision if the amount stolen is 250,000 or more; allows state to aggregate value of property stolen in certain circumstances; and changes venue for all offenses graded by value. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 1.

Sexual Offenses - As enacted, makes technical changes to clarify the offenses of soliciting sexual exploitation of a minor and exploitation of minor by electronic means to make language consistent and to copy from another section definitions for certain undefined terms. - Amends TCA Section 39-13-529.

Public Utilities - As introduced, revises civil penalties for public utilities that commit extortion or unjust discrimination or create undue advantage from "not less than $500 nor more than $2,000" to "not less than one week's value of such undue or unreasonable preference or advantage". - Amends TCA Section 7-82-104; Section 48-69-119; Section 64-4-107; Title 65 and Section 68-221-518.

Public Buildings - As enacted, authorizes replicas of certain historically-significant documents, such as the Magna Carta, Declaration of Independence and Ten Commandments, to be placed in local government public buildings. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 7 and Title 6, Chapter 54.
Taxes, Sales - As introduced, exempts funeral merchandise from sales and use taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Taxes, Sales - As introduced, exempts farm gates from sales and use taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Traffic Safety - As introduced, removes the requirement that any driver or passenger of a motorcycle 21 years of age or older wear a motorcycle helmet. - Amends TCA Section 55-9-302.

Traffic Safety - As introduced, permits motorcycle drivers and passengers, 21 years or older, to refrain from wearing a crash helmet with a health care coverage limit of at least $15,000. - Amends TCA Section 55-9-302.
Education - As introduced, establishes a special joint committee to review and study the establishment of an occupational course of study for students with disabilities. - Amends TCA Title 49, to.
Health Care - As enacted, requires health care providers to report injuries that appear to result from an illegal female genital mutilation. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 63 and Title 68.

Food and Food Products - As enacted, requires that sorghum molasses sold or offered for sale in Tennessee must be labeled as 100 percent pure or not pure; authorizes any person who suffers an injury or death, or an ascertainable loss of money or property, as a result of a violation of the bill to bring an action individually to recover actual damages. - Amends TCA Title 53.

Consumer Protection - As introduced, prohibits a person from transmitting or causing another person to transmit an unsolicited facsimile advertisement to any public elementary or secondary school or local education agency. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 4, Part 5.

Child Labor - As enacted, specifies that no public funds of this state or any political subdivision thereof shall be allocated to the regulation or enforcement of any change made to certain rules regarding the employment of children in an agricultural setting. - Amends TCA Title 43; Title 50, Chapter 3 and Title 50, Chapter 5.
subjects: Labor and Employment|Family and Children Issues

title: Firearms and Ammunition - As introduced, limits reproduction of handgun carry permit records. - Amends TCA Section 10-7-504.

Employees, Employers - As enacted, clarifies that the requirement for the distribution to servers of service charges or gratuities automatically added to a bill does not apply to charges or fees paid by guests to stay at a guest ranch. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 2, Part 1.

Medical Occupations - As introduced, prevents health care practitioners or facilities from asking a patient about gun ownership, possession or storage unless certain factors are present and prevents insurance companies from discriminating against an applicant or insured based upon gun ownership. - Amends TCA Title 56; Title 63 and Title 68.

Pest Control - As introduced, requires category 7 pest control applicators to acquire 15 points of continuing education every three years with an annual maximum of eight points. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 21, Part 1.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, provides $5,000 annual supplement to full-time classroom teachers who have taught in Tennessee public schools at least three years and who achieve National Board for Professional Teaching Standards certification. - Amends TCA Section 49-5-5609.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As enacted, specifies that a teacher may not teach a course in which an end of course examination is required for students to satisfy graduation requirements set by the state board of education, if the teacher's license does not carry a subject specific endorsement for the subject area of the course, unless the teacher demonstrates sufficient content knowledge in the course material by taking, at the teacher's own expense, and passing a standardized or criterion-referenced test for the content area.  - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

Forfeiture of Assets - As introduced, provides that 50 percent of the revenue from the sale of certain forfeited vehicles shall go to the state and the remainder to a local government when the state seizes the vehicle but the local government confiscates, tows, stores or conducts the sale of the vehicle. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 33 and Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, exempts the sale of all gold and silver bullion that is used as a medium of exchange, security, or commodity from sales tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

Bail, Bail Bonds - As enacted, declares a defendant who is unlawfully present in the United States and has committed certain traffic violations may be deemed a risk of flight for bail purposes; authorizes clerks to set bail for such defendants at a higher amount than normally permitted. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55.

Alcoholic Beverages - As enacted, creates a new farm wine permit; authorizes a farm producer to transport grapes or fruit grown on the farm to a licensed winery for the winery to manufacture, bottle and label the wine as being the product of the farm holding the farm wine permit; places certain requirements on the licensed winery. - Amends TCA Section 57-3-201 and Section 57-3-207.

Gas, Petroleum Products, Volatile Oils - As introduced, requires gasoline retailers in this state to offer at least two gasoline pumps that dispense gasoline that does not contain ethanol at each retail station; authorizes the commissioner of agriculture to investigate and assess fines for noncompliance. - Amends TCA Title 47; Title 60 and Title 67.
Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, makes K-12 teachers state employees. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 9.

Landlord and Tenant - As enacted, limits application of the Uniform Residential Landlord and Tenant Act to counties having a population of more than 75,000  instead of 68,000; change does not affect the current applicability of the Act. - Amends TCA Section 66-28-102.

Medical Occupations - As enacted, provides civil immunity to medical doctor or osteopathic physician who makes a good faith report to law enforcement regarding an employee's unauthorized use of the doctor or physician's DEA registration number to write prescriptions. - Amends TCA Title  63, Chapter 9 and Title 63, Chapter 6.
Highway Signs - As enacted, designates a certain segment of State Highway 28 in Sequatchie and Marion counties as "Veterans' Memorial Park Highway." -

Highways, Roads and Bridges - As introduced, provides that the chief administrative officer of the highway department in Decatur County must have four years of experience in the use of highway construction equipment; withholds certain funds from Decatur County and reallocates such funds to counties subject to existing highway experience qualifications. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 7, Part 1.

Property Assessors - As introduced, requires property assessor to set parcel identification numbers for subdivided lots effective at time of division and to prorate assessment between parent property and divided parcels; provides supplemental tax resulting in added value to divided parcel assigned only to such parcel. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.

Special License Plates - As enacted, authorizes issuance of brain injury awareness new specialty earmarked license plates; allocates 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to Brain Injury Association of Tennessee.  - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, enhances the penalty for indecent exposure and public indecency where the crimes occur under certain circumstances on school property. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13 and Title 40.

Day Care - As introduced, requires certain training and educational requirements on care givers for child care agencies and provides for certain eligibility for financial assistance under lottery scholarship and grant programs for such care givers. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 71.

State Employees - As introduced, requires the commissioner of human services to institute a mandatory drug testing program for all state employees and the speaker of the house and senate to jointly institute such a program for legislative employees including members of the general assembly.   - Amends TCA Section 50-9-104.

Campaigns and Campaign Finance - As introduced, prohibits a person bidding on or awarded a state contract from making contributions to members of the general assembly or the governor during specified periods of time. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 12.
Criminal Offenses - As introduced, institutes a $500 reward for reporting a felon in possession. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.

Schools, Charter - As introduced, provides that all records of a public charter school are open records to the same extent as those of public schools operated by LEAs; provides that the names of the sponsors and the governing body are open records.   - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.

Comptroller, State - As introduced, requires comptroller to study financing programs available to hospitals that have received both essential access payments and disproportionate share payments for infrastructure and capitol improvement needs. - Amends TCA Title 9 and Title 68.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Education, Higher - As introduced, freezes in-state tuition and fees and room and board for three years at the public universities and community colleges.   - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7; Title 49, Chapter 8 and Title 49, Chapter 9.

Drugs, Prescription - As introduced, requires a prescription issued by a physician in order to obtain products with immediate precursor of methamphetamine from a pharmacy. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 63.

Education - As introduced, requires cuts to a school district's budget to be made first to funds paid to professional organizations. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.
Lottery,  Corporation - As introduced, allows Tennessee lottery tickets to be purchased with debit cards in addition to cash.  - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51, Part 1.

Education - As introduced, prohibits use of state funds to pay dues or other fees required for an LEA to join or be a member of a professional organization. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.

Personal Property - As introduced, broadens the notice of sale requirements for storage unit owners, and provides storage unit occupants with a remedy if the owner fails to abide by the notice of sale requirements. - Amends TCA Section 66-31-105.

Workers Compensation - As introduced, exempts sole proprietors from paying certain fees assessed by the secretary of state's office in relation to workers compensation. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.

Fees - As introduced, increases expunction fee from $50.00 to $350 and requires a payment of $100 before the bureau issues a certificate of eligibility for diversion. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 6; Title  40, Chapter 32 and Title 40, Chapter 35.
Election Laws - As introduced, allows any registered voter in Tennessee to vote by absentee ballot; revises other voting provisions. - Amends TCA Title  2, Chapter 6 and Title 2, Chapter 3.
Election Laws - As introduced, enacts "Tennessee Election Day Registration Act." - Amends TCA Title  2, Chapter 7 and Title 2, Chapter 2.

Courts - As introduced, abolishes the court of judiciary on October 1, 2012, establishes new 16-member court of judicial conduct with appointments made by supreme court, governor, bar association and each caucus of general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 17, Chapter 5, Part 2.

Livestock - As introduced, makes branding of livestock mandatory; requires facilities to obtain written permission of brand holder prior to processing or selling livestock.  - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 7.
State Government - As introduced, establishes standards for state recognition of Native American Indian tribes. - Amends TCA Title 4.

Professions and Occupations - As introduced, authorizes state board for licensing alarms systems contractors to refuse to issue a license to an applicant who has been convicted of a crime indicating lack of good moral character. - Amends TCA Title 62.

Railroads - As introduced, changes deadline for submission of annual report concerning railroad companies' affairs to the department of transportation from February 1 to February 15. - Amends TCA Section 5-5-118; Title 7; Section 35-3-108; Section 55-8-147; Title 57, Chapter 4; Title 64, Chapter 2; Title 65 and Section 69-1-114.

Railroads - As introduced, adds Chattanooga to the list of cities in which public notice by newspaper must be provided prior to any meeting of a railroad company's stockholders to approve the issuance of bonds and stock. - Amends TCA Title 65.

Driver Licenses - As introduced, requires that all written and oral examinations administered by the department of safety for issuance of driver licenses, intermediate driver licenses, temporary driver licenses and temporary intermediate driver licenses be in English only. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 3.

Motor Vehicles - As introduced, deletes the June 30, 2012, repeal date for the reduced payment option available to persons in Davidson County whose licenses have been suspended for certain driving offenses and who have outstanding fines and costs. - Amends TCA Section 55-50-502.
Drugs, Prescription - As enacted, revises various provisions of present law regarding pain management clinics.  - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 1.

Welfare - As enacted, requires the department of human services to develop a plan to implement a program of suspicion-based drug testing for each applicant who is otherwise eligible for temporary assistance for needy families (TANF). - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 12; Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 18 and Title 71.

Short Term Loans and Lenders - As introduced, increases the shareholder ownership requirement from 5 percent to 10 percent to obtain a deferred presentment license; establishes a multi-state automated licensing system for deferred presentment services; authorizes the commissioner to set fees and deadlines for applications; promulgates rules and regulations; and implements sharing agreements between government agencies to use the multi-state automated licensing system.  - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 17.

Contractors - As introduced, requires the penalty for engaging in the business of a contractor without a license be adjusted every two years to reflect the percentage of change in the average CPI, all items-city average; requires the board to publish each adjusted amount on its web site. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 6 and Title 66.

Insurance, Health, Accident - As enacted, revises obsolete language related to independent practitioner of social work for purposes of reimbursement under medical, hospital and medical service plans and insurance by replacing it with current licensure terminology of a person duly licensed to engage in independent practice as a licensed clinical social worker. - Amends TCA Section 56-7-2401 and Section 56-7-2402.
Highway Signs - As enacted, designates bridge on S.R. 295 in Pickett County as "James "Jim" Harrison South Memorial Bridge." -

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As enacted, prohibits a director of schools and board of education from using abolition of a position as a method of avoiding dismissal charges against a teacher and the accompanying due process rights attaching to the status of tenure.
 - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 5.

Education - As introduced, makes failure by local boards of education and their representatives or professional employees' organizations and their representatives to participate in good faith in collaborative conferencing unlawful. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 6.

Education - As introduced, prohibits local board of education from avoiding or refusing to participate in collaborative conferencing; requires board to present a proposed MOU's content to professional employees and to provide opportunity for employees to express their concerns to the board before the board acts on the MOU. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 6.
Education - As introduced, requires local boards of education to provide payroll deduction options for employee benefits. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 2.
Professions and Occupations - As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Professional Employer Organization Act." - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 56 and Title 62, Chapter 43.

DUI Offenses - As enacted, authorizes judge to order the use of an ignition interlock device for any person granted a restricted driver license; order may be with or without geographical restrictions, but if the device is ordered, then it must remain on the vehicle during the entire period of the restricted license.  - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.
Recycling - As introduced, changes the size requirements of the posted notice for a metals recycling facility. - Amends TCA Title 39.

DUI Offenses - As eancted, expands present law to provide that it is not a defense to a violation of the DUI statute that a person is or was lawfully entitled to use an intoxicant, marijuana, controlled substance, or other drug. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

DUI Offenses - As enacted, increases penalty for violation of DUI statute when child under 18 is in the vehicle to require that the mandatory minimum 30-day sentence for this offense be served consecutive to any sentence received for a violation of specified other alcohol-related offenses. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

DUI Offenses - As enacted, clarifies that a person may be compelled to submit to an alcohol test under the implied consent law by other provisions of law, court order or search warrant. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

Education - As enacted, authorizes local boards of education to receive federal or private grants for educational purposes; specifies the process for the making of such grants.  - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2.
Libraries - As enacted, clarifies existing law regarding term length and board membership of city and county library boards.   - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 3.
TennCare - As introduced, decreases the notification timeframe for an enrollee or applicant to notify the bureau of any documentation changes from 30 days to 15. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As introduced, increases reporting requirements for the department of health, health care and services facilities, and entities receiving grants from annual to biannual. - Amends TCA Title 68.

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As introduced, deletes the requirement that recommendations regarding public needs allowance to the general welfare, health and human resources committee of the senate and to the health and human resources committee of the house be received no later than the second Tuesday in January 2010. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.

Museums - As introduced, requires annual report of the Tennessee Agricultural Museum to be submitted to the commerce, labor and agriculture committee of the senate and the agriculture committee of the house of representatives.  - Amends TCA Title 43.

Welfare - As introduced, establishes that the final study of medical assistance program and any participating managed care organizations be reported to the finance, ways and means committees of the senate and the house, the office of legislative budget analysis and the fiscal review committee on or before April 1 of each year, instead of April 15. - Amends TCA Title 71.
Tennessee Higher Education Commission - As introduced, requires THEC's annual report to be published prior to February 1 of each year, rather than February 15. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Real Property - As enacted, authorizes any town, city, county, county with a metropolitan government, the state or any not-for-profit to purchase, preserve, and sell development rights.  - Amends TCA Section 13-7-101 and Section 13-7-201.

Libraries - As enacted, requires CTAS to conduct a study of county librarians' salaries in this state as compared to those in states bordering this state. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8 and Title 10.

Tennessee Wildlife Resources Agency - As introduced, requires any shooting range on lands managed by the agency to be open to access and use during normal business hours to all persons possessing a Tennessee hunting license. - Amends TCA Section 38-8-116 and Title 70.

Herbal Products and Natural Foods - As enacted, makes it a Class A misdemeanor criminal offense for any person to knowingly dig, harvest, collect or remove wild ginseng from any land that such person does not own on any date not within the wild ginseng harvest season. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 8, Part 2.

County Government - As introduced, authorizes counties to develop first responder teams to address emergency situations in their county; grants authority to such first responder teams to take certain measures to secure the affected area and minimize harm to persons and property. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 1 and Title 7, Chapter 1.

Health, Dept. of - As introduced, authorizes the director of the division of health related boards to maintain a central file of paper and electronic documents and to receive notice of meetings of agencies within the division. - Amends TCA Title 63.

Utilities, Utility Districts - As enacted, requires boards of commissioners for utility districts to provide notice to their customers at least two weeks prior to any board meeting at which the board members intend to select three nominees to certify to the county mayor to fill an existing or upcoming vacancy on the board; notice must include an invitation for the customers to submit the names of qualified persons to be considered for nomination. - Amends TCA Section 7-82-307.

Contractors - As introduced, enacts the "Electricians Licensing Act"; requires persons performing electrical work under a contract for more than $5,000 of work to be licensed. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 6.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, exempts from taxation the purchases or leases of golf carts, equipment and lawn care products by golf course operators. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

Licenses - As introduced, provides that a person who has been licensed as a court reporter for at least five years and who is at least 55 years of age is not required to obtain continuing education credits as a condition for license renewal. - Amends TCA Title 20, Chapter 9, Part 6.

Criminal Procedure - As enacted, increases the records expunction fee that is payable after completing diversion from $50.00 to $350, expands the purposes for which the diversion fee may be used and implements a new $100 fee that must be paid when requesting diversion. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 6; Title 40, Chapter 32 and Title 40, Chapter 35.
Dentists and Dentistry - As introduced, authorIzes collaborative practice between dentists and dental hygienists in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Section 63-5-108.

Wildlife Resources Commission - As enacted, replaces the Tennessee wildlife resources commission (TWRC) with a 13-member fish and wildlife commission. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 11; Title 43; Title 44; Title 67; Title 69 and Title 70.
Consumer Protection - As introduced, revises procedures relative to promulgation of rules by the division of consumer affairs. - Amends TCA Title 47.

Real Property - As introduced, authorizes suit for trespass to be brought in any court of general jurisdiction in county where trespass occurred or where the trespasser resides. - Amends TCA Title 29 and Title 66.

Sentencing - As introduced, provides that a person who is convicted of an offense involving a motor vehicle that injures or kills two or more first responders who are acting in the line of duty at the scene of or in route to or from an accident or medical emergency must serve any sentences received consecutively rather than concurrently.  - Amends TCA Section 40-35-115.
Safety - As introduced, requires certain persons who install and maintain elevators to be licensed. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 121.

Education - As enacted, regulates student conduct on school buses; permits school personnel, including school bus drivers, to use reasonable force, subject to certain restrictions, in maintaining discipline.   - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 39 and Title 49.
Game and Fish Laws - As introduced, increases from one to two the number of free sport fishing days. - Amends TCA Title 70.
subjects: Agriculture and Food|Animal Rights and Wildlife Issues

title: Child Custody and Support - As introduced, permits a grandparent with previously granted visitation rights to file a petition in opposition to relocation of a child and, under certain circumstances, to obtain custody over the child.  - Amends TCA Title 16 and Title 36.

Inheritance Laws - As introduced, reduces the amount of a surviving spouse's elective share by the value of any assets transferred, or deemed transferred, within the six months immediately preceding the decedent's death. - Amends TCA Title 30; Title 31; Title 32; Title 35 and Title 36.

Physicians and Surgeons - As enacted, changes from "January 1, 2013" to "July 1, 2012" the effective date of Chapter 434 of the Public Acts of 2011, which prohibits physicians from utilizing telemedicine to provide abortion services. - Amends TCA Title 63 and Chapter 434 of the Public Acts of 2011.
Highway Signs - As enacted, names bridge on S.R. 246 in Williamson County in honor of the late Spc. Danny Gale Martin. -
Highway Signs - As enacted, designates certain segment of State Route 392 within Crossville as the "Milo Lemert Parkway". -
Tennessee Wildlife Resources Agency - As introduced, authorizes persons in Cumberland County to use dogs in the eradication of wild hogs. - Amends TCA Title 70.
Unemployment Compensation - As introduced, requires drug testing of persons filing new claims for unemployment benefits. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 50.

Day Care - As introduced, exempts certain adult day care services operated by nursing homes or assisted-care living facilities from licensure by the department of human services. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 2, Part 4.

Law Enforcement - As introduced, requires that no disciplinary action be taken against a law enforcement officer for a pursuit for an actual or suspected violator of a law or ordinance who flees from pursuit unless such pursuit violated pursuit policies established by the law enforcement agency that employed such law enforcement officer at the time of the pursuit. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 40 and Title 55.
Taxes, Sales - As enacted, authorizes repeal of Tennessee River Resort District status by two-thirds vote of legislative body of jurisdiction. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-103.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Alcoholic Beverages - As enacted, authorizes Riverview Restaurant, also known as the Catfish Place under the bridge, located in Cheatham County to be licensed as a premier type tourist resort. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

Physicians and Surgeons - As enacted, requires that in hormone replacement therapy clinics all hormone replacement therapy must be performed by a licensed physician or licensed osteopathic physician or by a certified nurse practitioner or a physician assistant that is delegated such tasks by a licensed physician or licensed osteopathic physician; establishes other requirements. - Amends TCA Title 63.
Highway Signs - As enacted, names certain bridge on U.S. 70 in DeKalb County in honor of the late PFC Billy Gene Anderson. -
Highway Signs - As enacted, includes I-26 in Unicoi County within Purple Heart Trail. - Amends Chapter 741 of the Public Acts of 2006 and Chapter 767 of the Public Acts of 2004.

General Assembly, Directed Studies - As enacted, enacts the "Welfare Roll to Payroll Act," which directs the commissioner of human services to conduct a summer study that will assess the feasibility of more work friendly assistance eligibility and benefits requirements in order to increase workforce participation.  - Amends TCA Title 71.

Workers Compensation - As enacted, clarifies that either party in a workers compensation dispute may bring suit in the county in which the employee resided at the time of the injury when issues remain after the benefit review conference; reduces from $100 to $50.00 the maximum amount that the secretary of state may charge for certain fees concerning construction service providers and workers compensation. - Amends TCA Title 50.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, includes appointing someone as a member or chairman of, or to a leadership position on, a committee, board or other governmental body within the definition of "pecuniary interest" for purposes of the bribery statutes. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 16, Part 1.
Pest Control - As introduced, prohibits pest control operators from offering or entering into no treatment contracts. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18 and Title 62, Chapter 21.

Sexual Offenders - As introduced, prohibits sexual offenders and violent sexual offenders from establishing a primary or secondary residence or accepting employment within 1,000 feet of a place of worship. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2.

Planning, Public - As introduced, creates different requirements for subdivisions and development in counties in which county-wide zoning has not been enacted. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 3, Part 4.

State Employees - As introduced, requires any group health insurance plan for state officials and employees to meet the requirements of a high deductible health plan as defined by 26 U.S.C. Section 223. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27, Part 2.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, exempts from property taxes and sales taxes civic leagues or organizations designated as Internal Revenue Code  501(c)(4) organizations and located in Hawkins County. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5 and Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
Criminal Offenses - As introduced, corrects omitted language from offense prohibiting the manufacture of hallucinogenic plant salvia divinorum and synthetic cannabinoids. - Amends TCA Title 39.

Controlled Substances - As enacted, permits county medical examiners to access the controlled substance database, absolves civil and criminal liability for authorized users acting in good faith within the proscribed limits, and establishes a presumption of good faith action where a medical examiner accesses the information for the purpose of conducting an investigation into a death or making a report as required by the duties of the position. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 7; Title 39 and Title 53, Chapter 10.
Tort Liability and Reform - As introduced, grants immunity from civil liability to an operator of an ice-skating rink who complies with certain responsibilities. - Amends TCA Title 29.

Employees, Employers - As enacted, provides that an employer permitting a person with a handgun carry permit to carry a handgun on the employer's property does not constitute an occupational safety and health hazard to the employees. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 3.

Probation and Parole - As enacted, permits private probation providers who meet certain qualifications and contract with the department of correction to supervise Class E felony offenders who are granted probation. - Amends TCA Title 40.

Taxes, Ad Valorem - As introduced, includes certain reusable materials as finished goods or manufactured articles in the hands of the manufacturer for purposes of property taxation. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 2.

Special License Plates - As enacted, extends until June 30, 2013, for Donate Life new specialty earmarked license plates to obtain the minimum number of orders for issuance of such license plate. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, grants immunity from civil liability and a defense to criminal liability for those who report certain injuries in good faith and specifies that the reporting requirement for those injuries is within 24 hours. - Amends TCA Title 38 and Title 39.

Newspapers and Publications - As introduced, requires notices of foreclosures, land sales, transactions involving real property and other legal notices required by statute be publicized by publishing notice in certain local newspapers and posting notice on certain web sites. -

Sentencing - As introduced, requires any sentence received for the offenses of identity theft and identity theft trafficking to be served consecutive to any other offense committed as a result of the identity theft. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 1.

Comptroller, State - As enacted, authorizes the comptroller to access, for the purpose of conducting audits or program evaluations, the discount, rebate, pricing and descriptions of other financial agreements as submitted in a procurement or as a report to the contractor; specifies that no official, employee or agent of the state may release or provide for the release, in any form, of information subject to confidential custody under present law. - Amends TCA Section 10-7-504; Title  56 and Title 63.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Taxes, Income - As introduced, defines "dividend" as distributions of income out of earned surplus to shareholders made on account of stock ownership and directly related to such ownership. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2, Part 1.
subjects: Labor and Employment|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Health Care - As introduced, designates the department of finance and administration as the state agency for the implementation of the federal Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, which requires states to implement health care exchanges; specifies department may do all acts necessary or proper to carry out this implementation power. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 56 and Title 71.

Taxes, Inheritance Gift - As enacted, eliminates the gift tax effective January 1, 2012; does not absolve taxpayer of any liability for tax duly imposed prior to January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title  67, Chapter 8, Part 6; Title 67, Chapter 8, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 8, Part 4.
subjects: Family and Children Issues|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Short Term Loans and Lenders - As introduced, revises various provisions governing deferred presentment services, including provisions regarding qualifications for licensure; authorizes commissioner of financial institutions to require persons subject to Deferred Presentment Services Act to be licensed through a multi-state automated licensing system. - Amends TCA Section 45-17-107; Section 45-17-108; Section 45-17-110; Section 45-17-111; Section 45-17-119 and Section 45-17-104.
Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, exempts income derived from stocks and bonds of certain Subchapter S corporations from the Hall income tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.

Election Laws - As enacted, specifies that for a municipal election not held in conjunction with any other election, if a polling place is located outside of the boundaries of a municipality but the precinct the polling place serves includes residents of the municipality, then the election commission may designate a polling place outside, but closest to the geographic precinct within the limits of the municipality, the precinct it is to serve. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 3, Part 1.

Fees - As introduced, establishes a fee imposed on customers for transmitting money through certain entities; requires the department of revenue to administer the collection of said fee; establishes a fund for the moneys collected that can be utilized by the Tennessee bureau of investigation for certain activities. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 9; Title 40, Chapter 33, Part 2; Title 45, Chapter 7, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 4.

Child Custody and Support - As enacted, creates a new ground for initiating the termination of parental or guardianship rights that can be brought by one parent against the other parent based on the commission of severe child sexual abuse by such other parent.  - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 37; Title 39, Chapter 13; Title 39, Chapter 15 and Title 39, Chapter 17.
Municipal Government - As enacted, makes permanent, instead of terminating in 2012, the municipal pilot program for dealing with abandoned construction.  - Amends TCA Section 13-21-102.

Fireworks - As enacted, revises the population figures from any county in excess of 200,000 in the present law to any county in excess of 335,000 based on the recent federal census which effectively means fireworks cannot be sold within the four largest counties; a conforming change removes language from the current law which would have permitted any county to continue selling fireworks if its population grew past 200,000 an exemption which applied to Rutherford County; such language is no longer necessary with the increased population to 335,000; clarifies that present law permits the sale of fireworks in the City of Lakeland in Shelby County at a stand where fireworks have been sold annually for at least 45 years. - Amends TCA Section 68-104-112.

School Transportation - As enacted, removes limitation on commercial advertising on school buses that requires such advertising to "be composed of lettering on a background color." - Amends TCA Section 49-6-2109.

Sexual Offenders - As introduced, provides that the conveyance or real or personal property of a sexual offender used to violate a provision of the sex offender registry is subject to forfeiture. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 5.

Sexual Offenders - As enacted, adds the offense of promoting prostitution to the list of sexual offenses requiring registration under the sex offender registry and adds second offense promoting prostitution to the list of violent sexual offenses. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2.

Sexual Offenders - As enacted, provides that if a sexual offender is not incarcerated at the time of sentencing, the offender is to report to a probation officer for the purpose of giving a DNA specimen; provides that cost of sample is to be paid by the offender. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 35, Part 3.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, revokes the beer permit and license to sell tobacco products and prohibits renewal of lottery retail contract for a period of one year if the owner or employee of a retail establishment is convicted of selling certain synthetic, analogue or imitation controlled substances. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4; Title 57, Chapter 5, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 10.

DUI Offenses - As enacted, adds all trained phlebotomists who are either operating under a hospital protocol, have completed phlebotomy training through an educational entity providing such training, or have been properly trained by a current or former employer to draw blood to the list of persons who are authorized to draw blood at the written request of a law enforcement officer for the purpose of determining whether a suspect has committed DUI; extends the same civil immunity and chain of custody requirements that apply under present law to persons who are authorized to perform blood draws on DUI suspects to all such trained phlebotomists. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10.

Judicial Officers - As enacted, authorizes the general sessions judges of Williamson County to appoint judicial commissioners; clarifies that when the general sessions judges cannot agree on a judicial commissioner appointment, the chief legislative body shall appoint the judicial commissioner; however, the general sessions judges would still supervise that judicial commissioner. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 1.

Law Enforcement - As enacted, requires that officers who knowingly provide POST with false or misleading information concerning histories be decertified, removed from office, and be deemed ineligible to apply for a new law enforcement position in Tennessee; requires denial of application for POST certification of an applicant who knowingly provides POST with false or misleading information. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, creates a state bonus for teachers scoring 3 or higher on their evaluations.   - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 5.

Education - As introduced, requires THEC to give notice of meetings of the consortium for cooperative innovative education to the senate and house education committees with an attached agenda; requires annual report of the consortium to state the number of times it met and summarize the work performed.   - Amends TCA Title 49.

Criminal Procedure - As enacted, authorizes persons to petition for expungement of records of conviction for certain non-violent, non-sexual misdemeanors and Class E felonies that were committed on or after November 1, 1989.  - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 32.

Education - As introduced, requires each LEA to develop a policy that would require students to complete at least 75 hours of service learning prior to high school graduation. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, includes the commission of or attempt to commit a criminal gang offense within the definition of racketeering activity and enterprise for purposes of the Racketeer and Corrupt Organization Act (RICO). - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 12, Part 2.
Criminal Offenses - As introduced, creates a separate offense for participating in criminal gang activity. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17 and Title 40, Chapter 35.
Safety - As introduced, revises the licensing of elevators. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 121.

Welfare - As introduced, directs a summer study by the department of human services to examine the efficiency of the department's sliding scale distribution of benefits to recipients whose income increased to the maximum amount to receive benefits. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5, Part 3.
Appropriations - As introduced, makes appropriations for the purpose of defraying the expenses of certain legislative enactments passed during the 2012 session of the 107th General Assembly. -
Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, authorizes the sale of wine at retail food stores in any jurisdiction only upon approval in a referendum in such jurisdiction. - Amends TCA Title 57.

General Assembly - As introduced, requires members who live within 50 miles of capitol building to be reimbursed actual expenses upon filing receipts, except such amount shall not exceed the federal employee allowance for expenditure reimbursement. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.

Eminent Domain - As introduced, eliminates the power of eminent domain for housing authorities and permits governing bodies to institute eminent domain proceedings on behalf of housing authorities. - Amends TCA Title 12; Title 13 and Title 29.
Highway Signs - As enacted, names bridge on S.R. 96 in Williamson County in honor of the late Master Sergeant James W. "Tre" Ponder III, U.S. Army.  -

Parks, Natural Areas Preservation - As introduced, increases from two to three years time after designation into the system that the commissioner of environment and conservation have completed a comprehensive plan of development and protection and begun the process of acquisition. - Amends TCA Title 11 and Title 60.

Controlled Substances - As introduced, makes materials containing any quantity of ephedrine  or pseudoephedrine a Schedule III controlled substance and exempts immediate methamphetamine precursors if they are not in form that can be used in manufacture of methamphetamine. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.
Highways, Roads and Bridges - As introduced, revises highways on which outdoor advertising is prohibited. - Amends TCA Section 54-21-118.

Insurance, Health, Accident - As introduced, requires individual and group health insurance policies to cover neuropsychological testing for children who have been diagnosed with cancer who have undergone radiation or chemotherapy for cancer; requires commissioner of finance and administration to take all permissible action to obtain similar coverage for children on TennCare who are diagnosed with cancer on or after January 1, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 71.
Criminal Offenses - As introduced, criminalizes the act of filing a lien without a reasonable basis or legal cause to do so. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

Local Education Agencies - As enacted, allows local boards of education to conduct scheduled board meetings electronically in some circumstances.   - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 44, Part 1 and Title 49, Chapter 2.

Funeral Directors and Embalmers - As introduced, increases the range of fines from $100-$500 to $500-$1,000 for any person who fails to place concise wording describing the material used to make a receptacle or container used for burial, entombment or other final disposition of a human body or remains. - Amends TCA Title 32; Title 47; Title 62, Chapter 5 and Title 68.

Campaigns and Campaign Finance - As introduced, creates Class C misdemeanor for any corporation or other business entity that receives state grants, bonds or tax credits to make contributions to candidates for state or local public office or to PACs that contribute to state or local candidates during any two-year election cycle in which such grants, bonds or tax credits were received. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

Highway Signs - As enacted, prohibits outdoor advertising on state route 840 in Williamson County from state route 246 to one mile from the intersection with state route 100; clarifies that former Interstate 181 in Washington and Sullivan counties is now called Interstate 26. - Amends TCA Section 54-21-118.

Homestead Exemptions - As introduced, exempts an individual's residence including no more than one-half acre of contiguous land from execution for debts other than taxes and debts used to purchase the home or where the home was pledged as collateral for a debt. - Amends TCA Title 26, Chapter 2, Part 3.
subjects: Housing and Property|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Liens - As enacted, makes it a Class A misdemeanor for any person, including any individual or entity, to knowingly prepare, sign, or file any lien or other document with the intent to encumber any real or personal property when such person has no reasonable basis or any legal cause to place such lien or encumbrance on such real or personal property. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 1.

Recycling - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Beverage Container Recycling Refunds Act," whereby certain procedures, processes, and fees are described for the recycling of waste; creates a deposit system for the recycling of certain beverage containers. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211 and Chapter 616 of the Public Acts of 2010.

Criminal Procedure - As introduced, requires a judge to revoke a defendant's participation in a domestic violence intervention class if the defendant is convicted of a subsequent domestic assault offense while attending the class and requires that the new sentence run cumulative to the original sentence. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
Children's Services, Dept. of - As enacted, adds additional language to the department's mission/purpose. - Amends TCA Section 37-5-102.
Children - As introduced, expands the definition of dependent and neglected child to include a child who has contracted a sexually transmitted disease. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 1, Part 1.

Child Abuse - As enacted, requires that, if a report of child abuse alleges physical abuse, it will be in the best interest of the child that the child be referred to a child advocacy center or that the investigation be conducted by a child protective services investigator who is adequately trained in investigating physical abuse reports; prohibits any probation officer previously assigned to the child from performing the investigation under any circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 37; Title 39 and Title 40.

Adoption - As introduced, grants adoption preference to a relative over a foster parent where a child has had substantial contact and interaction with that relative. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 1 and Title 37.

Child Abuse - As introduced, punishes the failure to protect a child from severe child abuse in the same manner as if the offender committed the severe child abuse. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 39 and Title 40.
TennCare - As introduced, deletes requirement that new beds authorized for ICF/MR beginning July 1, 2006, should be filled by persons from the developmental centers. - Amends TCA Section 71-5-105.

Arson - As introduced, increases the penalty for the offense of arson from a Class C to a Class B felony and sets a minimum fine for arson of a place of worship at $25,000 and aggravated arson at $50,000. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14.

Water Pollution - As introduced, prohibits issuance of a water quality control permit that would alter any ridgeline that is more than 2,000 feet above sea level. - Amends TCA Title 59 and Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.
Criminal Procedure - As introduced, prohibits defendants charged with domestic assault from pleading to a lesser offense. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.
Criminal Offenses - As introduced, enhances the financial penalty for violating an order of protection. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 39 and Title 40.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, punishes domestic assault as a Class A misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3; Title 16, Chapter 15; Title 29, Chapter 13; Title 36, Chapter 3; Title 39 and Title 40, Chapter 35.
Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, authorizes Norris Landing Marina in Claiborne County to be issued a license as a premier type tourist resort. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102 and Section 57-4-102.

Sentencing - As enacted, requires that a person convicted of committing a dangerous felony involving a firearm who is subsequently convicted of the same serve a minimum of 15 years imprisonment at 100 percent. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17 and Title 40.
Taxes, Income - As introduced, abolishes the Hall income tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.
subjects: Labor and Employment|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Business and Commerce - As introduced, repeals the "Equal Access to Intrastate Commerce Act." - Amends TCA Section 4-21-102 and Title 7, Chapter 51.

Physicians and Surgeons - As enacted, voids contractual restrictions on a physician's right to practice medicine if such physician is employed independently of a bona fide practice purchase and is terminated by an employing entity for reasons other than breach by the employee. - Amends TCA Section 63-6-204 and Section 68-11-205.

Water Pollution - As introduced, prohibits issuance of a water quality control permit that would alter any ridgeline that is more than 2,000 feet above sea level. - Amends TCA Title 59 and Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, requires the department of education to include in its annual report by LEA and statewide the number and percentage of teachers scoring each possible effectiveness rating on the teacher evaluations.  - Amends TCA Title 49.

Taxes, Sales - As introduced, authorizes metropolitan governments to levy an additional local sales tax on certain retail sales within a downtown development district for certain purposes. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 13; Title 57 and Title 67.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Landlord and Tenant - As enacted, permits landlord to terminate rental agreement if tenant creates a hazardous or unsanitary, instead of hazardous and unsanitary, condition on the property; revises certain provisions regarding accounts for security deposits. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 28.

Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As introduced, includes bomb and arson special agents among those persons in the TCRS engaged in law enforcement activities on a day-to-day basis having a mandatory retirement age. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 36, Part 2.

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As introduced, prohibits a private act hospital from entering into or renew a provider network or contract with a hospital or medical service corporation that contains an exclusive provider provision. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 57, Part 5.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, provides a sales and use tax refund for persons or entities installing a geothermal heat system in a residence or business. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

Local Government, General - As introduced, prohibits impact fees or adequate facilities taxes from being imposed on age-exclusive developments for persons 55 and older if children as permanent residents are also excluded; clarifies present acts imposing impact fees and adequate facilities taxes may be revised to reduce the fee or tax or remove types of property from being subject to such fees or taxes. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-2913.

Beer - As introduced, requires revocation or suspension for at least 60 days of beer sales permit held by any person who is convicted of a drug crime. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Section 8-21-401; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 57.

Tobacco, Tobacco Products - As introduced, requires the commissioner of revenue to revoke the tobacco license of a person convicted of a state drug offense for 60 days and requires the clerk of court to report convictions and pleadings to the commissioner for revocation purposes. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17 and Title 67.

Labor - As enacted, establishes certain authorization regarding the posting of information on right to work laws; requires commissioner of labor and workforce development to create model notice language. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 1, Part 2.
Controlled Substances - As introduced, adds new controlled substances to Schedule I hallucinogenic substances and stimulants and to Schedule II stimulants. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
Criminal Offenses - As introduced, creates new grade for offense of theft making theft over $500,000 a Class A felony. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 1.

Short Term Loans and Lenders - As introduced, limits the ability of a title pledge lender to assess and collect, as reimbursement, a charge for repossession of a vehicle that is the subject of a title pledge agreement. - Amends TCA Section 45-15-111.
Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As enacted, enacts the "Traumatic Brain Injury Residential Home Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11.
Highway Signs - As introduced, names segment of U.S. 31W within corporate limits of Millersville in honor of John W. Reynolds, Sr. -

Taxes, Sales - As introduced, clarifies the taxation of food and food ingredients by referencing the definition. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 1; Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Advertising - As introduced, defines the term "agreement" to be the agreement between the commissioner of transportation and the Secretary of the U.S. Department of Transportation for purposes of defining unzoned industrial and commercial areas and the size, lighting and spacing of outdoor advertising. - Amends TCA Title 29 and Title 54.
Education - As introduced, allows teachers to remove disruptive students from class pursuant to local board policies. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Traffic Safety - As enacted, requires a local government to include in any new, existing, or renewed contract involving unmanned traffic enforcement cameras that the contract must conform to any changes in state law.  - Amends TCA Section 55-8-198.
Criminal Offenses - As introduced, defines commercial sex act and criminalizes trafficking a person for commercial sex acts. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
Cemeteries - As enacted, exempts from income taxes the income from trust funds for perpetual care of a cemetery. - Amends TCA Title 67.

Taxes, Sales - As introduced, exempts from sales tax used clothing sold by a 501(c)(3) organization. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 1; Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Probation and Parole - As introduced, allows employees of board of probation and parole and board members to carry firearm during the course of official duties if they have a handgun carry permit and their job duties require them to have regular contact with probationers and parolees. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13 and Title 40, Chapter 28, Part 1.

Mental Health, Dept. of - As introduced, establishes an exception to the consent requirement for disclosure of medical records if the patient has been deceased for more than 10 years and the records requested are more than 50 years old; and allows state to charge up to $25.00 to the requester of the records. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5 and Title 33, Chapter 3, Part 1.
Education - As introduced, clarifies that public charter schools are public schools for the purposes of reporting pupil attendance and truancy.   - Amends TCA Title 37 and Title 49.

Education - As introduced, increases the number of days from 150 to 160 per year and from 75 to 80 per semester that a student must be present for classroom instruction for a student's TCAP scores to be attributable to a specific teacher.   - Amends TCA Title 37 and Title 49.

Local Education Agencies - As introduced, controls transfer and disposition of county school property lying in a city forming a new city school system or participating in the formation of a joint city school system.  - Amends TCA Title 5; Title  6; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3; Title 49, Chapter 5; Title 49, Chapter 6 and Title 49, Chapter 1.

Local Education Agencies - As introduced, authorizes department of education to provide appropriate assistance to the transition planning commission responsible for the transfer of administration of a special school district to a county school system.   - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 49, Chapter 3; Title 49, Chapter 5; Title 49, Chapter 6; Title 49, Chapter 1 and Title 49, Chapter 2.

Local Education Agencies - As introduced, permits creation of new city school systems and of joint city school systems in counties in which a school system has been consolidated with the county school system. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3; Title 49, Chapter 5; Title 49, Chapter 6 and Title 49, Chapter 1.

Criminal Procedure - As introduced, deletes provision prohibiting district attorney from applying to judge for a wiretap order in marijuana cases in which the amount is less than 700 pounds. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.
Taxes, Hotel Motel - As introduced, expands definition of municipality for occupancy tax purposes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 14.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Mental Health, Dept. of - As introduced, requires the department of mental health to report to legislative committees on a monthly rather than quarterly basis on the impact of the available suitable accommodations statutes. - Amends TCA Title 33.

TennCare - As enacted, requires that the general internist member of theTennCare pharmacy advisory committee who participates in TennCare be appointed from a list of all general internists provided by interested medical groups, including but not limited to the Tennessee Chapter of the American College of Physicians.  - Amends TCA Section 71-5-2401.

Education, Higher - As enacted, permits certain Tennessee veterans who are students at public institutions of higher education to register for classes prior to the general student population. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Criminal Procedure - As enacted, specifies that when a court orders a defendant charged with a misdemeanor to be evaluated for insanity or mental illness, the court must also order that any inpatient evaluation be completed within 30 days of admission to the facility. - Amends TCA Title 33, Chapter 7, Part 3.
Criminal Procedure - As introduced, establishes process of reciprocal disclosure of witnesses for criminal trials. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 17.

Evidence - As introduced, allows the results of a TBI-conducted drug or alcohol test to be introduced in evidence without the TBI employee being called as a witness if such notice is served on the defendant's attorney and the attorney has not objected within 10 days of receipt of notice. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

Courts, General Sessions - As enacted, clarifies that referees have the power of a trial court and the same authority as the judge directing the case to the referee in Shelby County environmental court. - Amends Chapter 772 of the Public Acts of 1982, as amended.
Taxes, Ad Valorem - As introduced, punishes by fine only, the Class C misdemeanor offense for failure to attend when summoned by the comptroller to provide books and records. - Amends TCA Title 67.

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As introduced, provides for a 5 percent instead of 10 percent reduction of penalty when deficient nursing home pays the penalty on or before the due date. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title  71.
Health Care - As enacted, revises provisions governing the long-term care system. - Amends TCA Title 71.
Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As introduced, deletes authorization for demonstration project involving nursing homes and disabled volunteers.  - Amends TCA Title 68.

Telecommunications - As introduced, requires the chair of the commerce, labor and agriculture committee of the senate and the chair of the commerce committee of the house to invite and compile comments from members of the telecommunications industry concerning the regulatory actions of the Tennessee Regulatory Authority. - Amends TCA Title 65.
Housing - As introduced, exempts certain residential real estate held by LLCs and limited partnerships as extended low-income housing commitments from property taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, exempts from taxation the sale or purchases of certain equipment and products by qualified golf course operators; prohibits outdoor advertising for public- owned golf courses under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 21 and Title 67, Chapter 6.
Recreational Areas - As enacted, includes rowing as an outdoor recreational opportunity for purposes of the Tennessee Adventure Tourism and Rural Development Act of 2011. - Amends TCA Title 11.

Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, removes certain restrictions that limit the ability of a person to obtain a wholesaler or retailer license in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Section 57-3-210 and Title 57, Chapter 3, Part 7.

Law Enforcement - As enacted, removes the requirements that a missing child report be transmitted to the Tennessee bureau of investigation and that the TBI distribute the report. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 38 and Title 39.

Alcoholic Beverages - As enacted, removes obsolete provisions; creates license for military personnel living abroad to ship wine to this state. - Amends TCA Section 57-1-111; Title  57, Chapter 3; Section 57-2-101; Section 57-4-101 and Section 57-4-203.
Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, allows cities and counties to limit number of retail liquor stores to no less than one per 6,000 residents. - Amends TCA Section 57-3-208.

Zoning - As introduced, expands nonconforming uses to those on contiguous land under common ownership and to land used, rather than in use, for the extraction of diminishing assets. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 7, Part 2.

Criminal Procedure - As enacted, provides that as part of a defendant's alternative sentencing for a violation of domestic assault, the sentencing judge may direct the defendant to complete a drug or alcohol treatment program or available counseling programs that address violence and control issues including, but not limited to, a batterer's intervention program that has been certified by the domestic violence state coordinating council. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

Child Custody and Support - As introduced, states that a parent may not be awarded custody or visitation when the parent has been convicted of a violent crime and classified as violent or dangerous due to a mental health disorder. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6 and Title 37.

Domestic Violence - As introduced, enhances the punishment for domestic assault committed in the presence of a child; authorizes law enforcement, in their discretion, to file a report of harm with the department of children's services for a child abuse investigation. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6 and Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1.

Traffic Safety - As introduced, requires the department of safety and homeland security to establish and maintain a hotline where unsafe driving practices of tractor trailer operators can be reported. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10.

Education - As enacted, establishes a four-year parental involvement pilot program in the school system with the most schools in the achievement school district (ASD); limited to schools operated by the ASD that serve grades K-3 or any combination thereof.  - Amends TCA Title 49.

Unemployment Compensation - As introduced, specifies that the employer, rather than the claimant, is responsible for overpayment of unemployment benefits when an award is overturned on appeal based on evidence that is submitted more than seven days after notice of the claim is sent to the employer. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.

Real Property - As introduced, requires municipalities to report owner and address of unfit, blighted and deteriorated properties to the secretary of state for publication on secretary's web site until such condition is cured. - Amends TCA Title 13.

Unemployment Compensation - As introduced, requires commissioner of labor and workforce development to appoint department attorney to indigent claimant in unemployment benefit appeal upon request when employer is represented by counsel at appeal; employer will be assessed $3,000 legal service fee if claimant prevails, otherwise cost comes from department's existing resources. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 23 and Title 50.
Traffic Safety - As introduced, prohibits animals in a driver's lap or between the driver and the driver's door while the motor vehicle is in motion. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8, Part 2.

Basic Education Program (BEP) - As enacted, specifies that LEAs may expend BEP funds earned for non-classroom components for the purpose of employing a building manager for a school. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.
Taxes, Sales - As introduced, extends limited sales tax refund for certain appliances, furniture, and building supplies purchased in response to May 2010 flood. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-396.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Tort Liability and Reform - As enacted, limits liability of apiarists under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 15.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, broadens offense of harassment to include certain electronic communication with or about another person or transmission or display of certain images; in certain circumstances, allows law enforcement to access log files, images or communications posted on social network services' Web sites. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 3.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, provides for more consideration of actual classroom experience for teachers in training; updates requirement of length of classroom observation and teaching for teachers in training from three quarters to two semesters.   - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 3; Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 1 and Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 56.
Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As introduced, improves retirement benefits of certain Tennessee public employees. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 36, Part 7.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, criminalizes photographing a person without consent and with the knowledge that the person is in a private place or has a reasonable expectation of privacy; enhances the fine associated with false imprisonment, assault, criminal trespass and trespass by motor vehicle when those crimes are committed with the purpose of obtaining a photograph in violation of the new crime. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 29; Title 39 and Title 40.
Highway Signs - As enacted, designates segment of State Route 14 beginning at the Tennessee-Mississippi border north on Third Street to Jackson Avenue in Memphis as the "Blues Trail." -
Highways, Roads and Bridges - As enacted, revises structure and operation of certain county highway departments. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 7.
Highway Signs - As enacted, designates U.S. 27 within City of Dayton as "Veterans Memorial Highway." -
Holidays and Days of Special Observance - As enacted, designates the third full week in May as "Rescue Squad Week." - Amends TCA Title 15, Chapter 2, Part 1.
Education - As enacted, defines cyber-bullying and requires schools to implement policies against cyber-bullying. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 10.
Highway Signs - As enacted, names segment of U.S. 27 in Rhea County in honor of the late Hiram Green. -

Alcoholic Beverage Commission - As enacted, allows commission to issue wholesale license to corporation that has acquired assets of a partnership or limited liability company operating in this state for 10 years if corporation has majority of its assets in Tennessee and officers actively present at licensed premises. - Amends TCA Section 57-3-203(g).

Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, permits a person possessing a nonresident seller's permit for wines and alcoholic beverages that are not registered under certain circumstances or not available from a manufacturer, winery or distiller to purchase alcoholic beverages from a Tennessee licensed wholesaler for resale outside the state. - Amends TCA Section 57-3-404 and Section 57-3-602.

Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, requires products sold as Tennessee wine or Tennessee sour mash whiskey to contain a certain percentage of products used in the manufacture of the wine or whiskey to be grown in Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 44 and Title 57.
