Environment and Conservation, Department of - As introduced, requires the department to regulate petroleum underground storage tanks only to the extent required by federal law. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 215.

Schools, Charter - As introduced, shifts authority to hear appeals from denials by local boards of education of charter school applications from the state board of education to the commissioner of education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.

Tennessee Higher Education Commission - As introduced, requires a public hearing on any rule or regulation proposed by THEC prior to the rule or regulation becoming effective and requires any affected institution be given notice of the hearing and an opportunity to present evidence to the commission. - Amends TCA Section 49-7-2005.

Special License Plates - As enacted, authorizes issuance of Boy Scouts of America new specialty earmarked license plates; allocates 50 percent of funds derived from sale thereof to five Tennessee Councils of Boy Scouts to fund and support scouting programs and activities. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Taxes - As enacted, clarifies that any person engaged in selling any quantity of unauthorized substances is liable for the tax; clarifies that the presumption that a person is a merchant does not apply when the person is actually engaged in selling any quantity of substances. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 28.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, requires a dental service plan corporation to show ability to pay the greater of operating expenses for six months or $10,000, instead of $2,500, in order to apply for license to operate a dental service plan. - Amends TCA Title 56.

Utilities, Utility Districts - As introduced, requires private corporations that collect sewer payments on behalf of municipalities to send consumers' water usage rates to the municipality if the corporation does not also collect payment for water usage. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 68, Chapter 221.
Driver Licenses - As introduced, requires LEAs to graduate 85 percent of high school seniors with an intermediate unrestricted driver license. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 55.

Motor Vehicles - As enacted, specifies that a garagekeeper or towing firm that does not verify ownership of a motor vehicle within three business days after taking possession of such motor vehicle pursuant to law or that does not notify by mail the owner of such motor vehicle within six days after taking possession would not be entitled to receive more than six days of storage-related expenses; provides for civil liability in certain circumstances for a garagekeeper or towing firm that fails to release a motor vehicle to a vehicle owner, secured creditor, lessor or lienholder. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 16, Part 1.

Ethics - As introduced, exempts an event to which the entire membership of a standing committee or committees is invited from the gift prohibition subject to the same cost and reporting restrictions imposed on events to which the entire membership of the general assembly is invited. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 6.
Mental Illness - As introduced, requires the state rather than the county to pay for mental health treatment of inmates charged with a misdemeanor in Greene County. - Amends TCA Title 33.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, expands definition of severe child abuse to include abuse resulting from a mother's ingestion of illegal drugs during pregnancy. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 37, Chapter 1 and Title 39, Chapter 15.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As enacted, revises conditions which if not satisfied would permit an insurer to disregard an insured's assignment of benefits. - Amends TCA Section 56-7-120.

Public Works Projects - As enacted, revises the provisions governing the threshold for public works that require a registered architect, registered engineer, or registered landscape architect. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 2.

Motor Vehicles - As enacted, prohibits the disclosure of traffic citations from red-light cameras to consumer reporting agencies; prohibits such information from being identified in credit reports. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-198.

Child Custody and Support - As introduced, requires an LEA to provide proof of a child's graduation from high school to certain persons within 15 business days, instead of the current 20, of the persons' written request for such proof. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6.

Courts, Juvenile - As introduced, clarifies that judges may, but are not required to, order a rehearing of any matter heard before a magistrate appointed by a juvenile court, and that such rehearings shall be de novo based upon the record of the hearing before the magistrate. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 1, Part 1.

Civil Procedure - As introduced, prohibits a court clerk from accepting the filing of another claim by a litigant who owes fees, taxes, costs and other expenses unless the litigant seeks injunctive relief to prevent irreparable injury or serious physical harm to the litigant. - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 18; Title 20 and Title 28.
subjects: Legal Issues|Civil Liberties and Civil Rights

title: Criminal Offenses - As introduced, criminalizes the assistance of unauthorized access to a service account and clarifies the criminal act of obtaining services without payment. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14.

Planning, Public - As introduced, revises authority or responsibility with respect to street construction and acceptance of public streets located within a subdivision in certain circumstances.  - Amends TCA Section 13-3-403 and Section 13-3-405.

Municipal Government - As introduced, allows municipal regional planning commission, in counties that have not adopted zoning, to exercise subdivision approval within the planning commission's region without the approval of the county legislative body. - Amends TCA Section 6-58-106(d).

Planning, Public - As introduced, redefines subdivision in municipal county and regional regulations by expanding the maximum size allowed for the subdivided parcels from less than five to less than 25 acres. - Amends TCA Section 13-3-401 and Section 13-4-301.

Zoning - As introduced, specifies evidence of abandonment of non-conforming use, directs the governmental entity with jurisdiction to establish beginning and ending dates for the prescriptive period, and creates a rebuttable presumption of abandonment upon a governmental finding of credible evidence establishing a non-conforming use for the prescribed period. - Amends TCA Section 13-7-208.

County Government - As introduced, permits the county mayor to retain veto power if serving as chair of the county legislative body; removes the authority of the county mayor to vote to break a tie when the county mayor is serving as chair; requires a two-thirds vote to override a veto instead of a majority vote. - Amends TCA Section 5-5-103; Section 5-5-109 and Section 5-6-107.

Banks and Financial Institutions - As introduced, authorizes members of boards of directors of credit unions to be compensated for services rendered, subject to review by the commissioner of financial institutions. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 4, Part 2.

Parks, Natural Areas Preservation - As introduced, adds retired members of the Tennessee national guard to those who are authorized to receive discounted rates offered by the commissioner of conservation and environment for activities at state parks; requires discounted rates to be posted in a facility if the facility is one to which the rates apply; requires rates to be offered regardless of whether the state operates the facility or the facility is leased to or managed by a private entity. - Amends TCA Section 11-3-121.
Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, revises teacher and principal evaluation system. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Jails, Local Lock-ups - As enacted, subject to the approval of the board of regents, authorizes the use of county prisoners' labor on farms operated by board of regents institutions. - Amends TCA Title 41 and Title 49.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Legal Issues

title: Special License Plates - As enacted, authorizes issuance of Almost Home Animal Rescue new specialty earmarked license plates; allocates 50 percent of funds derived from sale thereof to such organization to rescue and relocate animals scheduled for euthanasia.  - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
Taxes, Sales - As introduced, permits pharmacist, a pharmacy benefits manager or a covered entity to collect sales tax on diabetic supplies. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 67.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Railroads - As enacted, extends the requirements for stopping at a railroad crossing when a railroad train is approaching to apply to situations when either a railroad train or any other on-track equipment traveling on a railroad track is approaching; failure to stop for on-track equipment will be a Class C misdemeanor, which is the same criminal classification for failing to stop at a train crossing. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 4; Title 55, Chapter 8, Part 1 and Title 65.
Health Care - As enacted, revises various provisions governing adult care home providers in regard to traumatic brain injury. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, authorizes a franchise and excise tax credit of $1,000 for each unemployed person hired by a qualified small business; conditions the credit on the creation of at least five new qualified jobs; requires verification that unemployed persons have at least 20 weeks of unemployment benefits remaining as of the date of hire. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 21.

Annexation - As enacted, changes time when department of revenue is notified of an annexation from prior to the annexation becoming effective to upon the annexation becoming effective. - Amends TCA Section 6-51-115.
Education - As enacted, revises and enacts various provisions regarding virtual schools. - Amends TCA Title 49.
Traffic Safety - As introduced, prohibits in Bluff City issuance of traffic citations based solely on evidence from unmanned traffic enforcement cameras. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-198.

Election Laws - As enacted, allows city of Estill Springs to permit nonresident property owners to vote in municipal elections upon two-thirds approval of municipal legislative body. - Amends TCA Section 6-53-102.

Criminal Procedure - As enacted, authorizes the county legislative body to set the fee for participation in the litter removal program by first-time DUI offenders and permits the judge to find a person indigent for purposes of paying that fee. - Amends TCA Section 55-10-403.

Courts, Juvenile - As introduced, makes various changes to expunction of court files and records in juvenile court cases, allows unruly juveniles to petition for expunction of court files and records, and extends expunction to other scientific methods of establishing identity. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-155; Section 37-1-153 and Section 40-32-101.
Taxes - As introduced, reduces from 5.5 percent to 4.5 percent the sales tax rate on food.  - Amends TCA Title 67.

Children - As enacted, requires petitions in juvenile court cases to list the legal parents and any persons alleged to be the biological father of the child; requires a copy of the summons in such cases be sent to the legal parents and any persons alleged to be the biological father of the child. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-121 and Section 37-1-120.

Children - As enacted, states that training for guardians ad litem shall include early childhood, child and adolescent development provided by a qualified professional; requires permanency hearings for children in foster care to be held within 12 months of previous permanency hearing. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-149; Section 37-2-409 and Section 37-1-129.
Health Care - As introduced, authorizes nurse practitioners to issue universal do not resuscitate orders, which may only be issued by physicians under present law. - Amends TCA Title 68.
Criminal Offenses - As introduced, clarifies that indecent exposure can exist where certain behavior appears to be sexual conduct to an ordinary observer. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
Intellectual & Developmental Disabilities - As introduced, opens ICF/MR beds in private facilities to private pay and TennCare patients on a first-come, first-served basis. - Amends TCA Title 71.

Water Pollution - As enacted, authorizes municipal separate storm sewer systems that become qualified local programs pursuant to department approval to administer their own NPDES storm water construction permitting programs and the review thereof.  - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.

Water Pollution - As introduced, authorizes phase I and phase II designated municipal separate storm sewer systems to administer their own NPDES storm water construction permitting programs and the review thereof.  - Amends TCA Title 69.

Education - As introduced, clarifies who is a parent for purposes of being on school premises; defines "parent" as parent, foster parent, legal guardian or person having physicial custody of a child. - Amends TCA Title 49.
CoverTN - As enacted, abolishes Cover TN advisory committee. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 30.
Redistricting, Legislative - As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.

Sunset Laws - As enacted, creates sunrise provision for economic council on women with a termination date of June 30, 2013; revises certain provisions regarding appointments to council. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 50, Part 1.

State Employees - As introduced, specifies that whenever practicable an exit interview shall be conducted with dismissed state employees; authorizes governor to offer buyouts to state employees in lieu of reductions in force. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 30.
Civil Service - As introduced, authorizes removal for cause a member of the civil service commission who misses three consecutive meetings without an excuse. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 30, Part 1.
Civil Service - As introduced, requires rules promulgated by commissioner of human resources that affect state employees to comply with the UAPA. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 30, Part 2.

State Employees - As introduced, requires the commissioner of human resources to provide a report to the governor regarding any reduction in force of state employees implemented. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 30, Part 4.
State Employees - As introduced, removes requirement that age and sex be considered in qualifications for admissions for tests for promotion. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 30, Part 3.
Redistricting, Congressional - As introduced, updates reference to 2010 TIGER system. - Amends TCA Section 2-16-103.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Municipal and County Issues

title: Taxes, Real Property - As introduced, increases time in which petition challenging determination of capitalization rate, income estimates or land values must be filed with state board of equalization from 20 to 30 days prior to publication of notice of the availability of the proposed use value schedule in a newspaper of general circulation within the county. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 9, Part 3 and Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 10.
subjects: Housing and Property|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As introduced, authorizes a person who has at least 13 years creditable service in the TCRS and seven years creditable service in the optional retirement plan for employment at Tennessee Tech University during a specific period of time to have the option of transferring membership from the optional retirement program to the TCRS. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 35, Part 4.
Naming and Designating - As enacted, names field house at York Institute in honor of Charles Joseph Vaughn. -

Utilities, Utility Districts - As enacted, authorizes municipal electric system or other governmental utility system to enter into an employment contract for a term not to exceed five years with the superintendent, general manager or chief executive officer of the electric plant. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 52.
Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, exempts dividends from privately owned businesses from the Hall Income Tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.
Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, exempts sole proprietorships from the Hall income tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2, Part 1.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, revises certain criminal provisions to include certain disruptive and illegal conduct involving unions and employee organizations. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 12; Title 39, Chapter 14; Title 39, Chapter 16 and Title 39, Chapter 17.

Physicians and Surgeons - As introduced, exempts primary care physicians from restriction on right of an employed or contracted healthcare provider to practice upon termination or conclusion of the employment or contractual relationship. - Amends TCA Section 63-1-148.

Redistricting, Legislative - As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography; clarifies provisions concerning districts, terms and vacancies prior to November 2012 elections. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-102.

Libraries - As enacted, adds Cocke, Hawkins, Hamblen and Hancock counties to the Watauga regional library and changes region's name to the Holston River regional library. - Amends TCA Section 10-1-112.
Taxes, Hotel Motel - As enacted, authorizes the city of Newport to impose a tax on the privilege of occupancy. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 4 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 14.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, replaces obsolete language concerning tenure with current terminology. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Redistricting, Congressional - As introduced, requires compliance with state and federal constitutions as well as judicial decisions in passing congressional redistricting plan. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Municipal and County Issues

title: Immigration - As introduced, clarifies that a tax form, as such term is used in the part, means any form issued by the United States internal revenue service. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 12; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 50.
Conservation - As enacted, enacts the "Doe Mountain Recreation Authority Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 11 and Title  67.
Taxes, Sales - As introduced, exempts the retail sale of the service of bathing animals from the sales tax imposed on laundering or dry cleaning of tangible personal property. - Amends TCA Title 67.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Election Laws - As introduced, redefines an infamous crime for purposes of retaining the right of suffrage; authorizes incarcerated felons to vote except persons convicted of voter fraud, treason, first degree murder, or aggravated rape. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 20, Part 1 and Title 40, Chapter 29.

Tennessee Housing Development Agency - As introduced, clarifies that THDA annual report of its activities for the preceding year to the governor, comptroller of the treasury, and the general assembly is mandatory. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 23.

Education - As introduced, requires department of education to develop guidelines for LEA policies on concussions in sports and cheerleading activities; requires LEAs to develop policies and procedures regarding the identification and handling of concussions and head injuries that are consistent with the guidelines. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

State Employees - As enacted, provides that the disciplinary counsel for the court of the judiciary is a state employee for purposes of defense by the attorney general when a civil action is commenced for an act or omission performed during the course of duties for the court of judiciary. - Amends TCA Section 8-42-103.

Civil Procedure - As introduced, specifies the circumstances under which a pre-trial settlement offer may be made in a civil action; specifies the manner and circumstances under which costs or the monetary value of disputed property may be determined by a court in the event a settlement offer is made and rejected.  - Amends TCA Title 20.
subjects: Legal Issues|Civil Liberties and Civil Rights

title: Interest Rates - As introduced, changes the interest on judgments from 10 percent to a rate equal to the federal reserve weekly prime loan rate published by the commissioner of financial institutions for the calendar week preceding the judgment. - Amends TCA Title 47.

Highways, Roads and Bridges - As introduced, provides that the chief administrative officer of the highway department in Decatur County must have a high school diploma or equivalent and four years of experience in the use of construction equipment used for highway construction or maintenance. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 7, Part 1.

Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As introduced, includes years of service to a political subdivision participating in the consolidated retirement system for which credit was established in the calculation of years of service for premium payment in retiree group insurance plan. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, corrects the chemical compound, Benzoylindoles, found in illegal drugs such as hallucinogenic plants, from "Pravadoline (WIN 48, 09)" to "Pravadoline (WIN 48, 098)".  - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.
Taxes, Sales - As introduced, institutes Tennessee small business sales tax holiday program. - Amends TCA Title 67.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Special License Plates - As introduced, authorizes issuance of a TN Cave Salamander new specialty license plate; provides that the sale proceeds shall be deposited into the wildlife resources fund. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Public Utilities - As introduced, changes from February to March the month in which an annual report must be filed by the Tennessee Regulatory Authority concerning all matters relating to its office. - Amends TCA Title 65.

Highways, Roads and Bridges - As introduced, requires the chief administrative officer to file an inventory of all equipment and materials concerning road construction with the county governing body within 75 days after taking office instead of 60 days. - Amends TCA Title 54.
Transportation, Dept. of - As introduced, allows 40 days, instead of 30, to correct an unlawful sign. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 21.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, requires any contract, plan, or policy of insurance issued or renewed on or after July 1, 2012, that provides coverage for surgical first assisting benefits or services be construed as providing coverage for a registered nurse first assistant. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 63.

Bond Issues - As introduced, authorizes the state of Tennessee, acting by resolution of its funding board, to issue and sell its interest-bearing bonds and bond anticipation notes for certain purposes. -

Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As introduced, changes the eligibile creditable retirement date to 25 years of service instead of 30 years for dispatchers of emergency communications districts of political subdivisions that have set a mandatory retirement age for police officers and firefighters. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 86 and Title 8, Chapter 36, Part 2.
Police - As enacted, redefines "traffic or police officer" for purposes of traffic control or regulation. - Amends TCA Title 55 and Title 62.

Employees, Employers - As introduced, requires the department of human services to seek a waiver from the U.S. Department of Agriculture for cardholders' photos to be placed on EBT cards issued pursuant to the food stamp program and to submit implementation and cost information to the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5, Part 3.
State Symbols - As enacted, adds Echinacea Tennesseensis as a state wild flower, along with the passion flower. - Amends TCA Section 4-1-306.
Appropriations - As introduced, makes appropriations for the purpose of defraying the expenses of certain legislative enactments passed during the 2011 session of the 107th General Assembly. -

District Attorneys - As introduced, creates Class E felony of a district attorney general knowingly withholding or refusing to provide exculpatory information to a defendant and Class D felony if the defendant is convicted as the result of the violation and would have been acquitted if the evidence had not been withheld. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 16, Part 4.

Wildlife Resources Commission - As introduced, authorizes county legislative bodies to opt in to state law prohibiting the regulation of wild hog hunting on private property by the wildlife resources commission. - Amends TCA Title 70.

Controlled Substances - As introduced, changes the reporting deadlines for entries to the controlled substance database from at least monthly to at least every two weeks. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 10.

Education - As introduced, allows retired teachers' children who are under 24 years of age to receive a 25 percent discount at any state-operated institution of higher learning. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

Tennessee Wildlife Resources Agency - As introduced, opens all property managed by TWRA to recreational hunting and fishing by deleting authority of TWRA to restrict such areas for reasons of public safety, homeland security or as otherwise limited by law. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 4 and Title 70, Chapter 5.

Law Enforcement - As introduced, limits the law enforcement authority of wildlife officers to the extent such officers are acting within their scope of authority for enforcing a violation of subject matter over which such officers have jurisdiction under boating regulations and enforcement of wildlife laws. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 69 and Title 70.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, increases computer exemption during recurring August sales tax holiday from $1,500 to $1,650; deletes obsolete language for spring sales tax holiday. - Amends TCA Title 67.

Agriculture, Dept. of - As introduced, directs the commissioner to implement a program of state inspection for intrastate consumption of meat, poultry or meat and poultry products and, to the greatest extent possible, to utilize the services of licensed veterinarians under contract with the department to perform the inspections. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 7.

Education, Higher - As introduced, requires products sold at concessions on the premises of state postsecondary institutions be Tennessee products if the product being sold is made in Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7; Title 49, Chapter 8 and Title 49, Chapter 9.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, exempts staple food from state sales tax; defines staple food to include fruits and vegetables, grains, dried beans, flour, meats, poultry, fish, and certain nutritious beverages; holds local governments harmless from the loss of state-shared tax revenues. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 1; Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

Game and Fish Laws - As introduced, prohibits the seizure by TWRA of any hunting equipment or guns when such seizure does not arise from the actual illegal taking of wildlife.   - Amends TCA Section 70-6-201.
subjects: Agriculture and Food|Animal Rights and Wildlife Issues

title: Livestock - As introduced, authorizes breeding facilities to possess certain native species for purposes determined by and in accordance with rules promulgated by the department of agriculture.  - Amends TCA Title 43; Title 44 and Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 4.

Boards and Commissions - As introduced, creates a Tennessee exotic wildlife board within the department of agriculture; gives responsibilities to the board for wildlife held in captivity for commercial purposes and gives responsibilities to the wildlife resource commission for wildlife held in captivity for personal, non-commercial purposes. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 44 and Title 70.

Game and Fish Laws - As introduced, eliminates Tennessee residency and reciprocity requirements for persons employed as commercial helpers in the commercial fishing industry, limits the amount of time a commercial fishing license may be revoked or suspended, and limits commercial helper's license fees. - Amends TCA Section 70-2-101 and Section 70-2-205.
subjects: Agriculture and Food|Animal Rights and Wildlife Issues

title: Tennessee Wildlife Resources Agency - As introduced, requires the executive director of the TWRA to file a report with the general assembly on February 15 of each year that details annual property damage caused by wildlife and nuisance animals. - Amends TCA Title 70.
Game and Fish Laws - As introduced, limits the amount of time a commercial fishing license may be revoked or suspended. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 2.
subjects: Agriculture and Food|Animal Rights and Wildlife Issues

title: Game and Fish Laws - As introduced, authorizes a state or local governmental entity to submit a bill to TWRA for removal of the carcass of dead wildlife from the roadway and requires TWRA to reimburse such entity for the cost of removal, burial and destruction. - Amends TCA Section 70-4-115.
subjects: Agriculture and Food|Animal Rights and Wildlife Issues

title: Finance and Administration, Dept. of - As introduced, requires annual report on state agency lease payments to be posted on department Web site and filed with office of legislative budget analysis. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4 and Title 9.

Tennessee Wildlife Resources Agency - As introduced, requires TWRA to perform a test for chronic wasting disease on deer and elk harvested or found dead on Agency wildlife management areas to be funded from proceeds of joint partnerships entered into for marketing opportunities. - Amends TCA Section 70-1-302.

Criminal Procedure - As introduced, allows person who is convicted of a nonviolent felony to petition the court for expungement of the public records of such felony after 20 years if the person has not committed any other felonies during the 20-year period and has completed all requirements for the offense, including restitution . - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 32.
Emergency Communications Districts - As enacted, authorizes the diversion of harassing non-initialized 911 phone calls to a designated entity. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 86, Part 3.

Motor Vehicles - As introduced, clarifies that requirement that garagekeeper must notify owner of a rental car within three days of taking possession also applies when garagekeeper possesses a vehicle that was taken into custody by police as unclaimed or abandoned. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Section 66-19-103.

Motor Vehicles - As introduced, requires entity actually towing vehicle to report vehicle registration information to local law enforcement when vehicle is towed pursuant to Uniform Landlord Tenant Act. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 28, Part 5.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, implements various procedures concerning controlled substance analogues in the same manner in which those procedures are carried out concerning controlled substances. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7; Title 8; Title 10; Title 29; Title 36; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 49; Title 50; Title 53; Title 55; Title 57; Title 62; Title 63; Title 65; Title 67 and Title 68.

Boards and Commissions - As introduced, clarifies it is the sole responsibility of a municipality to appoint board members to a convention center where a city and a county had jointly participated in the construction of a convention center and the municipality purchased from the county all the county rights in such convention center. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6 and Title 7.

Child Custody and Support - As enacted, requires the department of human services and juvenile court or district attorney general to undertake public awareness campaign in counties implementing responsible teen parent pilot project that includes the means the department may use to collect child support. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 37 and Title 39.

Probation and Parole - As introduced, increases, from two to three months, the length of time that a probationer or parolee can remain in arrears or delinquent in paying supervision and rehabilitation contributions before the arrearage or delinquency constitutes sufficient grounds to revoke probation, parole, or release. - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 40; Title 50 and Title 55.
Regional Authorities and Special Districts - As introduced, limits additional proximate but noncontiguous property included within megasite to 750 acres. - Amends TCA Title 64, Chapter 6.
Judgments - As introduced, specifies that prejudgment interest begins to accrue on the date that process is effectuated unless an applicable contract specifies otherwise. - Amends TCA Title 47.
Taxes - As introduced, defines "mineral interest" for purposes of a back assessment or reassessment of property taxes against a mineral interest owner. - Amends TCA Title 67.

Education - As introduced, requires the accounting manuals provided by the boards of education covering the various phases of student body activity funds and other internal school funds to be published on the Internet for viewing by students, parents, and faculty.  - Amends TCA Title 49.
Education - As introduced, deletes reference to the select oversight committee on education. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Education - As introduced, requires the Tennessee foreign language institute's annual report to include information on any monies received from private donors or government sources and schools with which the institute has collaborated or contracted. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Clerks, Court - As introduced, authorizes court clerks to petition for destruction of records in certain criminal cases that have been finally disposed of for at least 10 years. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 32, Part 1.

Motor Vehicles - As introduced, requires the commissioner of revenue to notify any organization sponsoring a specialty license plate when such plate has failed to meet the minimum issuance requirements. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
Banks and Financial Institutions - As introduced, increases from $500 to $1,000 the license fee for any person engaging in the business of deferred presentment services in this state. -

Banks and Financial Institutions - As introduced, increases from $1,000 to $2,000 the amount of civil penalty that the commissioner of financial institutions may assess for each transaction in violation, or each day that a violation occurs, of the Deferred Presentment Services Act. - Amends amend TCA.

Banks and Financial Institutions - As introduced, requires persons licensed under the Deferred Presentment Services Act to file annual reports of certain information with the commissioner of financial institutions by October 1 of each year instead of September 1. -

Appropriations - As introduced, assigns the state employee staff responsible for the administration of the group insurance for state officials and employees to the department of finance and administration; requires that grant payments under the grant assistance program for nursing home care be made monthly or quarterly instead of monthly; deletes obsolete language for spring sales tax holiday. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 11; Title 12; Title 13; Title 16; Title 33; Title 36; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 42; Title 43; Title 44; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 50; Title 54; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 58; Title 59; Title 60; Title 61; Title 62; Title 63; Title 65; Title 66; Title 67; Title 68; Title 70 and Title 71.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, authorizes governmental entities to include language stating maximum penalty for offense of theft in signs warning public that theft of material from stone walls is theft. - Amends TCA Title 39.

State Employees - As enacted, allows state employee upon retirement to keep such employee's photo identification card issued by the state; requires sticker or other designation to be placed on the card; specifies such card may be used as valid photo id for voting purposes. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-112 and Title 8.

Mining and Quarrying - As introduced, enacts the "Responsible Coal Operators Act of 2012" to authorize the commissioner of environment and conservation to consider past practices when deciding whether to issue, renew or deny a permit issued under the Water Quality Control Act for a coal mine. - Amends TCA Title 59 and Title 69.
Naming and Designating - As introduced, designates "John Charles Tidwell Visitor Center" at Johnsonville State Historic Park. -

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, adds University of Tennessee System and board of regents as recipients of THEC's annual report on scholarship and grant programs data. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 31; Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 8, Chapter 4; Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 49.

Capitol - As enacted, authorizes secretary of state to produce a virtual tour of the state capitol, capitol annexes and grounds and to publish the virtual tour on the web sites of the general assembly and secretary of state; authorizes secretary of state to distribute the virtual tour on electronic media, through the state library and archives, to public and private K-12 schools. - Amends TCA Section 4-8-101.

Fees - As introduced, authorizes a certain municipality to assess and collect a historic landmark preservation fee for certain purposes; authorizes such municipality to create a board of directors to ensure that the historic landmark is preserved, maintained and improved. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 13; Title 57 and Title 67.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, exempts the sale of gold, silver and platinum coins and bullion that are used as mediums of exchange from sales tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

Gas, Petroleum Products, Volatile Oils - As introduced, directs the state oil and gas board to adopt regulations and governing standards for groundwater protection, including documentation of produced and waste fluids, by November 1, 2012.  - Amends TCA Title 60, Chapter 1 and Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.

Gas, Petroleum Products, Volatile Oils - As introduced, defines "fracking" and "trade secret" relative to well drilling; creates a notice requirement and prior approval from the state oil and gas board before any chemicals are injected into the wells; establishes a disclosure process if any injection is confidential or involves trade secrets.  - Amends TCA Title 60, Chapter 1 and Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.

Gas, Petroleum Products, Volatile Oils - As introduced, establishes regulations governing groundwater protection standards that are no less stringent than those adopted by the American Petroleum Institute in Guidance Document HF1, First Edition, Hydraulic Fracturing Operations - Well Construction and Integrity Guidelines, October 2009 or any later revision.  - Amends TCA Title 60, Chapter 1 and Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.

Child Custody and Support - As introduced, permits the court to terminate one parent's rights to a child but not the other where certain clear and convincing evidence is established. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 37 and Title 39.

Motor Vehicles - As enacted, requires entity actually towing vehicle to report vehicle registration information to local law enforcement when vehicle is towed pursuant to Uniform Landlord Tenant Act. - Amends TCA Section 66-28-519.
Fairs - As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee State Fair and Exposition Act." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 12; Title 43 and Title 67.
Campaigns and Campaign Finance - As introduced, enacts the "Voter-Owned Elections Act." - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.
Wildlife Resources Commission - As introduced, revises membership of Tennessee wildlife resources commission. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 70.

Consumer Protection - As introduced, authorizes the commissioner of financial institutions to enforce title 47 (laws governing commercial instruments and transactions) against any entity regulated by the commissioner. - Amends TCA Title 45 and Title 47.

Utilities, Utility Districts - As introduced, specifies that any customer installing water service is entitled to procure the equipment and supplies to be used for installation purposes. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 82 and Title 65.

Health Care - As introduced, states that after the initial utilization review, additional information or follow-up utilization review for outpatient mental health or chemical dependency patients shall be limited to no more than 10 percent of reviews performed by the utilization review agent for the previous year. - Amends TCA Section 56-6-705.

Traffic Safety - As introduced, prohibits using cell phone while driving in an activated school zone; violation is Class C misdemeanor punishable by $50.00 fine only. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

Psychologists - As introduced, requires licensed psychologists, psychological examiners, senior psychological examiners and certified psychological assistants, as a condition of renewal of their respective licenses, to complete three of continuing education requirements established by the board, which shall be obtained in a face-to-face, board defined Type 1 continuing education activity that pertains to ethics and Tennessee jurisprudence rational to the practice of psychology. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 11.

Workers Compensation - As introduced, authorizes psychologists licensed in this state to provide impairment ratings for mental injuries in workers' compensation cases. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.
Education, Higher - As introduced, prohibits state institutions of higher education from charging a fee to any higher education employee for parking. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.
Municipal Government - As introduced, prohibits employee organization from using municipal name for fundraising efforts. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 54, Part 1.

Education - As enacted, requires local boards of education to adopt policies concerning a teacher's ability to relocate a student for the safety of the student and the safety of others. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Flags - As introduced, requires that on state-wide days of mourning for members of the military whose deaths are combat-related, the honor and remember flag be flown in addition to the state flag at half-staff over the capitol. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 9; Title 12 and Title 13.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, increases the maximum fine to $30,000 for initiating the manufacture of methamphetamine within 200 feet of a child. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 53; Title 63; Title 67 and Title 68.

General Assembly - As introduced, changes the date of the first meeting of the joint legislative services committee at the call of the co-chairs to within 30 days, instead of 15 days, after the appointment of the members of the committee.  - Amends TCA Title 3 and Title 8, Chapter 44.

Motor Vehicles - As introduced, revises information that must be filed when motor vehicles are sold to a motor vehicle dismantler and recycler; requires the department of safety to provide a means for statements to be filed electronically; makes falsification of required statements, with intent to defraud, the offense of forgery. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 3, Part 2.
Environment and Conservation, Department of - As introduced, expands department reporting requirements on the hazardous waste regulatory program. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 212.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, changes the definition of "home school student" for purposes of the Tennessee HOPE scholarship to require that a student be home schooled the last year of high school instead of the last two years of high school. - Amends TCA Section 49-4-902.

Employees, Employers - As introduced, expands categories of employees subject to routine periodic drug testing under the drug free workplace program to include persons who work in safety or security related positions. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 9.

Welfare - As introduced, requires recipients of federal assistance and benefits administered by state, county or municipal agencies to present photo identification in order to receive or access benefits. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 71.

Children - As introduced, requires certain contractors of department of children's services to petition a court for an inpatient psychiatric evaluation of a child in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 37 and Title 49.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, revises the punishment for the offenses of public indecency and indecent exposure and revises the definition of "public place" with regard to the offense of public indecency. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

Zoning - As introduced, establishes reclamation regulation under mineral surface mining law and not local zoning regulations as law governing specified reclamation activities. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 7 and Title 59, Chapter 8, Part 2.

Pharmacy, Pharmacists - As introduced, defines limited service pharmacy permit as a permit issued by the board to an applicant that wants to provide peritoneal dialysis products for home patients in a setting for services not limited to scope and kind, but to time and conitions under which services are rendered. - Amends TCA Section 63-10-204.

Real Property - As introduced, increases the offense from a Class C misdemeanor to a Class B, punishable by fine only, for any assessor or deputy assessor to willfully or knowingly permit or allow any property subject to taxation to be or remain unassessed or omitted from assessment, or to willfully or knowingly assess any property at less than the percentage of value required by law. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 16; Title 17; Title 66; Title 67 and Title 68.

Economic and Community Development - As introduced, requires commissioners of economic and community development and revenue to study effects of tax incentives on industrial and tourism development and issue a report to the governor and legislature by January 15, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 53 and Title 7, Chapter 88.

Education - As enacted, specifies that LEAs and school administrators may not prohibit personnel from participating in constitutionally permissible religious activities on school grounds that are initiated by students at reasonable times before or after the instructional day so long as such activities are voluntary for all parties and do not conflict with the responsibilities or assignments of such personnel. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, allows insurance providers in this state to develop plans that provide major medical insurance coverage for an illness requiring hospital care, without having to include certain mandated coverage as long as such mandated coverage is not essential to the provision of basic health care for the illness requiring hospital care. - Amends TCA Title 56.

Education - As enacted, requires the department of education to establish within the school system with the most schools operated by the achievement school district (ASD) a four-year pilot program of assessment of kindergarten students.  - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

Education - As introduced, requires full funding of pre-K for students who are in school zones feeding into schools in the achievement school district that the district directly runs. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

Public Funds and Financing - As enacted, authorizes county legislative body to allow trustees to invest funds in state intermediate-term investment fund; specifies that any entity that is eligible to participate in the pooled investment fund may participate in the state intermediate-term investment fund. - Amends TCA Section 9-4-608.
Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, exempts income derived from stocks and bonds of certain Subchapter S corporations from the Hall income tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As enacted, prohibits title insurance companies and title insurance rating organizations from filing as part of their schedule of rates for title insurance, that part of the charge for title insurance applicable to search and examination in connection with insurance of title to real property located in counties with a population of less than 175,000 instead of those with less than 275,000. - Amends TCA Section 56-35-129.

Gas, Petroleum Products, Volatile Oils - As introduced, requires a dealer that engages in the liquefied petroleum gas business to submit evidence that the storage of flammable, combustible or explosive material shall not present serious health, safety and fire risks to structures within 1,000 feet of any storage facility owned by the dealer. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 135, Part 1.

Health Care - As introduced, requires the commissioner of health to report to certain legislative committees concerning implementation of certain aspects of federal health care reform legislation. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 33; Title 53; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.
Special License Plates - As enacted, authorizes issuance of Teamsters new specialty earmarked license plates. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Campaigns and Campaign Finance - As introduced, removes prohibition on insurance companies making campaign contributions; removes PAC aggregate limitation on candidates; deletes report requirement on certain large contributions made within 10 days of election. - Amends TCA Title  2, Chapter 10 and Title 56, Chapter 3.

Judges and Chancellors - As enacted, allows members of the judicial nominating commission to serve successive terms; allows solicitor general and employees of the attorney general to serve on the commission; allows members to participate in meetings by telephone if three or fewer applicants; allows members continuance in court hearings if commission meeting scheduled. - Amends TCA Title 17, Chapter 4, Part 1.

Sexual Offenders - As enacted, authorizes judge, after consideration of facts and circumstances surrounding the case, to require a person convicted of statutory rape for the first time to register as a sexual offender on the sexual offender and violent sexual offender registry. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 5 and Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, requires attorney general to report annually to judiciary committee of each chamber of the general assembly the number of persons prosecuted and convicted of unlawful drawing of real estate transfer documents. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 66.

Election Laws - As enacted, revises various provisions related to elections. - Amends TCA Section 2-13-203(d); Section 2-14-106(a); Section 2-14-202(b); Section 2-2-111(b); Section 2-2-114(b); Section 2-2-129(a)(1); Section 2-3-101(a); Section 2-3-103; Section 2-4-108(b); Section 2-5-151(c); Section 2-6-102(a)(1); Section 2-6-103(a)(1); Section 2-8-104; Section 2-9-109(b) and Section 67-6-707(2).
Public Contracts - As introduced, enacts the "Equal Access to Local Government Contracts and Services Act." - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21, Part 1; Title 5; Title 6 and Title 7.

Election Laws - As introduced, raises the dollar amount paid to election officials who attend the instructional meeting and serve at an election from $10.00 to $25.00 dollars; allows payment to those who attend meeting but don't serve in the election; raises the minimum dollar amount paid to election officials, judges, machine operators, and inspectors from $50.00 to $90.00 dollars on election day. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 4 and Title 2, Chapter 5.

Election Laws - As introduced, requires the publishing of a sample ballot in a newspaper of general circulation at least five days before early voting only, instead of prior to early voting and prior to an election by the county election commission.   - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 5.

Solid Waste Disposal - As introduced, requires that aluminum dross be disposed of in Benton County only in Class I landfills, prohibits increasing classification of existing landfills located within municipal boundaries in Benton County to Class I, requires local approval of increases in classification in counties and municipalities. - Amends TCA Title 68.

Welfare - As introduced, requires any voucher issued under the Special Supplemental Food Program for Women, Infants, and Children to be redeemable only when purchasing items of lesser cost if multiple items with comparable nutritional value are available. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5, Part 3.
Tort Liability and Reform - As enacted, limits liability of whitewater rafting companies in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 70.

Short Term Loans and Lenders - As introduced, requires pawnbrokers to file their daily transaction reports with the appropriate law enforcement agencies within the same timeframe as is currently required for the daily transaction reports of scrap jewelry and metal dealers.  - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 1, Part 2 and Title 45, Chapter 6, Part 2.

Traffic Safety - As introduced, requires that 95 percent of revenue from traffic violations resulting from traffic surveillance cameras be earmarked solely for educational needs of local governing entity. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-198.
Public Contracts - As introduced, enacts the "Equal Access to Local Government Contracts and Services Act." - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21, Part 1; Title 5; Title 6 and Title 7.
Food and Food Products - As enacted, clarifies and revises law concerning sales of nonpotentially hazardous foods prepared in home-based kitchens. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 8, Part 1.

Taxes, Sales - As introduced, revises definition of a border retail tourism development district to include a district located in a municipality that borders two states and is less than two miles from an intersection of two interstates. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 40, Part 1.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Nuisances - As introduced, enacts the "Chronic Nuisance Property Act." - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 51.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, requires department of education to recommend a teacher evaluation modification to the state board of education enabling local education agencies to set the frequency and extent of teacher evaluations to be completed for high performing teachers; requires implementation of teacher evaluation modification prior to 2013-2014 academic year; requires commissioner to report on modification recommended to education committees. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 5.

Environment and Conservation, Department of - As introduced, requires department to conduct a study of mercury levels present in state rivers and streams. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 5; Title 68 and Title 69.
Public Contracts - As introduced, enacts the "Equal Access to Local Government Contracts and Services Act." - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 51.

Insurance, Health, Accident - As introduced, allows, until such time as the federal government reimburses Tennessee for monies erroneously received in connection with individuals erroneously enrolled in the Medicaid program, the commissioner of commerce and insurance to project income for any applicant on a state-based insurance exchange that would make such person ineligible for Medicaid; Tennessee will not be obligated to reimburse the federal government for erroneous payments if the applicant is subsequently determined eligible for Medicaid. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 18; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

Manchester - As introduced, subject to local approval, revises charter to have elections for the county legislative body and school board coincide with general August election and to declare a vacancy in the office of alderman when the person qualifies as a candidate for election to the office of mayor. - Amends Chapter 74 of the Private Acts of 2005.

Firearms and Ammunition - As introduced, permits a county or municipal correctional officer to carry a firearm if the officer has completed POST firearms training and is authorized to carry by the sheriff. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 38 and Title 39, Chapter 17.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As enacted, creates a credit against the excise tax for a qualifying environmental project, which is a project in which the taxpayer makes an investment in excess of $100 million to eliminate mercury from the manufacturing process and operations of one or more existing chlor-alkali manufacturing and ancillary facilities and equipment in the state. - Amends TCA Title 67.

General Assembly - As introduced, permits a member to request and be paid an advance on the monthly expense allowance up to 90 days in advance of the date the allowance is due and payable in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-106.
Children - As introduced, requires LEAs to notify parents and guardians of disabled children of services available to such children. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Fees - As enacted, creates the local correctional officer training fund through the collection of a 10-cent fee for each completed telephone call or other electronic communication made by inmates housed in local jails or workhouses. - Amends TCA Section 41-7-104.
Mental Illness - As introduced, requires the state rather than a county to pay for mental health treatment of inmates charged with a misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 33.

Taxes, Ad Valorem - As introduced, allows damage award for interested parties who were not provided mandatory notice of a delinquent tax sale; specifies that sale is not required to be invalidated for lack of notice if the party is awarded damages; applicable only in Shelby County. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-2502.
Highway Signs - As introduced, names bridge on Greenvale Road in Wilson County in honor of the late Darrell Eugene "Crow" Sloan. -
Appeal and Review - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Land Use Review Act." - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 13; Title 27; Title 29 and Title 68.
Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, deletes obsolete references within state lottery proceeds statute. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

Election Laws - As introduced, removes requirement that voter needs photograph identification prior to voting; restores former requirement that voter present identification for purpose of comparing signature on the application for ballot. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7, Part 1.
Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, revises outdated provision concerning eligiblity for teacher preparation programs and teaching.  - Amends TCA Title 49.

Trusts - As enacted, includes "persons" in definition of "family member" for purposes of determining which family members a private trust can do business with while maintaining exemptions from the Banking Act; redefines "family member"; revises other provisions. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 2, Part 20.

Tennessee Arts Commission - As introduced, requires commission to publish synopsis of report concerning level of participation in the grant program for traditionally  underserved and underrepresented artists and art organizations. - Amends TCA Title 4.

Wills - As enacted, requires bonds of executors and administrators to include obligation to pay expenses for court costs, attorney's fees and other related expenses of administering the estate incurred due to failure to properly account for or utilize funds coming into hands of the estate. - Amends TCA Title 30, Chapter 1, Part 2.
Education - As introduced, increases minimum length of kindergarten day to not less than five hours from not less than four hours. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

Health Care - As introduced, extends the amount of time from 90 to 120 days that owners of newly acquired medical equipment have to register the equipment with the health services and development agency. - Amends TCA Title 68.
Children and Youth, Commission on - As introduced, deletes obsolete statutory provisions pertaining to the commission. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 3.

Mental Health, Dept. of - As introduced, extends the time the department of intellectual and developmental disabilities has to respond to the comments from the public meeting from 35 to 45 days.  - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 16; Title 33; Title 56 and Title 68.

Senior Citizens - As introduced, specifies that if a member of the commission on aging and disability misses three consecutive meetings without a good excuse such member will be replaced. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 71, Chapter 2.

Food and Food Products - As introduced, mandates that all employees of food service establishments or retail food stores shall wear disposable sanitary gloves while preparing food. - Amends TCA Title 53.

Taxes, Ad Valorem - As introduced, establishes procedure by which taxpayers obtaining appraisals of their property dated after the assessment date of the current tax year may have the appraised value of their property adjusted for the next tax year by the assessor immediately upon presentation of the appraisal, if the assessor finds the appraisal to be sufficient evidence of value.   - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.
Tennessee Higher Education Commission - As introduced, requires the THEC to publish its annual report prior to January 15 of each year, instead of February 15. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Economic and Community Development, Dept. of - As introduced, requires the department to publish the energy division's annual report on the department web site. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7.

Correction, Dept. of - As introduced, clarifies meaning of "arts and crafts" within items to be produced and sold by inmates to include woodworking projects, crafts produced by metalwork, pottery, carvings, sketches, paintings, ornaments, knick-knacks, drawings, sundries, and sculpture. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 6 and Title 41.

Education, Higher - As introduced, prohibits certain persons from attending public higher education institutions in this state; requires public higher education institutions in this state to develop a process to determine the lawful presence of each student applicant. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 50, Part 1 and Title 49.

Lottery,  Corporation - As introduced, prohibits an employee of a Tennessee education lottery corporation who leaves the employment of the corporation from representing any vendor or lottery retailer before the corporation for a period of three years, instead of the current two, following termination of employment with the corporation. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51 and Title 49.

Labor and Workforce Development, Dept. of - As introduced, allows the department no more than 90, instead of 60, days to conduct a show cause hearing for the employer to demonstrate the employer's failure to secure payment of compensation.  - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 14 and Title 50, Chapter 6, Part 4.

Financial Institutions, Dept. of - As introduced, decreases the amount of time for the commissioner to report to the governor after the end of a calendar year from 60 to 45 days. - Amends TCA Title 45.
General Assembly, Studies - As introduced, creates special joint committee to study casino gambling in Shelby County. -

Motor Vehicles - As introduced, increases from 10 to 14 years the age of abandoned, immobile or unattended motor vehicles that may be disposed of by demolishers without a title. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 16, Part 1.

Motor Vehicles - As introduced, authorizes owners, lienholders and insurers of motor vehicles that have been towed to inspect such vehicles prior to paying any towing and storage fees. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 16.

Health, Dept. of - As introduced, requires the department to report to the health and welfare committee of the senate and health and human resources committee of the house by no later than July 15 of each year on the risks of community-associated MRSA infections.  - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 63 and Title 68.

Human Services, Dept. of - As introduced, requires department to post web site information about assistance to private employers on the implementation of day care services as an employee benefit. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 12.

Human Resources, Department of - As introduced, adds government operations committees to list of entities to which the department of human resources must submit monthly report of bona fide employee promotions. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 8.
subjects: Labor and Employment|Municipal and County Issues

title: General Services, Dept. of - As introduced, requires the department to report to the governor and general assembly on the savings derived from the sale of supplies, materials and equipment deemed to be surplus, obsolete or unused. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 11.

Human Rights Commission - As introduced, extends the amount of time from 30 to 60 days that a complainant may file an application for reconsideration of an order finding no reasonable cause for a discriminatory practice. - Amends TCA Title 4.

Safety, Dept. of - As introduced, requires commissioner to periodically update listing of employees authorized to exercise functions of notary public. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 49, Chapter 1 and Title 55.

Business and Commerce - As introduced, requires a board, commission, agency, or other governmental entity created pursuant to the provisions governing professions, businesses, trades, including professions of the healing arts, to provide electronic notice 45 days in advance of meetings to licensees who have provided an email address. - Amends TCA Title 62 and Title 63.

Judicial Officers - As introduced, creates office of solicitor general appointed by the general assembly to defend and prosecute cases in the interest of the state; revises duties of attorney general and reporter. - Amends TCA Title 8.

Finance and Administration, Dept. of - As enacted, authorizes commissioner of finance and administration to enter into agreements with certain citizen support organizations to donate monetary gifts, goods or services to be used by Volunteer Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3.

Workers Compensation - As enacted, specifies that if a treating physician determines that pain is persisting for an injured or disabled employee beyond an expected period for healing, then the treating physician, if the physician is a "qualified physician", may either prescribe or refer such employee for pain management, encompassing pharmacological, non-pharmacological and other approaches to manage chronic pain. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 50, Chapter 6 and Title 56.

Law Enforcement - As introduced, requires the police officer standards and training commission to establish uniform standards concerning the amount of disclosure of information obtained from the previous employers of a law enforcement applicant. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8 and Title 38.

Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, authorizes retailers and licensees selling liquor by the drink to offer discounts in such manner as the retailers and licensees deem appropriate as long as all taxes that are due and payable are paid on the full price of the product prior to the discount being offered and as long as the sale of the alcoholic beverage is not below the cost paid by the retailer or licensee to purchase the alcoholic beverages.  - Amends TCA Title 57.

Public Contracts - As introduced, allows the state or any political subdivision thereof to choose certain preferred resident vendors' bids over the bids of the lowest responsible bidders as long as the preferred vendors' bids are no more than 5 percent greater. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3 and Title 12, Chapter 4.

Domestic Violence - As introduced, requires person who must dispossess all firearms possessed because of an order of protection in effect or domestic assault conviction to also dispossess of any ammunition for such firearms. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6; Title 39, Chapter 13 and Title 39, Chapter 17.

Game and Fish Laws - As introduced, authorizes TWRA to issue sport fishing and hunting licenses for $10.00 to Tennessee residents who are 100 percent disabled and receive social security disability. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 2, Part 1.
subjects: Agriculture and Food|Animal Rights and Wildlife Issues

title: Litter Control - As introduced, subject to local approval, limits the hauling of litter and other materials to commercial or for-hire vehicles specially designed and manufactured for such purpose. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 5 and Title 55, Chapter 7, Part 1.

Criminal Procedure - As enacted, revises law regarding the recoupment of allegedly stolen property in the possession of a used or scrap jewelry and precious metals buyer or dealer. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 3, Part 1 and Title 38, Chapter 1, Part 2.

Gas, Petroleum Products, Volatile Oils - As introduced, transfers oil and gas board from division of water pollution control to division of geology; modifies site preparation requirements for exploratory drilling and continuing educational requirements for drill and site supervisors. - Amends TCA Title 11, Chapter 1; Title 11, Chapter 5; Title 60; Title 68 and Title 69.

Alcoholic Beverages - As enacted, authorizes the Inn at Long Branch on Dale Hollow Lake in Clay County to obtain a license as a premier type tourist resort; authorizes the sale of alcoholic beverages from on-premises consumption at the Oliver Hotel in Knox County; changes the meal criteria for the Buffalo River Resort so that such establishment will be required to have food available rather than being required to serve meals at least four days on a weekly basis in order to qualify as a premier type tourist resort. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

Schools, Home - As introduced, allows home school students to participate in interscholastic athletics at the school the student would be authorized to attend if the student registers as a home school student and meets academic and conduct requirements as required for other students. - Amends TCA Section 49-50-801 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

Firearms and Ammunition - As introduced, permits retired correctional officers and inmate relations coordinators to carry firearms if certified. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 8 and Title 39, Chapter 17.

Salaries and Benefits - As introduced, limits ability of local governments to place employment practices, standards or other requirements that impose or mandate certain employee benefits on businesses that deviate from, modify, supplement, add to, change or vary in any manner from state statutorily imposed or recognized requirements. - Amends TCA Section 4-21-102 and Section 7-51-1802.

Election Laws - As introduced, exempts any person presenting evidence of honorable discharge from the military at the time of application for ballot from the requirements of showing an identification with a photograph of the voter when signing an application for ballot to vote. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-112.

Taxes - As introduced, allows an industrial machinery tax credit against franchise and excise taxes for certain forms of business entities that establish a qualified headquarters facility. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.

Municipal Government - As introduced, authorizes certain cities incorporated under the general law city manager charter to charge fire fees for the construction and maintenance of municipal fire departments. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 19.

Municipal Government - As introduced, establishes a mechanism for areas in Shelby County that have been annexed or are about to be annexed to submit a petition for certain referenda related to annexation or deannexation to be held in such areas. - Amends TCA Title 6.
General Assembly - As introduced, deletes references to the legislative office of program evaluation. - Amends TCA Title 3.

Environmental Preservation - As introduced, requires fines for environmental violations be spent remediating in the county of the areas generating such fines. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 68 and Title 69.
Courts - As enacted, directs the administrative office of the courts (AOC) to study the feasibility of establishing specialized veterans' courts in Tennessee.  - Amends TCA Title 16.

Industrial Development - As enacted, includes land, improvements, and machinery used or suitable for use in the production, treatment, processing, or transportation of biofuels and other similar products in the definition of "project" under the provisions governing projects by industrial development corporations. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 53.

Planning, Public - As introduced, requires a city or county to provide notice to citizens residing in an abutting city or county within a one-mile radius of a proposed facility that is to be built if the facility may be a danger to the health, safety or welfare of the citizens of such city or county. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6 and Title 7.

Sexual Offenders - As enacted, provides that the conveyance of personal property of a sexual offender used to violate a residential and work restriction of the sex offender registry is subject to forfeiture if the victim was a minor; specifies under the provisions regarding forfeiture of property used in the commission of a sexual offense that property is subject to "judicial forfeiture" instead of "administrative forfeiture". - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 5.

Sports - As introduced, requires schools to impose certain informational requirements and restrictions on activity relative to youth who suffer concussions in athletic events. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 68.
Public Health - As introduced, requires hospitals to provide parents of newborns with certain information concerning pertussis disease and immunizations. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.

Taxes, Gasoline, Petroleum Products - As introduced, extends period of time from 30 days to 30 business days for county legislative body to act on resolution or ordinance to levy one cent local gasoline tax following filing of petition with county legislative body to levy such tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 3.
Planning, Public - As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Local Land Bank Pilot Program." - Amends TCA Title 13.
Telecommunications - As introduced, requires entities to allow pole attachments and establishes process for resolving pole attachment disputes. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 21.

Education - As enacted, extends deadline for raising matching funds for Tennessee Intercollegiate State Legislature Foundation from June 30, 2012, to December 31, 2012, by delaying reversion of existing appropriation to general fund until  December 31, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, requires department of education to compare number of students receiving lottery scholarships from each school to determine effectiveness of each school's lottery scholarship day program and facilitate such programs at other schools whenever possible. - Amends TCA Section 49-4-932.

Education, Higher - As introduced, exempts students entering higher education institutions who were born before January 1, 1970, from any requirement of proof of vaccination against any disease.   - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1.

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As introduced, requires board for licensing health care facilities to promulgate rules requiring emergency room personnel to be trained in advanced cardiovascular life support by January 1, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 68.

Consumer Protection - As introduced, requires certain businesses to delete personal information provided by a consumer upon the consumer's written request unless the business is required to retain the information by law. - Amends TCA Title 10; Title 45; Title 47, Chapter 18; Title 62 and Title 63.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, requires every insurer offering homeowner property insurance to make available coverage for insurable landslide losses on any dwelling to the extent provided in the policy to which the landslide coverage attaches. - Amends TCA Title 56.

Privacy, Confidentiality - As introduced, specifies that the unauthorized divulging or posting in electronic format, readily accessible on the Internet, of a patient's name, address or other identifying information is subject to certain civil action, criminal prosecution, and civil penalties. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 28; Title 29; Title 47; Title 63 and Title 68.

Consumer Protection - As introduced, requires motor vehicle dealers to comply with prohibition against making contradictory statements in initial offers for prizes or travel services; broadens scope of prohibition to apply at any time. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18 and Title 55, Chapter 17.

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As introduced, prohibits vendors of services for electronic medical records from entering into or renewing contracts or agreements with health care facilities and health care providers that require indemnification of the vendor by the facility or provider or that prohibit lawsuits against the vendor. - Amends TCA Title 56; Title 63 and Title 68.

Physicians and Surgeons - As introduced, requires the board of medical examiners and the board of osteopathic examination to issue rules for the training of physicians who prescribe certain opioids. - Amends TCA Title 63.
Agriculture, Dept. of - As introduced, requires retail food establishments to post inspection reports in a conspicuous manner. - Amends TCA Title 43, Chapter 1 and Title 53, Chapter 8.

Fiscal Review Committee - As enacted, extends period of time committee has to comment on proposed non-competitive contracts from 20 days to 40 days; removes obsolete language. - Amends TCA Title  3, Chapter 7; Title 3, Chapter 2; Title  4, Chapter 56; Title  36, Chapter 5 and Title  71, Chapter 5.

Insurance, Life - As introduced, provides that good faith statements in an application for life insurance that are in error are not grounds to deny a claim arising out of such life insurance policy. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7.

Dentists and Dentistry - As enacted, revises various provisions governing dental hygienists.

 - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 5.
