Annexation - As enacted, requires annexing municipality to record adopted or approved annexation ordinance or resolution with register of deeds in counties where annexation adopted or approved; copy to be sent to comptroller and assessor of property for each affected county. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 51, Part 1.

Taxes, Ad Valorem - As enacted, revises deadlines for filing applications for refunds or presentments of credit vouchers; clarifies that repayment not required if certain persons determined to be eligible are later found to be ineligible for property tax relief. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 7.

Taxes, Personal Property - As introduced, for purposes of property tax classification and assessment, provides that real property does not include property determined by Tennessee courts to be personal property. - Amends TCA Title 67.
subjects: Housing and Property|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Taxes - As introduced, authorizes certain courts to attach a copy of the court's order to the tax books under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 67.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, sets awards from net lottery proceeds for certain postsecondary scholarships and grants at the amount the student initially received or at the amount awarded for initial recipients in the current semester of enrollment, whichever is greater. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51, Part 1 and Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

Election Laws - As introduced, requires the state election coordinator to study the feasibility of permitting registered voters who reside outside the precinct listed as their permanent residence on their permanent voter registration card to vote only for candidates running for statewide office; the study will not address property rights voting; the coordinator must report the results of the study to the general assembly by February 28, 2012. -

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As enacted, allows a student with a documented medical disability that restricts the student's attendance to part-time to petition for an extension of time in which to receive a Tennessee HOPE scholarship; revises law regarding the dual enrollment grant. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.
Criminal Offenses - As introduced, changes the standards by which a person is considered to be driving under the influence. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.
Alcohol Offenses, Motor Vehicles - As introduced, allows law enforcement to use reasonable force when causing certain people to submit to a test of their bodily fluid. - Amends TCA Section 55-10-406.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, creates the offense of internal possession of a controlled substance for producing a dirty drug test; punishes the offense in accordance with the same provisions governing simple possession. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

Public Contracts - As introduced, requires certain commissioners and agency heads to certify to comptroller that state employees could not have been used instead of contracting with outside entities in rendering services required under certain contracts. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8 and Title 12.

Utilities, Utility Districts - As introduced, authorizes a water utility district in the eastern portion of White County with over 1,000 customers to change the manner in which vacancies are filled and commissioners are selected. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 82.

Beer - As introduced, prohibits issuing or renewing permits to sell beer off-premises to persons selling beer through drive-up or drive-through windows or curb-service unless such person is certified as responsible vendor. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 5, Part 1.

Contractors - As introduced, makes it a violation of the Consumer Protection Act for a contractor to require a person to waive a right of lien in violation of law. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18; Title 47, Chapter 25; Title 62, Chapter 6 and Title 66.

Contractors - As introduced, authorizes all required notices and answers concerning administrative actions to be served or filed personally or by certified mail; if served personally the time runs from the date of service and if by certified mail from the postmarked date. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 6.

DUI Offenses - As introduced, lowers the DUI enhancement that would require an ignition interlock from .15 percent to .08 percent and removes the DUI enhancements that would require an ignition interlock relative to implied consent. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55.
Highway Signs - As enacted, names "SPC Michael E. Harr Memorial Bridge" on S.R. 126 in Sullivan County. -
Highway Signs - As enacted, names "Orville Depew 'Dick' Kitzmiller and Riley Lee Milhorn Memorial Bridge," on S.R. 75 in Sullivan County. -

Administrative Procedure (UAPA) - As introduced, allows the respondent in a contested case to continue the date of the first scheduled hearing until both parties certify that they are ready for the hearing;  allows either party to make a motion to set the hearing if unreasonable delay occurs. - Amends TCA Title 4.

Civil Procedure - As introduced, increases from $200 to $500 the amount of indebtedness that requires newspaper advertisements, three different times, announcing a pending court-ordered judicial sale. - Amends TCA Title 35.
subjects: Legal Issues|Civil Liberties and Civil Rights

title: Alcoholic Beverage Commission - As introduced, requires all fees, fines, and other penalties be paid to commission before license renewal for distillers, wholesalers, retailers, liquor-by-the-drink establishments, wineries, collectors, and direct shippers; authorizes commission to assess actual and reasonable costs of any hearing held in accordance with the contested case provisions. - Amends TCA Title  57, Chapter 3; Title  57, Chapter 4, Part 2 and Title 57, Chapter 1.

Workers Compensation - As introduced, adds language to not construe any limitations on obtaining compensation under the workers' compensation statute to limit third party actions against tort-feasors. - Amends TCA Title 50.

Bankruptcy - As enacted, clarifies that the notice of exemption given by a judgment debtor shall state "Tennessee law provides a $10,000 exemption" instead of "Tennessee law provides a $4,000 exemption." - Amends TCA Title 26.

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As enacted, extends for two years the nursing home privilege tax and restricts the use of such tax revenues to the funding of nursing home rates. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As enacted, extends the current moratorium on the issuance of certificates of need (CONs) for new nursing home beds until June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 16.

Taxes, Sales - As introduced, exempts from sales tax the sale of motor vehicles to active duty members of the armed forces stationed in Tennessee but on temporary duty assignment in another state. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-303.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Professions and Occupations - As introduced, provides for licensure or certification of radiology practitioner assistants as radiologist assistants. - Amends TCA Title 63.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, specifies that when a defendant commits a homicide or assault against a pregnant woman, the woman's fetus, regardless of viability, is also considered a victim of the offense. - Amends TCA Section 39-13-107 and Section 39-13-214.

Drugs, Over the Counter - As introduced, increases from one to two years the time period that a pharmacy must retain a written methamphetamine precursor registry. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17 and Title 53, Chapter 11.
Hamblen County - As introduced, subject to local approval, repeals the Hamblen County special endowment fund. - Chapter 106 of the Private Acts of 2006.

Schools, Charter - As introduced, revises various provisions of the Tennessee Public Charter Schools Act, including eliminating caps on the number of charter schools and changing requirements for charter schools' prospective student population. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.

Autopsies - As introduced, permits parents to see the body of an adult child prior to the commencement of an autopsy; authorizes the state to restrict a parent from touching the body to the extent necessary to preserve evidence. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title  38 and Title  68.

Intellectual & Developmental Disabilities - As introduced, exempts certain provider agencies from annual quality assurance evaluations if the agency possesses certain accreditation. - Amends TCA Title 33 and Title 68.

Unemployment Compensation - As introduced, excludes employees working under certain employment contracts for 999 or less hours from qualifying for unemployment benefits. - Amends TCA Section 50-7-303.

Sullivan County - As introduced, subject to local approval, repeals requirement that satellite offices for the register of deeds be maintained outside the county seat. - Repeals Chapter 242 of the Acts of 1899; and any other acts amendatory thereto.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, delays collection efforts for any taxpayer with not-for-profit status pending final outcome of litigation challenging tax assessment on ground that taxpayer was tax-exempt. - Amends TCA Title 48 and Title 67.
Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As enacted, revises the trauma center funding law; includes licensed Level IV institutions in definition of trauma center. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 59.
Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As introduced, requires hospitals to report annually on community benefits they provided. - Amends TCA Section 68-11-310.

Beer - As enacted, allows any establishment that has a permit to sell liquor or wine on premises to sell beer at any time such establishment can serve liquor or wine; changes hours for sale of beer in Tennessee River resort district to be not less than the hours for liquor by the drink. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4 and Title 57, Chapter 5.
Taxes, Sales - As introduced, prohibits general assembly from raising tax rate on food above 5.5% beginning on July 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As introduced, limits certificates of need to facilities and removes equipment and services from the certificate requirements. - Amends TCA Title 68.
Highway Signs - As enacted, designates segment of State Route 48 in Montgomery County as "Joel Plummer Memorial Highway." -
Sentencing - As introduced, increases from 10 to 15 the number of days prior to a sentencing hearing that a presentence report shall be filed. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

Uniform Laws - As enacted, corrects typographical error in Public Chapter 901 by inserting the word "or" in section specifying that remedies under the chapter are cumulative. - Amends TCA Section 36-5-2103 and Chapter 901 of the Public Acts of 2010.

Taxes, Privilege - As introduced, imposes a one-cent per ounce privilege tax on bottled soft drinks containing sugar; reduces from 5.5% to 4.5% the retail sales tax rate on food, which includes soft drinks. - Amends TCA Title  67, Chapter 6, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 4.

Taxes - As introduced, clarifies that, to meet the definition of "industrial machinery" for purposes of the sales and use tax exemption, any product resulting from the fabrication or processing must be for consumption off the premises of the one engaged in the fabrication or processing. - Amends TCA Title 67.

Safety, Dept. of - As introduced, authorizes military veterans to obtain driver licenses displaying language "Veterans," if department of safety receives private funding by June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50.

Education - As introduced, specifies that alternative schools must obtain the individualized education plan (IEP) and related records of a student entering the alternative school with an IEP. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-3402.
Tennessee Emergency Management Agency (TEMA) - As enacted, establishes job qualifications for directors of local emergency management agencies. - Amends TCA Title 58.
Driver Licenses - As introduced, extends ordinary duration of driver licenses from five to eight years; increases fees for driver licenses and photo identification cards. - Amends TCA Title 55.

Safety - As enacted, exempts ambulances from requirement that each for-hire motor carrier providing passenger transportation service in a motor vehicle or motor vehicles designed or constructed to accommodate and transport eight or more passengers, or any motor vehicle transporting passengers who are TennCare enrollees eligible for such transportation services under TennCare, maintain at least $1,000,000 in liability insurance, drug test operators, conduct biennial physical exams of operators, and conduct annual safety examinations. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 51 and Title 65.
Transportation, Dept. of - As enacted, creates a special coordination committee to coordinate transportation efforts of state and local government. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 54.
Highway Signs - As enacted, designates bridge on S.R. 438 in Perry County as "Dickson Augustus Weems Memorial Bridge" -
Highway Signs - As enacted, designates bridge on S.R. 438 in Perry County as "Roy Bell & David O'Guin Memorial Bridge" -

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, allows a student with a documented medical disability that restricts the student's attendance to part-time to petition for an extension of time in which to receive a Tennessee HOPE scholarship. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.
Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Music Recording Investment Incentive Act." - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3.

Financial Responsibility Law - As introduced, limits right to recover noneconomic damages by a motorist who does not comply with the financial responsibility law. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12 and Title 56, Chapter 7.

Special License Plates - As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked plates for Donate Life; 50% of the proceeds from sale of such plates earmarked for Tennessee Donor Services to raise awareness of organ and tissue donation. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As introduced, authorizes lump sum death benefit to beneficiary for noncontributory member dying prior to retirement as if such member had been a contributory member. - Amends TCA Section 8-36-107.

Capitol - As introduced, clarifies that the duties of the Capitol Commission include establishing a policy relative to historical commemorative statues and monuments on the capitol grounds as well as on the Bicentennial Mall. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 8.
Physicians and Surgeons - As introduced, regulates the activities of radiology benefit managers with respect to orders or recommendations of treating physicians. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 63.

Drug and Alcohol Rehabilitation - As introduced, allows licensed drug and alcohol abuse counselors to assist clients with applications for state and federal benefits.  - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 68, Chapter 11 and Title 68, Chapter 24.

Child Custody and Support - As enacted, requires that in taking into account the child's best interest for purposes of a child custody arrangement, the court shall order a custody arrangement that permits both parents to enjoy the maximum participation possible in the life of the child. - Amends TCA Section 36-6-106 relative to child custody.

Lottery,  Corporation - As introduced, relieves lottery retailers from payment for stolen unsold instant lottery tickets if retailer notifies law enforcement and the lottery corporation as soon as practicable upon discovery of theft, and if within 72 hours of the issuance of a police report concerning the theft, a copy of the report is filed with the corporation. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51, Part 1.
Telecommunications - As enacted, enacts the "Uniform Access, Competition, and Consumer Fairness Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 5.

Police - As enacted, revises the requirement that police officers be provided with training to deal with mentally ill persons to require that training be provided annually.

 - Amends TCA Section 38-8-119.

Boards and Commissions - As introduced, authorizes TWRA to enter into partnership agreements with nonprofit organizations to promote agency goals and objectives including, but not limited to, marketing opportunities. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 1, Part 3.

Traffic Safety - As introduced, requires loose material hauled in open bed of certain motor vehicles to be covered by tarpaulin in addition to present requirement limiting height of load. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 7.

Taxes, Inheritance Gift - As introduced, for inheritance tax purposes, excludes from decedent's gross estate the special use value of certain family owned farmland; exempts from additional taxation certain woodland and conservation transactions; exempts up to $5 million or 50 percent of the value of certain land covered by conservation easements. - Amends TCA Title 67.
subjects: Family and Children Issues|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Workers Compensation - As introduced, allows individuals to be exempt from the workers' compensation requirements if such individual is a member of a recognized religious sect or division and is an adherent of established tenets or teachings of such sect or division by reason of which such individual is conscientiously opposed to acceptance of the benefits provided by the workers' compensation laws. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.

DUI Offenses - As introduced, allows person issued a restricted driver license to drive to and from a doctor's office, hospital, pharmacy or other location to obtain necessary medical care or to obtain an item for which the person has a prescription. - Amends TCA Title 55.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, provides that aggravated criminal trespass is also committed if the trespasser destroys or vandalizes a gate, fence, lock or other barrier in order to gain entrance to the property. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 4.

Watershed Development - As enacted, authorizes the Beech River watershed development authority to create the position of board member emeritus and establishes the qualifications for such position. - Amends TCA Title 64, Chapter 1.

Veterinarians - As introduced, removes specifically defined categories of veterinary facilities and excludes from the definition of "veterinary facility" certain premises. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 12.
Census - As enacted, requires utilization of census 2010 geography in establishment or alteration of precincts after March 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Section 2-3-102.

Taxes, Hotel Motel - As enacted, authorizes Lexington, by ordinance adopted by a two-thirds vote, to levy an occupancy tax on the privilege of staying in any hotel or motel in Lexington; the ordinance to set the rate and further set forth the manner of collection and administration of the privilege tax; requires that all proceeds received by the municipality from the tax be deducted for tourism development. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 14.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Regional Authorities and Special Districts - As enacted, adds executive director of development district in which a megasite is located to megasite board. - Amends TCA Title 64, Chapter 6.

Livestock - As introduced, requires inspection of livestock by agriculture crimes unit within department of agriculture to precede inspection by county agricultural extension agents in response to alleged offenses being committed against livestock. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 43.

Alcoholic Beverages - As enacted, adds Buffalo River Resort in Perry County to the definition of premier type tourist resort for purposes of the sale of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption, if local legislation body adopts resolution adopting resort as premier type tourist resort. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, adds Buffalo River Resort in Perry County to the definition of premier type tourist resort for purposes of the sale of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

Public Employees - As introduced, prohibits public employees from having a payroll deduction to a political action committee or for dues for membership organizations that use funds for political activities. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 7 and Title 8.

Planning, Public - As introduced, authorizes regional and municipal planning commissions to revoke subdivision plats under certain circumstances and return proceeds from enforced bond or guaranty to property owner. - Amends TCA Section 13-3-403(b) and 13-4-303(b).

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As enacted, authorizes a hospital to designate an entity to report the hospital's discharge claims data with the commissioner of health. - Amends TCA Section 68-1-108(a).
Business and Commerce - As introduced, enacts the Equal Access to Intrastate Commerce Act. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21, Part 1; Title 5; Title 6 and Title 7.
Taxes, Sales - As enacted, extends limited sales tax refund for certain appliances, furniture, and building supplies purchased in response to May 2010 flood. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-396.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Veterans - As introduced, permits use of small American flags to decorate graves at Tennessee veterans' cemeteries on Veterans' Day, subject to federal law. - Amends TCA Title 46, Chapter 6.
Business and Commerce - As enacted, enacts the "Equal Access to Intrastate Commerce Act." - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21, Part 1; Title 5; Title 6 and Title 7.
Business and Commerce - As introduced, enacts the "Equal Access to Intrastate Commerce Act." - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 51.
Juries and Jurors - As introduced, allows Morgan County to use jury coordinators instead of jury commissioners for the selection and attendance of jurors. - Amends TCA Section 22-2-101.
Senior Citizens - As introduced, requires reports to and by the select committee on long-term care concerning recent long-term care reform legislation. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.

Senior Citizens - As introduced, creates a special joint committee to study the creation of a department of aging and adult services. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 13; Title 33; Title 34; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.
Taxes, Personal Property - As introduced, removes loan companies and cemetery companies from tax on shares of stock. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 11.
subjects: Housing and Property|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Tobacco, Tobacco Products - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Protection from Secondhand Smoke for Children Act." - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 9.

Professions and Occupations - As introduced, requires criminal background checks on persons seeking renewal of locksmith licenses; exempts locksmiths with 10 years experience from continuing education requirements; sets license renewal fee at not less than $200. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 11, Part 1.
Firearms and Ammunition - As introduced, prohibits any person who is not a licensed dealer from selling a firearm at a gun show or within 1,000 feet of a gun show. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

Public Health - As introduced, requires ice cream truck workers to submit to a criminal background check and prohibits persons on the sexual offender registry or convicted of certain sexual offenses from being employed as such workers. - Amends TCA Title 40; Title 53; Title 55 and Title 68.
Motor Vehicles - As introduced, prohibits issuance of speeding tickets based solely on evidence from  traffic enforcement camera. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.
DUI Offenses - As introduced, increases the penalty for the offense of boating under the influence of an intoxicant to approximate DUI penalties. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 55 and Title 69.
Firearms and Ammunition - As introduced, increases the penalty for certain offenses involving the possession of firearms by minors. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

Election Laws - As enacted, changes date of presidential preference primary from first Tuesday in February to first Tuesday in March; changes the qualifying deadline for candidates in a county primary held in February in presidential election years from "the first Thursday in November" to "the second Thursday in December" and specifies that candidates in municipal elections held in conjunction with the presidential preference primary election must file their nominating petitions by the second Thursday in December. - Amends TCA Title 2.

Fines and Penalties - As introduced, specifies that traffic citation from traffic enforcement camera may be paid by mail or in person within the jurisdiction of the surveillance camera's governing body. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

Law Enforcement - As introduced, requires police officer, instead of law enforcement employee, to review video evidence from traffic enforcement camera and make determination as to whether violation has occurred.  - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.
Traffic Safety - As introduced, deletes requirement that vehicle making right turn on red signal come to full and complete stop prior to making such turn.  - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

Fines and Penalties - As introduced, prohibits municipalities and counties from using any revenue generated from traffic enforcement cameras for operational expenses of such program; instead, such revenue donated to eligible nonprofit organizations. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-198.

Credit and Debit Cards - As introduced, imposes civil and criminal penalties against certain persons who knowingly fail to perform credit card or debit card identification checks at the point of sale. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 45 and Title 47.

Registers of Deeds - As introduced, requires an assignment of a deed of trust to be properly recorded with the register of deeds within 10 days of the date of assignment. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 21, Part 10; Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 1 and Title 66, Chapter 24, Part 1.
subjects: Housing and Property|Municipal and County Issues

title: Mortgages - As introduced, requires all closings under the Tennessee Home Loan Protection Act to be attorney supervised closings and only attorneys with sufficient errors and omission insurance, as set annually by the commissioner of financial institutions, shall be authorized to act as supervising attorneys. - Amends TCA Title 45 and Title 47, Chapter 32.

Holidays and Days of Special Observance - As enacted, designates first full week in March each year as "Volunteer Firefighters Week"; such dates shall not be a legal holiday under state law. - Amends TCA Title 15, Chapter 2, Part 1.
Insurance, Health, Accident - As enacted, authorizes insurers to use incentives and rewards to encourage or reward participation in a health promotion program. - Amends TCA Title 56.
Mental Illness - As introduced, authorizes court ordered assisted outpatient treatment in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 33.

Sexual Offenders - As enacted, requires registration with the sex offender registry by a juvenile between the ages of 14 and 18 who is adjudicated delinquent for any violent juvenile sexual offense committed on or after July 1, 2011.  - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 40; Title 49 and Title 55.

Motor Vehicles, Titling and Registration - As enacted, exempts antique vehicles being registered for antique motor vehicle license plates from emissions testing requirement imposed in certain counties for motor vehicle registration. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4; Title 55, Chapter 6 and Title 68, Chapter 201.

Cooperatives - As enacted, provides for suspension of certain assessments against grain producers; revises other provisions regarding assessments and grain indemnity fund. - Amends TCA Title 43, Chapter 32, Part 2.

Finance and Administration, Dept. of - As introduced, prohibits the transfer of funds to the general fund from the department of health, health related boards fund, and from commerce and insurance, division of regulatory boards fund. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 10.
Highway Signs - As enacted, designates segment of U.S. Highway 27 in Rhea County as "Tyler Leon Sneed Memorial Highway." -

Funeral Directors and Embalmers - As introduced, exempts funeral directors from registering as pre-need sales agents or pre-need sellers before engaging in the sale of pre-need merchandise or pre-need contracts. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 5.
Criminal Procedure - As enacted, clarifies provisions governing victims assistance assessment.  - Amends TCA Title 40.
Criminal Procedure - As enacted, revises eligibility criteria for pretrial and judicial diversion programs. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.
Sentencing - As introduced, enhances the penalties for a second or subsequent conviction of domestic assault. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, changes the sentence for the offense of rape of a child from a minimum of 25 years to a minimum Range II sentence; permits a Range III sentence to be imposed if appropriate. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

Consumer Protection - As introduced, makes it a violation of the Consumer Protection Act to use any word in an advertisement or trade name referring to a governmental entity that may tend to mislead consumers to believe a private entity is acting for or on behalf of, or has a direct or indirect relationship to a governmental entity, when such use is false, inaccurate, or misleading. - Amends TCA Title 47.
Criminal Offenses - As introduced, removes the requirement that unconsciousness be "protracted" in cases where "serious bodily injury" results from strangulation. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title  40.

Sentencing - As introduced, requires that 100% of the sentence imposed for attempts to commit murder in the first degree shall be served, minus certain credits; prohibits release eligibility for persons committing such offenses. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

Bail, Bail Bonds - As enacted, specifies that defendant released before trial will continue on release during trial or release pending trial under same terms and conditions as were previously imposed, unless the court determines that other terms and conditions or termination of release are necessary; authorizes court to order a defendant held without release during existing trial, if, after the defendant is released upon personal recognizance, an unsecured personal appearance bond, or any other bond approved by the court, the defendant violates a condition of release, is charged with an offense committed during the defendant's release, or engages in conduct which results in the obstruction of the orderly and expeditious progress of the trial or other proceedings. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As introduced, corrects reference from "commissioner of personnel" to "commissioner of human resources" in provision regarding membership of TCRS board of trustees. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 34; Title 8, Chapter 35; Title 8, Chapter 36 and Title 8, Chapter 37.

Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As introduced, corrects reference to the board of trustees of the consolidated retirement system. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 25, Part 1; Title 8, Chapter 25, Part 3; Title 8, Chapter 25, Part 27.

Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As enacted, increases from $10,000 to $50,000 the maximum amount of retirement benefits that may be paid in a lump sum to a state employee's surviving spouse or next of kin in the absence of knowledge of a purported will naming a surviving executor.  - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 34; Title 8, Chapter 35; Title 8, Chapter 36; Title 8, Chapter 3.

Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As enacted, revises various provisions governing the Tennessee consolidated retirement system; requires that counsel for treasury department serve as attorney for the chair of TCRS and treasury with regard to deferred or tax-sheltered compensation plans. - Amends TCA Section 8-24-104(c); Title 8, Chapter 25, Part 1; Section 8-25-111; Title 8, Chapter 25, Part 3; Title 8, Chapter 34, Part 2; Section 8-34-203; Section 8-34-302(a)(6); Section 8-34-319; Section 8-34-321; Title 8, Chapter 35, Part 2; Section 8-35-201(d); Section 8-35-218(a); Section 8-36-208(b) and Section 8-36-212.

Election Laws - As enacted, changes the early voting period when a presidential preference primary is held or an election is held at the same time as a presidential preference primary, to not more than 20 days nor less than seven days before the day of the election, instead of not more than 20 nor less than five days before the day of the election. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 6.

Election Laws - As enacted, eliminates early voting period for a municipal election in a municipality having a population of 5,000 or less, if there is no opposition for any office in the election and the election is held on a date which does not coincide with the August or November general election unless the municipality files a request with the county election commission for the early voting period to apply; does not apply to municipal elections in Davidson County. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 6.

Funeral Directors and Embalmers - As introduced, requires a funeral establishment to store or make arrangements to store in a cold storage vault a dead human body received by the funeral establishment for burial until shortly before the funeral service and burial of the body is scheduled to occur. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 5.

Fairs - As introduced, authorizes the commissioner of agriculture to appoint a qualified organization to be the sole and exclusive operator of a fair known as the Tennessee State Fair. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 12; Title 43 and Title 67.

Courts, Juvenile - As introduced, requires petitions in juvenile court to contain the name of any alleged biological father if applicable; requires service of summons on alleged biological father in abuse, neglect or dependency proceedings; allows for service by electronic publication. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 1, Part 1.

Courts, Juvenile - As enacted, revises certain provisions governing jurisdiction in juvenile court; grants temporary jurisdiction to issue temporary orders in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-103.

Juvenile Offenders - As enacted, amends various provisions regarding the transfer of juveniles to adult court and the department of children's services' custody of such children; authorizes communication between the adult court and the juvenile court; clarifies provisions on home placement supervision of juveniles. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 1, Part 1.
Divorce,  Annulment and Alimony - As enacted, clarifies various provisions relating to divorce and custody proceedings. - Amends TCA Title 29 and Title 36.

Alcohol Offenses, Motor Vehicles - As enacted, permits an officer to test the blood alcohol content of certain drivers regardless of whether they consent. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title  40 and Title  55.
Pharmacy, Pharmacists - As introduced, enacts the "Prescription Integrity Act of 2011," which regulates therapeutic substitution of medications. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 10 and Title 63.

Financial Institutions, Dept. of - As introduced, adds to list of events triggering extraordinary reporting requirements by licensed money transmitters the institution of any official investigation by a government entity with jurisdiction over financial laws. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 9; Title 40, Chapter 33, Part 2; Title 45, Chapter 7, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 4.
DUI Offenses - As enacted, revises provisions governing the setting of bail in certain DUI-related cases. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 11.

Professions and Occupations - As introduced, raises the age to be an entertainer in a cabaret or other adult-oriented establishment from 18 to 21; requires any political subdivision that has or adopts an ordinance regulating such establishments to require certain information be provided by a person applying for a permit as an entertainer. - Amends TCA Title 7.
Civil Procedure - As introduced, authorizes certain electronically published newspapers to be used for legal notices. - Amends TCA Section 1-3-105; Title 30, Chapter 2 and Title 67, Chapter 5.
subjects: Legal Issues|Civil Liberties and Civil Rights

title: Animal Cruelty and Abuse - As introduced, exempts an animal from having a rabies inoculation if a veterinarian determines in writing that the inoculation would compromise the animal's health, but the owner must still be responsible for the fees. - Amends TCA Section 68-8-103.
Insurance, Health, Accident - As introduced, requires health insurance coverage of certain treatments for ectodermal dysplasia, cleft lip and cleft palate for children. - Amends TCA Title 56.

Law Enforcement - As enacted, establishes the Blue Alert system to provide rapid dissemination of information to aid in detection of persons when law enforcement officer is killed, injured or suspiciously missing in line of duty. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 6, Part 1.

Funeral Directors and Embalmers - As introduced, requires that one of the seven members of the board of funeral directors and embalmers must be a representative of a multi-facility owner and operator of funeral homes, cemeteries or crematories. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 5, Part 2.

Fire Prevention and Investigation - As introduced, requires all public, private or volunteer fire agencies to conduct criminal background checks on paid or volunteer fire protection personnel applicants, and includes rescue squad personnel. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 102.

Insurance, Health, Accident - As enacted, allows dental service plans to make payments to dentists electronically if the dental service plan also receives claims from dentists electronically. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 30.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, deletes current statutory language which authorizes the commissioner of commerce and insurance to assess investigatory and hearing costs. - Amends TCA Title 56.

Tennessee Regulatory Authority - As introduced, lowers the civil penalty for violations concerning gas pipeline systems from an amount not to exceed $10,000 per violation for each day that such violation persists to an amount not to exceed $5,000. - Amends TCA Title 65.
subjects: State Agencies|Federal, State, and Local Relations

title: Funeral Directors and Embalmers - As introduced, requires local law enforcement to begin an investigation within 12 hours of receiving a report of an alleged violation by a funeral director of abuse of a corpse or concerning the handling, custody, care, or transportation of dead human bodies. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-312 and Title 62, Chapter 5.
Housing - As introduced, creates the Tennessee Home Construction Jobs Development Act." - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 60 and Title 13, Chapter 23.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As enacted, removes requirement that written notice of termination of teacher contain a statement that such notice was authorized by a majority vote of the local board of education with the name of the teacher receiving such note being recorded in the minutes of the board. - Amends TCA Section 49-5-409.

Education - As enacted, removes the provision whereby only students in K-12 who were enrolled in and attended a public school during the previous school year are eligible to participate in a virtual public education program. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 16.
Education, Dept. of - As introduced, requires the commissioner of education's annual report to be issued on July 1, rather than November 1, of each year. - Amends TCA Title 49.
Education - As introduced, changes the date on which the department of education must publish its annual report from November 1 to July 1. - Amends TCA Section 49-1-211.

Education - As enacted, requires notice of termination of director of schools to comply with same requirements as notice of extension of a director's contract; requires termination of contract of director of schools to be first item on the agenda of the board meeting at which such action is to be considered. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-203.

Wine & Wineries - As introduced, authorizes Tennessee licensed wineries to conduct business at no more than two additional satellite locations after obtaining a satellite permit and paying a fee to the alcoholic beverage commission. - Amends TCA Title 57.

Real Property - As introduced, requires persons registering or paying property taxes on real property to designate an address of residence that notice of legal and administrative proceedings, whereby the real property is the subject, may be sent to meet proper service of process. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 29; Title 66 and Title 67.

Fiscal Review Committee - As introduced, allows access by the fiscal review committee staff to certain confidential tax information and records in the possession of the department of revenue; requires the fiscal review committee staff to maintain the confidentiality of such information and records. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 17.

Election Laws - As introduced, requires a county election commission to accept and not return a mail voter registration form received within seven days prior to the registration deadline if the form lacks postage or has insufficient postage. - Amends TCA Section 2-2-109.

Taxes, Real Property - As introduced, increases income limitations for certain disabled homeowners, from present $24,000 to $26,500 each year, to be eligible for reimbursement for property taxes. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 16; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 61; Title 62; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.
subjects: Housing and Property|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Domestic Violence - As introduced, increases time of effectiveness of orders of protection; specifies that a person who violates an ex parte order of protection is subject to arrest. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6.
Domestic Violence - As introduced, extends the time of ex parte orders of protection from 15 to 28 days. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6.
Domestic Violence - As introduced, makes a third conviction of domestic assault punishable as a Class D felony. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1.

Funeral Directors and Embalmers - As introduced, requires funeral directors to surrender custody of a dead human body after receiving a written notice and to disclose to the purchaser of a funeral service that it is a violation of the law for a funeral establishment to refuse to surrender the custody of a dead human body to the person legally entitled to custody; removes exemption from continuing education requirements if disciplinary action is taken against a licensee by the board. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 5.

Education, Higher - As introduced, requires the board of regents and the board of trustees for the University of Tennessee system to develop a verification process to establish the lawful presence of applicants for admission; prohibits the admission of applicants unlawfully present in the United States to either system. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 49.
Immigration - As introduced, unless the context provides otherwise, specifies the criteria for being deemed a Tennessee citizen or resident. - Amends TCA Title 1; Title 36 and Title 68, Chapter 3.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, authorizes the commissioner of commerce and insurance to develop and implement a reporting plan to track the costs of civil litigation in which discovery of insurance limits is allowed in Tennessee as compared to other states and the federal system. - Amends TCA Title 56.

Traffic Safety - As introduced, requires that local governments employing traffic enforcement cameras make required signage in advance of such cameras visible and conspicuous; requires that citations state fine amount and additional fees or court costs separately. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 55, Chapter 8.
Mortgages - As enacted, adds exceptions to the licensure requirements under the Tennessee Residential Lending, Brokerage and Servicing Act. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 13.

Taxes, Ad Valorem - As introduced, provides for the redemption of certain property at tax sales that is situated in federally designated qualified census tracts within Shelby County. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.

Finance and Administration, Dept. of - As introduced, removes department's authority to transfer funds from the health-related boards fund and division of regulatory boards fund to any other department or agency of state government. - Amends TCA Section 4-3-1016; Section 56-1-310 and Section 63-1-137.

Election Laws - As introduced, moves presidential preference primary to first Tuesday in May from first Tuesday in February to coincide with county primary date. - Amends TCA Title  2, Chapter 5, Part 1; Title  2, Chapter 5, Part 2; Title 2, Chapter 12, Part 1 and Title 2, Chapter 13.

Fire Prevention and Investigation - As introduced, for counties which provide county-wide fire protection and which fund fire protection services from revenue as an alternate to establishing fire tax districts, requires the annual budget to identify specific revenues and amounts generated by situs-based taxes and other revenue sources that have been shared with municipalities which are used to fund such fire protection services. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 17, Part 1 and Title 58, Chapter 2.

Education, Higher - As introduced, provides that veterans or current members of the United States armed forces who are not residents of Tennessee shall be classified as out-of-state students but shall not be charged out-of-state tuition rates. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Taxes, Privilege - As introduced, deletes the requirement that taxes remitted by NHL and NBA players be solely used for expenses associated with securing current, expanded or new events for municipally-owned indoor sports facilities. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-1703.

Traffic Safety - As introduced, provides that the red flag required to be attached to a load that  projects beyond the rear of a motor vehicle may be made of plastic pliable material instead of cloth. - Amends TCA Title 55.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, deletes current statutory language that authorizes the commissioner at rulemaking hearings to administer oaths, receive oral and documentary evidence, and exercise subpoena power. - Amends TCA Title 56.

Planning, Public - As introduced, deletes the authorization in present law that two or more central business improvement districts may overlap and encompass some or all of the same properties. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 84.

Planning, Public - As introduced, authorizes a municipality to issue revenue bonds for a public facility acquired, improved or constructed by a third party including a private entity, notwithstanding any local charter provision or other law to the contrary. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 32 and Title 7, Chapter 33.

Education - As introduced, directs LEAs to make reasonable efforts to determine if students have health care insurance and to report findings to commissioner of education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2.
Motor Vehicles - As introduced,  authorizes the commissioner of commerce and insurance to promulgate rules pertaining to automobile clubs and associations. - Amends TCA Title 55.

Insurance, Health, Accident - As enacted, authorizes a dental service plan corporation to limit participation by dentists if the dental plan is providing or managing dental benefits for the impoverished uninsured on behalf of or as required by any governmental entity. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 30.
Taxes, Excise - As introduced, exempts new, and newly relocated, small businesses from excise tax liability for a period of five consecutive tax years. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.

Jails, Local Lock-ups - As enacted, specifies that if a county has been reimbursed for housing convicted felons for a continuous period of three or more fiscal years and has received the maximum amount allowed per prisoner per day as reasonable allowable costs during this period, then the county would thereafter be presumed to be entitled to the full maximum amount allocated per prisoner per day as reimbursement of reasonable allowable costs for housing such prisoners. - Amends TCA Section 41-8-106.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Legal Issues

title: Anderson County - As introduced, subject to local approval, reallocates proceeds from the hotel/motel tax from the general fund for county general revenue, with 90 percent being allocated to the tourism fund and 10 percent, minus the trustee's commission, being allocated to the Anderson County chamber of commerce for economic development purposes. - Amends Chapter 193 of the Private Acts of 1990; as amended.
Regional Authorities and Special Districts - As introduced, adds a representative from Oak Ridge to the Knoxville Regional Transportation Planning Office. - Amends TCA Title 64, Chapter 8.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, corrects definition of "regional accrediting association" for HOPE scholarship purposes to change the name of the Northwestern Association of Schools and Colleges to its present name of the Northwest Commission on Colleges and Universities. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.
Scholarships and Financial Aid - As introduced, requires TSAC to publish eligibility requirements for the minority teaching fellows program. - Amends TCA Section 49-4-706.

Campaigns and Campaign Finance - As introduced, requires local law enforcement to make every reasonable effort to have a visible presence during the time a door-to-door campaign is scheduled upon the written request of the public official conducting such campaign. - Amends TCA Title 2.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, creates the ASPIRE work study program to provide additional postsecondary financial assistance from net lottery proceeds to students receiving both the Tennessee HOPE scholarship and the ASPIRE award. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.
Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, simplifies lottery scholarship statutes by removing obsolete and unnecessary provisions. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, permits THEC to post its annual report on its Web site and provide a summary of the report to the standing committees on education in lieu of disseminating the full report to the committees. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

Schools, Charter - As introduced, requires annual progress report of governing body of a public charter school to be made to the executive director of the state board of education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 13; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.

Schools, Charter - As introduced, requires applications for establishment of charter schools to provide, in addition to the names and addresses of the members of the governing body, a telephone number or email address for each member. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 13; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.
Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, exempts solar panels purchased for legitimate business purposes or commercial uses from sales tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, exempts solar panels purchased for residential use from sales taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

Campaigns and Campaign Finance - As introduced, establishes monetary limits on a candidate's contributions to the candidate's own campaign for state or local office. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10, Part 3.

Scholarships and Financial Aid - As introduced, requires TSAC to develop, implement, and administer student loan repayment programs for nurses who perform community service or accept employment with the state. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 49, Chapter 4; Title 63 and Title 68.

Lottery,  Corporation - As introduced, requires corporation policies and procedures concerning competitive bidding of major procurement contracts to be reviewed and approved by the procurement commission. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51 and Title 4, Chapter 56.

Campaigns and Campaign Finance - As introduced, allows corporations to contribute to candidates and certain multicandidate political campaign committees; allows use of corporate funds for certain political activity. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

Election Laws - As introduced, changes date of presidential preference primary from February to March and the qualifying deadline to the second Thursday in December. - Amends TCA Section 2-13-205 and Section 2-5-101.

Election Laws - As enacted, creates criteria to enable a minor party to be recognized; permits name of candidate for such party to be listed under the appropriate column for a recognized minor party. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 1, Part 1; Title 2, Chapter 13, Part 1; Title 2, Chapter 13, Part 2 and Title 2, Chapter 5, Part 2.
Local Government, General - As introduced, expands purposes for which hot mix asphalt produced by Hardeman County may be used. - Amends TCA Section 12-8-101 and Section 54-7-202.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, permits Tennessee HOPE scholarships to be awarded during summer school as well as during fall and spring semesters. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, expands the definition of historic performing arts center to permit the sale of alcoholic beverages and wine at the Relix Variety Theatre located in the downtown north redevelopment zone of Knoxville. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

Budget Procedures - As introduced, requires reference in governor's budget document to personal income and appropriations from state tax revenues from 10 years prior to current year and fiscal year, instead of from 1977 and from fiscal year 1977-1978. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 52.
Game and Fish Laws - As enacted, revises the provisions governing using a spotlight to locate deer. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 1.
subjects: Agriculture and Food|Animal Rights and Wildlife Issues

title: Law Enforcement - As introduced, provides that a law enforcement officer from another state does not have immunity or power to arrest if in this state when in fresh pursuit of a suspect unless the officer's communication device is compatible with the devices used in the jurisdiction of pursuit. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 7, Part 2 and Title 55, Chapter 8.

Game and Fish Laws - As introduced, deletes prohibition against using bait, including grain and other ingredients, used as or for food purposes, to capture or kill protected birds or animals. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 1.
subjects: Agriculture and Food|Animal Rights and Wildlife Issues

title: Transportation, Dept. of - As introduced, authorizes commissioner to implement procedure to award certain federal transportation enhancement grant funding directly to established nonprofit organizations for acquisition and preservation of civil war battlefield sites and that preference be given to nonprofit civil war preservation organizations over state agencies. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 23 and Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 51.

Traffic Safety - As introduced, requires that a traffic citation based upon evidence obtained by a traffic enforcement camera is to be served upon the driver in the same manner as a criminal summons and prosecuted in the same manner as a traffic citation based upon the observation of a law enforcement officer. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 2 and Title 55, Chapter 8.
Judgments - As introduced, requires a lien book to be kept in the register's office of the county where the land lies. - Amends TCA Title 25.

Bonding, Surety and Professional - As introduced, deletes statutory requirement that certain health clubs post either a bond of $25,000 or an audited financial statement with the department of commerce and insurance. - Amends TCA Section 47-18-321.

Victims' Rights - As introduced, requires the treasurer's annual report to include the total amounts received and paid out of the criminal injuries compensation fund and the number of claims for compensation asserted. - Amends TCA Title 29.

Civil Procedure - As introduced, allows clerk of court in which an action was initiated to transmit the transcript and original documents to clerk of court to which venue was transferred through e-mail in addition to physical transfer of records, upon agreement of both clerks. - Amends TCA Title 20.
subjects: Legal Issues|Civil Liberties and Civil Rights

title: Statutes of Limitations and Repose - As introduced, provides for extension of statutes of limitations and statutes of repose in the event the governor declares a disaster. - Amends TCA Title 28.

Sexual Offenders - As enacted, allows three or more sexual offenders to establish primary or secondary residence together if the property on which they live has been zoned for a use other than residential or mixed use by the appropriate local zoning laws. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2.
Professions and Occupations - As introduced, creates a special committee of public citizens to review which licensed or certified professions can be deregulated. -
Motor Vehicles - As introduced, removes present exemptions to offense involving allowing minor on off-highway vehicle without helmet. - Amends TCA Section 55-52-201.
Redistricting, Congressional - Enacts "Tennessee Fair and Independent Congressional Redistricting Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16; Title 4, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Title 8, Chapter 4.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Municipal and County Issues

title: Public Contracts - As introduced, authorizes certain allowances for Tennessee businesses in the evaluation of bids and proposals for state contracts. - Amends TCA Title 12.

Taxes, Sales - As introduced, provides for the state sales tax on food and food ingredients, which is presently 5.5 percent, being reduced by 0.5 percent per year in any fiscal year following a year in which the amount of surplus state revenue collected above budgeted estimates exceeds $50 million. - Amends TCA Title 67.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Appropriations - As introduced, requires identification of appropriation items impacting single legislative districts; requires majority vote on each item by full finance committees; requires 2/3 vote on each item for approval on floor. - Amends TCA Title 3 and Title 9.

Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As introduced, terminates pension eligibility for members elected or appointed to the general assembly on and after November 6, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 3 and Title 8.

Public Contracts - As introduced, authorizes certain allowances for businesses maintaining health programs or pension plans in the evaluation of bids and proposals for state contracts. - Amends TCA Title 12.
Redistricting, Legislative - As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.

Landlord and Tenant - As introduced, requires rental agreement under Uniform Residential Landlord and Tenant Act to include, as an addendum, energy audit of estimated energy usage at dwelling unit. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 28.
Redistricting, Legislative - As introduced, clarifies that state house districts must comply with all federal statutes and court decisions. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.
Redistricting, Legislative - As introduced, clarifies that senate must comply with applicable federal statutes. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-102.

Redistricting, Legislative - As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography; clarifies provisions concerning districts, terms and vacancies prior to November 2012 elections; clarifies that contiguity by water is sufficient. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-102.
Redistricting, Congressional - As introduced, updates reference to 2010 TIGER system; clarifies contiguity by water is sufficient. - Amends TCA Section 2-16-103.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Municipal and County Issues

title: Redistricting, Congressional - As introduced, requires compliance with state and federal constitutions as well as judicial decisions in passing congressional redistricting plan. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16, Part 1.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Municipal and County Issues

title: Domestic Violence - As introduced, allows a victim of domestic abuse, sexual assault, or stalking to terminate a lease or rental agreement if notice and documentation that tenant is a victim are presented to landlord. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 7, Part 1.

Courts - As enacted, provides that on or before October 1, 2012, any person who provides satisfactory proof that such person graduated from a court reporting program in this state prior to January 1, 2012, will be licensed to practice as a court reporter. - Amends TCA Title 20, Chapter 9, Part 6.
Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As enacted, requires hospitals to have certain persons authenticate verbal orders. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 3.
Domestic Violence - As introduced, requires a petitioner for order of protection to pay court costs and attorney fees if the petition is dismissed. - Amends TCA Title 36.

TennCare - As introduced, requires TennCare managed care organizations (MCOs) to allow TennCare enrollees to request particular providers for non-emergency ambulance service and requires all providers to be reimbursed on same basis whether or not they are in the MCO's network. - Amends TCA Title 71.

School Districts, Special - As introduced, requires county trustee to notify commissioner of education within 10 days of payment of funds of dissolved special school district to the county board of education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 5.

Local Education Agencies - As introduced, requires director of schools of each LEA to submit report on alternative schools to the commissioner of education instead of the senate and house education committees; requires commissioner to include compilation of these reports in commissioner's annual report. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1 and Title 49, Chapter 2.

Education - As introduced, eliminates required annual study by the state board of education of the weight of textbooks; requires commissioner of education to perform the study one time every five years and permits study to be done more often if the commissioner determines it to be necessary. - Amends TCA Title 49.
Education - As introduced, allows designees of named members of THEC to serve in members' places. - Amends TCA Title 49.
Education - As enacted, enacts the "Move on When Ready Act." - Amends TCA Title 49.
Taxes, Sales - As introduced, defines installation and deinstallation services for sales tax purposes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Human Services, Dept. of - As introduced, directs the comptroller to study issues relating to the letting of contracts for weatherization services by the department of human services. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 71.

Correction, Dept. of - As introduced, requires department to test all incoming inmates for blood borne pathogens effective July 1, 2011, and requires that all inmates in custody of department be tested for blood borne pathogens by January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 41.

Courts, Administrative Office of the - As enacted, directs the office to study certain issues related to the use of old warrants and related process by local law enforcement and to report to the house and senate judiciary committees on or before February 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.
Criminal Offenses - As introduced, provides for a special probation punishment for certain first offense marijuana violators who are age 18-21. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

Redistricting, Congressional - As introduced, requires compliance with state and federal constitutions as well as judicial decisions in passing congressional redistricting plan. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Municipal and County Issues

title: Redistricting, Legislative - As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.
Insurance, Motor Vehicles - As introduced, establishes certain claim settlement practices for insurers issuing automobile liability insurance in Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 56.

Adoption - As introduced, requires notice be given to a parent before the parent is considered to have willfully failed to support or visit a child for purposes of termination of parental rights. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 1.
Highway Signs - As enacted, designates segment of State Route 62 in Knox County as "Veterans Memorial Mile." -

General Assembly, Directed Studies - As introduced, directs the commissioner of economic and community development, in consultation with MTAS and CTAS, to study the effects of state and local tax incentives on the economic development of municipalities and counties. - Amends TCA Title 67.

Mortgages - As introduced, prohibits mortgage companies from estimating the cost of homeowner's insurance for inclusion in their good faith estimate of closing costs; requires the prospective purchaser to provide this information to the mortgage company. - Amends TCA Title 45.
Wine & Wineries - As enacted, allows direct shipper to ship wine to any address in the state. - Amends TCA Section 57-3-217.
Taxes - As introduced, increases the late application fee, accompanying a late application responding to a notice of disqualification, from $50.00 to $75.00. - Amends TCA Title 67.

Firefighters - As introduced, authorizes fire service utility district in Knox County to impose charges on nonsubscriber for cost of services rendered. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 82, Part 3 and Title 7, Chapter 86, Part 2.

Fire Prevention and Investigation - As introduced, provides that fire chiefs can relinquish control over any other fire district's fire department or company responding to an emergency in the chief's fire district. - Amends TCA Title 6 and Title 7.
Optometry - As enacted, changes the name of the association that nominates members for the governor to appoint to the board of optometry. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 8.
Highway Signs - As introduced, requires the department of transportation to mark the appropriate exits for certain hospitals. - Amends TCA Section 54-5-706.
School Transportation - As introduced, enacts the "Crime-Free School Zone Act." - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 49.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, increases the penalty for a second, third, or subsequent offense of selling of secondhand mattresses without the required tag. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18 and Title 68, Chapter 15, Part 2.

Public Funds and Financing - As introduced, clarifies that bonds to refund outstanding obligations will be sold and state bonds will be issued consistent with adopted finance transaction policies. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 21 and Title 9, Chapter 9.

Utilities, Utility Districts - As enacted, revises various provisions regarding utility districts, water systems and wastewater systems including provisions governing a required bond and annual audit; revises law regarding the filling of vacancies on the board of commissioners of a utility district and the filling of vacancies in the office of a utility district commissioner and removes certain exceptions to various requirements regarding utility districts. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 82 and Title 68, Chapter 221, Part 10.

Public Funds and Financing - As introduced, requires the director of the office of legislative budget analysis to report by the second Tuesday in January to the speakers of each house, the education committees of each house, and the comptroller, if the commissioner of education fails to provide the revised BEP funding formula for the ensuing fiscal year by January 1. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 8; Title 37 and Title 49.

Comptroller, State - As introduced, requires the comptroller to report the status of all local governments' and local government entities' debt management policies, including total outstanding debt, to the state and local government committees of each house by the second Tuesday in March. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8 and Title 9.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: County Officers - As introduced, increases the bond a county property assessor must post from $10,000 to $25,000 and removes the present law provision stating that the governing body of any county by a 2/3 vote may elect whether or not county officials must post a bond. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 13; Title 18; Title 49; Title 54 and Title 67.

Transportation, Dept. of - As introduced, authorizes commissioner of transportation to develop guidelines for use of nonpublic advertising on TDOT motor vehicles and contract for such advertising; all generated revenue from such advertising deposited in highway fund. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 23 and Title 12, Chapter 2.

Unemployment Compensation - As enacted, provides that when the department of labor and workforce development conducts unemployment hearings that personnel records and other business records that are in the possession of a claimants employer and that are relevant to a claim are admissible and may constitute proof of misconduct, regardless of whether such evidence is hearsay or whether corroborated by direct witness testimony, if such evidence is accompanied by an affidavit of its custodian or other qualified person certifying the evidence as a business record. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 50.

Education - As introduced, authorizes the department of education to establish a three-year pilot project of competitive grants for middle school after school and summer educational programs. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51 and Title 49.

Workers Compensation - As introduced, allows certain employers to apply for exemptions from the workers' compensation law if such employers meet certain requirements, such as filing a security bond for $500,000 with the commissioner of commerce and insurance. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6 and Title 56.

Firearms and Ammunition - As enacted, specifies procedures for determining retired law enforcement officer's eligibility to carry a firearm under federal law. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 8, Part 1.
Taxes, Income - As enacted, exempts income derived from cemetery trusts from state and local taxation. - Amends TCA Title 46, Chapter 7, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 2, Part 1.
subjects: Labor and Employment|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Animal Control - As introduced, creates an offense for certain felons if such felons own certain dangerous animals within 10 years of release. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 44.

County Officers - As introduced, establishes that the sole educational and experience qualification for the position of highway superintendent in certain counties is a high school education or GED. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 7, Part 1.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, requires the department of education to post teacher effect data by LEA and school in which the teacher is employed on the Internet. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 6.
Livestock - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Arsenic Feeding Law." - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 2 and Title 47, Chapter 18.

Taxes, Sales - As introduced, clarifies that sales tax does not apply to sales of agricultural products from farmer to consumer; specifies that agricultural products includes certain meats and prepared food items containing farm-raised ingredients. - Amends TCA Title 43; Title 44; Title 53 and Title 67.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Milk, Dairy Products - As introduced, specifies that the Dairy Law of the state of Tennessee does not prohibit the independent or partial owner of any hoofed mammal from using products made from the milk from such animal for the owner's personal consumption or other personal use; present law addresses only the milk from such animals. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 3.
Agriculture - As introduced, expands the Dairy Industry Promotion Act to include organic milk and milk products. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 19, Part 1.

Education, Curriculum - As enacted, requires the office of coordinated school health, in the department of education, to report to the general assembly by August 1, 2012, on the implementation of the requirement of each LEA to integrate at least 90 minutes of physical activity per week into the instructional school day for elementary and secondary school students. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

Child Custody and Support - As introduced, enacts the "Equal and Fair Parenting Act," to create a rebuttable presumption that equally shared parenting is the custody arrangement in the best interest of a child. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6, Part 1.

Food and Food Products -  As introduced, requires all poultry processed in this or other states and sold in this state to state whether arsenic was fed to poultry at any time prior to processing. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1 and Title 53, Chapter 1, Part 1.
Agriculture - As introduced, enacts the "Farm Land Protection Act." - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 7; Title 29 and Title 43.

Education - As introduced, provides for re-establishment of elected office of school superintendent for certain counties or cities upon two-thirds vote of governing body; any such ordinance or resolution once approved is not operative until approved in an election; provides for qualifications of candidates. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-203 and Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 3.

Game and Fish Laws - As enacted, creates the commercial fishing advisory committee; requires TWRA to request approval from the Convention for the International Trade of Endangered Species (CITES) to establish a length limit of at least 36 inches and an annual season length no shorter than November 15 to April 15; requires TWRA to develop a plan to study sustainability, population conditions, and juvinal survival rates on waters not currently open to commercial roe fishing. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 2.
subjects: Agriculture and Food|Animal Rights and Wildlife Issues

title: Wine & Wineries - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Farm Winery Law." - Amends TCA Title 57.
Pest Control - As introduced, adds a horticulturist and a person with ornamental lawn and turf experience to the pest control board. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 21.

Municipal Government - As enacted, retains authority for a municipality or municipal agency to participate in, sponsor, conduct, or administer a cooperative purchasing agreement for the procurement of any supplies or any services other than construction, engineering or architectural services or construction materials with one or more other local governments outside of this state but removes authority for such cooperative agreements to be within this state. - Amends TCA Section 12-3-1009.

Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As introduced, requires TCRS divestment of certain holdings. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 24; Title 8, Chapter 34; Title 8, Chapter 35; Title 8, Chapter 36; Title 8, Chapter 37; Title 8, Chapter 5 and Title 9, Chapter 4.
Criminal Offenses - As introduced, enacts the "Animal Fighting Enforcement Act," increasing penalties for certain offenses involving animal fighting. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2.
Land, Agricultural and Open Spaces - As introduced, permits certain entities to limit the liability of a landowner to the entity for certain activities on the landowner's land. - Amends TCA Title 70.
subjects: Agriculture and Food|Municipal and County Issues

title: Public Utilities - As enacted, authorizes increase to the maximum amount of the allowance that may be provided to members of boards of public utilities. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 52, Part 1.

Child Custody and Support - As introduced, entitles either party to a visitation agreement to file a petition for an expedited hearing pursuant to the provisions governing expedited hearings for support and reduces period of time for non-compliance with an order of visitation from six months to three months. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 5 and Title 36, Chapter 6.

Taxes, Privilege - As introduced, requires certain counties that levy a payroll tax to reduce the county real property tax rate in an amount sufficient to offset all revenue derived by the county from such payroll tax; requires certain municipalities that levy a payroll tax to reduce the municipal real property tax rate in an amount sufficient to offset all revenue derived by the municipality from such payroll tax. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 67.

Animal Control - As introduced, creates a Class C misdemeanor offense for owners of certain animals that do not obtain a certificate of completion for an educational course administered by the department of agriculture. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 44.

Traffic Safety - As introduced, requires violations from traffic enforcement cameras to be reviewed by POST-certified officers, rather than employees of law enforcement office; prohibits mailing of notices of such violations by traffic camera vendors. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, creates a per se DUI offense for driving with Schedule I or II drugs in a person's system unless the person has a valid prescription for the Schedule II drug. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title  40 and Title  55.

Immigration - As introduced, requires each LEA to determine each student's, and each health care facility to determine each patient's, citizenship and immigration status; aggregate reports of students and patients to be delivered to general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 49 and Title 68, Chapter 11.
Criminal Offenses - As introduced, creates offenses of use and possession of certain devices with the intent to commit, aid, or abet any unlawful activity. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 1.
Education, Higher - As introduced, designates progress report on Memphis Research Consortium to be annual report to standing committees on education. - Amends TCA Title 49.
