Sales - As introduced, creates pilot project in Shelby County requiring a seller of scrap jewelry or precious metals to give thumbprint on purchaser's transaction log. - Amends TCA Section 38-1-203.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, increases the penalty for knowingly making a false report of child abuse or child sexual abuse from a Class E felony to a Class D felony if at the time the report is made the defendant is a party in a custody or visitation determination, the custody or visitation determination involves the person against whom the report is made, and the report is made for the purpose of delay or to gain advantage in the custody or visitation determination. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6; Title 37, Chapter 1 and Title 39, Chapter 15.

Statutes and Codification - As enacted, authorizes the Tennessee Code Commission to make stylistic, nonsubstantive changes when codifying acts of the general assembly and preparing replacement volumes, so long as such changes are consistent with style guidelines adopted by the commission and submitted to the senate and house judiciary committees. - Amends TCA Section 1-1-108.

Controlled Substances - As enacted, revises various provisions regarding law enforcement access to the controlled substances database and the application process for such access. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 10, Part 3.

Criminal Procedure - As introduced, provides that a federal employee who is not designated as a Tennessee peace officer may not make an arrest or conduct a search and seizure in this state without the written permission of the sheriff of the county in which the arrest, search and seizure will take place except under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 3, Part 1.

Energy - As introduced, requires each owner of a commercial building to have for that building a comprehensive energy audit conducted; notice of the results of such audit shall be displayed to all tenants and potential tenants of the building. - Amends TCA Title 13.
Education - As enacted, requires the state board of education to post the teacher code of ethics on its Web site. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 10.

Bail, Bail Bonds - As enacted, authorizes the use of a duplicate capias for the arrest or surrender of an individual when the clerk is unavailable to provide a certified capias. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 11, Part 1.

Education - As enacted, requires office of research and education accountability to compile activities and recommendations of statewide education reform initiatives and report to governor and education committees as requested. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 1.

Education - As enacted, requires that state board of education mandate revisions to financial literacy education, including as component on certain achievement tests, after recommendations made by financial literacy commission. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 3 and Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 31.

Public Contracts - As enacted, specifies that if a statute, ordinance, resolution, rule or regulation mandates the use of competitive bidding of any kind or nature whatsoever, by any state agency, county or municipal corporation, then no addenda would be permitted less than 48 hours of the bid opening date; questions concerning the bid documents must be received by the designer no less than 96 hours before the bid opening date; not applicable to DOT contracts or state or local agency contracts funded with state or federal highway funds. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 4, Part 1.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As enacted, enacts the "Surplus Lines Insurance Act" and the Surplus Lines Insurance Multi-State Compliance Compact. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 14.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As enacted, authorizes filings for personal risk insurance that provide for an overall statewide rate increase or decrease of no more than 15% in the aggregate for all coverages that are subject to the filing to take effect the date it is filed. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 5.

Professions and Occupations - As enacted, requires the health related boards and the boards attached to the division of regulatory boards to develop a procedure to expedite the licensing or certification of persons who were licensed or certified in another state and accompanied their spouse, who is the subject of a military transfer, to Tennessee; requires regulatory boards to develop methods to allow certain persons to perform professional services for a limited period of time. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 13; Title 62 and Title 68.

Beer - As enacted, applies the hours for the sale of beer on Sunday to the area of the county outside of a municipality that adopts liquor-by-the-drink in a referendum, unless the county legislative body by a 2/3 vote sets the hours for the sale of beer on Sunday in areas outside such municipality. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4 and Title 57, Chapter 5.

Insurance, Health, Accident - As introduced, authorizes the state insurance committee to establish a program under which citizens of Tennessee may buy into and be covered under the same group insurance health care plan offered to all state employees. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27, Part 2.

Revenue, Dept. of - As introduced, increases reasonable fee authorized to be charged by commissioner of revenue to issue revenue letters or revenue rulings from $200 to $250. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 18.

Agriculture - As introduced, requires the commissioner of agriculture to appoint an advisory committee to provide assistance to the commissioner concerning invasive pest plants in Tennessee; the appointments shall be from rural and urban areas of the three grand divisions and the members shall serve without compensation or reimbursement for travel expenditures. - Amends TCA Title 43, Chapter 6, Part 1.

General Assembly - As introduced, subjects members of the general assembly to the same laws as are applicable to elected municipal, county and other local officials enacted in the public interest to provide transparency and accountability in government. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 1.

Election Laws - As introduced, authorizes county election commissions to use ballot-on-demand printers during early voting periods upon a majority vote of the county legislative body approving such use; establishes a standard for the printing of a sufficient number of ballots for any election. - Amends TCA Section 2-20-105.

Jails, Local Lock-ups - As enacted, authorizes $4.00 to be deducted from the wages of prisoners in a county workhouse in certain circumstances to satisfy judgments against the prisoner to make restitution to the victim. - Amends TCA Section 41-2-129(c).
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Legal Issues

title: Dentists and Dentistry - As introduced, provides for a department of health program to augment the provision of adult emergency dental services for indigents. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.

Water - As enacted, requires any public water system or waterworks system that initiates or permanently discontinues the fluoridation of its water supply to give notice of such discontinuance to the departments of health and environment and conservation within 10 days of decision and public notice to customers in the next general mailing, which must be 30 days prior to discontinuance. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 221.

Education, Dept. of - As introduced, requires the department of education to develop an athletic concussion policy for adoption by each LEA and commands insurance companies issuing policies to certain entities for accident coverage to require those entities develop an athletic concussion policy and procedures. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title  56.

Motor Vehicles, Titling and Registration - As introduced, authorizes Davidson County clerk to perform vehicle inspections, and collect a fee up to $37.50 for such inspection, prior to issuing certificate of title for a rebuilt motor vehicle. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 21, Part 7; Title 18, Chapter 6 and Title 55, Chapter 3.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, makes an owner of a potentially vicious or vicious dog who fails to microchip such dog within 30 days of the dog being classified as a potentially vicious or vicious dog subject to a Class C misdemeanor, punishable by fine only. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 44.
Criminal Procedure - As enacted, deletes outdated language from requirements concerning the sex offender registry. - Amends TCA Section 38-6-116.

Bail, Bail Bonds - As introduced, provides that persons who have been convicted of a felony and escaped from confinement or broken terms of bail or probation shall be presumed at substantial risk for willfully failing to appear and require substantial bail. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 11, Part 1 and Title 40, Chapter 30, Part 1.

Orders of Protection - As enacted, removes statutory requirements that law enforcement agencies make order of protection entries into the Tennessee criminal information system; eliminates these entries from the TBI database within two years from the effective date of the act. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6 and Title 71, Chapter 6.

Unemployment Compensation - As enacted, authorizes spouses of military members who leave employment due to military reassignment to qualify for unemployment benefits; requires that state pay such benefits and does not count against employer's experience rating. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.

Alcoholic Beverages - As enacted, makes several additions to present law concerning the sale of alcoholic beverages; expands the definition of "Tennessee River resort district" to include a limited service restaurant located within a jurisdiction that has elected Tennessee River resort district status.  - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4, Part 1.
Alcoholic Beverages - As enacted, provides for the manufacturing and retail sale of high alcohol content beer; revises various provisions of law regarding alcoholic beverages. - Amends TCA Title 57.

Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, authorizes a licensed wholesaler holding a basic permit under the Federal Alcohol Administration Act as an importer to import alcoholic beverages and wine under certain circumstances; permits a licensed wholesaler to deliver alcoholic beverages and wine by common carrier to a retailer only in certain quantities. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 3.

Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, authorizes a manufacturer of intoxicating liquors or drinks in certain localities to be issued a license by the alcoholic beverage commission for on-premises consumption of the liquors or drinks produced at the licensed facility. - Amends TCA Section 57-2-103.

Animal Control - As introduced, requires all owners of dangerous, vicious, and wild animals to secure minimal liability insurance of $100,000 within 60 days from the date the owner knows or should reasonably know that the animal is a dangerous, vicious, or wild animal. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 44.
Sheriffs - As enacted, increases certain fees sheriffs and constables may collect. - Amends TCA Section 8-21-901.

Municipal Government - As enacted, clarifies and updates the language of various provisions of law regarding the powers of incorporated municipalities; generally removes archaic language and comports the powers to be compliant with other general law provisions. - Amends TCA Title 6.
County Government - As introduced, removes restrictions on county redesignating county mayor as county executive; specifies duties for county attorney. - Amends TCA Title 5.

Public Employees - As introduced, requires development and periodical offering of seminars to state employees on financial planning and utilization of state benefits as part of such financial plan. - Amends TCA Title 8.

Campaigns and Campaign Finance - As introduced, clarifies the period of time included in statements filed prior to primary and general elections; clarifies that an unexpended balance of contributions in a deceased candidate's campaign account may be allocated to any institution of public or private education in the state. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

Open Meetings - As introduced, clarifies that any legal authority shall be cited in the written denial of a public records request. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8 and Title 10.

Election Laws - As introduced, increases size of voting precincts from 5,000 registered voters to 6,000 registered voters; requires one voting machine for every 800 registered voters instead of 1,000 voters. - Amends TCA Title 2.

Ethics - As introduced, allows ethics commission or commission staff to provide information on the status of a complaint to the named complainant and to the alleged violator. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10; Title 3, Chapter 6; Title 4, Chapter 55 and Title 8, Chapter 50, Part 5.

Correction, Dept. of - As introduced, requires counties receiving correctional incentive subsidies to submit an accounting of such expenditures to the commissioner; if the facility has not been certified pursuant to state jail standards, prohibits grant of future subsidies unless required expenditures are made; authorizes the commissioner to reimburse counties for actual improvement expenditures. - Amends TCA Title 41.

Constitutional Amendments - Proposes an amendment to clarify the constitutional language that currently prohibits the levying of a tax on any class of income, other than income derived from stocks and bonds, and to prohibit any tax levied on or measured by employer payrolls. -

Redistricting, Legislative - As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography; clarifies provisions concerning districts, terms and vacancies prior to November 2012 elections; clarifies that contiguity by water is sufficient. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-102.
Driver Licenses - As introduced, requires that all written examinations for a driver license or intermediate driver license be in English. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 3.

Railroads - As introduced, authorizes TDOT to employ analysts and economists in addition to other employees to perform duties related to railroad regulation. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 3, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 5.
Landlord and Tenant - As enacted, revises certain provisions of Uniform Landlord and Tenant Act. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 28.

Malpractice - As introduced, provides that tort actions brought against a nursing home, home for the aged or assisted-living facility based upon the provision of health care services is a medical malpractice action and is governed by the provisions of Title 29, Chapter 26. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 26; Title 47, Chapter 18 and Title 68, Chapter 11.
Transportation, Dept. of - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Transportation Challenge Grant Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 2.

Licenses - As introduced, exempts from mortgage lender licensure certain persons who make five or fewer residential mortgage loans in any consecutive 12-month period, and certain licensed real estate brokers. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 13.
Pharmacy, Pharmacists - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Medication Therapy Monitoring and Management Act of 2011" for anti-epileptic drugs. - Amends TCA Title 53.
Pharmacy, Pharmacists - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Medication Therapy Monitoring and Management Act of 2011" for immunosuppressant and anti-epileptic drugs. - Amends TCA Title 53.

General Assembly - As introduced, prohibits a committee of either house from considering, or the chief clerk from referring, a general bill concerning revenue unless it limits statutory changes to only one part of title 67. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 2, Part 1 and Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 51.

Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As enacted, changes the method of selection of trustees of TCRS representing teachers and retired teachers from election by the representative assemblies of the Tennessee Education Association and the Tennessee Retired Teachers Association respectively to appointment by the speakers of the senate and the house; authorizes professional education employees' organizations to recommend persons to the speaker of each chamber of the general assembly for appointment to teacher trustee positions for TCRS.  - Amends TCA Section 8-34-302 and Section 8-34-303.
State Employees - As introduced, requires certain executive branch employees to make financial disclosures. - Amends TCA Title 8.

Driver Licenses - As enacted, subject to funding, authorizes honorably discharged veterans to have language or a symbol indicating their military service placed on their driver license; requires the department of veterans' affairs, in consultation with the department of safety, to develop appropriate language or military symbol. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 3.
Physicians and Surgeons - As introduced, reduces the penalty for unauthorized practice of medicine from a Class B to a Class C misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 63.
Homeland Security - As enacted, enacts the "Material Support to Designated Entities Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 55 and Title 58.

Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As introduced, permits retired firefighter, emergency medical or rescue worker, emergency medical technician, paramedic, state police officer, police officer, sheriff, or deputy sheriff to work no more than 200 days performing services typically performed by such employees and for which such retiree was trained to perform prior to retirement; provided that the retiree will not accrue any additional retirement credit during the retiree's temporary period of employment. - Amends TCA Section 8-36-805.

Employees, Employers - As enacted, prohibits person, firm, corporation or association of any kind operating in this state from executing an agreement with a union or employee organization of any kind that includes a maintenance of membership clause prohibiting employees from withdrawing from a union or employee organization prior to the agreements expiration. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 1, Part 2.

State Employees - As introduced, creates civil penalty for employee engaged in a work stoppage; requires all documentation of labor negotiation with state employee associations be public record; revises other provisions governing state employees and employee associations. - Amends TCA Title  8, Chapter 44; Title  8, Chapter 50 and Title 8, Chapter 23.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, prohibits certain union and employee organization activities. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 11; Title 39, Chapter 14; Title 39, Chapter 16 and Title 39, Chapter 17.
Labor - As enacted, broadens scope of violence in the workplace laws. - Amends TCA Title 20, Chapter 14.
State Employees - As introduced, creates financial disclosure requirements for state employee associations. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 50.

Labor - As introduced, requires a labor or employee organization to obtain prior, voluntary, written approval for use of dues or fees paid by an employee to the organization and specifies other requirements relative to such dues or fees. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 1.

Election Laws - As introduced, requires candidates for president of the United States, as a condition of having the candidate's name appear on the ballot, to file a sworn affidavit with the secretary of state together with certain information to prove the candidate meets the constitutional residency requirements. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 5, Part 2.
Election Laws - As enacted, prohibits election commission members and administrators of elections from hiring relatives for certain election-related positions. - Amends TCA Title 2.
Public Funds and Financing - As introduced, adds step-up bonds and obligations to list of eligible collateral for public depository purposes. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 9, Chapter 5.

Public Funds and Financing - As introduced, authorizes the treasurer to accept as security for public deposits certain governmental bonds containing increases in the interest rate; authorizes the treasurer to discount the face value of such bonds. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 1 and Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 5.

Taxes, Privilege - As enacted, clarifies that a holder of an indebtedness has a duty to collect the tax imposed on the recordation of evidence of the indebtedness and to remit the tax as required by law. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-409.

General Assembly, Studies - As enacted, changes the reporting deadline of the special joint committee to study the capping of utility rates for senior citizens from February 1, 2011, to June 1, 2011. - Amends Chapter 1071 of the Public Acts of 2010.

Evidence - As introduced, restricts a plaintiff from introducing certain evidence of amounts charged by health care providers if the defendant or the defendant's insurer meets certain requirements. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 34, Part 2.
Public Records - As introduced, authorizes expunction of records of certain persons convicted of simple possession before age 21. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 32, Part 1.

Motor Vehicles - As introduced, for family automobiles which secure a debt, authorizes a debtor to petition a chancery court for an order granting the debtor up to 30 days to repay or settle the debt. - Amends TCA Title 47 and Title 55.
Consumer Protection - As introduced, revises certain disclosures relative to time-shares and prohibits certain advertisements. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 32.

Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, allows 20-auditorium, all digital movie theater in Davidson County to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises, if one auditorium is restricted to patrons 21 years of age or older. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.
Aircraft and Airports - As introduced, subjects property and revenues of airport authorities to taxation and requires authority approval for vendor fee increases. - Amends TCA Title 42, Chapter 4.
Business and Commerce - As introduced, clarifies requirements concerning secondhand mattresses sold in this state. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 15, Part 2.

Taxes, Sales - As introduced, reduces from 5.5% to 5% the sales tax on food in fiscal year 2011-2012; reduces the rate from 5% to 4.5% in fiscal year 2012-2013. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Taxes, Sales - As introduced, reduces from 5.5% to 5% the retail sales tax on food and food ingredients. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Taxes, Inheritance Gift - As introduced, requires maximum exemption to be applied against the net estate for inheritance tax purposes to be the same as under federal estate tax law. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8.
subjects: Family and Children Issues|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Contracts - As introduced, clarifies that performance requirements or incentives in contracts or grants between state entities and providers of services related to prevention, treatment or care of delinquent juveniles are allowed to ensure that the initial amount of the grant or contract does not decrease, nor financial penalties accrue to the grant or contract recipients based on performance requirements. - Amends TCA Section 37-5-121.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, adds University of Tennessee System and Board of Regents as recipients of THEC's annual report on scholarship and grant programs data. - Amends TCA Title 49.
Election Laws - As introduced, adds additional requirements to be submitted for certain candidates' names to be placed on the ballot in this state. - Amends TCA Title 2.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, provides that person who commits theft of services may be required to perform debris removal, cleanup, restoration or other necessary physical labor at the location within the area affected by a disaster or emergency, if the offense occurred: during or within 30 days following the occurrence of a tornado, flood, fire, or other disaster or emergency; within the area affected by the disaster or emergency; and when, as a result of the disaster or emergency, the owner of the property taken, or the person charged with custody of the property, is unable to adequately guard, secure or protect the property from theft. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14 and Title 40.

County Officers - As introduced, prohibits county officials' compensation from increasing in any year in which the compensation of other county employees is not increased; prohibits the new federal census figures from being used to increase the compensation of county officials until the salary of other county employees is increased. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 24, Part 1.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, revises the Insurance Producer Licensing Act of 2002 and other provisions pertaining to investigations of insurance producers and insurers. - Amends TCA Title 56.

Taxes, Ad Valorem - As enacted, authorizes property tax relief to surviving spouses of disabled veterans who would have been eligible for relief had the veteran qualified under later amendments to the law. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-704.
Medical Occupations - As introduced, specifies conditions under which collection stations for laboratory specimens that are open to the public must operate. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 29, Part 1.

Air Pollution - As introduced, exempts new and unused motor vehicles of model years of the current calendar year and of any calendar year within two years of such calendar year from motor vehicle inspection requirements. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 1 and Title 68, Chapter 201, Part 1.
Sports - As introduced, enacts the "Youth Sports Safety Act." - Amends TCA Title 49; Title 50 and Title 68.

Workers Compensation - As introduced, modifies the surcharge on premiums for workers' compensation insurance policies issued by an insurance carrier for the administration of TOSHA. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6 and Title 56.

Judicial Officers - As introduced, creates office of solicitor general to defend and prosecute cases in the interest of the state; revises duties of attorney general and reporter. - Amends TCA Title 8.
Taxes, Real Property - As introduced, extends certain property tax assessment remedies for disaster damage. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-604 and Section 67-5-606.
subjects: Housing and Property|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, allows a 16-auditorium movie theater in Davidson County to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises if the theater has one auditorium restricted to patrons 21 years of age or older. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.
Medical Occupations - As enacted, revises law regarding restrictions on physicians' rights following the termination or conclusion of employment. - Amends TCA Section 63-6-204.
Medical Occupations - As introduced, identifies reasons other than breach of contract for which restrictions on employment agreements with physicians are void. - Amends TCA Section 63-6-204.
Newspapers and Publications - As introduced, creates a pilot project in Knox County to allow legal notices to be posted on the Internet rather than in a newspaper. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 21.
Education, Higher - As introduced, requires credit for courses taken at military schools be transferable to public postsecondary educational institutions. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

Public Records - As introduced, authorizes a local government's legislative body to designate certain records as proprietary information, and thereby not subject to public records law. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 10, Chapter 7.
Highways, Roads and Bridges - As introduced, authorizes pregnant females to drive in HOV lanes without additional passengers in the motor vehicle. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-188.
Child Custody and Support - As introduced, creates rebuttable presumption that shared custody is in child's best interest. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6, Part 1.

Business Organizations - As introduced, exempts any new LLCs or foreign LLCs from the initial filing fees associated with articles of organization or other documents filed with the secretary of state; requires an annual fee thereafter. - Amends TCA Title  48, Chapter 249; Title 48, Chapter 246 and Title 48, Chapter 247, Part 1.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As enacted, specifies that provision whereby information contained in a policy application or obtained in the servicing of a policy of insurance may not be used by the servicing carrier or its representatives for the purpose of soliciting any form of insurance, except when permission to use the information is granted by the commissioner on any specific risk, also applies to a policy of insurance written through a plan depopulation initiative. - Amends TCA Title 56.

Consumer Protection - As introduced, prohibits a lessor from charging more than two and a half times the cash price of any merchandise subject to a rental-purchase agreement; requires lessor to keep records of lessor's cost for the merchandise; provides that violation results in the agreement being voided and retention of the merchandise by the consumer. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18.
Taxes, Sales - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee High Growth Sustainable Jobs Act." - Amends TCA Title 50; Title 66 and Title 67.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Health, Dept. of - As introduced, directs the commissioner of health to develop a plan for ensuring that 90 percent of pregnant women in this state have access to prenatal care and to report concerning such plan to the house health and human resources committee and the senate general welfare, health and human resources committee by February 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 56; Title 68 and Title 71.
Credit, Consumer - As introduced, authorizes specified fees relative to deferred presentment services. - Amends TCA Section 45-17-112.

Child Custody and Support - As introduced, entitles either party to a visitation agreement to file a petition for an expedited hearing pursuant to the provisions governing expedited hearings for support and reduces period of time for non-compliance with an order of visitation from six months to three months. - Amends TCA Title  36, Chapter 6 and Title 36, Chapter 5.

Education - As enacted, deletes certain provisions regarding Tennessee Challenge 2000; implements certain reporting requirements on THEC regarding an education fact book; revises certain other provisions relating to THEC and higher education. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 49.
Schools, Charter - As introduced, allows cities that do not operate city school systems to sponsor charter schools. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.
Tort Liability and Reform - As introduced, defines Fairfield Glade as a governmental entity under the Governmental Tort Liability Act. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 20.

Civil Procedure - As enacted, increases the auctioneer's fee for sale of real property at public sale under any order or decree of any court from 6 percent to 8 percent.
 - Amends TCA Section 35-5-112.
subjects: Legal Issues|Civil Liberties and Civil Rights

title: Guardianship - As introduced, allows certain fiduciaries and related persons to purchase property of a minor or disabled person without court approval when it is done by public auction. - Amends TCA Section 34-1-116.

Taxes, Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, requests the commissioner of revenue to explore the possibility of developing an on-line filing system which would permit the automatic deduction from the collectors business account for the payment of the tax due on sales of mixed drinks and setups upon the filing of the monthly statement by the collector where the collector has supplied the commissioner with the collectors bank account number, the bank transit routing symbols and number and an authorized signature as filed with the payee bank. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-410.
Child Custody and Support - As introduced, requires fees over $500 collected for child support be paid by obligor and recipient of the child support payments. - Amends TCA Title 36.
Agriculture - As introduced, requires plants and seeds sold in Tennessee to be labeled to indicate open pollination, genetic modification, or hybridization. - Amends TCA Title 43.
Animal Control - As introduced, requires owners of Class I wildlife in Roane County to attach tracking devices to the animals. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 4.

Harriman - As introduced, subject to local approval, permits the city of Harriman to raise its occupancy tax from a rate not to exceed 5 percent to a rate not to exceed 7 percent. - Amends Chapter 115 of the Private Acts of 1995.

Real Property - As introduced, increases from three to four years the time period an owner must not have resided at transferred property to be exempt from residential property disclosure. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 5.

Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, removes authority from the department of agriculture to regulate or inspect a distillery or wholesaler of alcoholic beverages. - Amends TCA Title 43; Title 53 and Title 57.
Sunset Laws - As introduced, creates sunrise provision for commission of Indian affairs, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 34, Part 1.
Real Estate Agents and Brokers - As introduced, deletes requirement that executive director of the real estate commission have passed the broker's examination. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 13.

Divorce,  Annulment and Alimony - As introduced, authorizes defendant in divorce case to request one automatic recusal of the judge assigned to hear the case. - Amends TCA Title 17; Title 20 and Title 36, Chapter 4.

Child Custody and Support - As introduced, authorizes man who has paid child support for a child who is not his biological child to recover such child support from the biological father. - Amends TCA Section 36-2-309.
Election Laws - As introduced, calls for a run-off election in the event that there is a tie for county or civil district office. - Amends TCA Title 2.
Child Custody and Support - As introduced, authorizes parent or guardian who pays for supervision of child visitation to select provider of supervision services. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6.
Domestic Violence - As introduced, requires a petitioner for order of protection to pay court costs and attorney fees if the petition is dismissed. - Amends TCA Title 36.
Domestic Relations - As introduced, authorizes use of discovery to aid in defense of petition for protective order. - Amends TCA Title 19; Title 20; Title 36, Chapter 3 and Title 40.

Motor Vehicles, Titling and Registration - As introduced, authorizes licensing of certain all terrain vehicles (ATVs); allows local governments to authorize use of such ATVs on certain public highways. - Amends TCA Title 55.

Child Custody and Support - As introduced, prohibits changing of custodial arrangements due to an order of protection against the custodial parent unless the child is the victim of child abuse or the effects of domestic violence. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6.
Judges and Chancellors - As introduced, requires election of all judges, including appellate and supreme court judges. - Amends TCA Title 17.

Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, expands the definition of historic performing arts center to permit the sale of alcoholic beverages and wine at the Relix Variety Theatre located in the downtown north redevelopment zone of Knoxville. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.
Therapists, Physical and Occupational - As introduced, requires the board of physical therapy to meet not less than quarterly. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 13.

Handgun Permits - As introduced,  exempts any person who has successfully completed all handgun training of not less than four hours as required by any branch of the military from paying the $115 handgun carry permit application and processing fee. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

Funeral Directors and Embalmers - As introduced, requires hard or electronic copies of pre-need contracts and pre-need insurance arrangements be maintained; deletes prohibition against promises of a rebate, discount or reduction in price upon the death of any person. - Amends TCA Section 62-5-409 and Section 62-5-411.

Traffic Safety - As introduced, requires local governing body of municipalities or counties to approve location of each traffic enforcement camera placed or located within such jurisdiction after July 1, 2011; establishes penalty up to $50.00 plus court costs. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.
Election Laws - As introduced, revises the requirements to become a "statewide political party" and requires voters to register as a statewide political party affiliate.  - Amends TCA Title 2.

Motor Vehicles - As introduced, requires nonresidents, 21 years of age or older, operating a motorcycle registered in another state to comply with mandatory motorcycle equipment laws from state in which motorcycle is registered. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 9, Part 3.

Motor Vehicles - As introduced, exempts from requirement to wear a helmet while riding a motorcycle nonresidents, 21 years of age or older, from states that do not require motorcycle helmets. - Amends TCA Section 55-9-302.

Financial Responsibility Law - As introduced, increases penalty for failing to provide evidence of financial responsibility from $100 fine to $250 fine for first offense and $500 fine and mandatory impoundment of driver's motor vehicle for second or subsequent offense. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12; Title 55, Chapter 16 and Title 55, Chapter 4.

Banks and Financial Institutions - As introduced, requires that the loan limit prescribed for state banks take into consideration the credit exposure to derivative transactions. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 2.

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As introduced, prohibits any private act hospital from conditioning receipt of medical staff privileges at such hospital or an affiliate of such hospital on any economic criteria unrelated to quality of care or professional competence. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 56 and Title 68.

Civil Procedure - As enacted, revises provisions governing description of property in notice of judicial or trust sale; authorizes the postponement and rescheduling of a foreclosure sale without further newspaper publication under certain circumstances, unless prohibited by contract. - Amends TCA Title 35, Chapter 5.
subjects: Legal Issues|Civil Liberties and Civil Rights

title: Clerks, Court - As enacted, transfers the probate court clerking responsibilities in Blount County from the county clerk to the clerk and master. - Amends TCA Section 18-6-106.
Election Laws - As introduced, prohibits spending of public funds on the support or opposition of any referendum. - Amends TCA Title 2.

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As introduced, requires the comptroller of the treasury to review the land acquisition of any hospital authority to determine whether such acquisition would negatively impact businesses in the surrounding area, including but not limited to, health care related businesses. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 56 and Title 68.

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As introduced, requires that on or after July 1, 2011, if any private act hospital authority operates ambulance service and such ambulance service carries forward a net operating deficit for two consecutive calendar years, such ambulance service shall be subject to general procurement laws. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 56 and Title 68.
Business Organizations - As introduced, revises various provisions relative to business organizations. - Amends TCA Title 48 and Title 61.

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As introduced, requires the department of health to make available for public inspection all federal return of organization exempt from income tax (Form 990) for all private act hospital authorities in this state. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 56 and Title 68.

Business Organizations - As enacted, clarifies various provisions relative to business organizations and revises various provisions regarding documents from such organizations that are filed with the secretary of state. - Amends TCA Title 48 and Title 61.
Taxes, Real Property - As introduced, limits increase in value of certain real property. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.
subjects: Housing and Property|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As introduced, establishes provisions governing the employment of physicians by licensed nursing homes and their affiliates. - Amends TCA Section 63-6-204 and Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.

Vital Records - As introduced, changes definitions of certificate of birth and birth certificate; requires verification documentation for issuance of birth certificates; prohibits issuance of birth certificates or disclosure of certain birth information in situations where verification documentation is not presented. - Amends TCA Title 1 and Title 68.

Tort Liability and Reform - As introduced, creates an advisory council that shall study the potential impact of tort reform measures on anticompetitive activities engaged in by hospitals, insurance companies and health care professionals and whether or not such impact, if any, would increase or decrease the overall cost of healthcare in this state. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 24; Title 25 and Title 29.
Malpractice - As introduced, establishes requirements for skilled nursing facility liability actions. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 26.

Election Laws - As introduced, requires persons registering to vote to provide certain identification  upon registering in an election commission office or upon voting for the first time. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 2.

Financial Responsibility Law - As introduced, requires person with two or more convictions for driving under the influence to maintain double the amount of liability insurance, deposit of cash, or bond filed with the commissioner of safety in order to comply with financial responsibility laws. - Amends TCA Title 55.

Motor Vehicles - As introduced, increases penalty for leaving the scene of an accident when a minor child is injured from Class A misdemeanor to Class E felony. - Amends TCA Title  39; Title  40 and Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 1.
Election Laws - As introduced, requires 10 percent of registered voters in district to recall municipal office holder if district smaller than the municipality. - Amends TCA Section 2-5-151.

Taxes, Business - As introduced, returns administration and collection of the business privilege tax to county clerks and designated city officials in Shelby, Davidson, Knox, and Hamilton counties. - Amends TCA Section 50-6-904 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 7.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Securities - As enacted, broadens transaction exemptions under the Tennessee Securities Act of 1980. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 2.

Domestic Violence - As introduced, requires victim of domestic violence filing for order of protection and respondent to attend one hour of domestic violence counseling prior to hearing on the order; requires costs of counseling to be assessed against the respondent in certain cases. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6.

Orders of Protection - As introduced, authorizes a court to order a first time violator of an order of protection to attend counseling and pay for such counseling, in addition to optional counseling for the victim; authorizes a court to order a $3,000 fine for each subsequent violation in addition to other penalties. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.

Lottery,  Corporation - As introduced, eliminates state lottery January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 17, Part 1; Title 4, Chapter 31; Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 8, Chapter 4; Title 9, Chapter 4; Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 5; Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 6; Section 39-15-413 and Title 49.

Taxes, Ad Valorem - As introduced, prohibits the back assessment of property taxes on any growing crops owned by certain entities; clarifies that growing crops includes pine plantations and saplings. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 10; Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 2; Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 6 and Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 8.
Taxes, Sales - As introduced, deletes the retail sales tax imposed on food and food ingredients. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Insurance, Health, Accident - As introduced, permits a dependent spouse to acknowledge receipt of notice by written acknowledgement if not as provided under the Tennessee Rules of Civil Procedure. - Amends TCA Section 56-7-2366.
Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, exempts from sales tax certain baby items intended for traveling, feeding, and daily living. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

Tort Liability and Reform - As introduced, clarifies that a landowner who gives permission for use of land for recreational purposes owes no duty to the participant to give notice of hazardous conditions or to keep premises safe for such use except for known hazards or owner's gross negligence. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 7.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, increases penalty for disorderly conduct within 500 feet of a funeral or memorial service from Class C misdemeanor to Class B misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 3.
Election Laws - As introduced, allows student attending a state university to use student identification card as evidence of identification. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7.
Election Laws - As introduced, allows early voting for regular November election starting August 15 instead of 20 days before election day. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 6, Part 1.
General Assembly, Studies - As introduced, creates special joint committee to study establishing grant program to assist first-time home buyers in economically distressed areas. -

State Government - As introduced, makes a one-time reduction to the total amount of health insurance benefits paid on behalf of current and former legislators, and administrative department heads and executive officials in the executive branch, by $100 million; effective July 1, 2011, for former members and executive officials; effective at the election of 108th general assembly for current members. - Amends TCA Title 8.

Taxes, Gasoline, Petroleum Products - As introduced, requires commissioner of TDOT to provide status report on certain highway projects to the chairmen of the transportation committees of the house and senate by November 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 67.

Tennessee Regulatory Authority - As introduced, permits certain utilities providing water to only initiate a rate proceeding once every six years; provides that books, records and documents that authority has access to for rate regulation for certain utilities providing water are considered public records. - Amends TCA Title 65.
subjects: State Agencies|Federal, State, and Local Relations

title: General Assembly, Studies - As introduced, creates special joint committee to study the delivery of community services by various agencies. -

Tort Liability and Reform - As introduced, adds additional restrictions on the use of tax revenues relative to obligations involving the Tennessee Governmental Tort Liability Act. - Amends TCA Section 29-20-402.
Public Records - As introduced, removes confidentiality of certain nonprofit entity records concerning contractors. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 10.
Parks, Natural Areas Preservation - As introduced, designates the Pigeon River as a Class II Scenic River under the Tennessee Scenic Rivers Act of 1968. - Amends TCA Title 11, Chapter 13, Part 1.

Sunset Laws - As introduced, deletes references to defunct commission of Indian affairs. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 4, Chapter 34; Section 11-6-116; Section 15-2-106 and Section 68-24-701.
Highways, Roads and Bridges - As introduced, expands purposes for which hot mix asphalt produced by local governments can be used. - Amends TCA Section 12-8-101.

Flags - As enacted, authorizes display of P.O.W.-M.I.A. flag at state capitol and each county courthouse and city or town hall on any day U.S. flag is displayed at such buildings. - Amends TCA Title 58, Chapter 4, Part 3.
Trade Regulation - As introduced, declares certain goods that are made in Tennessee are not subject to the commerce clause of the federal constitution. - Amends TCA Title 4.

Education - As introduced, permits, on a case-by-case basis, a child who has not reached five years of age by September 30 to enter school, if a parent requests early entrance and the LEA determines early entrance is in the best interest of the child. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, deletes references to defunct fireworks advisory council. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Section 68-104-216.

Pharmacy, Pharmacists - As introduced, requires the department of commerce and insurance to cooperate fully with the department of health in all aspects of the transfer of the board of pharmacy and the long term effects of such transfer including prompt submission of any requested documents or records. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 1; Title  56, Chapter 7, Part 31; Title 56, Chapter 57; Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 32 and Title 63.

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As introduced, permits a city or county that owns all or some portion of real or personal property used to provide health care to sell the asset and use the proceeds as it sees fit, without any notice to the attorney general and reporter; authorization applies only if city or county opts in. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 62.

Employees, Employers - As introduced, prohibits any local legislative body from negotiating with local police association or fireman association concerning the terms or conditions of professional service if no local boards of education are allowed to negotiate with a professional employees' organization or teachers' union concerning the terms or conditions of professional service. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 49; Title 50 and Title 68.
Taxes, Sales - As introduced, makes certain adjustments to statutes pertaining to sales and use taxes. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-103 and Section 67-6-202.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Sunset Laws - As enacted, deletes references to defunct Tennessee Alzheimer's disease task force. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 71, Chapter 2.

Schools, Charter - As enacted, revises various provisions of law regarding public charter schools, including provisions regarding the governing body of a public charter school, public charter school applications, and funding for public charter schools. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, requires Tennessee higher education commission to provide data in its annual report on the rate at which students receiving scholarships and grants pursuant to this part graduate. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 17; Title 4, Chapter 31; Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 5 and Title 49.

Tennessee Higher Education Commission - As introduced, changes from December 1 to February 1 the date by which the commission shall triennially report its findings of the study of independent nonprofit colleges and universities. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Education - As enacted, removes authorization for the commissioner of education to remove from office any local board of education member who fails to attend the annual training as prescribed by the state board of education.  - Amends TCA Title 49.
Boards and Commissions - As introduced, repeals creating authority for Watkins Institute commission. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Section 49-50-701.

Banks and Financial Institutions - As introduced, limits the amount of the handling charge assessed to not more than the amount of the check, draft, or order if such instrument is less than $30.00. - Amends TCA Section 47-29-102.

Banks and Financial Institutions - As introduced, requires payor banks to process items sequentially as indicated by the numbers on the bank drafts on the day items are charged against a customer's account; places limits on handling charges for insufficient funds if items are not processed sequentially. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 4, Part 4.

Private Protective Services - As enacted, repeals sunset provision and creating authority for the private protective services advisory committee. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Section 62-35-129.
Taxes, Hotel Motel - As introduced, lowers maximum rate that municipalities are authorized to charge for hotel occupancy tax from 5% to 4%. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title  67.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Consumer Protection - As enacted, specifies the manner of obtaining fingerprints of certain applicants under the Uniform Debt-Management Services Act. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 55.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As enacted, specifies that all records containing the results of individual teacher evaluations administered pursuant to the policies, guidelines, and criteria adopted by the state board of education would be treated as confidential and would not be open to the public; specifies that the LEA, public charter school, state board of education, or department of education may access and utilize such records as required to fulfill their lawful functions. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, repeals the public livestock market board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29.

Bond Issues - As introduced, authorizes the state of Tennessee, acting by resolution of its funding board, to issue and sell its interest-bearing bonds and bond anticipation notes for certain purposes. -

Mortgages - As enacted, revises various provisions related to the notice of the right to foreclose that must be sent by the lender to the debtor prior to foreclosure; effective January 1, 2013, deletes certain notice requirements. - Amends TCA Section 35-5-117.
Tourism - As enacted, enacts the "Tourism Development Authority Act." - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 67.

Boards and Commissions - As introduced, makes permissive instead of mandatory the provisions for the Home Builders Association of Tennessee, Inc. submitting list of recommended persons to the governor and the governor consulting with the association about its recommendations prior to the governor making appointment to the state board for licensing contractors. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Section 62-6-104.

Military - As introduced, authorizes the governor to proclaim a statewide day of mourning for any member of the armed services who dies as a result of injuries sustained from a service connected, combat-related cause. - Amends TCA Section 4-1-406.

Polk County - As introduced, subject to local approval, revises procedure for determining the tax on the privilege of participating in an amusement; to be determined annually by the county legislative body in accordance with established criteria, rather than imposing a set fee. - Amends Chapter 2 of the Private Acts of 1981; as amended.

Sunset Laws - As introduced, creates sunrise provision for the judicial council, June 30, 2013; revises provisions governing legislative oversight authority of council. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 16, Chapter 21, Part 1.

Public Employees - As introduced, prohibits personnel from MTAS, CTAS, the state planning office, regional development districts or human resource agencies from assisting state or local government in the selection process for professional services. -

Water Authorities - As introduced, authorizes instead of requires that governor select members of water quality control board from lists of nominees submitted by Tennessee Conservation League, county services association, Farm Bureau, TML, Tennessee Automotive Association and Tennessee Association of Business. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Section 69-3-104.
Mortgages - As introduced, requires mortgage counselor be consulted before an adjustable rate mortgage can be completed. - Amends TCA Title 47.

Solid Waste Disposal - As introduced, authorizes instead of requires that governor select members of solid waste disposal control board from lists of nominees submitted by Tennessee Manufacturers Association, public higher education institutions, Tennessee Environmental Council, county services association, Farm Bureau, TML and Tennessee Automotive Association. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Section 68-211-111.

School Districts, Special - As introduced, under certain circumstances, requires the schools within certain abolished special school districts to be included within the department of education's achievement school district, and requires such schools to be managed and governed accordingly.  - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 5.

Boards and Commissions - As introduced, authorizes instead of requires that governor select members of the petroleum underground storage tank board from lists of nominees submitted by the Tennessee Association of Business, Tennessee Petroleum Council, Tennessee Oil Marketers Association, Tennessee Environmental Council and Tennessee Municipal League; requires governor to consult with such entities prior to making appointments. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Section 68-215-112.

Election Laws - As enacted, allows city of New Market to permit nonresident property owners to vote in municipal elections upon 2/3 approval of municipal legislative body. - Amends TCA Section 6-53-102.

Veterinarians - As introduced, requires governor to consult with Tennessee Veterinary Medical Association, which under current law may recommend licensed doctors of veterinary medicine and licensed veterinary technicians for appointment to the board, prior to making appointments to board of veterinary medical examiners. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Section 63-12-104.
Appropriations - As introduced, makes appropriations to defray the costs of certain enactments of the 2011 annual session of the 107th General Assembly. -

Bond Issues - As introduced, authorizes the state of Tennessee, acting by resolution of its funding board, to issue and sell its interest-bearing bonds and bond anticipation notes for certain purposes. -

Taxes - As enacted, revises various provisions of law governing taxes, including certain sales tax and franchise/excise tax credit provisions. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 49; Title 55; Title 57 and Title 67.

Taxes - As enacted, revises various tax provisions including provisions regarding gains on sales of assets designated as goodwill and Class VII assets, local option taxes with respect to industrial and farm machinery, sales tax credits to dealers, and electronic tax return filings and payments. - Amends TCA Title 55; Title 67 and Chapter 1134 of the Public Acts of 2010.

Optometry - As introduced, clarifies that governor is authorized, but not required, to make appointments to the board of optometry from lists of nominees provided by the Tennessee Optometric Association. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Section 63-8-105.

Taxes - As enacted, delays effective date of certain streamlined sales tax provisions until July 1, 2013; specifies that if the headquarters staff employee position does not remain filled during the investment period, the taxpayer must repay any franchise tax credit or refund taken relating to such position, plus interest; extends certain filing deadlines when due date falls on legal holiday. - Amends TCA Title 67; and Chapter 530 of the Public Acts of 2009 and Chapter 602 of the Public Acts of 2007.

Tennessee Regulatory Authority - As introduced, decreases from four to three the number of directors for the authority by removing position presently filled by joint agreement among the governor, the speaker of the senate and the speaker of the house of representatives. - Amends TCA Title 65.
subjects: State Agencies|Federal, State, and Local Relations

title: Civil Procedure - As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Civil Justice Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 27; Title 29 and Title 47.
subjects: Legal Issues|Civil Liberties and Civil Rights

title: Schools, Charter - As enacted, revises various provisions regarding charter schools, including provisions governing students eligible to attend; removes caps on number of public charter schools. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.
Education, Dept. of - As introduced, revises requirements to be commissioner of education to only require the commissioner to have a bachelor's degree. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3.

Education, Dept. of - As introduced, removes the requirement that if the commissioner of education ceases to be the commissioner, then such former commissioner must remain a member of the teacher evaluation advisory committee until the committee ceases to exist. - Amends TCA Section 49-1-302.

Education - As introduced, clarifies that a manager of a school placed in the achievement school district will determine whether a teacher may continue "employment," instead of "teaching," at the school. - Amends TCA Section 49-1-614.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As enacted, changes date by which assignments for the following school year and notices of termination must be sent to school personnel from May 15 to June 15; specifies that director of schools must decide if a teacher is qualified for an open position; changes various requirements for obtaining tenure and other tenure-related provisions. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As enacted, enables students who first received the Tennessee HOPE scholarship, HOPE access grant or HOPE scholarship for nontraditional students in the fall semester 2009 or thereafter, to receive such lottery-funded scholarships and grants in the summer semester, in addition to the fall and spring semesters; revises the law on terminating events for the HOPE scholarship or access grant. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4.

Surveyors - As introduced, authorizes instead of requires that the governor select members of board of land survey examiners from lists of nominees submitted by Tennessee Association of Professional Surveyors. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Section 62-18-103 and Section 62-18-104.

Motor Vehicles, Titling and Registration - As introduced, increases the grace period for active military members stationed outside of continental United States to renew vehicle registrations from "14 days" to "30 days" after the member's return to the state; revises when a registration plate must be attached to the rear of a truck. - Amends TCA Title 55; Title 65 and Title 66.

Driver Licenses - As enacted, creates exception for commercial driver license holders and violations occurring in a commercial motor vehicle to the prohibition on the department of safety suspending a driver license for failing to appear in court on a traffic citation unless the request for suspension is made within six months of the violation. - Amends TCA Section 55-50-502(a)(1)(l).

Criminal Procedure - As enacted, authorizes a court to order defendants who are in custody and are found not guilty by reason of insanity of a felony offense against the person, such as felony sex offenses, assaults, kidnappings, and robberies, to remain in custody after the verdict to receive an outpatient mental health evaluation. - Amends TCA Section 33-7-303(a).

Intellectual & Developmental Disabilities - As enacted, redefines "developmental disability"; makes technical changes to reflect changes made by 2010 Public Chapters 734 and 1100. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 4; Title 5; Title 8; Title 10; Title 12; Title 13; Title 33; Title 37; Title 40; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, Chapter 6.

Drugs, Over the Counter - As introduced, specifies that authorization for commissioner of health to remove non-narcotic, over the counter drugs from schedule of dangerous drugs does not apply to non-exempt products containing an immediate methamphetamine precursor that must be kept behind the pharmacy counter. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-403.

Juvenile Offenders - As enacted, specifies proper venue for proceedings in which a child who is in the custody of the department of children's services is alleged to be unruly. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-111.

Public Health - As introduced, specifies that assistance under the program for the care and treatment of persons suffering from hemophilia would be subject to availability of funds. - Amends TCA Title 68.

Banks and Financial Institutions - As enacted, adds the conference of state bank supervisors and the money transmitter regulators association to list of entities to which the department of financial institutions may release confidential information concerning licensees and applicants, if such organizations enter into confidentiality agreements with the commissioner. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 7.

Commerce and Insurance, Dept. of - As enacted, authorizes the commissioner to require assignments of independent review organizations on a random basis if random assignments are required by the U.S. department of health and human services.  - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 61.

Insurance, Health, Accident - As enacted, removes provisions regarding the small employer carrier committee and risk-assuming and reinsuring carriers under the Tennessee Small Employer Group Health Coverage Reform Act and rewrites law regarding accident and sickness insurance rates. - Amends TCA Title 56.

Funeral Directors and Embalmers - As introduced, authorizes instead of requires that governor select some members of board of funeral directors and embalmers from lists of nominees submitted by Tennessee Funeral Directors Association and Tennessee Funeral Directors and Morticians Association. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Section 62-5-201.
Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As enacted, enacts the "Revised Tennessee Captive Insurance Act." - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 13.
Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As enacted, extends the tax on intermediate care facilities for the mentally retarded to July 15, 2013. - Amends TCA Section 68-11-830.

Boards and Commissions - As introduced, authorizes instead of requires that governor select psychologist members of board of examiners in psychology from lists of nominees submitted by Tennessee Psychological Association, and select psychological examiner and senior psychological examiner board members from lists provided by Tennessee Association of Psychological Examiners. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Section 63-11-102.
Workers Compensation - As enacted, revises various provisions of workers' compensation law regarding construction services providers. - Amends TCA Title 50 and Title 56.

Audiologists and Speech Pathologists - As introduced, authorizes instead of requires that governor select the physician member of the board of communication disorders and sciences from list of nominees provided by Academy of Otolaryngology. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Section 63-17-104.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As enacted, provides that the marketing, sale, offering for sale, issuance, making, proposing to make and administration of a service contract shall not be construed to be the business of insurance and shall be exempt from regulation as insurance pursuant to title 56. - Amends TCA Title 56.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the Tennessee medical laboratory board, June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 29, Part 1.

Budget Procedures - As introduced, directs the department of revenue and the department of finance and administration to promptly furnish certain information required for the state funding board to estimate state revenues for the upcoming fiscal year. - Amends TCA Section 9-4-5202.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the Tennessee medical examiner advisory council, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 38, Chapter 7, Part 2.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the Tennessee auctioneer commission, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 62, Chapter 19, Part 1.

Welfare - As introduced, requires the department of human services to expend at least 2 percent of the Child Care and Development Funds block grant on activities to improve the quality of child care. - Amends TCA Section 71-3-502.

Election Laws - As enacted, requires a voter to present qualified photographic identification before voting; voters without proper identification will be allowed to cast provisional ballots. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7, Part 1.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the state election commission, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 11, Part 1 and Title 4, Chapter 29.
State Government - As introduced, prohibits requiring vendors with the state of Tennessee to waive any legal remedies against the state. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 12.

Claims Commission, Tennessee - As introduced, tolls statute of limitations for filing claim against state employee with claims commission as of the date suit is filed or criminal prosecution instituted in which claimant and employee or employee's agency participate. - Amends TCA Section 9-8-402.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Legal Issues

title: Administrative Procedure (UAPA) - As introduced, requires certain government-run proceedings that impose sanctions against a licensed entity to include notice and a hearing before an administrative law judge, and further clarifies that such licensed entity does not have to waive such rights when contracting with the state. - Amends TCA Section 4-5-320.

Boards and Commissions - As introduced, authorizes board of claims to determine claims for compensation by persons granted declaratory judgments for state agency's termination of program participation without compliance with rulemaking process. - Amends TCA Section 9-8-108.

Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends termination date for the state board of education to June 30, 2013; directs the division of state audit in the office of the comptroller of the treasury to provide its findings to the house and senate government operations committees by July 1, 2013, on the state board of education's responses to the findings and recommendations in the January, 2011, performance audit of the state board of education. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 3.

Local Education Agencies - As introduced, converts the three ex officio members of a Section 49-2-502 transitional planning commission from voting to non-voting members. - Amends Chapter 1 of the Public Acts of 2011.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the real estate commission, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 62, Chapter 13.

Local Education Agencies - As introduced, urges the respective appointing authorities, in making appointments to a transition planning commission, to ensure that appointments reflect the ethnic and gender demographic makeup of their respective jurisdictions. - Amends Chapter 1 of the Public Acts of 2011.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the real estate appraiser commission, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 62, Chapter 39, Part 2.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the emergency medical services board, June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 140, Part 5.

Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends termination date for the department of education to June 30, 2013; requires the division of audit in the comptroller's office to provide its findings to the house and senate government operations committees by July 1, 2013, on the department's responses to the findings and recommendations in the January 2011 performance audit of the department. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29, Part 2 and Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 8.
Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, revises licensing requirements for surplus lines agents. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 14 and Title 56, Chapter 6.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the council on children's mental health care, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29, Part 2 and Title 37, Chapter 3, Part 1.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the council for hearing instrument specialists, June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 17, Part 2.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the committee for clinical perfusionists, June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Section 63-28-112.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the board of pharmacy, June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 10, Part 3.

Capital Punishment - As introduced, provides that a person who had severe and persistent mental illness at the time of committing murder in the first degree cannot be executed but may be sentenced to life imprisonment or life without parole. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 2.

Mortgages - As introduced, exempts from licensure:  individuals making five or fewer mortgage loans within the same 12-month period and sellers who receive one or more mortgages, deeds of trust, or other security instruments as security for a purchase money obligation. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 13.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the board of nursing, June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 7, Part 2.
Schools, Charter - As introduced, opens enrollment in charter schools to all students eligible to enroll in Tennessee public schools. - Amends TCA Title 49.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the board of examiners for nursing home administrators, June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 16, Part 1.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the board of examiners for architects and engineers, June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 62, Chapter 2, Part 2.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the board of dietitian/nutritionist examiners, June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 25, Part 1.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the alcoholic beverage commission, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 57, Chapter 1, Part 1.

Revenue, Dept. of - As introduced, requires annual report to the general assembly as to participation in the Local Tourism Development Zone Business Tax Act. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 88, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 30.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the air pollution control board, June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 201, Part 1.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the Four Lake regional industrial developmental authority, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 64, Chapter 5, Part 2.

Lobbying, Lobbyists - As introduced, repeals provision prohibiting persons registered as lobbyists from serving as members on certain state boards, commissions, committees and councils. - Amends TCA Section 50-6-121; Section 57-1-102; Title 62; Title 63 and Title 64.
