title: Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the department of finance and administration, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 1 and Title 4, Chapter 29.

Hazardous Materials - As introduced, expands period, from 15 to 30 days, for interested persons to be notified by the division of radiological health prior to the issuance of a permit to or hearing an appeal from radioactive waste processors. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 68.
Interstate Compacts - As enacted, creates sunrise provision for the interstate insurance product regulation compact. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 56, Chapter 58, Part 1.
Statutes and Codification - As enacted, codifies the acts of the 2010 legislative session. -
Sunset Laws - As introduced, extends energy efficient schools council, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Section 49-17-103.
Sunset Laws - As introduced, reduces termination date for board of dispensing opticians, from June 30, 2015 to June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 14, Part 1.
Sunset Laws - As introduced, revises termination date for board of physical therapy from June 30, 2014 to June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 13, Part 3.
Sunset Laws - As introduced, revises termination date for board of athletic trainers from June 30, 2016 to June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 24, Part 1.
Dams - As introduced, enacts the "Safe Dams Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 11.

Dentists and Dentistry - As introduced, requires the governor to consult with the Tennessee Dental Association prior to making appointments to the board of dentistry. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Section 63-5-103.
Sunset Laws - As introduced, extends the wildlife resources commission, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 70, Chapter 1, Part 2.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the West Fork Drakes Creek dam and reservoir interstate authority, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 64, Chapter 1, Part 9.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the water and wastewater operators, board of certification, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 221, Part 9.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the Tennessee wars commission, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 11, Part 5 and Title 4, Chapter 29.
Sunset Laws - As introduced, extends the Tennessee motor vehicle commission, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 55, Chapter 17, Part 1.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the Tennessee health information committee, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 56, Chapter 2, Part 1.
Sunset Laws - As introduced, extends the cemetery advisory board, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 46, Chapter 1, Part 3.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the civil service commission, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 8, Chapter 30, Part 1.

Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the commission on aging, June 30, 2016; requires the division of state audit to return to the Tennessee commission on aging and disability in 2012 to review actions taken by the commission to address the monitoring issues raised in the first finding in the January 2011 performance audit report. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title  71, Chapter 2, Part 1.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the commission on children and youth, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 37, Chapter 3, Part 1.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the committee for purchase from the blind and other severely disabled, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 71, Chapter 4, Part 7.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends conservation commission, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 11, Chapter 2, Part 1.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the archaeological advisory council, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title  11, Chapter 6, Part 1.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the board of boiler rules, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 122, Part 1.
Sunset Laws - As introduced, extends the board of medical examiners, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title  63, Chapter 6, Part 1.

Redistricting, Legislative - As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography; clarifies provisions concerning districts, terms and vacancies prior to November 2012 elections; clarifies that house districts are not affected by reapportionment of county legislative bodies. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.

Traffic Safety - As introduced, requires notices of citations based on surveillance cameras to include opportunity to view photographic or video evidence; exempts certain motor vehicles from such violations; requires reporting by cities and counties operating traffic enforcement camera programs. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.
Sunset Laws - As introduced, extends the board of respiratory care, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 27, Part 1.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the bureau of ethics and campaign finance, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 55, Part 1.

Franklin County - As introduced, subject to local approval, increases the hotel motel tax from an amount not to exceed 5% to an amount not to exceed 7%. - Amends Chapter 219 of the Private Acts of 1988.

Taxes, Sales - As introduced, exempts sale of food and food ingredients, except prepared food, alcoholic beverages, candy, dietary supplements, and tobacco, from state sales and use taxation beginning January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

title: Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the interstate compact on the placement of children, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 37, Chapter 4, Part 2.

Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the human rights commission, June 30, 2013; requires the division of state audit to return to the human rights commission on November 1, 2011, to review actions taken by the commission to address the internal control issues raised in the fourth finding in the April 2011 performance audit report. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21, Part 2 and Title 4, Chapter 29.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the elevator and amusement device safety board, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 121, Part 1.
Education - As introduced, establishes a Tennessee civil rights education commission. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8 and Title 49.

Campaigns and Campaign Finance - As introduced, permits a candidate who has been assessed a civil penalty by the registry of election finance in an amount in excess of $5,000 to make installment payments; requires ouster proceedings be initiated if after the qualifying deadline the candidate fails to make payments in accordance with the agreement entered into with the registry. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 8.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the Douglas Henry state museum commission, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 20, Part 3 and Title 4, Chapter 29.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the department of transportation, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 1.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the department of safety, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 1 and Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 20.

Agriculture - As introduced, deletes requirement that department of agriculture prepare annual report concerning activities of the Tennessee agricultural museum board for approval by the governor. - Amends TCA Title 43 and Title 44.

Firearms and Ammunition - As introduced, allows a judge who has a permit to carry a handgun and is in the actual discharge of duties as a judge to carry a handgun while in the courtroom. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.
Sentencing - As introduced, removes the jury's ability to sentence a defendant convicted of first degree murder to death. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title  40.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the department of labor and workforce development, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 1 and Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 14.

New Johnsonville - As introduced, subject to local approval, changes the term of office for mayor from two years to four years beginning with the August 2012 local election. - Amends Chapter 603 of the Private Acts of 1949; as amended.
Elkton - As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the due dates for property taxes in the City of Elkton. - Amends Chapter 431 of the Acts of 1907; as amended and rewritten.
Trenton - As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the charter. - Amends Chapter 551 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.

Baileyton - As introduced, subject to local approval, raises monetary limit on purchases that do not require prior approval of the board of mayor and aldermen, from $1,000 to $5,000; raises limit on purchases that do not require competitive bidding, from $5,000 to $10,000. - Amends Chapter 192 of the Private Acts of 1994.

Big Sandy - As introduced, subject to local approval, increases the mayoral term from two years to four years and alters the election cycle so that city elections are held in November in 2014, 2016, and every other year thereafter. -

Camden - As introduced, subject to local approval, beginning with the 2014 city election, moves the election of the mayor and board of aldermen to coincide with the November general election. - Amends Chapter 350 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.

Knox County - As introduced, subject to local approval, authorizes county mayor to nominate persons for membership on the board of commissioners of the Tennessee Technology Corridor Development Authority; authorizes board to review the environmental and developmental impact of medium and high density residential developments. - Amends Chapter 148 of the Private Acts of 1983; as amended.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the department of human resources, June 30, 2016.  - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 1 and Title 4, Chapter 29.
Appropriations - As enacted, makes appropriations for fiscal years beginning July 1, 2010, and July 1, 2011. -

Public Funds and Financing - As enacted, revises certain provisions of law necessary for implementation of appropriations act, including authorizing and prohibiting the transfer of certain funds; terminating the local planning assistance section of the department of economic and community development; and clarifying the duties of certain governmental entities. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 8; Title 9; Title 10; Title 11; Title 12; Title 13; Title 16; Title 17; Title 18; Title 29; Title 33; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 43; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 50; Title 53; Title 54; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 58; Title 59; Title 60; Title 62; Title 63; Title 64; Title 65; Title 66; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.

Budget Procedures - As introduced, authorizes the index of appropriations from state tax revenues for 2011-2012 fiscal year to exceed the index of estimated growth in the state's economy by $200 million or 1.65 percent. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 52.

Franklin - As introduced, subject to local approval, designates the four at-large aldermanic positions as A,B,C, and D and requires that candidates select and designate the position being sought. - Amends Chapter 79 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.
Fayetteville - As introduced, subject to local approval, rewrites the charter. - Amends Chapter 294 of the Acts of 1903.
Savannah - As introduced, subject to local approval, requires two readings for passage of an ordinance instead of three. - Amends Chapter 683 of the Private Acts of 1951.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the prevailing wage commission, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 12, Chapter 4, Part 4.

Cheatham County - As introduced, subject to local approval, permits flexibility for the development tax to be collected at the time a building permit is issued or to defer collection until a certificate of occupancy is issued. - Amends Chapter 28 of the Private Acts of 1997.
Trenton - As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the charter. - Amends Chapter 551 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.
Greene County - As introduced, subject to local approval, abolishes the position of road commissioner. - Amends Chapter 130 of the Private Acts of 1927; as amended.

Cookeville - As introduced, modifies requirements for membership on the board of trustees for the Cookeville Regional Medical Center Authority. - Amends Chapter 49 of the Private Acts of 1999, as amended.
Winchester - As introduced, subject to local approval, modernizes the city charter. -
Greene County - As introduced, subject to local approval, abolishes the position of road commissioner. - Amends Chapter 130 of the Private Acts of 1927; as amended.
Sparta - As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the charter. - Amends Chapter 99 of the Private Acts of 1973.

Lafayette - As introduced, subject to local approval, requires reading of ordinances on two different days, rather than three, prior to adoption; authorizes mayor to appoint a director of public works, subject to confirmation by the city council; increases salary of mayor. - Amends Chapter 235 of the Private Acts of 1945; as amended.
Winchester - As introduced, subject to local approval, modernizes the city charter. -

Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the oil and gas board, June 30, 2016; revises appointment process of membership of oil and gas board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 60, Chapter 1, Part 2.
Jonesborough - As introduced, subject to local approval, modernizes the city charter. - Amends Chapter 135 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.

Newbern - As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the charter to establish staggered terms for the aldermen, to eliminate the need for periodic reappointment of the recorder and revise the duties of the recorder, and to eliminate the need for periodic reappointment of the police chief. - Amends Chapter 450 of the Acts of 1901.

Cumberland County - As introduced, subject to local approval, increases the hotel-motel tax from an amount not to exceed 5% to an amount not to exceed 7.5%. - Amends Chapter 145 of the Private Acts of 1979.

Education, Higher - As introduced, establishes tuition waiver at public institutions of higher education for dependents of first responders who are killed in the line of duty. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1.

Unemployment Compensation - As enacted, extends the period in which an eligible person may collect extended unemployment benefits pursuant to the federal Tax Relief, Unemployment Insurance Reauthorization, and Job Creation Act of 2010. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.

Rockwood - As introduced, subject to local approval, authorizes city to set criteria for awarding contracts by ordinance, rather than by charter provision, in accordance with the Municipal Purchasing Law. - Amends Chapter 327 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.

Kingston - As introduced, subject to local approval, moves the date of the city election to coincide with the November general election; extends the four-year terms of office of the mayor and councilmen elected at the regular city election held in June 2009 or June 2011 to expire December 1, 2014 or 2016. - Amends Chapter 298 of the Private Acts of 1972.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the occupational safety and health review commission, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 50, Chapter 3, Part 8.
Tort Liability and Reform - As enacted, revises certain provisions regarding tort actions and damages. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 27; Title 29 and Title 47.
Business and Commerce - As introduced, repeals Chapter _ of the Public Acts of 2011 (Senate Bill 632 / House Bill 600). - Repeals Chapter ___ of the Public Acts of 2011.

Birth Control - As introduced, requires that taxpayer-funded family planning services and programs to be provided through the county health departments or, alternatively, by the  department of health; prohibits payment of such family planning funds to third-party providers or private organization or entities.  - Amends TCA Section 68-34-105.
Fireworks - As introduced, permits the sale of consumer fireworks in Shelby County by deleting language that prohibits the sale of fireworks in such county. - Amends TCA Section 68-104-112.
Game and Fish Laws - As introduced, removes authority of Tennessee wildlife resources commission and TWRA to regulate hunting of wild hogs on private land. - Amends TCA Title 70.
subjects: Agriculture and Food|Animal Rights and Wildlife Issues

title: Election Laws - As enacted, allows persons age 60 and older to vote absentee upon request, instead of age 65 and older; effective until July 1, 2017. - Amends TCA Section 2-6-201(5).
Employees, Employers - As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Works Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 50, Chapter 7.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, terminates the occupational safety and health administration labor advisory council. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 50, Chapter 3, Part 9.
Board of Regents - As introduced, appropriates $15 million to the board of regents to provide funding for equipment and program expansion at the technology centers. - Amends TCA Title 49.
Taxes, Sales - As introduced, institutes Tennessee small business sales tax holiday program. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Energy - As introduced, requires the University of Tennessee to develop a plan that will double the output of the West Tennessee solar farm by 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 9.

Real Property - As introduced, requires the department of economic and community development to maintain a publicly accessible database of commercial real estate that is available for sale throughout the state. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7; Title 62, Chapter 13 and Title 66.

Economic and Community Development - As introduced, requires the department of economic and community development to ensure the full development of the West Tennessee megasite; appropriates funds for such purpose. - Amends TCA Title 64, Chapter 6.
Education - As introduced, enacts the "Equal Opportunity Scholarship Act." - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

Criminal Procedure - As introduced, provides that a prosecution can be commenced for certain offenses committed on or after July 1, 2012, within the applicable period established by law or within one year after the date on which the accused's identity is established through DNA evidence, whichever period is longer. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
Criminal Offenses - As introduced, makes knowingly killing a police dog that is acting in its official capacity a Class D felony. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

Revenue, Dept. of - As introduced, requires commissioner to include analysis of impact of utilizing regional water planning methods of other states on tax revenues in 2013 report to general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 67.

Election Laws - As introduced, removes requirement that voter needs photograph identification prior to voting; restores former requirement that voter present identification for purpose of comparing signature on the application for ballot. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7, Part 1.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the medical care and cost containment committee, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 50, Chapter 6, Part 1.

Statutes and Codification - As enacted, provides that no statutory private right of action is created unless statute contains express language creating the right; prohibits implied rights of action unless certain requirements met, such as fact that there is no controlling statute and action based on common law. - Amends TCA Title 1, Chapter 3, Part 1.

Tort Liability and Reform - As introduced, provides that doctrine of joint and several liability does not apply in civil actions governed by comparative fault except for applicable cases involving the family purpose doctrine. - Amends TCA Title 20, Chapter 6, Part 1 and Title 29, Chapter 11, Part 1.

Tort Liability and Reform - As introduced, codifies that with certain exceptions a landowner owes no duty of care to a trespasser and is not subject to civil liability for injury, death or property damage suffered by a trespasser while on the landowner's land. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 34.

Business and Commerce - As introduced, limits ability of local governments to place employment practices, standards or other requirements on businesses that deviate from, modify, supplement, add to, change or vary in any manner from state statutorily imposed or recognized requirements. - Amends TCA Section 7-51-1802.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the regional transportation authority, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title  64, Chapter 8, Part 1.

Taxes, Real Property - As introduced, requires increases in property tax rates higher than 1 percent by a county or municipality to be approved through a referendum; authorizes the referendum process. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 67.
subjects: Housing and Property|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Tort Liability and Reform - As introduced, revises provisions governing liability of landowners who permit others to use their land for recreational purposes free of charge. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 29; Title 49 and Title 70, Chapter 7.
Public Contracts - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Civil Rights Initiative Act." - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21.

Sentencing - As introduced, adds carjacking and especially aggravated burglary to offenses for which a defendant is required to serve at least 85 percent of the sentence before release eligibility; provides that certain prisoners be released upon turning 65 if they have served 15 consecutive calendar years. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
Lottery,  Corporation - As introduced, limits advertising of ticket sales to retailer premises; prohibits advertising to promote the lottery via media. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51, Part 1.
Public Funds and Financing - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Linked Deposit Act." - Amends TCA Section 4-29-236; Title 9 and Title 45.

Schools, Charter - As enacted, specifies that charter schools may promote or retain students based upon the students' demonstrated skills on the TCAP tests or upon their grades. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-3115.
Education, Higher - As introduced, appropriates $130 million to the board of regents for the purpose of constructing a science building at MTSU. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

Public Funds and Financing - As introduced, requires review and approval of the state funding board before a local government could borrow money or contract for or issue debt if the debt of the local government is greater than 10 percent of the assessed valuation of its taxable property or if the proposal for new debt would exceed such 10 percent level. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 9.
Sunset Laws - As introduced, extends the soil scientist advisory committee, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 62, Chapter 18, Part 2.

Ethics - As introduced, prohibits gifts to a member of the general assembly, the value of which exceeds $50.00, and which is also made available to the general public; provides an exception to this prohibition. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 6.

Public Health - As introduced, revises current law to restrict the entities to which the department of health may disburse federal Title X family planning funds to certain public agencies. - Amends TCA Section 68-34-105.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, allows a student who has completed an associates degree while receiving a Tennessee HOPE scholarship to be eligible for a Wilder-Naifeh technical skills grant to attend a Tennessee technology center in a diploma or certificate program, provided the student meets certain eligibility requirements. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

Child Custody and Support - As introduced, deletes provision stating that a court may permanently modify a decree of child custody or visitation in the event that a parent volunteers for permanent military duty as a career choice. - Amends TCA Section 36-6-113.

Education - As introduced, requires students who score below proficient on TCAP test or do not demonstrate competency on end-of-course examination to attend summer school or receive tutoring in the subject tested at the expense of the student's parent and be retested prior to being promoted or receiving credit for course. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, allows teachers and principals with superior value added growth data scores to choose those scores to comprise 50 percent or more of their evaluations based on standards set by the state board of education.   - Amends TCA Title 49.
Law Enforcement - As enacted, expands, subject to certain restrictions, the private universities or colleges that are permitted to have police forces. - Amends TCA Section 49-7-118.

Alcoholic Beverages - As enacted, requires the alcoholic beverage commission to report certain information regarding high alcohol content beverages to the state and local government committees of the senate and house of representatives by January 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 1; Title 57, Chapter 3; Title 57, Chapter 4 and Title 57, Chapter 5.

Consumer Protection - As introduced, allows a mattress manufacturer, wholesaler or retailer to offer a comfort exchange policy pursuant to the sale of a mattress. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1 and Title 68, Chapter 15, Part 2.

Special License Plates - As enacted, expands authorization of new specialty earmarked license plates for Sons of Confederate Veterans to include issuance of such plates for motorcycles.  - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the southeast interstate low-level radioactive waste compact, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 202, Part 7.

Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As introduced, effective July 1, 2012, creates a new defined contribution plan as a mandatory retirement package for newly hired state employees; closes existing defined-benefit pension plan to newly hired state employees; requires state agencies to contribute no less than 6 percent and up to 15 percent of a participating employee's salary to an individual account and contribute a certain rate to the defined benefits plan in order to cover the plan's unfunded liabilities. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 25, Part 1; Title 8, Chapter 25, Part 3; Title 8, Chapter 34; Title 8, Chapter 36 and Title 8, Chapter 37.

Health, Dept. of - As introduced, requires the department to pay pregnant women who are enrolled in TennCare and living in certain zip codes $50.00 for each prenatal office visit they attend from 2013-2018. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.
State Government - As introduced, establishes standards for state recognition of Native American Indian tribes. - Amends TCA Title 4.

TennCare - As introduced, prohibits bureau of TennCare from paying for psychotropic prescription drugs that are not used for medically indicated uses in the medical assistance program. - Amends TCA Title 71.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, creates Class A misdemeanor offense of knowingly or recklessly maiming or harming a service animal and the Class C misdemeanor of interfering with a service dog in the performance of its duties and provides for restitution to the handler of the dog. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the southern dairy compact commission, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 43, Chapter 35, Part 1.

Schools, Home - As introduced, allows home school students, including those in schools conducted by parents associated with an organization that conducts church-related schools, to participate in extracurricular athletics if the student meets the academic and conduct standards required of other participants; prohibits, subject to certain conditions, charging home school students participation fees by public schools and tuition by private schools. - Amends TCA Section 49-50-801 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

Animal Cruelty and Abuse - As introduced, creates Class E felony of aggravated cruelty to livestock, which is intentionally engaging in specified conduct in a depraved and sadistic manner that results in serious bodily injury or death to the animal and is done without lawful or legitimate purpose. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2.
Education - As introduced, requires publication of notice of maturity of school bonds issued by a county on the county's web site. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3.

Mental Illness - As introduced, requires court, when competency of a criminal defendant to stand trial is an issue, to hear testimony to determine if the defendant poses a likelihood of serious harm if ordered for an evaluation of competency on an outpatient basis. - Amends TCA Title 33, Chapter 7, Part 3.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, changes a terminating event for receipt of the Tennessee HOPE scholarship from attempt at any postsecondary institution of a specified number of semester hours to receipt of the scholarship for a fixed number of full-time equivalent semesters.    - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, creates Class E felony for failure of a child's parent to report within one hour of the time the parent discovers or should discover that the child is dead or that the child is missing for more than 48 hours. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 38 and Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 4.

Taxes, Litigation - As enacted, authorizes any county that adopts either or both of the litigation taxes authorized by law to also adopt a resolution by a two-thirds majority vote of the legislative body to use those funds, in addition to the purposes described in law, for the purpose of obtaining and maintaining software and hardware associated with collecting, receiving and maintaining records for law enforcement agencies. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 6.

Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the standards committee, department of children's services, June 30, 2013; revises the membership of the child care agencies licensing standards committee, appointed by the commissioner of children's services. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 37, Chapter 5, Part 5.

Controlled Substances - As enacted, adds offenses the conviction of which requires the offender to be on the methamphetamine registry, makes registry retroactive and revises procedure by which methamphetamine-related convictions are transmitted to TBI from clerk's office. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

Drugs, Prescription - As introduced, prohibits pain management clinics and prescribers at such clinics from prescribing certain drugs to a patient in an amount that exceeds the drug manufacturer's recommended dosage. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 53; Title 63 and Title 68.

Senate - As enacted, changes T.C.A. to reflect renaming of the senate environment, conservation and tourism committee as the "senate energy and environment committee." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 11; Title 43; Title 67; Title 69 and Title 70.

Safety - As enacted, transfers Title 68, Chapter 103, relative to working in proximity to high-voltage lines, into Title 50, Chapter 3, relative to the Occupational Health and Safety Act, effective July 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 50 and Title 68, Chapter 103.

Comptroller, State - As enacted, changes references from "county audit division" to "comptroller of the treasury" and "department of audit" in provisions regarding judicial information system advisory committee members; the county financial management system; and audits of the solid waste authority. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 16 and Title 68.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Privacy, Confidentiality - As enacted, classifies as a confidential record the emergency contact information for any state, county, municipal or other public employee or former employee, or of any law enforcement officer in the employ of a public college or university. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7.

Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the standards committee, department of human services, June 30, 2013; revises the membership of the child care agencies licensing standards committee, appointed by the commissioner of human services. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 71, Chapter 3, Part 5.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the state soil conservation committee, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 43, Chapter 14, Part 2.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the state unemployment compensation advisory council, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 50, Chapter 7, Part 6.
Sunset Laws - As introduced, extends the state TennCare pharmacy advisory committee, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 71, Chapter 5, Part 24.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, terminates the teacher evaluation advisory committee. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 3.
Sunset Laws - As introduced, extends the Tennessee board of court reporting, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 20, Chapter 9, Part 6.
Education, Higher - As introduced, creates the office of higher education ombudsperson within the office of the comptroller of the treasury. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

Public Contracts - As enacted, requires the chief procurement officer to develop a transition plan by "April 1, 2012", instead of "October 1, 2011", and corrects various typographical errors in provisions governing the procurement office and the authorized entity to promulgate rules. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 56, Part 1 and Title 12, Chapter 4.

Motor Vehicles, Titling and Registration - As introduced, extends the reduced registration fee of $1.25 to motor vehicles operated by governmental units as bailee or lessee in addition to motor vehicles owned and operated by governmental units or private or volunteer fire department units exclusively used for governmental and fire protection purposes. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
Regional Authorities and Special Districts - As enacted, requires submission of certain reports and notices in regard to watershed districts. - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 6, Part 1.

Public Funds and Financing - As enacted, extends to June 30, 2016, the authorization for the state funding board to sell bonds at private sale permanent, which authorization is scheduled to expire June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Section 9-9-205.

Comptroller, State - As enacted, provides for electronic, in addition to telephonic, notifications under the Advocacy for Honest and Appropriate Government Spending Act. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 4, Part 4.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the Tennessee criminal justice coordinating council, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 41, Chapter 52, Part 1.

Taxes - As enacted, clarifies that a taxpayer may request the assessor to mitigate a forced assessment by reducing the forced assessment to the standard depreciated value of the taxpayer's assessable property plus 25 percent. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-1206 and Section 67-5-903.

Public Funds and Financing - As introduced, requires that sum sufficient to pay interest and installments of principal on state debt be set apart from the first general fund revenues received during the fiscal year for any year in which sufficient funds are not appropriated in the state budget for the timely payment of such interest and installment payments. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 9.

Public Funds and Financing - As introduced, requires, if the appropriations act fails to make sufficient provisions to pay principal of, premium and interest on bonds, notes or revenue notes on state debt, or, at the time such principal, premium or interest is payable sufficient moneys are unavailable for such payment, that a sufficient sum be set apart from the first revenues thereafter received to be applied to such purposes.  - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 9.
County Government - As introduced, enacts the "County Financial Management Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 5 and Title 7.

State Government - As enacted, revises provisions governing approval of compromises and settlements by the governor, comptroller or general assembly in actions involving the state. - Amends TCA Section 20-13-103.

Local Government, General - As enacted, extends from June 30, 2012, to June 30, 2014, the expiration date for the authority of Hamilton, Knox and Shelby counties, Chattanooga, Knoxville, Memphis and Metropolitan Nashville to sell bonds at private sale upon terms and conditions that it determines and upon approval by the governing body of the local government; authorizes local governments to petition state funding board for permission to sell specific bonds determined to be required to be sold at taxable interest rates at private sale upon terms and conditions that the local government determines and upon approval by the governing body of the local government. - Amends TCA Section 9-21-132.
Special License Plates - As enacted, authorizes issuance of special license plates for concerns of police survivors (COPS). - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Motor Vehicles, Titling and Registration - As introduced, authorizes sheriffs to purchase SHERIFF license plates for their personal vehicles that must be renewed annually; authorizes SHERIFF license plates for county vehicles to be considered governmental plates that are not subject to annual renewal. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 2.

Special License Plates - As introduced, reclassifies the Tennessee Walking Horse cultural license plate as a new specialty earmarked license plate; changes the distribution of revenue from 80 percent to the arts and 20 percent to the highway fund to 50 percent to the TN Walking Horse Breeders' and Exhibitors' Association, 40 percent to the arts and 10 percent to the highway fund. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Administrative Procedure (UAPA) - As introduced, removes authority of the government operations committees to stay the running of the period between the time a rule is filed with the secretary of state and the rule's effective date. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As enacted, creates a rebuttable presumption that when an applicant for or party to an insurance contract signs an application, amendment, or other document stating the type, amount, or terms and conditions of coverage, the statements provided by the signatory bind all insureds under the contract and that the signatory has read, understands, and accepts the contents of the signed document; creates a rebuttable presumption that when an insured pays a premium the coverage provided has been accepted by all insureds under the contract. - Amends TCA Title 56.
Welfare - As introduced, requires suspicion-based urine drug tests of TANF applicants and recipients. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 50 and Title 71.

Parks, Natural Areas Preservation - As introduced, requires the commissioner of environment and conservation to offer discounted rates to former members of a reserve or Tennessee national guard unit with 20 or more years of service for activities at Tennessee state parks. - Amends TCA Title 11, Chapter 3, Part 1.

Special License Plates - As enacted, extends the time to meet the minimum order requirements for the American Red Cross new specialty earmarked plate by an additional year. - Amends TCA Section 55-4-356.

Medical Occupations - As introduced, defines the regulations physicians and those working under a physician's supervision must follow when performing cosmetic or aesthetic procedures or treatments.  - Amends TCA Title 63.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, requires state board of education to develop alternatives to student achievement data for use as evaluation criteria for teachers supervising student teachers; requires teachers to have met or exceeded expectations on evaluations for two consecutive years to qualify as supervisors of student teachers. - Amends TCA Title 49.
Highway Signs - As enacted, names bridge on S.R. 99 in Rutherford County in honor of late Lance Corporal Justin Kyle Lewter. -

Lottery,  Corporation - As introduced, requires the state funding board's approval of the lottery corporation's estimate of maximized net lottery proceeds and for payment of bonuses to lottery corporation executives.    - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51.

Administrative Procedure (UAPA) - As introduced, revises from 60 to 75 days the time the government operations committees can stay the running of a permanent rule's effective date. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5.

Professions and Occupations - As introduced, authorizes law enforcement officials on duty to help persons gain entry to their locked motor vehicle without being licensed as locksmiths. - Amends TCA Section 62-11-105.

Law Enforcement - As introduced, creates Class A misdemeanor of removing or attempting to remove a law enforcement officer's handcuffs or other restraints and the Class E felony of removing or attempting to remove a law enforcement officer's firearm or stun weapon. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1.
Taxes, Inheritance Gift - As introduced, beginning on January 1, 2013, reduces the inheritance tax rate annually by 1 percent until the tax is phased out. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8.
subjects: Family and Children Issues|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Military - As enacted, creates Class B misdemeanor offense of a person falsely representing that he or she was or is a member of the United States armed forces with the intent to deceive another into believing such representation. - Amends TCA Title 58, Chapter 1, Part 1.
County Government - As introduced, enacts the "County Finance Officer Certification and Education Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 5.

Purchasing - As enacted, revises provisions regarding cooperative purchasing agreements and county government purchasing in regard to the utilization of pricing discounts. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3, Part 10.
Administrative Procedure (UAPA) - As enacted, continues certain permanent rules filed with secretary of state after January 1, 2010. -

Equalization Board - As enacted, authorizes board to approve a continuing education program for registered taxpayer agents and to charge agents a per-credit hour fee to defray cost of program. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-1514.

Public Funds and Financing - As enacted, clarifies that provisions governing purchases by one local government under same terms as another local government's purchasing agreement apply to purchases of goods and equipment. - Amends TCA Section 12-3-1004.

Financial Responsibility Law - As introduced, allows law enforcement and county clerks to electronically verify insurance status of any vehicle; provides that a valid insurance coverage indicator on the vehicle's electronic record shall be acceptable evidence of insurance in lieu of an officer requesting other types of evidence; prohibits issuance or renewal of title or registration unless insurance coverage is electronically verified. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12; Title 55, Chapter 3; Title 55, Chapter 4 and Title 56.

Taxes, Ad Valorem - As introduced, authorizes, instead of requires, a county to offer a bid at a sale of property for delinquent county taxes when there are no other bidders for the property. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 25.
Education, Higher - As introduced, limits any increase in tuition and school-related fees to the consumer price index. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.
Highway Signs - As enacted, names bridge on S.R. 11 in Marshall County in honor of late Matt Hayes. -
Highway Signs - As enacted, names bridge on S.R. 7 in Maury County in honor of the late John Newton Woody. -
Highway Signs - As enacted, names bridge on S.R. 166 in Maury County in honor of Dr. L. Paul Sands. -

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, requires the state board of education to develop a transitional licensure program for professionals interested in teaching in grades 7-12 that does not require pedagogical study.   - Amends TCA Title 49.

Education - As introduced, alters reporting requirements of the department of health of the aggregate results of all BMI screenings performed in the previous calendar year to make report due annually on February 15 instead of January 31 and to add the house and senate education committee chairs as recipients of the report. - Amends TCA Title 49.
Governor - As introduced, requires governor to submit legislation to revise TCA to reflect changes in governmental structure made by executive order. - Amends TCA Title 4.
Education - As introduced, prompts the state board of education and the department of safety to update the DARE curriculum as new forms of substance abuse are identified. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Education, Dept. of - As introduced, simplifies the reporting requirements of the commissioner of education relative to LEAs' Internet acceptable use policies by allowing commissioner to post the report on the department's Web site and give notice of the posting via email to the chairs of the education committees in lieu of submitting the biennial report to the chairs. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As enacted, authorizes the issuance of licenses to teach in grades nine through 12 to persons who have taught at a postsecondary education institution, the students of which are eligible for lottery funded scholarships; such a license will only authorize the licensee to teach in the subject area in which the licensee taught at the higher education institution. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5.

Humphreys County - As introduced, subject to local approval, rewrites county road law to conform with the Tennessee County Uniform Highway Law. - Amends Chapter 634 of the Private Acts of 1935; as amended.

Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the board of examiners for architects and engineers, June 30, 2016; revises certain provisions regarding appointments to the board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 62, Chapter 2, Part 2.

Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the committee for clinical perfusionists, June 30, 2016; revises certain provisions regarding appointments to the committee. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 28, Part 1.

Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the board of dietitian/nutritionist examiners, June 30, 2016; revises certain provisions regarding appointments to the board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 25, Part 1.

Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the board of examiners for nursing home administrators, June 30, 2016; revises certain provisions regarding appointments to the board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 16, Part 1.

Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the board of pharmacy, June 30, 2016; revises certain provisions regarding appointments to the board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 10, Part 3.

Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the emergency medical services board, June 30, 2016; revises certain provisions regarding appointments to the board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 140, Part 3.

Administrative Procedure (UAPA) - As introduced, requires each state agency head to complete periodic training for purposes of complying with the provisions of the Regulatory Flexibility Act. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5.

Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the council for hearing instrument specialists, June 30, 2016; revises certain provisions regarding appointments to the council. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 17, Part 2.

Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the Tennessee medical laboratory board, June 30, 2016; revises certain provisions regarding appointments to the board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 29, Part 1.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the department of intellectual and developmental disabilities, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends board of nursing, 2014; revises certain provisions governing board members and appointments. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 7.

Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the board for licensing health care facilities, June 30, 2016; requires comptroller to issue questions and answers to board regarding surveyors in response to CMS audit. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the department of children's services, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 37, Chapter 5.
Sunset Laws - As introduced, extends the Second Look commission, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 37, Chapter 3, Part 8.

Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the Tennessee technology development corporation, June 30, 2017; revises certain provisions regarding appointments to the corporation board of directors. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 14 and Title 4, Chapter 29.

Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the advisory council on workers' compensation, June 30, 2016; revises certain provisions regarding appointments to the council. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 50, Chapter 6, Part 1.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the Interstate Insurance Product Regulation Compact of 2007, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 56, Chapter 58, Part 1.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends state procurement commission, state protest commission, and advisory council on state procurement, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the Tennessee life and health insurance guaranty association, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 56, Chapter 12, Part 2.

Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the state board for alarm systems contractors, June 30, 2016; revises certain provisions regarding appointments to the board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 62, Chapter 32.
Sunset Laws - As introduced, extends the state board of accountancy, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 62, Chapter 1.
Sunset Laws - As introduced, extends the Tennessee higher education commission, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 7.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the Tennessee arts commission, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 20 and Title 4, Chapter 29.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the Tennessee council for career and technical education, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 11.
Sunset Laws - As introduced, extends the Tennessee financial literacy commission, June 30, 2017.  - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 17.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the department of general services, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the state capitol commission, June 30, 2017; revises certain provisions governing appointments to the board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 8.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends Tennessee residence commission, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 23 and Title 4, Chapter 29.

State Government - As enacted, places the Doe Mountain recreation authority under the governmental entity review requirements by scheduling the authority to sunset on June 30, 2014; schedules the board of appeals for the department of human resources to sunset on June 30, 2014; schedules the civil service commission to terminate and cease to exist on April 1, 2013; replaces the present law requirement that the TennCare bureau competitively procure an annual study designed to accurately assess the cost of dispensing a prescription in a retail or community pharmacy setting to a TennCare enrollee with a requirement that the TennCare bureau annually report to the house health and human resources committee and the senate health and welfare committee concerning pharmacy benefits under TennCare. - Amends TCA Title 4.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the Tennessee emergency management agency, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 58, Chapter 2.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the interstate earthquake compact of 1988, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 58, Chapter 2, Part 4.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the emergency management assistance compact, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 58, Chapter 2, Part 4.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the civil defense and disaster compact, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 58, Chapter 2, Part 4.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the state forestry commission, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 11, Chapter 4.
Sunset Laws - As introduced, extends the Tennessee heritage conservation trust fund, board of trustees, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 11, Chapter 7.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the Tennessee tobacco farmers certifying board, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 43, Chapter 36, Part 1.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the soil scientist advisory committee, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 62, Chapter 18, Part 2.
Sunset Laws - As introduced, extends the water quality control board, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 69, Chapter 3.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the department of environment and conservation, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.

Correction, Dept. of - As introduced, requires commissioner to report the death of any person in custody to the members of the general assembly representing such person within five business days of such death rather than 10 days, with additional requirement that the report include the department facility where the death occurred. - Amends TCA Title 4.
Sunset Laws - As introduced, extends the petroleum underground storage tank board, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 215.

Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the air pollution control board, June 30, 2015; revises certain provisions regarding appointments to board and qualifications of board members. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 201, Part 1.

Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the board of ground water management, June 30, 2015; requires board to adopt certain conflict of interest policy. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 69, Chapter 10, Part 1.
Sunset Laws - As introduced, extends the solid waste disposal control board, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 211.
Sunset Laws - As introduced, extends the Tennessee court of the judiciary, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 17, Chapter 5, Part 2.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, extends the judicial performance evaluation commission, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 17, Chapter 4, Part 2.
Sunset Laws - As introduced, extends the judicial nominating commission, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 17, Chapter 4.

Courts, Jurisdiction - As introduced, provides that the supreme court, circuit, criminal and chancery courts have no jurisdiction to determine the constitutionality of a statute properly enacted by the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5 and Title 16.

Liens - As enacted, requires comptroller to conduct a performance audit of the implementation and impact of current law authorizing the creation of a lien on a motor vehicle by filing a notarized copy of an instrument when the existing certificate of title on the vehicle is unavailable. - Amends TCA Section 55-3-126.

Taxes, Ad Valorem - As introduced, requires increases in property tax rates higher than $1.00 per $100 of the assessed value of property by a county or municipality to be approved through a referendum; authorizes the referendum process. - Amends TCA Title 67.

Taxes, Ad Valorem - As introduced, requires increases in property tax rates higher than 25 percent by a county or municipality to be approved through a referendum; authorizes the referendum process. - Amends TCA Title 67.

Physicians and Surgeons - As enacted, alters the definition of a physician in the Preferred Provider Organization Transparency Act to include chiropractic physicians, medical doctor or an osteopathic physician. - Amends TCA Section 56-60-102(10).
Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, exempts from sales tax the purchase of solar panels for legitimate business or commercial purposes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, exempts from sales tax the purchases of solar panels exclusively for residential use. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-334.
Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, extends property tax relief to the surviving spouse of a veteran whose death results from a service-connected disability. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-704.

Motor Vehicles - As enacted, enacts "The BWC 5 Act," which requires recreational vehicles leased to consumers to have working carbon monoxide detectors; requires all lease agreements for RVs to state that the vehicle is equipped with a working detector; allows court costs and attorney's fees in civil suits for damages from failure to comply with this requirement. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 9.

Special License Plates - As enacted, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked license plates for East Tennessee Children's Hospital; and allocates 50 percent of the proceeds from such plates to the hospital. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Administrative Procedure (UAPA) - As introduced, prohibits an agency that has filed an emergency rule from filing a proposed rule on the same subject without first holding a public rulemaking hearing. - Amends TCA Section 4-5-202.

Taxes, Privilege - As introduced, specifies that the proceeds collected from privilege taxes relating to tourism should be applied in the municipality in which the taxes were collected. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.
State Symbols - As enacted, establishes the eastern red cedar as the official state evergreen tree. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 1, Part 3.
Municipal Government - As introduced, creates taxpayer cause of action and remedy for the recovery of funds unlawfully paid by a municipality.  - Amends TCA Section 6-56-112.

Human Rights - As introduced, prohibits entities from discriminating on the basis of sexual orientation in practices and contracts. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 11; Title 12; Title 37; Title 39; Title 40; Title 49; Title 56; Title 57; Title 62; Title 65; Title 68 and Title 71.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, enhances the penalty for involuntary labor servitude where the victim was under age 13 and adds means by which the crime is possible. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13 and Title 40.
Remedies and Special Proceedings - As enacted, creates civil right of action for victims of human trafficking offenses. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 3.

Boards and Commissions - As introduced, prohibits persons registered as lobbyists from serving as members of state boards, commissions or other governmental entities whose activities are regulated by such entities; requires members to be state residents; prohibits public members from having a direct or indirect affiliation with professions and industries being overseen or regulated. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29, Part 1.
Education - As introduced, requires data from virtual schools to be reported on the annual report card of the department of education. - Amends TCA Title 49.
Education - As introduced, requires comptroller to audit annually the books and records of a virtual school operated or managed by a for-profit entity. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 16.

Election Laws - As introduced, requires secretary of state to publicize the photo identification requirement prior to the primary and general elections in 2012 via public service announcements on radio and television. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 8, Chapter 3.
Tort Liability and Reform - As introduced, enacts the Jobs Creation Lawsuit Reform Act. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 28; Title 29; Title 47, Chapter 18 and Title 63, Chapter 6.
Education - As introduced, requires Tennessee students in Tennessee virtual schools to take the same proficiency tests as students attending other public schools. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 16.
Public Contracts - As introduced, prohibits persons who violate the Fair Labor Standards Act from contracting with the state for the provision of goods or services. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 4.

Special License Plates - As enacted, authorizes issuance of Ronald McDonald House new specialty earmarked license plate; allocates 50 percent of sale proceeds to Ronald McDonald House, for distribution to Tennessee chapters to further the mission of improving health, education and well-being of children. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
Comptroller, State - As enacted, removes references to the office of the comptroller of the treasury in connection with the judicial cost accountant. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 24.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: County Government - As enacted, prohibits conflicts of interest in contractual services in regard to county officers in same manner as interests in supplies, material or equipment are prohibited. - Amends TCA Section 5-21-121 and Section 54-7-203.
Motor Vehicle Commission - As introduced, requires the commission to create a new license for motor scooter dealers that do not sell other types of motor vehicles. - Amends TCA Title 55.
Orders of Protection - As introduced, authorizes a judge to order parties to mediation who have sworn petitions for orders of protection against one another. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6.

Special License Plates - As enacted, extends the time within which the minimum initial order of 1,000 Historic Collierville new specialty earmarked license plates may be made, before authorization for the issuance of such plates becomes invalid, from July 1, 2012, to July 1, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Education - As introduced, prohibits schools and school systems from restricting parents or approved adults from eating lunch with a student at school during the student's lunch time. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Sexual Offenders - As introduced, makes the failure of a sexual offender or violent sexual offender to provide a DNA sample as required by law a Class E felony violation of the Tennessee Sexual Offender and Violent Sexual Offender Registration, Verification and Tracking Act of 2004. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, terminates the board of review, department of labor and workforce development. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Section 4-5-319 and Section 50-7-704.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, allows a job tax credit for small, high-wage employers that create new jobs in high technology areas; requires approval by the commissioners of revenue and economic and community development.  - Amends TCA Section 67-4-2109.

Nurses, Nursing - As introduced, eliminates requirement that the board of medical examiners and the board of nursing jointly adopt rules to regulate supervision of nurse practitioners; removes prohibition against changing, by means of legal interpretation or rule, the prescriptive rights, supervision or scope of practice for advance practice nuses from the law as it existed on May 22, 2002. - Amends TCA Title 63.

Controlled Substances - As enacted, adds to the list of persons that may receive information from the controlled substance database any quality improvement committee of a licensed hospital, as part of the committee's confidential and privileged activities with respect to the evaluation, supervision or discipline of a healthcare provider employed by the hospital or any of its affiliates or subsidiaries, who is known or suspected by the hospital's administrator to be prescribing controlled substances for the prescriber's personal use. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4; Title 53, Chapter 10, Part 3; Title 53, Chapter 11, Part 3; Section 53-11-402; Title 63, Chapter 1, Part 3; Title 63, Chapter 10, Part 2 and Title 71, Chapter 5, Part 26.
Drugs, Prescription - As introduced, classifies willful failure to report information to the controlled substance database a misdemeanor criminal offense. - Amends TCA Section 53-10-307.

Law Enforcement - As introduced, authorizes capitol police who have completed certain law enforcement training to have law enforcement powers throughout the state; authorizes capitol police to be employed as a security guard/officer for a private business licensed by the state. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 20; Title  38 and Title 62, Chapter 35, Part 1.

Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As introduced, adds that a guilty plea, nolo contendere plea, or finding of guilt for a felony arising out of a public employee's or official's office constitutes malfeasance in office requiring forfeiture of retirement benefits. - Amends TCA Section 8-35-124; Section 8-35-203 and Section 8-36-201.

Criminal Procedure - As introduced, provides that a person convicted of official misconduct, attempt or conspiracy to commit official misconduct or any other offense committed by a public official in office or relating to the duties of the office is ineligible for pretrial diversion or judicial diversion. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

Telecommunications - As enacted, enacts the "Kelsey Smith Act" to require wireless telecommunications service providers to provide geographic information concerning the location of a service user's wireless device to agency responding to call in an emergency situation that that involves the risk of death or serious physical harm. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 86; Title 38 and Title 65.

Controlled Substances - As introduced, permits the commissioner of health or certain licensing boards to suspend on an emergency basis the license of a practitioner who is under state or federal indictment involving the sale or dispensing of controlled substances. - Amends TCA Title 63.
Health, Dept. of - As enacted, enacts "The Henry Granju Act," which creates new reporting requirements related to drug overdoses. - Amends TCA Title 63 and Title  68.

Drugs, Prescription - As introduced, permits the commissioner of health or certain licensing boards to suspend on an emergency basis the license of a practitioner who is under any state or federal indictment involving controlled substances. - Amends TCA Title 63.
Hamblen County - As introduced, subject to local approval, repeals the Hamblen County special endowment fund. - Chapter 106 of the Private Acts of 2006.

Fees - As introduced, establishes a fee imposed on customers for transmitting money through certain entities; requires the department of revenue to administer the collection of said fee; establishes a fund for the moneys collected that can be utilized by the Tennessee bureau of investigation for certain activities. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 9; Title 40, Chapter 33, Part 2; Title 45, Chapter 7, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 4.
Taxes - As introduced, gives the purchaser of telecommunication services no more than 60 days, instead of 90, to receive a full tax refund on a returned purchase. - Amends TCA Title 67.

Criminal Procedure - As introduced, increases from $50.00 to $350, the fee for expungement of records following completion of judicial diversion; requires payment of $100 fee prior to issuance of certificate of eligibility for diversion; revises how fee can be used. - Amends TCA Section 38-6-118; Section 40-32-101 and Section 40-35-313.

Taxes - As introduced, deletes obsolete language that exempts certain tangible personal property for the spring sales tax holiday; increases from $1,500 to $1,600 the sales tax exemption for computers sold during the recurring August sales tax holiday. - Amends TCA Title 67.

District Attorneys - As introduced, adds 13 assistant district attorney positions across the state and requires that the DA general conference prepare a report for the speakers and the chairs of the judiciary committees recommending districts in which positions should be designated. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 16, Chapter 2.
Food and Food Products - As introduced, requires the department of agriculture to create standards for honey. - Amends TCA Title 43; Title 44, Chapter 15, Part 1 and Title 47, Chapter 18.

Education, Higher - As enacted, authorizes and encourages reverse articulation or reverse transfer agreements between the board of regents' community colleges and universities in the board of regents and UT systems and that are private SACS accredited institutions.  - Amends TCA Title 49.
Civil Procedure - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Legal Funding Act." - Amends TCA Title 23 and Title 29.
subjects: Legal Issues|Civil Liberties and Civil Rights

title: Budget Procedures - As introduced, requires allocation of half of surplus tax revenues to the rainy day fund under specified circumstances and directs commissioner of finance and administration to certify such amount each year. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 67.

Budget Procedures - As introduced, directs commissioner of finance and administration to certify the amount of surplus state revenue collected each year, and requires that appropriation act for subsequent fiscal year direct such amount be allocated to the rainy day fund. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 67.
Public Officials - As introduced, authorizes attorneys' fees for a violation of open meetings law if the plaintiff substantially prevails on any part of the claim. - Amends TCA Section 8-44-106.

Aircraft and Airports - As introduced, requires airport authorities to have no more than nine commissioners; grandfathers in any authority that has more than nine as of July 1. - Amends TCA Title  42, Chapter 5 and Title 42, Chapter 3.
Sexual Offenders - As introduced, includes senior living facilities in the places where sex offenders are prohibited from living within 1,000 feet of. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

Sexual Offenses - As enacted, enhances the criminal classification of the offenses of indecent exposure and stalking when committed by a sexual offender. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13 and Title 39, Chapter 17.

Sexual Offenders - As introduced, requires the TBI to report sexual offender registration and certain related information to the FBI "within 48 hours of receiving such information" instead of "promptly." - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39.

Hazardous Materials - As introduced, beginning July 1, 2013, prohibits manufacture, sale, offer for sale or distribution in Tennessee of children's products that contain cadmium at more than .004 percent by weight. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 47, Chapter 18 and Title 68.

Energy - As introduced, requires the department of economic development division of energy and the University of Tennessee to pursue increased energy generation capacity at the West Tennessee solar farm by seeking the means and resources necessary to double the generating capacity originally planned for the solar farm. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 9.
Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee New Entrepreneur Tax Credit Act." - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.
Election Laws - As introduced, requires the registry of election finance to give members of the general assembly email notification. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

Sentencing - As introduced, increases the time a civil judgment for restitution ordered as a condition of probation that remains unpaid would remain in effect from "10 years" to "20 years." - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40, Chapter 35.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, decreases the time in which a hearing shall be given to an insurer when the department disapproves of a rate increase from 30 days after the disapproval or modification order to 10 days after the disapproval or modification order. - Amends TCA Title 56.
Sentencing - As introduced, deletes outdated provisions of sentencing law. - Amends TCA Title 40.

Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, requires alcoholic beverage commission to promulgate rules and regulations restricting sale of certain high alcohol content beverages. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 1; Title 57, Chapter 3; Title 57, Chapter 4 and Title 57, Chapter 5.

Election Laws - As introduced, allows valid photograph identification cards issued to students at public institutions of higher learning in Tennessee to be used for voting. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-112.

State Government - As introduced, makes a one-time reduction to the total amount of health insurance benefits paid on behalf of current and former legislators and administrative department heads and executive officials in the executive branch by $100 million; effective July 1, 2012, for former members and executive officials; effective at the election of 108th General Assembly for current members. - Amends TCA Title 8.

Nuclear Materials, Transportation and Safety - As introduced, substitutes the state's definitions for federal law concerning low-level radioactive waste to prevent by-product material, source material and special nuclear material from being placed in landfills. - Amends TCA Title 68.
Traffic Safety - As introduced, requires countdown timers be installed at all intersections with unmanned traffic safety cameras implemented after July 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-198.
Health Care - As introduced, adds a focus on innovative practices by providers in each of the grand divisions to the annual report on safety net access and adequacy. - Amends TCA Section 68-1-123.

Food and Food Products - As introduced, prohibits sale of baby food and infant formula in containers containing bisphenol A and sale of all food and beverages in reusable containers containing bisphenol A beginning January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18; Title 53 and Title 68.

Special License Plates - As introduced, authorizes Autism Speaks new specialty earmarked license plate; allocates 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to Autism Speaks to support organization's mission. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
State Government - As introduced, creates the office of inspector general for fraud, waste, corruption and abuse within all departments and branches of state government. - Amends TCA Title 4.
Knox County - As introduced, repeals the office of legislative affairs. -
Open Meetings - As introduced, reduces public notice period for government operations committee sunset hearings, from 10 days to six days. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29.

Open Meetings - As introduced, requires notice of government operations committee sunset hearings be posted on the division of state audit web site, deleting the current requirement that such notice be published in newspapers of general circulation. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29.
Criminal Offenses - As introduced, creates the crime of "retail theft." - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14 and Title 40.

Municipal Government - As enacted, increases from $300,000 to $500,000 the maximum amount of revenue and debt a municipality may have in order to qualify to contract with a certified municipal finance officer (CMFO) or a qualified individual who is exempt from CMFO certification for financial oversight instead of employing a CMFO. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 56, Part 4.

Taxes - As introduced, revises provisions governing what constitutes a quorum of the  assessment appeals commission; changes reference from "trustee" to "assessor of property" in provisions governing back assessments and reassessments. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1 and Title 67, Chapter 5.

Codes - As enacted, specifies the procedure that local governments must use in order to adopt mandatory sprinkler requirements for one-family and two-family dwellings.  - Amends TCA Section 68-120-101.

Education - As introduced, requires the state board of education to promulgate a rule permitting the length of the school term to be calculated by instructional hours as well as the current number of instructional days.    - Amends TCA Section 49-6-3004.
Local Education Agencies - As introduced, allows any operating LEA to convert to a special school district.  - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 5.
Taxes, Inheritance Gift - As introduced, eliminates gift tax on transfers made on or after January 1, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8.
subjects: Family and Children Issues|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Criminal Offenses - As introduced, removes the requirement that a defendant must use force against a law enforcement officer in order to commit the offense of resisting a stop, frisk, halt or search. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 16, Part 6.

Local Education Agencies - As enacted, prescribes procedures to govern the abolition of certain special school districts; requires comprehensive transition plan; lifts ban on creation of municipal and special school districts in any county to which this act applies. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2.

General Assembly - As introduced, requires the general assembly to meet in regular session every two years instead of each year; requires legislative staff to remain employed continually each year; requires state budget to be for two fiscal years instead of one; reduces frequency of reports submitted to general assembly from each year to every other year; directs code commission to change certain references to implement these changes. - Amends TCA Title 1, Chapter 1; Title 2; Title 3; Title 4; Title 7, Chapter 82; Title 8; Title 9; Title 11; Title 12; Title 13; Title 16; Title 17; Title 20, Chapter 7, Part 1; Title 29, Chapter 13, Part 1; Title 33; Title 36; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 45; Title 47, Chapter 18; Title 49; Title 50, Chapter 7; Title 53; Title 54, Chapter 3; Title 55, Chapter 6; Title 56; Title 63; Title 64; Title 67, Chapter 4; Title 68, Chapter 211; Title 69 and Title 71.

Election Laws - As introduced, removes requirement that voter needs photograph identification prior to voting; restores former requirement that voter present identification for purpose of comparing signature on the application for ballot. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7, Part 1.
