Highways, Roads and Bridges - As introduced, directs the commissioner of transportation to study the feasibility of widening a portion of Winchester Road in Shelby County in consultation with the departments of economic and community development and of environment and conservation. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title  54.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, expands the drugs whose production, manufacture, distribution, sale or possession would be a crime under the present law offense regarding synthetic derivatives or analogues of methcathinone. - Amends TCA Title 39.
Controlled Substances - As introduced, enacts the "Safe Access to Medical Cannabis Act." - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 63 and Title 68.
Bail, Bail Bonds - As enacted, requires persons who have previously failed to appear in court as scheduled to post money or real estate as security for a bail bond. - Amends TCA Section 40-11-104.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As enacted, requires THEC to make recommendations for changes to the lottery scholarship eligibility for GED recipients in light of impending changes to the GED test by the American Council on Education; requires the department of labor and workforce development, with the assistance of the department of education, the state board of education, and THEC to develop and implement a program for individuals who did not graduate from high school that will provide a means, other than the GED, to obtain a credential signifying completion of high school or its equivalent. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Child Custody and Support - As introduced, requires parenting plans to specify the percentage of time a child will spend with the mother and the father and requires courts to report such percentage to the department of human services. - Amends TCA Title 36 and Title 71.

District Attorneys - As introduced, requires district attorneys to report potential conflicts of interest from serving on public or private boards, commissions or organizations to the attorney general and reporter. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 17; Title 39 and Title 40.

Education, Dept. of - As introduced, establishes a 25 percent tuition waiver for children of members of the military stationed overseas; provided, that the student qualifies for in-state tuition.   - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1.
Employees, Employers - As introduced, enacts the "Lifelong Learning Accounts Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 4.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, provides that punishment for killing a police dog when it is acting in its official capacity is theft and punished according to the value of the animal, including the training, but in no event less than a Class D felony. - Amends TCA Title 39.

Victims' Rights - As introduced, requires that criminal injury compensation funds made to minors be turned over to chancery or circuit court to be placed in an interest bearing account. - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 29 and Title 34.

Civil Procedure - As enacted, adds physician assistants to list of medical professionals who are exempt from subpoena to trial in a civil action but who are subject to subpoena to a deposition. - Amends TCA Section 24-9-101.
subjects: Legal Issues|Civil Liberties and Civil Rights

title: Safety, Dept. of - As enacted, requires the department to conduct a study on the safety of motorcycle passengers under 18 years of age and report its results and recommendations to the senate transportation and safety committee and the house transportation committee by October 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 55.
Highway Signs - As introduced, designates bridge between city of Grand Junction and town of LaGrange as "Dr. N.H. Edwards Bridge." -

Pharmacy, Pharmacists - As introduced, requires the board of pharmacy to notify licensed pharmacies and pharmacists of changes to applicable rules, statutes, policies, and guidelines; requires the board to maintain a link on its Web site to applicable statutes, rules, policies, and guidelines; requires that licensees maintain at the sites of their practices a copy of the board's statutes, rules, policies, and guidelines. - Amends TCA Title 53 and Title 63.

Controlled Substances - As introduced, requires health care practitioners who are authorized to prescribe controlled substances to query the controlled substance database concerning the prescription history of certain persons and to make appropriate reports. - Amends TCA Title 53 and Title 63.

Taxes, Income - As introduced, requires annual adjustment of the Hall Income Tax exemption income levels for persons 65 years of age or older to reflect any increase in the average consumer price index. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.
subjects: Labor and Employment|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, increases the Hall income tax exemption for taxpayers 65 years of age or older to $36,200 for single filers and $47,000 for persons filing jointly beginning January 1, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.

Graysville - As introduced, subject to local approval, requires the mayor of Graysville be elected on a ballot separate from that of candidates for commissioner. - Amends Chapter 230 of the Private Acts of 1992; as amended.

Education, Higher - As introduced, requires, in moving from the enrollment-based higher education funding formula to the outcomes-based funding formula, a 10-year period in which the hold harmless provision of the enrollment-based funding formula is phased out.  - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 2.

Education - As introduced, authorizes and encourages LEAs to partner with individuals, community and faith-based groups and organizations, and for-profit and nonprofit entities to devise parental involvement programs that reward schools and classes and honor parents for participating in parenting classes that increase parental involvement in education and schools. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 70.

Education - As introduced, includes "maintaining a safe environment" among the reasons for prohibiting persons other than staff, students, parents and persons with lawful business from entering school property during school hours.   - Amends TCA Title 49.
Highway Signs - As introduced, names bridge in Sullivan County in honor of the late Richard Lee Edwards, Sr. -

Consumer Protection - As introduced, requires certain roofing contractors and agents to make certain disclosures to solicited persons where an insurance claim has been made or is anticipated for the provision of roofing goods or services. - Amends TCA Title 47; Title 56 and Title 62.

Nuclear Materials, Transportation and Safety - As introduced, requires any permit issued by the department of environment and conservation to specify the types of waste a facility is prohibited from receiving for disposal or processing; prohibits any person from knowingly accepting for disposal or processing certain nuclear or radioactive materials in any landfill. - Amends TCA Title 68.

Marriage - As enacted, allows appointed and elected municipal court judges to solemnize marriages in any county of the state rather than in just the municipality in which the judge has jurisdiction. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 3.

Financial Responsibility Law - As introduced, limits the noneconomic damages a person may recover in a car accident if that person owns or operates a vehicle without financial responsibility.   - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 39; Title 55, Chapter 12 and Title 56, Chapter 7.

General Assembly - As enacted, requires TBI to conduct background investigations for persons appointed by the speaker of the senate or the speaker of the house; limits number of such investigations to 15 per calendar year per speaker. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 6.

Alcoholic Beverages - As enacted, allows restaurant to have minimum of 40 seats instead of 75 seats for purpose of selling alcoholic beverages; clarifies that limited service restaurant may sell more than 50 percent food and still qualify for license. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4.
Contractors - As enacted, revises certain requirements concerning retainage. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 34, Part 1.

Sentencing - As enacted, makes elected and appointed public officials ineligible for diversion for criminal offenses committed in their official capacity or that involve the duties of their offices. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

Criminal Procedure - As introduced, provides that in a criminal case the trial judge has no authority to grant a defendant a new trial or set aside the verdict because the judge disagrees with the jury about the weight of the evidence. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 18.

Board of Regents - As introduced, permits a community college to begin operating at a location in the service area of another community college that has ceased operations at the location. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7 and Title 49, Chapter 8.

Child Custody and Support - As enacted, amends the Criminal Injuries Compensation Fund to provide an attachment or lien on the judgment to satisfy child support arrearages in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 13.

DNA and Genetic Testing - As introduced, requires all persons arrested on or after January 1, 2012, for the commission of any felony to have a biological specimen taken for the purpose of DNA analysis; requires sample of biological specimen to be destroyed if charges dismissed or defendant acquitted. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 35, Part 3.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, broadens eligibility for the HOPE scholarship by removing the requirement that a military parent's home of record or residence is Tennessee if a student qualifies to be classified as an in-state student and meets other specified requirements. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

Taxes, Sales - As introduced, revises requirements for apportionment of state sales taxes to eligible municipalities that plan economic development projects; authorizes municipalities to include subsequently annexed property as a part of a project under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 51, Part 1; Title 7, Chapter 40, Part 1 and Section 67-6-103.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Sullivan County - As introduced, subject to local approval, repeals requirement that satellite offices for the register of deeds be maintained outside the county seat. -

Welfare - As introduced, requires the reduction of Temporary Assistance to Needy Families (TANF) payments for parents or caretakers of TANF recipients whose children fail to maintain satisfactory progress in school. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 3, Part 1.

Campaigns and Campaign Finance - As introduced, limits amount candidate may personally loan campaign to $100,000 per election but does not limit amount candidate may contribute to campaign; creates voluntary spending limits for certain state and local candidates. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

Campaigns and Campaign Finance - As introduced, limits amount candidate may personally loan campaign to $100,000 per election but does not limit amount candidate may contribute to campaign; creates voluntary spending limits for statewide candidates. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

Civil Procedure - As introduced, requires a plaintiff receiving in a judgment less than 80 percent of the settlement amount offered in a lawsuit or a defendant owing a judgment more than 120 percent of the settlement amount offered in a lawsuit prior to trial to pay certain litigation expenses of the opposing party. - Amends TCA Title 25.
subjects: Legal Issues|Civil Liberties and Civil Rights

title: Highway Signs - As introduced, "SPC Michael E. Harr Memorial Bridge," S.R. 126 in Sullivan County -

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, creates defense in prosecution of prostitution where a person is a victim of involuntary labor servitude, sexual servitude, or where the person is a victim as defined under the federal Trafficking Victims Protection Act. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
Business and Commerce - As introduced, repeals the "Equal Access to Intrastate Commerce Act." - Amends TCA Section 4-21-102, Title 7, Chapter 51.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As enacted, specifies that certain filing provisions would not apply to a commercial risk policy issued by an insurer of commercial risk insurance to an exempt commercial risk policyholder; specifies circumstances under which certain penalty provisions will apply to commercial risk insurance. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 5.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, authorizes an insurer to make, offer, or permit a preference or distinction in certain insurance policies based on membership in certain groups that are actuarially justified and not excessive, inadequate or unfairly discriminatory; authorizes the commissioner of commerce and insurance to examine such insurers for compliance. - Amends TCA Section 56-5-315 and Title 56, Chapter 8.

Public Records - As enacted, specifies that any records obtained by or disclosed to a municipality or county by a holder of a state-issued certificate of franchise authority or any other cable or video service provider for the purpose of an audit or review will be confidential and not subject to the open records laws. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 59, Part 3 and Section 10-7-504.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, elevates assault by an inmate against a correctional officer or jailer from Class A misdemeanor to Class D felony aggravated assault if the assault results in sutures, medical procedure such as MRI or loss of work for day or more and establishes mandatory minimum incarceration of two years. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1.

Tennessee Bureau of Investigation - As introduced, directs TBI to create policy and uniform procedures authorizing familial DNA searches in certain criminal investigations by January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 38.

County Boundaries - As introduced, requires the division of property assessments to determine whether the detachment of certain property from Davidson County and the attachment of the property to Wilson County would be contrary to the provisions of Article X, Section 4 of the Constitution of Tennessee concerning the area of a county and the distance from a county line to a courthouse of an adjoining county and report its findings to the state and local government committees by July 1, 2012.   -

Sexual Offenses - As enacted, clarifies that law permits prosecution and conviction for displaying sexual activity to a minor by electronic communication regardless of whether the victim is a minor or an undercover police officer posing as a minor. - Amends TCA Title 39.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As enacted, increases the Hall income tax exemption for taxpayers 65 years of age or older to $26,200 for single filers and $37,000 for persons filing jointly beginning January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.

Education - As introduced, authorizes and encourages LEAs to partner with individuals, community and faith-based groups and organizations and for-profit and nonprofit entities to devise parental involvement programs that reward schools and classes and honor parents for participating in parenting classes that increase parental involvement in education and schools. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 70.

Highways, Roads and Bridges - As introduced, revises various provisions of the Tennessee County Uniform Highway Law; makes qualifications for chief administrative officer of highway department uniform. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 7.
TennCare - As introduced, enacts an initiative to improve program integrity in the CoverKids and TennCare programs. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 71.
Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, establishes a pay system for LEA instructional personnel based on performance.   - Amends TCA Title 49.

Special License Plates - As enacted, authorizes issuance of Tennessee Federation of Garden Clubs and Wilson County - The Place to Be! special license plates; extends deadline for National Civil Rights Museum and Tennessee veterans special license plates to meet minimum order requirement. - Amends TCA Title 55.
Professions and Occupations - As introduced, authorizes sale of specified scrap metal with required documentation. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 9.

Employees, Employers - As enacted, establishes criteria for waiver of employee's 30-minute rest break or meal period by persons principally employed in service of food or beverages who receive tips. - Amends TCA Title 50.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, expands the sales tax exemption on motor vehicles purchased by members of military services and the active National Guard, to members stationed outside Tennessee, if they submit proof that Tennessee is their permanent residence.  - Amends TCA Section 67-6-303.

Traffic Safety - As introduced, prohibits people from jumping off bridges that are 20 feet or more in height, punishable as Class C misdemeanor by fine only not to exceed $50.00 - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 11, Part 2 and Title 55, Chapter 8.
Taxes, Inheritance Gift - As introduced, increases amount of inheritance tax exemption from current $1 million to $2 million for decedents dying in 2011 or later. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8.
subjects: Family and Children Issues|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Remedies and Special Proceedings - As introduced, authorizes the award of punitive damages in a civil action against a defendant based on vicarious liability under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 29.

Civil Procedure - As enacted, requires the court in a civil case, on a trial court's granting of a motion to dismiss for failure to state a claim upon which relief may be granted, to award costs and reasonable and necessary attorney's fees incurred in the proceedings as a consequence of the dismissed claims to the party against whom the dismissed claims were pending. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 25; Title 27 and Title 29.
subjects: Legal Issues|Civil Liberties and Civil Rights

title: Professions and Occupations - As enacted, exempts employees of state higher education institutions who provide locksmithing services at facilities operated by the board of trustees of the University of Tennessee or the state board of regents from locksmith licensure requirements. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 62, Chapter 11, Part 1.

Environment and Conservation, Department of - As introduced, transfers jurisdiction of the Off-Highway Vehicle Act from wildlife resources agency to department of environment and conservation. - Amends TCA Title 11; Title  68 and Title  70.

Consumer Protection - As enacted, authorizes a mattress manufacturer, wholesaler or retailer to offer a comfort exchange policy pursuant to the sale of a mattress; includes a mattress returned pursuant to such a policy in definition of secondhand. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1 and Title 68, Chapter 15, Part 2.

Coon Dog Laws - As enacted, adds Morgan County to group of counties where the training season for coon dogs is at least six months, instead of having a training season from July 1 to the first day of the open season for hunting coons. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 1.

Education - As enacted, allows county boards of education to use the county's centralized purchasing system to provide a life insurance plan for employees.   - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 8 and Title 49.

Taxes, Inheritance Gift - As introduced, increases, from $1,000,000 to $5,000,000, the single allowable exemption to be applied against net estate for state inheritance taxes; requires exemption amount to match exemption for federal estate taxes; requires state gift tax exemption to be the same as inflation adjusted exclusion amount for federal gift taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8, Part 1; Title 67, Chapter 8, Part 3 and Title 67, Chapter 8, Part 4.
subjects: Family and Children Issues|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Highway Signs - As enacted, names a portion of I-75 the Tuskegee Airmen Memorial Trail. -
Travel Regulations - As enacted, authorizes the issuance of overdimensional permits by TDOT to certain qualified vehicles to travel on the interstate at night. - Amends TCA Section 55-7-205.

Schools, Charter - As introduced, prohibits operation of or supply of goods or services to public charter schools by foreign nationals or organizations controlled by foreign nationals; prohibits foreign nationals, other than those who are lawful permanent residents of the United States, from teaching in public charter schools. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.

Taxes, Franchise - As introduced, establishes credit against franchise and excise tax liabilities for taxpayers who incur unreimbursed costs related to an employee's organ donation procedure. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Criminal Offenses - As introduced, increases the punishment for assault and aggravated assault against health care providers. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13.

Motor Vehicles, Titling and Registration - As enacted, establishes procedures for labeling a motor vehicle a "methamphetamine vehicle" on the title, due to its being used in the manufacturing of methamphetamine. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 3.
Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, enacts the "Educate and Employ Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 20 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 21.

Special License Plates - As introduced, requires the department of revenue to include on its web site the minimum order requirements for cultural and new specialty earmarked license plates. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 2.

Taxes, Hotel Motel - As introduced, limits the purpose of any ordinance enacted by a home rule municipality, or enacted by a private act, with regard to an occupancy tax to those that directly increase tourism within the jurisdiction from which they are collected. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Taxes, Hotel Motel - As introduced, requires that the proceeds collected from hotel occupancy taxes be used to directly increase tourism in the jurisdiction in which such taxes are collected. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Civil Procedure - As introduced, increases from five to seven days the notice required to a defendant prior to a hearing regarding abatement of a nuisance. - Amends TCA Title 23 and Title 29.
subjects: Legal Issues|Civil Liberties and Civil Rights

title: Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As introduced, effective January 1, 2013, creates a new defined contribution plan as a mandatory retirement package for newly hired state employees; closes existing defined-benefit pension plan to newly hired state employees; requires state agencies to contribute annually no less than 2 percent of a participating employee's salary to an individual account and to match employee contributions up to an additional 6 percent. - Amends TCA Title 8.

Taxes, Sales - As enacted, creates sales and use tax exemption for purchase of building supplies for construction of storm or tornado shelters purchased between July 1, 2011, and December 31, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Newspapers and Publications - As introduced, requires the delivery of newspapers and tabloids be only to persons who have requested such delivery. - Amends TCA Title 62.

Judges and Chancellors - As enacted, terminates the court of the judiciary and replaces it with a 16-person board of judicial conduct; revises provisions governing such a board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 17, Chapter 5.
Public Records - As introduced, clarifies that requests for copies to records custodian may be sent electronically. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7.

Open Meetings - As introduced, clarifies that a governing body shall not hold a series of gatherings with less than the required number of members present where the purpose of the gatherings is to avoid compliance with the law. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 44.
Highway Signs - As enacted, provides for erection of directional signs for Children's Holocaust Memorial at Whitwell Middle School on Interstate 24 in Marion County. -

Health Care - As introduced, extends grace period for renewing a certificate to operate a pain management clinic from 90 to 120 days from the expiration date of the former certificate.   - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 1, Part 3.

Public Funds and Financing - As introduced, requires review and approval of the comptroller before a local government could borrow money or contract for or issue debt if the debt of the local government is greater than 10 percent of the assessed valuation of its taxable property or if the proposal for new debt would exceed such 10 percent level. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8 and Title 9.

Health, Dept. of - As introduced, requires the department to pay pregnant women who are enrolled in TennCare and living in certain zip codes $50.00 for each prenatal office visit they attend from 2013-2018. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.

Clerks, Court - As enacted, authorizes clerks with electronic filing systems to charge $120 for each registered user of the system and to institute an 8-cent per page copy transaction fee; fee not applicable to the state; specifies that in any court where electronic filing, signing, or verification of papers has been authorized by local court rule, the state and any department or contractor of the state would not be required to file documents electronically, notwithstanding any local court rule. - Amends TCA Section 8-21-401.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, requires TSAC to develop a short application form for use by students applying for lottery scholarships that are not restricted by income. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.
Water Resources - As introduced,  enacts the "Drinking Water Access and Resources Planning Act." - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 221.

Firearms and Ammunition - As enacted, clarifies that it is lawful to purchase from and cause to be shipped to a personal residence in this state a black powder weapon, knife with a blade in excess of four inches or a sword or bayonet. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

Marriage - As introduced, expands the type of judge that may solemnize the rite of matrimony in any county in Tennessee to include judges of the municipal court of any municipality. - Amends TCA Section 36-3-301.

Drug and Alcohol Rehabilitation - As enacted, provides that a person is eligible for drug court if the person has been charged with but not convicted of a violent felony or does not have a pattern of convictions for violent misdemeanors. - Amends TCA Title 16, Chapter 22, Part 1.

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As enacted, removes requirement that board for licensing health care facilities report to the Tennessee code commission if the board fails to collect fees in amount sufficient to pay operating costs of board in any fiscal year; retains requirement that such report be sent to government operations committees. - Amends TCA Section 68-11-216(b).
Lottery, Charitable - As enacted, extends deadline for applications for 2010-2011 annual events for five days after effective date of act. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 17, Part 1.
Consumer Protection - As introduced, creates a rebuttable presumption that price-gouging has been committed in certain situations. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 51.

Firearms and Ammunition - As introduced, permits employees with valid handgun carry permits to store firearm in employer's public access parking lot provided it is in a locked vehicle and in a glove box or compartment not visible from outside the vehicle; provides employers with ability to prohibit firearms in employer parking lots in some circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As enacted, entitles a claimant to a refund of the state and local sales and use tax paid by the claimant to retailers as a result of the claimant's purchases of major appliances, residential furniture, or residential building supplies that are used in the claimant's primary residence to replace, repair, or restore such items that were damaged or destroyed in a federally declared natural disaster in this state occurring on or after January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

Banks and Financial Institutions - As enacted, allows securities or investment accounts held by bank trust departments to have a payable on death designated beneficiary.  - Amends TCA Title 35, Chapter 12.

Insurance, Liability - As introduced, makes governmental insurance pools, risk pools and interlocal agreements, and the entity administering the pool or fund, subject to the open meetings law and the open records act except for the disclosure of certain proprietary information. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5 and Title 29, Chapter 20, Part 4.
Damages - As introduced, creates a process to obtain punitive damages against an employer with vicarious liability for an employee agent. - Amends TCA Section 29-39-104.
Judgments - As enacted, revises provisions governing interest rates on judgments. - Amends TCA Title 47.
Civil Procedure - As introduced, enacts the "Offer of Settlement Act." - Amends TCA Title 20.
subjects: Legal Issues|Civil Liberties and Civil Rights

title: Special License Plates - As enacted, extends time period for meeting initial issuance requirements for "I Recycle" new specialty earmarked license plates until July 1, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Historical Sites and Preservation - As introduced, appropriates a grant in the sum of $150,000 to the James K. Polk Memorial Association for renovation and improvement of the James K. Polk Home and surrounding property. -

Tennessee Higher Education Commission - As introduced, requires listing of authorized institutions, which must be posted on the commission's web site, to be updated within 10 business days of a postsecondary institution's acquiring or losing authorization to operate.   - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 20.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, creates new lottery scholarship programs for students preparing to become teachers; requires THEC, TBR, and UT to assist colleges in establishing joint teacher preparation programs with nonprofit organizations and LEAs to meet the requirements of one of the scholarships. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Victims' Rights - As enacted, increases from $1.00 to $3.00, effective July 1, 2012,  the litigation tax collected for deposit in the statewide automated victim information and notification system fund. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 38 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 6.
Correction, Dept. of - As enacted, requires the department of correction to study how to reduce the state's correctional healthcare costs.  - Amends TCA Title 41.

Consumer Protection - As enacted, imposes certain requirements on persons providing roofing goods and services in regard to contracts for certain services; provides for certain notice; allows for cancellation of contract in certain circumstances if consumer discovers repair is not covered by insurance. - Amends TCA Title 47; Title 56 and Title 62.
Criminal Offenses - As introduced, enacts the "Animal Fighting Enforcement Act," increasing penalties for certain offenses involving animal fighting. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2.

Gas, Petroleum Products, Volatile Oils - As enacted, defines "natural gas equipment" and "natural gas provider"; creates limited tort liability for natural gas providers if the proximate cause of the injury or damages was caused by certain acts of the ultimate consumer. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 34, Part 2.

Taxes, Gasoline, Petroleum Products - As enacted, creates a natural gas dealer's permit for persons or entities that dispense compressed natural gas to customers' vehicles through qualified natural gas dispensers; requires the permittee to remit the compressed natural gas tax imposed on the metered gas. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 3, Part 11.
Tort Liability and Reform - As enacted, codifies the liability of a landowner to a trespasser. - Amends TCA Title 29.

Campaigns and Campaign Finance - As introduced, requires corporations to file statement of contributions and expenditures when using corporate funds to aid in either the election or defeat of a candidate; requires corporation to disclose such corporation paid for public communication when it expressly advocates the election or defeat of a clearly identified candidate. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10 and Title 2, Chapter 19.
Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, establishes franchise and excise job tax credit for job creation under specified circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4 and Title 67, Chapter 6.

Education, Higher - As introduced, requires any increase in tuition at public institution of higher education to result in an equal decrease in the institution's annual appropriation and requires office of legislative budget analysis and comptroller to provide comments to the finance, ways and means and education committees on such decreases. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7; Title 49, Chapter 8 and Title 49, Chapter 9.
Public Contracts - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Civil Rights Initiative Act." - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21.

Taxes, Privilege - As introduced, abolishes the recordation tax and abolishes the wetland acquistion fund, the local parks land acquisition fund, the state land acquistion fund and the agricultural resource conservation fund, which funds derive funding from the recordation tax. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-409.

Economic and Community Development - As enacted, requires the state agency responsible for processing applications for grant funds relating to workforce development to accept electronic signatures in the same manner as it accepts physical signatures. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 14; Title 47, Chapter 10 and Title 50.

Courts, Juvenile - As enacted, makes various changes to the appointment of counsel and guardians ad litem for indigent children and defendants in juvenile court.   - Amends TCA Section 37-1-126 and Section 37-1-150.

Tennessee Regulatory Authority - As introduced, mandates the means by which TRA is required to determine whether or not a public utility's increase to an existing rate, joint rate, toll, fare, charge, schedule or classification is just and reasonable. - Amends TCA Title 65.
subjects: State Agencies|Federal, State, and Local Relations

title: Game and Fish Laws - As introduced, provides that a wildlife officer who issues a citation for a violation of the wildlife laws is to set the time and date of the person's court appearance in a random manner without regard to what judge or judges are sitting. - Amends TCA Section 70-1-310 and Section 70-4-415.
subjects: Agriculture and Food|Animal Rights and Wildlife Issues

title: State Government - As enacted, requires the state architect to allocate energy efficient commercial building tax deductions from the IRS to persons designing such buildings. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 15 and Title 12, Chapter 3.

Statutes of Limitations and Repose - As introduced, creates an October 1, 2014, statute of repose for personal injury and death actions that accrued prior to the effective date of the Tennessee Civil Justice Act of 2011. - Amends TCA Title 28.

Education - As introduced, requires at least 50 percent of the sample of school improvement plans reviewed by the office of education accountability to be comprised of plans from low-performing schools and low-performing LEAs; deletes reference to education oversight committee. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Education - As introduced, requires LEAs to report each fiscal year the percentage of expenditures made on classroom expenditures district-wide and by school; requires classroom expenditures to be at least 70 percent of the total operating expenditures both district-wide and by school by fiscal year 2015-2016 and to reach at least 90 percent by fiscal year 2019-2020. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 3.

Tort Liability and Reform - As introduced, provides that the department may only suspend or revoke license or impose civil penalty on an entity providing mental health and developmental disability services or alcohol treatment for breaches of duty of care and not based upon vicarious liability. - Amends TCA Title 33, Chapter 2.

Homestead Exemptions - As introduced, establishes a flat homestead exemption of $50,000, per owned principal residence, for all Tennesseans, regardless of marital status or age.  - Amends TCA Title 26, Chapter 2, Part 3.
subjects: Housing and Property|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Tort Liability and Reform - As introduced, limits liability of whitewater rafting companies in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 7.

Children - As introduced, creates Class E felony of a parent failing to make or knowingly refusing to make all reasonable efforts to report a missing child to appropriate authorities within 24 hours of when the child believed to be missing. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.
Consumer Protection - As introduced, requires gift certificates with a monetary value of less than $10.00 to be redeemable in cash for cash value. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18.

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As introduced, establishes an Independent Formal Dispute Resolution Program for nursing homes, as required by the federal Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act; directs that the program will have three independent members; and explains the qualifications required of each member. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.

Boards and Commissions - As introduced, removes authority of Tennessee State Employee Association to appoint members to certain boards and commissions. - Amends TCA Title  4, Chapter 27; Title  4, Chapter 3, Part 55; Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 53; Title  8, Chapter 27 and Title  41, Chapter 22, Part 4.

Recycling - As introduced, enacts the "Solid Waste Planning Act of 2012" to require consideration of economic activities concerning recycling when promulgating rules and regulations concerning solid waste and landfills; makes certain other changes and additions to present law concerning recycling. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211.
Mental Illness - As introduced, authorizes disclosure of public records of mental illness that are more than 70 years old. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5 and Title 33.

Taxes, Sales - As introduced, authorizes metropolitan governments to levy an additional local sales tax, not to exceed statutory maximum, on retail sales within a downtown development district, if all funds derived from the tax increase are used to promote business activity or to provide improved government services in the district. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 13; Title 57 and Title 67.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Animal Cruelty and Abuse - As enacted, creates Class E felony of aggravated cruelty to livestock, which is intentionally engaging in specified conduct in a depraved and sadistic manner that results in serious bodily injury or death to the animal and is done without lawful or legitimate purpose. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2.
Hazardous Materials - As introduced, prohibits certain waste processors from processing radioactive waste. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 202, Part 1.

Conservation - As introduced, requires 10 percent reduction in energy use by state government entities by January 1, 2014, and an additional 10 percent reduction by January 1, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 12, Chapter 3 and Title 68, Chapter 214.

Taxes, Sales - As introduced, exempts the diabetic supplies of blood glucose monitor test strips, lancets and visual reading and urine test strips from the sales and use tax. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: TennCare - As enacted, enacts the "Annual Coverage Assessment Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5.
Courts, Circuit - As introduced, authorizes collection of criminal court fines, costs and litigation taxes in same manner as civil debt. - Amends TCA Title 20 and Title 40.

Energy - As introduced, replaces references to the "office of energy management" with references to the "state building management program." - Amends TCA Title  4, Chapter 3; Title 8, Chapter 4, Part 1 and Title 12, Chapter 3.

Fines and Penalties - As enacted, requires that in addition to the other penalties for reckless driving or reckless endangerment, the court will assess a fine of $50.00 to be collected into dedicated county fund and distributed from such fund for specific purposes.  - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 55.

Judges and Chancellors - As introduced, adds the government operations committees of both houses to the list of committees to receive the administrative director of the courts' report on the utilization of senior justices and judges. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 16 and Title 17.

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As introduced, prohibits any person from coercing, compelling or forcing a hospital to violate any person's free exercise of religion or religious beliefs; makes a violation a Class A misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11.
Highway Signs - As enacted, designates the segment of U.S. Highway 411 located in the city limits of Madisonville, as the "LCpl. Franklin 'Frankie' Namon Watson Memorial Highway." -

Civil Procedure - As introduced, requires the party who filed a petition to remove a case to federal court to pay all costs of the removal if the petition is granted. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 20, Chapter 12.
subjects: Legal Issues|Civil Liberties and Civil Rights

title: Indigents - As introduced, requires trial courts to verify income and property of defendants seeking court-appointed counsel in non-capital criminal cases; creates a judgment lien in favor of state against defendants for unpaid attorney's fees and costs; provides that willful nonpayment of the judgment is criminal contempt; increases professional privilege tax for deposit in indigent defense fund; requires supreme court to adopt rules concerning qualifications and appointment of private attorneys. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 14; Title 16; Title 37; Title 40, Chapter 14 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 17.
General Assembly - As enacted, corrects references remaining in TCA to oversight committees that were abolished by Chapter 410 of the Public Acts of 2011. - Amends amend TCA.
Special License Plates - As enacted, authorizes issuance of Dogwood Arts new specialty earmarked license plates. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
Education - As introduced, prohibits promotion of third grade students based on participation in an LEA-approved research-based intervention. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-3115.
Public Officials - As enacted, revises and enacts provisions governing public officials receiving a benefit not otherwise authorized by law. - Amends TCA Section 39-16-402.

Malpractice - As enacted, specifies that upon the filing of any healthcare liability action, the named defendant may petition the court for a qualified protective order allowing the defendant and their attorneys the right to obtain protected health information during interviews, outside the presence of claimant or claimant's counsel, with the relevant patient's treating healthcare providers.  - Amends TCA Section 29-26-121.
Education, Curriculum - As introduced, requires the state board of education to develop a green jobs vocational and technical education program. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Judges and Chancellors - As introduced, requires the rating of each applicant to fill an appellate court vacancy as highly qualified, qualified or not qualified; authorizes the governor to appoint applicants who are rated as either highly qualified or qualified; requires legislative confirmation under limited circumstances.  - Amends TCA Title 17, Chapter 4, Part 1.

Judges and Chancellors - As enacted, clarifies to which judges certain financial disclosure laws apply; clarifies that newly elected judges may practice law to wind up their practice; revises other provisions governing judges. - Amends TCA Section 2-10-102; Section 17-2-112; Section 17-2-202; Section 17-1-105 and Section 23-3-102.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, repeals the cemetery advisory board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 46, Chapter 1, Part 3.
Sunset Laws - As enacted, creates sunrise provision for the interstate nurse licensure compact, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 7, Part 3.

Motor Vehicles - As introduced, authorizes farmers and nursery workers to transport farm machinery and products without having a commercial driver license during times of emergency or disaster. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 4.

Boards and Commissions - As introduced, authorizes and encourages health related and regulatory boards to notify licensees within 30 days of a complaint being filed against them. - Amends TCA Title 62 and Title 63.

Law Enforcement - As introduced, authorizes the peace officer standards and training commission to exempt from basic law enforcement training those police recruits who have earned a bachelor's degree in criminal science, provided they meet other training requirements. - Amends TCA Title 38.
Courts, Supreme Court of Tennessee - As introduced, requires justices of the supreme court to be chosen by nonpartisan elections. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 16 and Title 17.
Special License Plates - As enacted, authorizes issuance of a Tennessee Sheriffs' Association new specialty earmarked license plate. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 2.

Special License Plates - As enacted, extends the time to meet the minimum order requirements for the Labrador Retriever Foundation new specialty earmarked plate until July 1, 2013. - Amends TCA Section 55-4-353.

Special License Plates - As enacted, authorizes Tennessee Breast Cancer Coalition new specialty earmarked license plate; allocates 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to the Tennessee Breast Cancer Coalition to support organization's mission. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Motor Vehicles - As enacted, clarifies that certain trailers and semitrailers used in transporting rolled hay bales, rather than rolled alfalfa bales, are exempt from maximum width and height requirements for motor and other vehicles. - Amends TCA Section 55-7-202.
Judges and Chancellors - As introduced, revises membership of court of the judiciary. - Amends TCA Section 17-5-201.

Malpractice - As introduced, provides that in a health care liability action, a medical expert is limited to testimony concerning the standard of acceptable professional practice in the local community and testimony of the regional or national standard and why it is applicable is inadmissible. - Amends TCA Section 29-26-115.

Election Laws - As introduced, allows persons age 60 and older to vote absentee upon request, instead of age 65 and older to conform to current age requirement of those authorized to obtain a nonphoto bearing driver license.   - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 6; Title 2, Chapter 7, Part 1 and Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 3.

Business and Commerce - As enacted, decreases time a scrap jewelry and metal dealer has to hold items from 30 days from date of purchase to 20 days from date of purchase. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 1, Part 2.

Banks and Financial Institutions - As enacted, extends from July 1, 2012, to July 1, 2015, the time period within which certain licensed money transmitters may obtain authority to own or control a credit card state bank; revises other provisions regarding credit card state banks. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 2, Part 19.

Special License Plates - As introduced, creates new specialty license plate for SpiritHorse Therapeutic Riding; allocates funds from the sale of the plates to allow children with special needs to work with horses. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Workers Compensation - As introduced, applies the Governmental Tort Liability Act to certain government entities for workers' compensation purposes. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 20; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 50, Chapter 6.

Budget Procedures - As introduced, enacts the "Taxpayer Transparency Act"; requires the commissioner of finance and administration to create and maintain a searchable budget database web site detailing certain state budgetary information. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 51.
Local Government, General - As introduced, enacts the "Local Government Transparency Act". - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 49.

Real Property - As introduced, increases from a Class C misdemeanor to a Class B misdemeanor any developer or certain other persons offering or disposing of a time-share interval without having complied with the Time-Share Act of 1981. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 47, Chapter 18; Title 62, Chapter 13; Title 66 and Title 67, Chapter 6.

Fees - As introduced, requires department of safety to publish maximum fee amount that may be charged for vehicle ignition interlock device on department's web site. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10.

Adoption - As introduced, states that either party to an adoption may enforce contract provision providing for open adoption or visitation; allows certain adopted children to be issued new certificate of birth upon reaching age of majority. - Amends TCA Title 36 and Title 68.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, creates a Class A misdemeanor for an individual to either: knowingly prevent another individual from placing a telephone call to 911 or from requesting assistance in an emergency from a law enforcement agency, medical facility, or other agency or entity the primary purpose of which is to provide for the safety of individuals; or intentionally render unusable a telephone that would otherwise be used by another individual to place a telephone call to 911 or to request assistance in an emergency from a law enforcement agency, medical facility, or other agency or entity, the primary purpose of which is to provide for the safety of individuals. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 65.
Judges and Chancellors - As introduced, requires appellate judges be retained by 75 percent of persons voting rather than by a majority of voters. - Amends TCA Title 17, Chapter 4, Part 1.

Sentencing - As introduced, increases from 85 percent to 100 percent the percentage of the sentence imposed that a person convicted of certain specified offenses must serve before being eligible for release. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 35, Part 5.
Highway Signs - As enacted, designates segment of S.R. 18 as "National Bird Dog Highway."  -

Election Laws - As introduced, requires voters in a primary election to acknowledge the political party primary in which they choose to vote most closely represents their views. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 5.
Election Laws - As introduced, requires a person to declare a statewide political party affiliation before voting in a primary election. - Amends TCA Title 2.

Environmental Preservation - As enacted, changes dates of harvest season for wild ginseng from August 15 through December 31 to September 1 through December 31 of each year; adjusts reporting requirement for ginseng dealers to reflect new start date of harvest season. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 28, Part 1 and Title 70, Chapter 8, Part 2.
Driver Licenses - As introduced, prevents sex offenders from obtaining or renewing commercial drivers licenses as of July 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55.

Taxes - As introduced, imposes occupational privilege taxes on performers at adult cabarets, increases sales taxes on certain adult services, materials and products; places revenues in a fund for reduction of taxes on food and food products. - Amends TCA Title 67.

Drugs, Over the Counter - As introduced, provides certain penalties for any person or entity selling or introducing certain synthetic drugs as products and labeling such drugs for a use that the person or entity knows or reasonably should know will not be the intended use. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 47, Chapter 18.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As enacted, authorizes property tax relief for spouses of veterans whose deaths resulted from being deployed in support of peace operations. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-704.

Air Pollution - As introduced, revises membership of air pollution control board to add a member suggested by the Tennessee chapter of the American Lung Association; removes a member suggested by Tennessee Association of Business. - Amends TCA Section 68-201-104.

Education, Dept. of - As enacted, requires that certain information regarding advanced placement courses and dual enrollment courses be included in commissioner's annual report. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, increases computer exemption during recurring August sales tax holiday from $1,500 to $1,750; deletes obsolete language for spring sales tax holiday. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 55; Title 57 and Title 67.
Boards and Commissions - As introduced, repeals licensure of soil scientists. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29, Part 2 and Title 62, Chapter 18.

Fire Prevention and Investigation - As enacted, changes references from "fire tax" to "fire and emergency services tax" in regard to tax that may be levied to assist in funding a county-wide fire department. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 17; Title 12, Chapter 3; Title 66, Chapter 5 and Title 68, Chapter 102.
Planning, Public - As introduced, prohibits local or regional planning commission from prohibiting private road maintenance agreements in residential developments. - Amends TCA Title 13.

Tennessee Wildlife Resources Agency - As enacted, makes it a Class A misdemeanor to knowingly transport or release into the wild, or cause to be transported into or within the state, live wild-appearing swine into or within the state without appropriate documentation from the department of agriculture. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 1.

Taxes, Gasoline, Petroleum Products - As introduced, prohibits certain counties whose chief administrative officers of highway departments are exempt from state qualifications for holding such office from being eligible to receive state-shared fuel taxes or grant funds from the department of transportation. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3; Title 54, Chapter 7, Part 1 and Title 67.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, states that teachers of non-academic subjects that are not measured by TVAAS data shall not be evaluated based on such data; allows each LEA to create an annual evaluation system for such teachers.  - Amends TCA Title 49.

Alcoholic Beverages - As enacted, authorizes a commercially-operated recreational facility that meets certain characteristics to qualify as a premier type tourist resort for purposes of the sale of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption; authorizes a restaurant around Center Hill Lake in DeKalb county that meets certain criteria to qualify as a premier type tourist resort. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.
Consumer Protection - As introduced, revises disclosures required and cancellation provisions relative to time-shares and prohibits certain advertisements. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 32.

Fees - As enacted, clarifies provisions regarding forfeitures of a cash bond or other surety as the result of a municipal traffic violation being transmitted to the TBI. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 54; Title 7, Chapter 3 and Title 38, Chapter 6, Part 1.

Judges and Chancellors - As introduced, terminates salary adjustments for any judge who is convicted of or pleads guilty or no contest to a felony constituting official malfeasance. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 23; Title 16 and Title 17.

State Employees - As introduced, requires annual authorization by state employees of certain portions of payroll deductions for employee associations; provides for record keeping of those organizations and for voluntary withdrawal of nonmandatory dues by employees. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 23.

Criminal Procedure - As enacted, expands definition of "uses" and "conducts" to include "transport" and "conceal" for purposes of the money laundering criminal offenses. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40 relative to criminal offenses and criminal procedure.
Uniform Laws - As introduced, enacts the "Uniform Electronic Legal Material Act." - Amends TCA Title 1; Title 8 and Title 10.
Professions and Occupations - As enacted, revises and enacts various provisions governing scrap metal dealers.  - Amends TCA Title 62.

Special License Plates - As introduced, reclassifies the Tennessee Walking Horse cultural license plate as a new specialty earmarked license plate; changes the distribution of revenue from 80 percent to the arts and 20 percent to the highway fund to 50 percent to the TN Equine Association, 40 percent to the arts and 10 percent to the highway fund. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Motor Vehicles - As introduced, requires law enforcement to notify, within 30 days of impoundment, the owner and lienholders having an interest in a methamphetamine vehicle. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 3, Part 2.
Highway Signs - As enacted, designates segment of S.R. 48 in Dickson County as "Brigadier General Noah Daniel Memorial Highway." -

Taxes, Income - As introduced, increases annual Hall income tax exclusion from first $1,250 to $7,500 for individual returns and from first $2,500 to $15,000 for joint returns beginning January 1, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2, Part 1.
subjects: Labor and Employment|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Local Education Agencies - As introduced, authorizes county boards of education, by agreement with city and special school districts, to allow students from such districts to access the county board's cooperative innovative high school program, if the city or special school districts have not established such program.   - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6 and Title 49.

Local Education Agencies - As introduced, requires the county mayor, county trustee and county board of education to make quarterly settlement of school funds from all sources, including the BEP and other state and federal funds. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2.

Local Education Agencies - As introduced, permits local boards of education to enter into continuing contracts governing the use of each other's schools in case of casualty losses or natural disasters.   - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6 and Title 49.

Local Education Agencies - As introduced, clarifies that unused municipal school buildings may be used by private child care centers and kindergartens for the purpose of providing educational and child care services to the community.   - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 49, Chapter 3; Title 49, Chapter 5; Title 49, Chapter 6; Title 49, Chapter 1 and Title 49, Chapter 2.

Municipal Government - As enacted, specifies that from and after the effective date of the transfer of the administration of the schools in a special school district to the county board of education pursuant to present law, then the restrictions on the creation of new municipal school districts will no longer apply with such a county. - Amends TCA Section 6-58-112.
Public Contracts - As introduced, authorizes county governments to adopt local preference purchasing policies. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3.

Judgments - As enacted, requires that, if a court wrongly grants a default decision imposing an obligation for child support from or against an eligible individual protected under the federal Servicemembers Civil Relief Act, the court must issue an order to the individual receiving funds that the funds be returned and reimbursed. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 25; Title 26; Title 27; Title 29; Title 36; Title 47 and Title 67.

Corporations, For Profit - As enacted, revises and adds to the considerations that the attorney general must make when deciding whether to object to a proposed public benefit hospital conveyance transaction. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 68.

Funeral Directors and Embalmers - As enacted, establishes priority of right to the disposition of human remains and limits certain liability of funeral establishments and funeral directors. - Amends TCA Title 32; Title 47; Title 62, Chapter 5 and Title 68.

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, authorizes a 20 percent tax credit for a qualified purchaser of solar panels and related solar energy technology to be installed in a residence or business; allows the credit to be applied against sales and use taxes and franchise and excise taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, establishes means by which students with documented disabilities who do not meet high school academic qualifications for a HOPE scholarship can attend college, meet college academic requirements and receive the scholarship. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.
Motor Vehicles - As introduced, adds Englewood to municipalities which permit golf carts on certain highways; extends termination date of pilot project to July 1, 2013. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-201.

Jails, Local Lock-ups - As enacted, directs the board of the Tennessee corrections institute to establish criteria for determining whether to waive the minimum qualification standards to employ a jail administrator, workhouse administrator, jailer, corrections officer or guard in county jail or workhouse; and prohibits waivers for employees dishonorably discharged from the military, suffering from mental illness, convicted of domestic assault or any felony conviction. - Amends TCA Section 41-7-106.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Legal Issues

title: Mental Illness - As introduced, authorizes a court to order assisted outpatient treatment as an alternative to inpatient treatment for a person with mental illness.  - Amends TCA Title 33.

Emergency Communications Districts - As introduced, prohibits the transfer to the general fund of interest derived from the 911 emergency communications fund as well as the fund itself. - Amends TCA Section 4-3-1016 and Title 7, Chapter 86, Part 3.
Uniform Commercial Code - As enacted, revises provisions of the Uniform Commercial Code. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 1; Title 47, Chapter 2; Title 47, Chapter 2A and Title 47, Chapter 9.

Election Laws - As introduced, requires the coordinator of elections to file a report with the state and local government committees and speakers of each house no later than February 15 of each odd-numbered year detailing the success or failure of a minor party in receiving recognition as a recognized minor party during the previous election cycle. - Amends TCA Title 2.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, allows insurance companies to offer preference or distinction in property, marine, casualty, or surety insurance as to form or policy, certificate, premium, rate, benefits, or conditions of insurance, based upon membership, nonmembership, or employment of any person by or in certain groups. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 8, Part 1.

Firearms and Ammunition - As introduced, permits employees with valid handgun carry permits to store firearm in employer's public access parking lot provided it is in a locked vehicle and in a glove box or compartment not visible from outside the vehicle; provides employers with ability to prohibit firearms in employer parking lots in some circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

Judges and Chancellors - As introduced, allows a person to carry a firearm during a judicial proceeding if the person is a judge, has a handgun carry permit and only carries the gun concealed while engaged in judicial duties. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-1306.

Insurance, Health, Accident - As enacted, states that coverage made available in plans under the Memphis Plan Act of 1991 shall constitute minimum essential health coverage for purposes of compliance with certain federal minimum coverage requirements; specifies that operation consistent with the present law standards described in the Memphis Plan Act of 1991 would create a presumption that the operating entity is a "health care sharing ministry" under federal law regarding minimum essential coverage.  - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7.
Probate Law - As enacted, revises and clarifies various provisions of law related to probate matters. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 29; Title 30; Title 32; Title 33; Title 35 and Title 56.

Libraries - As enacted, authorizes a city in a county not participating in a region to join the state regional system as related to state purchasing contracts with approval by the secretary of state; requires the secretary of state to assess fees from participating cities for any additional cost of services under the state contracts.  - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 5.

Consumer Protection - As introduced, provides buyers involved in home solicitation sales with additional cancellation rights; establishes additional notice requirements for sellers; allocates the cost of any notary witnessing the signatures to sellers. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 7.
Motor Vehicles - As enacted, prevents car dealerships from being held vicariously liable when loaning a vehicle to a customer with proof of insurance. - Amends TCA Title 55.

Professions and Occupations - As introduced, adds a reference for certification of locksmiths to the most recent and recognized version of the American Locksmith of America Certification. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 11, Part 1.

Education - As introduced, requires the department of education to provide funding to certain entities that assist students in the custody of the department of children's services in obtaining a GED.   - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 14 and Title 49.
Education - As introduced, permits state appropriations or state funds to be made to the directors of schools association. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 21.

Education - As introduced, requires the Tennessee organization of school superintendents and the Tennessee school boards association to collaborate to set and achieve goals related to the general improvement of education in the state. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-2001.

Special License Plates - As enacted, requires that the license plates for veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom be redesigned upon utilization of the existing inventory of the current versions of such plates by the department or revenue; requires that a new license plate be designed and made available to honorably discharged veterans and active members of the U.S. armed forces serving in Operation New Dawn. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
Driver Licenses - As introduced, exempts persons who canceled their social security numbers from furnishing such information to obtain a driver license. - Amends TCA Section 55-50-321.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, creates two new Class C misdemeanor offenses, punishable only by fine of $50.00, if either a legal guardian expressly permits their child to participate in any solicitation or collection event at a highway or street intersection, or the organizer of the collection event expressly permits the child's participation. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17 and Title 68.
Revenue - As introduced, specifies proper notice be given prior to inspecting a taxpayer's books and records concerning certain privilege taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 23.

Registers of Deeds - As enacted, allows the name and address of the person that prepared an instrument that conveys or encumbers the title to real estate or personal property to appear anywhere within the instrument; revises other registration provisions.  - Amends TCA Section 66-24-115.
subjects: Housing and Property|Municipal and County Issues

title: Taxes, Privilege - As enacted, reduces the rate of assessment for the realty recordation tax. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-409.

Unemployment Compensation - As introduced, includes service performed by election officials and election workers receiving over $1,000 in remuneration in definition of excluded service. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, prohibits unauthorized use of governmental seals, emblems or insignia; permits secretary of state and other officials to authorize the use of seals, emblems or insignia in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 12 and Title 39, Chapter 16.

Education - As introduced, limits virtual school enrollment to students of the LEA creating the virtual school; permits LEAs to contract with each other to offer joint virtual education programs. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 16.

Local Education Agencies - As enacted, requires local board of education to approve budget for operation of county schools after the county legislative body's approval in accordance with Local Option Budgeting Law of 1993. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-101.

Motor Vehicles - As introduced, authorizes the department of safety to charge for copies of motor vehicle records under the Uniform Motor Vehicles Records Disclosure Act. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 25.

DUI Offenses - As introduced, increases the application fee for a restricted license, after having a driver license suspended based on a failure by a driver to submit to tests determining blood alcohol content, from $20.00 to $50.00; increases the fine for both the offense and the delinquent act of underage driving while impaired from $250 to $500. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40; Title 41 and Title 55.

Driver Licenses - As introduced, specifies that the letter from a physician verifying a person's disability must set forth the nature of the disability, when applying for a photo identification license. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 3 and Title 55, Chapter 51, Part 1.
Criminal Offenses - As introduced, extends time period that timber purchaser must retain bill of sale from one year to 16 months. - Amends TCA Title 39.
Forfeiture of Assets - As introduced, changes number of days within which a seizing agency must apply for a forfeiture warrant after seizing property from five to seven days. - Amends TCA Title 39.
Game and Fish Laws - As introduced, exempts persons with certain weapons training from the hunter education course required before being able to hunt. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 2, Part 1.
subjects: Agriculture and Food|Animal Rights and Wildlife Issues

title: Indigents - As introduced, prohibits defendants who make an appearance bond from being considered indigent for purposes of a court-appointed attorney. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 14; Title 16; Title 37, Chapter 1; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

Drugs, Over the Counter - As introduced, adds roach clips, rose and pen combinations, cocaine spoons, certain tobacco products, and other items to list of items that are considered drug paraphernalia. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

Criminal Procedure - As introduced, requires that a person give identification when requested by law enforcement that are enforcing criminal laws. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 39 and Title 40.

Employees, Employers - As introduced, prohibits employment discrimination based on an applicant or current employee's ownership, storage, transportation or possession of a firearm that is otherwise in accordance with state and federal law. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 50.

Employees, Employers - As introduced, prohibits public and private employers from inquiring into a prospective employee's criminal background on an initial application for employment. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 13; Title 47; Title 49; Title 50 and Title 71.
Redistricting, Congressional - As introduced, updates reference to 2010 TIGER system; clarifies contiguity by water is sufficient. - Amends TCA Section 2-16-103.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Municipal and County Issues

title: Decatur - As introduced, subject to local approval, extends terms of aldermen that expire in April 2011 to November 2012 and terms of aldermen and mayor that expire in April 2013 to November 2014 to coincide town elections with general November election. - Amends Chapter 58 of the Private Acts of 2003.

Tobacco, Tobacco Products - As introduced, prohibits sales of certain tobacco products by certain persons and businesses; prohibits sales of certain tobacco products and drug paraphernalia near schools, churches, and other locations. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 47 and Title 67.

Firearms and Ammunition - As introduced, prevents employers and landowners from prohibiting individuals licensed to carry from storing guns in locked, personal vehicles. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title  40.
Special License Plates - As enacted, authorizes issuance of an American Lung Association new specialty earmarked license plate. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
Housing - As enacted, authorizes new mechanisms for merging or dissolving housing authorities. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 20.

Insurance, Health, Accident - As introduced, requires health insurance policies to cover communication of mammographic breast density information to patients; requires physicians to communicate mammographic breast density information to patients. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title  63.
Physicians and Surgeons - As introduced, reuqires physicians to communicate certain information about mammographic breast density to patients. - Amends TCA Title 63.
Alcoholic Beverages - As enacted, allows Blue Porch Inn in Rutherford County to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102 and Section 57-4-101.

Health, Dept. of - As enacted, specifies that the Tennessee Hospital Association (THA) must use claims data received from the commissioner strictly for its own internal purposes and for internal purposes of its members. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 1.

Board of Regents - As introduced, adds an additional faculty member and student member to the board of regents; makes terms of such members two years and one year as a nonvoting member, one as a voting member; removes a position on the board reserved for a person now deceased.  - Amends TCA Section 49-8-201(a) and (b).

Education, Higher - As enacted, eliminates certain reporting duties of higher education institutions and governing boards; eliminates requirement that applicants for certain positions in residence halls pay for background checks; requires board of regents employees to receive longevity payments with their regular paychecks. - Amends TCA Section 4-22-103; Section 8-23-206; Section 8-44-108(b)(3) and Section 49-7-149.
Board of Regents - As enacted, allows the court to award back pay to a tenured faculty member whose dismissal the court finds was not appropriate. - Amends TCA Section 49-8-304.

Education, Higher - As enacted, declares that teacher effect data made available to teacher preparation programs are not public records and will be used only in evaluating the preparation programs; requires each institution or postsecondary system receiving the estimates to develop a policy to protect the confidentiality of the data. - Amends TCA Section 49-1-606.

Education - As introduced, requires a biennial report by the office of research and education accountability on costs of school construction for use by the BEP review committee in considering the capital outlay component of the BEP.   - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 49 and Title 67.

Agriculture - As enacted, revises various provisions of the Agriculture Commodities Promotion Act, including provisions requiring certain reports by purchasers and provisions governing the membership of the beef promotion board. - Amends TCA Title 43, Chapter 29, Part 1.

Securities - As introduced, directs the commissioner of commerce and insurance to report to the general assembly on the availability for sale in Tennessee of certain Canadian stocks. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 2, Part 1.

Local Education Agencies - As introduced, provides for re-establishment of elected office of school superintendent for county or city school systems upon two-thirds vote of county or city governing body and approval in an election on the question by the voters; provides for qualifications of candidates; adjusts duties of the local board of education in county or city school systems electing superintendents. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Eminent Domain - As introduced, extends notice to property owners of public hearing concerning redevelopment plan from 10 days to 14 days. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 31; Title 13, Chapter 20 and Title 29.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, provides for mutual consent placement of teachers and alternate options for teachers not selected for positions through mutual consent. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Courts - As introduced, requires that any proof of tolls incurred by jurors must include receipts.  - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 26, Part 1; Title 16, Chapter 4, Part 1; Title 16, Chapter 3, Part 1 and Title 22, Chapter 4, Part 1.

Public Funds and Financing - As introduced, authorizes the commissioner of finance and administration to adopt policies for writing off or cancelling any checks drawn on the state treasury that have not been redeemed.  - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9 and Title 66, Chapter 29.

Fines and Penalties - As introduced, authorizes courts to order payment of restitution in addition to, rather than in lieu of, $50.00 fine for riding an OHV on another's land without permission. - Amends TCA Title 11; Title 39; Title 55; Title 68 and Title 70, Chapter 9.

Real Estate Agents and Brokers - As introduced, sets a 10-day period in which notice must be provided by a person seeking to collect a judgment out of funds held in the real estate education and recovery account. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 62, Chapter 13 and Title 66.

Professions and Occupations - As introduced, requires that any governmental employee, on whose behalf the government chooses to pay the professional privilege tax, use their certification or licensure in connection with their employment. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 17.

Public Records - As introduced, defines "state law" to be Tennessee statutes, rules and case law for purposes of the provision in the public records law exempting any records from disclosure that are confidential under "state law." - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5.

Finance and Administration, Dept. of - As introduced, allows the commissioner to develop procedures setting forth circumstances under which direct deposit of state employees' compensation may be required. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 1; Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 10 and Title 8.
