Criminal Offenses - As introduced, creates Class C misdemeanor of a law enforcement officer unlawfully installing a tracking device on a person or object and establishes a procedure whereby the district attorney can apply to a court for permission to install a tracking device for a specified period for specified offenses. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 6 and Title 40, Chapter 6.

Search & Seizure - As introduced, prohibits the use of unmanned aircraft or similar structures for the purpose of conducting investigations or surveillance where the investigating agency does not have a search warrant for the property under surveillance. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

Education - As introduced, broadens the purpose of certain statutory restrictions concerning who may enter school grounds during school hours. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6.
Professions and Occupations - As introduced, repeals licensure for locksmiths. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 11.

Environment and Conservation, Department of - As introduced, transfers jurisdiction of Off-Highway Vehicle Act from wildlife resources agency to department of environment and conservation. - Amends TCA Title 11; Title  68 and Title  70.
Cosmetology - As introduced, repeals requirement that manicurists be licensed. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 4.

County Officers - As introduced, removes provision that permits clerks, registers of deeds, trustees and sheriffs to retain payments made for special services as a trustee, receiver or special commissioner. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 22, Part 1.
Handgun Permits - As introduced, exempts handgun carry permit holders from criminal background check requirement when purchasing a firearm. - Amends TCA Title 39.

Gas, Petroleum Products, Volatile Oils - As introduced, extends from 20 to 30 days the period of time to file a written notice of appeal before a citation or assessment becomes final for a violation of the rules and regulations promulgated by the oil and gas board. - Amends TCA Title 60.
Game and Fish Laws - As enacted, deletes wild hog from definition of "big game" and removes permitting requirements for hunting wild boars and wild hogs. - Amends TCA Title 70.
subjects: Agriculture and Food|Animal Rights and Wildlife Issues

title: Business Organizations - As enacted, revises multiple provisions of the Tennessee Business Corporation Act. - Amends TCA Title 48.

Special License Plates - As enacted, authorizes issuance of Autism Awareness new specialty earmarked license plates; allocates proceeds to ASMT, Inc., for distribution to ASMT, Inc., Autism Society of East Tennessee, and the Autism Society of the MidSouth as nonprofit organizations dedicated to informational and referral services in their respective grand divisions. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Lottery, Charitable - As enacted, authorizes formation of a broad-based school foundation, subject to certain conditions, by a school or its administrators or supporters; authorizes school foundations, although not in existence for at least five years, to be 501(c)(3) organizations for purposes of the Tennessee Charitable Gaming Implementation Law; removes requirement that 501(c)(3) organizations wanting to conduct an annual event to raise no more than $5,000 be in existence for five years; extends certain deadline for 2011-2012 annual event period. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 17; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.
Holidays and Days of Special Observance - As introduced, requires the governor to proclaim the second Friday in October of each year as Arbor Day. - Amends TCA Title 15.

Veterans - As introduced, establishes a veteran-owned business assistance program to be administered by the department of economic and community development. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7; Title 48, Chapter 102, Part 4 and Title 58.

Remedies and Special Proceedings - As introduced, removes requirement of separately considering the vicarious liability for noneconomic damages of a defendant and the liability of an agent, employee or representative of the defendant. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 39.

Election Laws - As introduced, exempts a person 60 years of age and older who does not have a valid driver license with a photo from the requirements of showing a photo identification when signing an application for ballot to vote. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7, Part 1.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, specifies that painting and striping motor vehicle to appear to be a law enforcement vehicle, when it is not in-fact a law enforcement vehicle, with intent to cause another to believe the vehicle is a law enforcement vehicle constitutes Class A misdemeanor offense of criminal impersonation. - Amends TCA Section 8-10-120; Section 8-8-219; Title 38; Title 39 and Title 55.
Highway Signs - As enacted, designates segment of S.R. 385 in Shelby and Fayette counties as "Governor Winfield Dunn Parkway." -

Advertising - As introduced, clarifies that owners, publishers, operators and employees of a publisher, television station or radio station are not liable for distributing false or misleading advertising matter regarding a mortgage loan unless they know that the matter is false or misleading. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 1; Title 45, Chapter 13 and Title 45, Chapter 5.
Public Contracts - As enacted, revises provisions governing the extension of a contract to provide correctional services. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 41.

Criminal Procedure - As introduced, allows alleged violator 10 days from receipt of letter from district attorney, instead of 15 days, to pay bad check plus fees prior to commencement of criminal action. - Amends TCA Title 40.
Gas, Petroleum Products, Volatile Oils - As introduced, increases the civil penalty for unfair sales practices by dealers of petroleum products from $1,000 to $1,500. - Amends TCA Title 47.
Education, State Board of - As introduced, defines "textbook" for purposes of the duty of the state board to prescribe textbooks and materials for the public schools. - Amends TCA Section 49-1-302.

Transportation, Dept. of - As enacted, authorizes TDOT to allot space on the exterior of the incident response HELP trucks and enter into contracts for the purpose of obtaining certain commercial sponsorship for the HELP program; revenue generated from any such commercial sponsorship would be deposited in the highway fund to be used solely for transportation purposes. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 23 and Title 54.

Forests and Forest Products - As introduced, prohibits clear cutting in state forests; applies to all contracts and leases entered into on and after date this bill becomes law. - Amends TCA Title 11 and Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.

Education - As introduced, requires office of education accountability to submit a copy of its report on monitoring system and school improvement plans to the finance, ways and means committees, in addition to the education committees. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Tort Liability and Reform - As enacted, revises various references through Tennessee Code Annotated from "medical malpractice" to "health care liability" and from "medical malpractice action" to "health care liability action" to conform to the provisions enacted by the 2011 session of the 107th General Assembly in the Tennessee Civil Justice Act of 2011. - Amends TCA Section 7-57-502; Section 8-42-101; Section 8-21-401; Section 9-8-307; Section 10-7-504; Section 28-3-104; Section 29-26-118; Section 29-26-119; Section 29-26-120; Section 29-26-121; Section 29-26-122; Section 29-26-202; Section 29-20-310; Section 29-26-115; Section 29-26-116; Section 29-26-117; Section 37-5-314; Section 56-3-111; Section 56-30-115; Section 56-31-114; Section 56-32-110; Section 56-32-130; Section 56-54-101; Section 56-54-102; Section 56-54-103; Section 56-54-104; Section 56-54-105; Section 56-54-106; Section 56-7-1001; Section 56-7-101; Section 56-7-115; Section 56-8-104; Section 56-13-104; Section 56-19-125; Section 56-2-201; Section 56-27-115; Section 61-1-306; Section 62-3-121; Section 63-25-110; Section 63-27-112; Section 63-3-119; Section 63-30-111; Section 63-31-109; Section 63-4-114; Section 63-5-124; Section 63-51-105; Section 63-51-111; Section 63-51-117; Section 63-6-214; Section 63-6-219; Section 63-6-221; Section 63-6-234; Section 63-8-120; Section 63-9-111; Section 63-9-117; Section 63-11-215; Section 63-12-124; Section 63-13-209; Section 63-23-108; Section 68-140-311; Section 68-140-511 and Section 68-11-223.

Health, Dept. of - As introduced, requires the board of pharmacy to report to the senate health and welfare committee and health and human resources committee of the house concerning the drugs it has approved to be dispensed by local health departments by February 1 of each year. - Amends TCA Section 63-10-205.

Public Health - As introduced, requires the commissioner of health to report, by January 15, 2013, to certain house and senate committees concerning the effects of telemedicine.  - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 23.

Taxes - As introduced, requires that a common carrier's exemption authorization number be included on any certificate of exemption given to a dealer in order for a common carrier to qualify for a reduced sales tax rate on purchases. - Amends TCA Title 67.

Motor Vehicles, Titling and Registration - As introduced, increases the grace period for active military members stationed outside of continental United States to renew vehicle registrations from "14 days" to "30 days" after the member's return to the state; revises when a registration plate must be attached to the rear of a truck. - Amends TCA Title 56; Title 65 and Title 66.
Tourism - As enacted, revises various provisions of the Border Region Retail Tourism Development District Act. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 67.
Taxes - As introduced, specifies that a federal license to sell alcoholic beverages does not mean a federal excise tax receipt. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 55; Title 57 and Title 67.
Environmental Preservation - As introduced, extends time for filing appeal of final actions of a region or authority from 30 days to 45 days. - Amends TCA Title 67; Title 68 and Title 69.

TennCare - As introduced, changes the date of the annual actuarial report by the comptroller of the treasury concerning TennCare from April 15 to March 31; increases the frequency of the bureau of TennCare's reports on the pharmacy rebate program from quarterly to monthly. - Amends TCA Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

Welfare - As introduced, requires the production of a photo identification when an electronic benefits transfer card from a department of human services administered program is used to make a purchase. - Amends TCA Title 71.
Employees, Employers - As introduced, prohibits discrimination in employment on the basis of an individual's status or history of unemployment. - Amends TCA Title 50.
Health Care - As introduced, requires that every newborn be tested for lysosomal storage diseases. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 5.
Dentists and Dentistry - As introduced, authorizes board to permit registered dental assistants to expose and process dental radiographs. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 5, Part 1.

Civil Procedure - As introduced, requires notification of certain boards when a temporary writ of injunction is issued by a court against a business holding a license or permit issued by such agencies; also requires notification when a business holding such a license is declared by a court to be a nuisance; suspension to be for a certain period of time.  - Amends TCA Title 4; Section 4-3-1304; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Section 8-21-401; Title 29, Chapter 3 and Section 68-1-101.
subjects: Legal Issues|Civil Liberties and Civil Rights

title: Alcoholic Beverage Commission - As introduced, authorizes the commission to conduct criminal history background or fingerprint checks on a random sample of permittees or licensees; increases each application fee by $50.00 to cover the cost of checks to be deposited in a special background check fund. - Amends TCA Title 57.
Public Funds and Financing - As enacted, revises provisions governing compensation to exonerated persons.  - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 8, Part 1.
Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As enacted, revises certain provisions regarding the reporting of medical treatment for sexual assault or domestic abuse. - Amends TCA Title 36 and Title 38.
Election Laws - As introduced, removes requirement that a person must pay restitution to victims and court costs to have right of suffrage restored. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 29, Part 2.

Health, Dept. of - As introduced, increases the range of civil penalties assessed for any commercial breeder that advertises, sells or offers to sell any companion animal without a valid license from the commissioner from $50-$1,000 to $100-$2,000. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 17, Part 7.
Animal Cruelty and Abuse - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Animal Abuser Registration, Tracking and Verification Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39.

Taxes, Real Property - As introduced, requires purchaser of property at delinquent tax sale to record copy of the decree that ordered the sale within three days of purchase to serve as notice of purchaser's interest during the redemption period. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.
subjects: Housing and Property|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As introduced, creates new category of Level I adult care home under Long-Term Care Community Choices Act. - Amends TCA Title 68.

Schools, Charter - As introduced, includes in definition of underutilized and vacant property of an LEA schools in which the number of students enrolled is less than 50 percent of the school's capacity; authorizes comptroller to conduct a review of the LEA's catalog of underutilized and vacant property, if requested. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Wine & Wineries - As introduced, creates an additional class of licenses allowing the sale of wine at certain retail food stores; requires person purchasing wine at certain retail food stores to present photo identification. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 1 and Title 57, Chapter 3.

Schools, Charter - As introduced, changes grounds for revocation of a public charter school agreement from failing to make AYP for two consecutive years to failing to meet achievement benchmarks of the state's academic accountability system for five consecutive years; allows revocations for failure to meet academic accountability to be appealed to the state board of education.   - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.

Consumer Protection - As introduced, prohibits lenders from entering into transactions in which a person or entity, for certain consideration, provides funds to another person involved in a legal action and the person receiving the funds assigns to the person or entity the contingent right to receive a part of the proceeds or the legal action's settlement or award; voids contracts resulting from such transactions; makes such prohibited behavior a violation of the Consumer Protection Act of 1977. - Amends TCA Title 45 and Title 47, Chapter 18.
County Officers - As introduced, clarifies that sheriffs have a duty to enforce county ordinances and resolutions. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 8.

Taxes, Litigation - As introduced, authorizes the Sullivan County legislative body, by two-thirds majority vote, to levy a privilege tax of $25.00 in all civil and criminal cases, such revenue to be used exclusively to provide representation for indigent criminal defendants.  - Amends TCA Section 67-4-601.

Municipal Government - As enacted, extends date from July 1, 2012, to July 1, 2014, on expansion of urban growth boundaries for certain tracts of land 10 acres or smaller. - Amends TCA Section 6-58-104.
Public Officials - As introduced, authorizes purchase of insurance to protect against breach of fiduciary duty by public officials and employees. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 29.

Motor Vehicles - As introduced, specifies that the amount of the fine for failing to use a child restraint system in a rear facing position is $75.00, and not a maximum of $50.00; requires that children up to age two, instead of one, must be protected in such systems. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 9.

Wine & Wineries - As introduced, allows sale of wine in retail food stores where sales of alcoholic beverages for on premises consumption has been approved but does not allow sale of wine in retail food stores where sales of alcoholic beverages in retail package stores has been approved. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 1 and Title 57, Chapter 3.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As enacted, specifies that an independent postsecondary institution that was an eligible independent postsecondary institution for lottery scholarship purposes, but became ineligible because of a change in the definition of eligible independent postsecondary institution, will, until June 30, 2016, remain in eligible status so long as it is accredited by SACS. - Amends TCA Section 49-4-902(11)(B).
Sunset Laws - As introduced, terminates the advisory committee on women's health. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 1, Part 18.

Schools, Charter - As enacted, makes charter schools subject to open meetings law; requires charter schools to maintain a web site and post certain notices and information on the web site in certain situations; makes charter school records open records to the same extent as records of public schools operated by LEAs. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.

Wine & Wineries - As introduced, allows local jurisdictions to hold a referendum concerning the sale of wine in retail food stores; creates license for sale of wine in retail food stores. - Amends TCA Title  57, Chapter 1 and Title 57, Chapter 3.

Administrative Procedure (UAPA) - As introduced, expands notice requirement for contested case hearings, from reasonable notice to 30 days notice; prohibits appeal of order of continuance in hearings until order permitting appeal is issued; authorizes petition for attorney's fees and costs by persons in contested case hearings. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5.
Public Employees - As introduced, redefines the duties of the executive director of the public defenders conference. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 14 and Title 9, Chapter 4.

Mental Health, Dept. of - As introduced, directs the information gathered through the family support program to be provided to the house health and human resources committee and the senate health and welfare committee. - Amends TCA Section 33-5-212.

Wine & Wineries - As introduced, creates an additional class of licenses allowing the sale of wine at certain retail food stores; requires person purchasing wine at certain retail food stores to present photo identification. - Amends TCA Title 57.

Physicians and Surgeons - As introduced, prohibits health care providers and facilities from charging an uninsured patient who pays in full with cash more than the lowest charge received from a health insurer for the health care service. - Amends TCA Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.
General Assembly, Studies - As introduced, creates special joint committee to study hazardous duty pay for certain state employees. -

Transportation, Dept. of - As enacted, authorizes TDOT to obtain certain commercial sponsorship of the 511 system and to enter into contracts for this purpose; revenue generated from any such commercial sponsorship would be deposited in the highway fund to be used solely for transportation purposes. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 23 and Title 54.

Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, allows retail package stores to sell ice, soft drinks, mixes, glassware and corkscrews in addition to alcoholic beverages. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 1 and Title 57, Chapter 3.

Firearms and Ammunition - As enacted, permits retired correctional officers and inmate relations coordinators previously employed by the department of corrections to apply to obtain certification to carry a weapon in this state in the same manner as a retired law enforcement officer obtains certification to carry in this state. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 8 and Title 39, Chapter 17.
County Officers - As introduced, allows Roane County to reinstate office of constable by approval of the voters. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 10, Part 1.

Utilities, Utility Districts - As enacted, deletes language that referenced a subsection that was repealed concerning utility district rates sufficient to pay costs and retire bonds.  - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 82.

Utilities, Utility Districts - As introduced, requires local development authority to file a statement with the utility management review board when any utility district, water system or wastewater facility fails to meet any loan covenant with the authority; classifies the non-compliant entity as financially-distressed utility. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 82, Part 4; Title 7, Chapter 82, Part 7 and Title 68, Chapter 221, Part 10.

Alcoholic Beverage Commission - As introduced, requires commission to implement new licensing structure for restaurants and limited service restaurants based on liability insurance codes. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4.

Revenue - As introduced, requires the department of revenue to provide relevant reports regarding the bail bond tax to the administrative office of the courts and such other organizations as it deems appropriate. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.

Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As enacted, creates additional plans through which political subdivisions of the state may participate in the Tennessee Consolidated Retirement System (TCRS).  - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 25, Part 1; Title 8, Chapter 25, Part 3; Title 8, Chapter 34; Title 8, Chapter 35; Title 8, Chapter 36 and Title 8, Chapter 37.

Public Funds and Financing - As enacted, changes requirements for federal home loan banks in regard to the issuance of letters of credit as eligible collateral for public funds to require that the banks be rated "investment grade" by at least one nationally recognized securities rating service instead of being rated in the highest category by at least two nationally recognized securities rating services. - Amends TCA Section 9-4-103(9)(A).

Local Education Agencies - As introduced, requires local education agencies to annually review and promulgate policies to prohibit harassment, intimidation, bullying or cyber-bullying.  - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, allows sale of wine in retail food stores where sales of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption has been approved but does not allow sale of wine in retail food stores where sales of alcoholic beverages in retail package stores has been approved. - Amends TCA Title 57.

Planning, Public - As introduced, requires a municipal planning commission not less than 30 days prior to the date the commission meeting is scheduled to amend, extend or add to the plan, to post on its web site a map or detailed information describing in specificity how the plan is to be amended, extended or revised. - Amends TCA Title 13.
Education - As introduced, prohibits nepotism in hiring of licensed employees in LEAs. -

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, requires that the income of individuals over 65 years of age have the same meaning ascribed to "adjusted gross income" for federal income tax purposes; requires that income from stock dividends and bond interest be exempt for state tax purposes to the same extent such income is exempt for federal tax purposes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.
Utilities, Utility Districts - As introduced, revises provisions governing the creation of a utility district. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 82.

Education, Higher - As introduced, requires applicants for employment involving custodial services at a public institution of higher education to submit to criminal history records check and have results sent to the institution; prohibits the hire of person on sex offender registry for position involving custodial services for campus facilities. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7; Title 49, Chapter 8 and Title 49, Chapter 9.

Education - As introduced, specifies that a third grade student who does not have an understanding of curriculum and ability to perform reading skills may be promoted if the student participates in research-based intervention and shows such understanding and skills upon being retested. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-3115.

Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As introduced, redefines "average final compensation" to cap such amount at the  salary of a Class 1 official for persons in the Tennessee consolidated retirement system. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 34; Title 8, Chapter 35; Title 8, Chapter 36 and Title 8, Chapter 37.

Business and Commerce - As introduced, requires a scrap jewelry or metal dealer or pawnbroker to take the thumbprint of a seller under certain circumstances.  - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 1, Part 2 and Title 45, Chapter 6, Part 2.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, increases punishment for selling or manufacturing synthetic derivatives or analogues of methcathinone from Class A misdemeanor to Class D felony for first offense, Class C felony for second or subsequent offenses and Class C felony for selling to minor regardless of offense. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

Correctional Programs - As introduced, requires 10-cent fee be collected on telephone calls made by inmates in local jails or workhouses; requires fee to be remitted to special account for local correctional officer training through Tennessee corrections institute. - Amends TCA Section 41-7-104.

Education - As introduced, requires the departments of health and education to jointly amend and periodically revise guidelines concerning use and availability of anti-seizure medication during an emergency. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Safety - As enacted, expands the definition of ready-removable in the Tennessee modular building act to permit ready-removables to include electrical wiring; specifies that all ready-removables with electrical wiring must meet applicable state and local electrical permitting requirements, local building permitting requirements, and have hardwired smoke alarms installed in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 126, Part 3.

Gas, Petroleum Products, Volatile Oils - As introduced, requires that for the purpose of ad valorem property taxation, the value of certain facilities that extract, purify, dehydrate, or otherwise treat landfill methane be assessed at the same percentage as a qualified pollution control facility. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 28, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 6.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, increases from 60 to 90 days the time that the insurance company has to respond to the policyholder's demand for payment of damages or loss; and increases from 30 to 45 days the time that the insurance company has, prior to the commencement of action by the policyholder, to make a payment. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7.

Water Authorities - As introduced, increases the period of advance notice that a public water system must provide to customers before initiating or permanently ceasing fluoridation from 30 to 35 days. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 221.
Drugs, Prescription - As introduced, creates a medication monitoring process to ensure the safety of certain drug therapies. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 10.
Adoption - As introduced, clarifies that each child placed for temporary care or adoption by an unlicensed party is a separate Class A misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 36 and Title 37.

Adoption - As introduced, adds siblings and grandparents of the adopted child, in addition to the biological parents, as persons for whom any post-adoption services provided by the department of children's services will be available. - Amends TCA Title 36.

Criminal Procedure - As introduced, requires the clerk of court to include in regular monthly report the number of defendants in termination of parental rights cases for whom the court appointed counsel waived the administrative fee or collected the administrative fee. - Amends TCA Title 40.
Children - As introduced, entitles children to representation by legal counsel in proceedings alleging truancy. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 1, Part 1 and Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 30.

Schools, Charter - As enacted, revises charter school application process time frames; permits LEAs to charge charter school applicants an application fee; revises other charter school-related provisions. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.

Drugs, Over the Counter - As introduced, requires pharmacies and pharmacy personnel to use a national record keeping system to log certain drug sales and changes the rate at which an individual may buy methamphetamine precursors. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-431.

Special License Plates - As enacted, authorizes FedExFamilyHouse new specialty earmarked license plate; allocates 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to Le Bonheur Children's Hospital Foundation to be used to support FedExFamilyHouse. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
Health Care - As introduced, enacts the Health Care Compact. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 33; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.
Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As enacted, revises various provisions regarding investment of Tennessee Consolidated Retirement System (TCRS) assets. - Amends TCA Section 8-37-104(a)(10)(A).
Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As enacted, allows nursing homes and their affiliates to employ physicians in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 63 and Title 68, Chapter 11.

Zoning - As introduced, defines agricultural uses to mean any land, machinery, buildings, recreational and educational activities for the commercial production of farm products and nursery stock for purposes of certain zoning provisions. - Amends TCA Title 13 and Title 43.

Flags - As introduced, authorizes P.O.W.-M.I.A. flags to be flown at welcome centers and, if flown, requires flag to be flown between the United States flag and the Tennessee state flag. - Amends TCA Title 15, Chapter 2, Part 1 and Title 58, Chapter 4, Part 3.

Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As introduced, decreases from five years to two years the professional experience required for an emerging investment manager; redefines "emerging investment manager" to include a Tennessee-based business. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 37.
Taxes, Sales - As introduced, specifies that food that is glazed by the seller is not "prepared food" for purposes of taxation. - Amends TCA Title 67.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Campaigns and Campaign Finance - As introduced, prohibits PACs from using funds for anything other than a contribution or expenditure as defined by statute; adds to definition of "contribution" monies received for defraying legal expenses an officeholder or candidate incurred in connection with an election or campaign. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10, Part 1.

Public Utilities - As introduced, prohibits any public utility from collecting outstanding underpaid fees resulting from an error by the public utility's employee or agent beyond six months from date of erroneous bill. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 34; Title 7, Chapter 82; Title 28, Chapter 3, Part 3; Title 65 and Title 68, Chapter 221, Part 2.

Local Education Agencies - As enacted, specifies that when reviewing the proposed budget of the county department of education, the county legislative body may only alter or revise the total amount of expenditures as proposed and such alterations or revisions must comply with state law and regulations. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 21.

Sports - As enacted, clarifies that amounts of state and local sales tax revenue derived from an indoor sports facility in Davidson County that are subject to special distribution under present law will be distributed to the sports authority or comparable municipal agency formally designated by the municipality; specifies that such revenue must be used exclusively for the payment of, or the reimbursement of expenses associated with securing current, expanded or new events for such facilities. - Amends TCA Title 67.
Controlled Substances - As introduced, adds six chemical derivatives of the Schedule I controlled substance methcathinone as Schedule I drugs. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

Prisons and Reformatory Institutions - As introduced, increases from $60.00 per day to $100 per day the possible amount that a county may seek as reimbursement for maintaining an inmate unless the actual per diem cost of maintaining the inmate is less. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 9; Title 40 and Title 41.

State Inmates - As introduced, requires department of correction reports on the cost of care for an inmate to include an itemized list of the necessary provisions included in such cost. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 40, Chapter 24 and Title  41, Chapter 21, Part 9.
Probation and Parole - As introduced, establishes pilot program to reduce the number of repeat offenders in the state. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 40 and Title 41.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, restores teachers' rights to collective bargaining; removes collaborative conferencing provisions. - Amends TCA Section 5-23-107 and Title 49.

Taxes, Income - As introduced, repeals the Hall Income Tax in 2015; decreases tax rate from 6 percent to 4 percent in 2013; decreases tax rate from 4 percent to 2 percent in 2014.  - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2, Part 1.
subjects: Labor and Employment|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, authorizes an insurer who offers a voluntary wellness program to accept a physician's statement that a plan member has a medical condition making the member's participation unreasonably difficult or medically inadvisable. - Amends TCA Title 56.

Consumer Protection - As enacted, adds "engaging in a ponzi scheme" and "making fraudulent statements or intentional omissions in order to induce a consumer to sell securities or other things of value to fund an annuity product or other form of investment" to the list of unfair or deceptive acts or practices under the Consumer Protection Act.  - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18.

Courts - As introduced, requires that any necessary equipment and supplies be provided to conduct proceedings when a court holds its session at a location outside the courtroom.  - Amends TCA Title 16.

General Assembly - As introduced, requires that the executive director of the district attorneys general conference and the director of the TBI appear annually before a joint committee meeting of the house and senate judiciary committees to report on the quality and quantity of the respective prosecutorial and investigative resources and any recommendations for improvement; requires the house and senate judiciary committees to invite the chief justice of the Tennessee supreme court to annually deliver a state of the judiciary address to a joint meeting of those committees. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 53 and Title 67.

Sentencing - As introduced, adds charitable and governmental agencies to entities at which a person convicted of simple possession may be required to perform community service. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40; Title 53, Chapter 10 and Title 53, Chapter 11.

Sentencing - As introduced, increases the number of days that a presentence report must be filed with the clerk prior to a sentencing hearing from 10 days to 15 days.   - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 53.

General Assembly - As introduced,  requires that the executive director of the district attorneys general conference and the director of the TBI appear annually before a joint committee meeting of the house and senate judiciary committees to report on the quality and quantity of the respective prosecutorial and investigative resources and any recommendations for improvement; requires the house and senate judiciary committees to invite the chief justice of the Tennessee supreme court to annually deliver a state of the judiciary address to a joint meeting of those committees. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 53 and Title 67.

Fines and Penalties - As introduced, authorizes the court to instruct the jury to consider the defendant's personal income and ability to pay when determining the fine amount to impose. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 53.
Education, Curriculum - As enacted, requires that a family life education curriculum comply with certain restrictions.  - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

Banks and Financial Institutions - As introduced, extends indefinitely provisions authorizing a money transmitter licensed pursuant to title 45, chapter 7 with a net worth of not less than $25 million to organize and own or control a credit card state bank in Tennessee, such provisions are scheduled to expire on July 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 2 and Title 45, Chapter 7.

Gambling - As introduced, removes the grading punishment for lotteries, chain letters and pyramid clubs and punishes the offense according to the grading punishment for theft. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

Taxes, Litigation - As enacted, imposes additional $2.00 litigation tax on criminal charges instituted in general sessions court in counties served by judicial commissioner; creates judicial commissioner continuing education account; subject to appropriation, authorizes moneys in fund to be utilized for development and presentation of continuing education programs; act not applicable in Robertson County. - Amends TCA Section 40-1-111 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 6.

Taxes, Tobacco, Tobacco Products - As introduced, mandates any operator of a roll your own cigarette machine is a tobacco product manufacturer and must pay the excise tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 26.

Controlled Substances - As introduced, makes materials containing any quantity of ephedrine or pseudoephedrine a Schedule III controlled substance and exempts immediate methamphetamine precursors if they are not in form that can be used in manufacture of methamphetamine. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.

Judges and Chancellors - As introduced, allows party to an action who thinks the judge or chancellor is incompetent to hear the case because of a conflict to file motion for recusal and exercise one automatic right of recusal if judge's response to motion does not resolve the conflict. - Amends TCA Title 16 and Title 17.

Abortion - As enacted, enacts the "Life Defense Act of 2012," which requires that physicians performing abortions have admitting privileges in hospital within certain area of where abortion performed. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 10, Part 3; Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 2 and Title 68.
Pharmacy, Pharmacists - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Medication Therapy Monitoring and Management Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 53.
University of Tennessee - As enacted, authorizes the University of Tennessee to enter into certain agreements with foundations that support the university. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 9, Part 1.

Economic and Community Development - As introduced, requires the commissioner of economic and community development to annually report to certain committees in the general assembly by February 1 of each year concerning data compiled from each agency that receives public funding to assist small businesses. -

Budget Procedures - As introduced, directs commissioner of finance and administration to certify the amount of surplus state revenue collected each year, and requires that appropriation act for subsequent fiscal year appropriate such amount for higher education purposes or allocate such amount to the rainy day fund. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 67.

Health Care - As introduced, requires that every newborn be tested for lysosomal storage disorders, including Krabbe, Fabry, Gaucher, Pompe, Hurler Syndrome, Niemann-Pick, and others as determined by the department of health as screenings for such become available. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 5.

Taxes, Sales - As introduced, exempts the diabetic supplies of blood glucose monitor test strips, lancets and visual reading and urine test strips from the sales and use tax. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Livestock - As enacted, limits liability of a bovine owner for injuries, loss, damage or death of another resulting from bovine activities if the bovine owner maintains proper warning notice on signs, and maintains proper fences and enclosures. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 43 and Title 44.

Education, Curriculum - As introduced, redefines terms from which each school district develops a policy prohibiting harassment, intimidation, bullying and cyber bulling on and off school grounds. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 10.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, enhances the crime of the unlawful sale, loan or gift of a firearm or switchblade knife from a Class A misdemeanor to a Class D felony if the recipient of the firearm or switchblade knife is a minor. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

Professions and Occupations - As introduced, requires scrap jewelry and metal dealers to have a computer system in operation to log certain information if so requested by a law enforcement agency; requires such dealers to photograph their inventory and retain such photographs for two years. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 1, Part 2.

Short Term Loans and Lenders - As enacted, requires pawnbrokers to have a computer system in operation to log certain information if so requested by a law enforcement agency. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 39 and Title 45, Chapter 6, Part 2.

Flags - As enacted, requires state flags to be flown at half-staff by state and political subdivisions during day of mourning declared by the governor for armed services members killed in action. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 1, Part 4.

Sunset Laws - As introduced, combines regional community services agencies into one state agency; extends the state community services agency, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 37, Chapter 5, Part 3.

Salaries and Benefits - As introduced, raises the standard to clear and convincing proof of competent medical evidence to overcome the presumption that any impairment of health of law enforcement officers and firefighters caused by hypertension or heart disease resulting in hospitalization, medical treatment or any disability shall have been suffered in the course of employment. - Amends TCA Section 7-51-201.

Judges and Chancellors - As introduced, requires the TBI to complete background investigations on the panel of nominees for a vacant appellate court judgeship within 90 days of being directed to do so by the governor. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 4; Title 16 and Title 17.

Campaigns and Campaign Finance - As enacted, requires that statements certifying a candidate's treasurer must contain the office that the candidate is seeking and the year of the election.  - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10 and Title 4, Chapter 55.

Election Laws - As introduced, removes requirement that a person must pay outstanding child support obligations that accumulated during any period of incarceration to have right of suffrage restored. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 29, Part 2.
Children - As introduced, deletes obsolete reporting requirement for the juvenile records task force. - Amends TCA Title 37.
Motor Vehicles - As introduced, requires tractor trailers and semitrailers to have mud flaps behind the rearmost wheels. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 7.
Gas, Petroleum Products, Volatile Oils - As introduced, requires truck stops to remove abandoned tires from their property within 24 hours. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211, Part 8.

Taxes, Inheritance Gift - As introduced, eliminates distinction between Class A and Class B donees for gift tax purposes; increases gift tax exemption by linking Tennessee to federal exemption level. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8, Part 1.
subjects: Family and Children Issues|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Planning, Public - As enacted, authorizes local governments to create grant programs to provide funding to home owners and developers who invest in blighted property for the purpose of providing stabilization of the value of the neighborhood and increase the value of such property. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7 and Title 8.

Economic and Community Development - As introduced, requires department of economic and community development to study feasibility of creating an inner-city small business fund and report its findings to the general assembly by February 15, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 12 and Title 13.

Bonding, Surety and Professional - As introduced, requires comptroller to establish a pilot project to provide bonding to minority-owned businesses in the construction industry in Shelby County. - Amends TCA Title 9; Title 12 and Title 13.

Business and Commerce - As introduced, directs the comptroller to study the feasibility of waiving the performance bond requirement for small businesses and report its findings and conclusions to the state and local government committees of both the senate and house by February 13, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 12.

DUI Offenses - As enacted, increases the minimum time that a driver license may be revoked for third and fourth and subsequent DUI convictions from three and five years to six and eight years. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

Open Meetings - As introduced, requires notice of government operations committee sunset hearings be posted on the comptroller and general assembly web sites, deleting the current requirement that such notice be published in newspapers of general circulation. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29.

Planning, Public - As introduced, requires counties of a planning region to create a property rights advisory counsel composed of at least three volunteer residents within the planning region who are to review all proposed zoning or comprehensive plan amendments to ensure the proposed compulsory land-use controls are necessary and that private alternatives to land-use controls have been proven by clear and convincing evidence to be unfeasible. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 3, Part 1.
Criminal Offenses - As introduced, adds new criminal offenses involving mass picketing and targeted residential picketing. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 3.
Nurses, Nursing - As introduced, revises terms practical nurse and advanced practice nurse to advance practice registered nurse. - Amends TCA Title 49; Title 53; Title 56; Title 63 and Title 71.

Election Laws - As introduced, allows registry of election finance to receive complaints with regard to certain campaign finance Class C misdemeanor offenses. - Amends TCA Title  2, Chapter 19 and Title 2, Chapter 10.
Insurance, Health, Accident - As introduced, authorizes transfer risk from health insurers to providers and provider networks. - Amends TCA Title 56.
Textbooks - As introduced, provides a means for parents to request textbooks that inculcate principles of religion within the study of secular subjects. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 22.

Game and Fish Laws - As introduced, prohibits agents of the TWRA and other law enforcement officials from seizing commercial fishing equipment absent a finding of guilt for the crime charged in a court of law. - Amends TCA Section 70-6-201.
subjects: Agriculture and Food|Animal Rights and Wildlife Issues

title: Basic Education Program (BEP) - As introduced, requires the director of legislative budget analysis to report to the speakers of the house of representatives and the senate and to the house and senate education committees if the commissioner of education fails to provide the director with the revised BEP funding formula for the ensuing fiscal year by January 1. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 8; Title 37 and Title 49.

Firearms and Ammunition - As introduced, requires employers to permit employees to carry firearms in their locked motor vehicles when parking in a parking area that is open to the public generally and confers immunity upon the employer for damages arising out of occurrence with a stored firearm. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

Funeral Directors and Embalmers - As enacted, revises certain provisions governing licenses that become invalid due to nonrenewal; clarifies that the operator of a crematory facility must obtain a permit for cremation of human remains prior to performing a cremation.  - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 5.

Zoning - As introduced, includes multifamily residential developments among establishments affected by non-conforming use exemptions and restrictions in municipal zoning regulations; changes from 30 continuous months of cessation of operation by a facility during which non-conforming use exemption expires to continuous period of between 12 and 30 months as established by zoning ordinance. - Amends TCA Section 13-7-208.

Alcohol Offenses, Motor Vehicles - As introduced, requires the bodily fluid of a driver of a motor vehicle to be tested for alcohol or drugs if law enforcement has probable cause to believe that the driver caused an accident resulting in death or serious bodily injury or if there is reasonable suspicion that the driver was under the influence and was impaired to the slightest degree. - Amends TCA Section 55-10-406.
Energy - As introduced, creates the "Property Assessed Clean Energy Act." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 45 and Title 68.
Paternity - As introduced, requires paternity testing before a father can be listed on a birth certificate. - Amends TCA Title  24, Chapter 7, Part 1; Title 36 and Title 68.

Campaigns and Campaign Finance - As introduced, limits the amount of money that a multicandidate political campaign committee can contribute to candidates and other multicandidate political campaign committees excluding party and caucus PACs; requires multicandidate political campaign committee to certify names and addresses of persons making decisions about the committee's contributions and expenditures. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

Clerks, Court - As enacted, requires clerk to accept cost bond signed by attorney in lieu of party paying fees or clerk must forfeit all costs. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 21, Part 4 and Title 25, Chapter 1, Part 1.
Highway Signs - As enacted, names segment of S.R. 249 in Cheatham County in honor of the late Corporal Kristopher Daniel Greer, USMC. -

Criminal Procedure - As enacted, provides that a defendant in a criminal case has the right to have court reporter and make a verbatim recording of all proceedings in open court. - Amends TCA Title 20, Chapter 9 and Title 40, Chapter 14.

Local Government, General - As introduced, authorizes corporate authorities of municipalities to hold landowners responsible for maintaining and securing vacant property; authorizes municipalities to establish registries by which to effect service of process and notice on landowners. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 54, Part 1.

Taxes - As introduced, enacts the "Millionaires' Tax Act." - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 16; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 61; Title 62; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.

Taxes - As enacted, urges the comptroller, in conjunction with the department of environment and conservation and the department of revenue, to study laws and policies dealing with Tennessee's taxation of recycled products using a raw material in the manufacturing process; and investigate any tax policy or make any recommendation that would help promote Tennessee's businesses using more recycled material in their manufacturing process. - Amends TCA Title 67.
Pharmacy, Pharmacists - As introduced, revises requirements on pharmacists in issuing certain methamphetamine precursors. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-431.

Election Laws - As enacted, requires the coordinator of elections to compare the statewide voter registration database with the department of safety database to ensure non-United States citizens are not registered to vote in this state. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 2, Part 1.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, changes school personnel in positions for which no teaching license is required from at-will employees to at-will employees for the first two years of employment and then employees on year-to-year contracts in years thereafter; allows director of schools to dismiss such employees for cause after giving written notice of the charges and a hearing. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-301.

Special License Plates - As introduced, requires department of revenue to establish program to authorize the sale of non-refundable gift vouchers redeemable toward additional $35.00 fee for cultural, specialty earmarked and new specialty earmarked license plates. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Entertainment Industry Investment Act." - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3.

Taxes, Sales - As introduced, revises definition of a border retail tourism development district to include any district located in municipalities whose corporate limits are within 25 miles of two state borders, and a district boundary is within 30 miles from a state border and five miles from an existing interstate. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 40, Part 1.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Special License Plates - As enacted, extends the deadline for the Niswonger Children's Hospital special license plate to meet the minimum order requirement to July 1, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
Mental Illness - As introduced, creates a duty to warn and report certain threats of suicide to certain entities or persons. - Amends TCA Title 33 and Title 39.

Environment and Conservation, Department of - As enacted, authorizes the air pollution control board to issue TDEC commissioner authority to grant variances for certain open burnings and emissions testing requirements. - Amends TCA Section 68-201-118.
Alcoholic Beverages - As enacted, allows the National Ornamental Metal Museum in Memphis to serve or sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

State Inmates - As introduced, directs the department of correction to promulgate rules and regulations on the use of spit masks in prisons; prohibits restricting a prisoners blood circulation and breathing with the use of spit masks. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 40, Chapter 7 and Title 41.

Students - As enacted, requires LEAs to include in student discipline codes a prohibition on students wearing on school grounds during the school day clothing that exposes underwear or body parts in an indecent manner that disrupts the learning environment.   - Amends TCA Title 49.

Sexual Offenders - As enacted, requires any sexual offender who is housed in a halfway house or any other facility as an alternative to incarceration to register as a sexual offender and report with the offender's registering agency. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39.
Gas, Petroleum Products, Volatile Oils - As introduced, prohibits truck stops within 1/2 mile of residential areas; applies only to Davidson and Shelby counties. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 24.

Special License Plates - As enacted, directs the legend of animal friendly new specialty license plates to bear "Spay/Neuter"; plates to be issued only after exhaustion of existing stock. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
Game and Fish Laws - As introduced, authorizes non-resident landowners to hunt on land that they are the sole owner of without purchasing a license. - Amends TCA Title 70.
subjects: Agriculture and Food|Animal Rights and Wildlife Issues

title: Insurance, Health, Accident - As introduced, expands definition of small employer to include employers employing one or two employees. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 22.
County Government - As introduced, adds three county mayors as appointed by the governor to the current seven member state consolidation committee. - Amends TCA Title 5.

Tennessee Bureau of Investigation - As introduced, permits the bureau, if necessary in performing the duties of the bureau, to utilize dogs that are trained to detect chemicals and compounds used to make explosives and explosive devices. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.

Real Property - As introduced, prohibits the transfer of a possessory interest in a deed of trust, mortgage or other lien securing the payment of money or other thing of value on an owner-occupied residence while a foreclosure is pending. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 35, Chapter 5; Title 45, Chapter 20; Title 47 and Title 66.
Holidays and Days of Special Observance - As enacted, designates the month of July each year as "Tennessee Genealogy Month." - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 1, Part 4.

Education, Higher - As introduced, allows municipal corporation to begin or cease enforcement of traffic ordinances on campus within 45 days, rather than 30 days, of a higher education institution requesting it. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 49.

Boards and Commissions - As introduced, provides that a member of the judicial performance evaluation commission is not eligible to seek or be appointed to an appellate judgeship for a period of one year immediately following conclusion of the member's service on the commission. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 16 and Title 17.

Courts - As introduced, increases from $500 to $1,000 the civil fine for undertaking or attempting to undertake the practice of court reporting without a license or knowingly presenting or filing false information with the licensing board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 20, Chapter 9.

Taxes, Privilege - As introduced, changes the municipal stadium seat privilege tax which may be levied by county having a metropolitan form of government on spectators attending an event at a municipal stadium from 10% of the consideration charged to a fee of $20.00. - Amends TCA Title 7.

Fiscal Review Committee - As enacted, codifies position of committee's executive director who is hired subject to majority vote of committee; attaches committee to general assembly for administrative purposes. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 7.

Adoption - As introduced, states that withdrawal of or change to an automatic veto for adoption contact shall be effective immediately upon receipt of the written request by the department. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 37 and Title 40.

Municipal Government - As introduced, authorizes municipality to establish ownership registry for buildings that have been vacant in excess of 30 days and set other registration requirements to insure that the municipality has means to serve notice and execute service of process. - Amends TCA Section 6-54-113.

Highways, Roads and Bridges - As introduced, allows the clerk of the court to specify the form of the bond that is required to be posted by the utility district that is exercising eminent domain in conjunction with a highway project. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 23; Title 7, Chapter 82; Title 29, Chapter 16; Title 29, Chapter 17 and Title 54.

Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As enacted, allows a charitable organization to calculate reserves using the Annuity 2000 Mortality Table and other interest assumption, or other mortality table; allows organization to maintain a separate Tennessee account; allows the commissioner to designate a later time for the organization to submit an audited report. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 52.
Purchasing - As introduced, authorizes county governments to adopt local preference purchasing policies. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, changes a nonacademic eligibility requirement for receipt of Tennessee HOPE scholarship by home schooled student from being home schooled for two years immediately preceding completion of high school to being home schooled for one year immediately preceding completion of high school.   - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

Alcohol Offenses, Motor Vehicles - As introduced, creates misdemeanor offense of possessing open container of alcoholic beverage within passenger area of motor vehicle on public highway. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

Building Commission, State - As introduced, requires that all public buildings mark stair edges with 2-inch thick black and yellow non-slip low vision tape of at least 2-inch thickness; for purposes of exterior steps, black and yellow non-slip paint conforming to the same requirements is permissible. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 68 and Title 71.
subjects: Housing and Property|Federal, State, and Local Relations

title: Privacy, Confidentiality - As enacted, classifies consumer specific energy usage data, except for aggregate monthly billing information, as a private record. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5.

Eminent Domain - As introduced, increases the return date of service of process from 20 to 30 days, as to inform the necessary parties of the eminent domain hearing. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 17.
Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, makes certain changes to background check requirements for teachers. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 10 and Title 49, Chapter 5.
Garnishments and Executions - As introduced, makes various changes to the garnishment summons form to be served by the sheriff or other applicable officer. - Amends TCA Title 26, Chapter 2.

Education - As introduced, prohibits professional employees of a local school system or the department of education who are board members of professional education associations from receiving administrative leave to attend board meetings. - Amends TCA Section 8-50-110.
Naming and Designating - As enacted, names pathway surrounding Tennessee Bicentennial Mall in honor of Andrea Conte. -

Autopsies - As enacted, extends the date from July 1, 2011, to July 1, 2012, for a facility where autopsies are performed to receive accreditation from the National Association of Medical Examiners. - Amends TCA Section 38-7-105.

Boards and Commissions - As introduced, allows attorney members of judicial nominating commission to have continuance in trial court hearings if commission meeting scheduled. - Amends TCA Title 17, Chapter 4, Part 1.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, enhances simple possession of a controlled substance to a Class E felony where a person has two prior convictions for manufacturing, delivering or selling a controlled substance. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.
Trade Regulation - As introduced, declares certain goods that are made in Tennessee are not subject to the commerce clause of the federal constitution. - Amends TCA Title 4.

Criminal Procedure - As enacted, clarifies that a defendant cannot get records expunged if convicted of an offense other than the charged offense or convicted of one offense in a multi-count indictment, including lesser included offenses. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 32, Part 1.
State Government - As introduced, requires department of finance and administration to create electronic tracking system for permits and licenses issued by the state. - Amends TCA Title 4.

State Government - As enacted, authorizes certain departments, boards and other governmental entities to allow holders of licenses, certifications or registrations to be notified by electronic mail of renewals, fee increases and changes in the law and of any meeting where changes in rules or fees are on the agenda.  - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 37; Title 45; Title 62; Title 63 and Title 71.
Zoning - As introduced, enacts "Tennessee Non-Conforming Property Act." - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 7.

Planning, Public - As introduced, clarifies development regulations in effect on date of submission of application for development govern review of that development; specifies that preliminary approval for planned development remains effective five years. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 3, Part 4; Title 13, Chapter 4, Part 3; Title  13, Chapter 7, Part 2 and Title 13, Chapter 7, Part 1.

Ethics - As enacted, requires members of local and regional planning commissions to file disclosure statements of conflict of interests with Tennessee ethics commission. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 50, Part 5.
Highway Signs - As enacted, designates bridge at State Route 109 and U.S. Highway 70 / State Route 24 in Wilson County the "Spc. Michael Lane Stansbery Jr. Memorial Bridge."  -
Zoning - As introduced, allows on-site signs for structures that are rebuilt to nonconform to existing zoning regulations similar to off-site signs. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6 and Title 13.
Zoning - As introduced, allows on-site signs for structures that are rebuilt to non-conform to existing zoning regulations similar to off-site signs. - Amends TCA Section 13-7-208.

Judges and Chancellors - As enacted, requires speakers to appoint all nine members of the judicial evaluation commission since the judicial council no longer exists. - Amends TCA Title 17, Chapter 4, Part 2.

Environment and Conservation, Department of - As enacted, requires the commissioner to prepare semiannual permitting efficiency reports that include statistics on whether the department has timely acted on permit applications pursuant to the appropriate rule, beginning in 2013. - Amends TCA Title  4, Chapter 3, Part 5 and Title 68.

Game and Fish Laws - As enacted, enacts the "Hunter Wright Hunting and Fishing Act," which authorizes the director of the TWRA to issue an annual sport combination hunting and fishing license upon payment of a $5.00 fee to Tennessee residents who are minors and who are disabled.  - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 2.
subjects: Agriculture and Food|Animal Rights and Wildlife Issues

title: Public Contracts - As introduced, creates pilot project that will give allowances for Tennessee businesses in the evaluation of bids and proposals for state contracts during a two-year period. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 56; Title 12, Chapter 4 and Title 12, Chapter 3.
Election Laws - As introduced, adds additional requirements for a presidential candidate's name to be placed on the ballot in this state. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 5, Part 2.

Economic and Community Development - As introduced, requires the development of a logo or seal to promote products and goods, other than agricultural products, made in Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7.

Attorneys at Law - As introduced, requires an attorney who has admitted or is found in a post conviction proceeding to have rendered ineffective assistance of counsel to repay funds received, if any from the state, into the state treasury. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 16 and Title 40.

Financial Disclosure - As introduced, broadens notification authority of the registry to permit the registry to notify each member of the general assembly of requirements for filing disclosure statements by sending the notice to a members legislative email address, if the member supplies the email address as a preferred means of receiving such notice.   - Amends TCA Title 2.
Political Parties - As introduced, allows recognized minor party to remain recognized for four years; lowers signature requirement to become recognized minor party. - Amends TCA Title 2.
subjects: Campaign Finance and Election Issues|Federal, State, and Local Relations

title: Mental Health, Dept. of - As introduced, requires the department to design its structured information system in a manner that protects any confidential information about a service recipient, including any personally identifiable information.  - Amends TCA Title 33.
Highway Signs - As introduced, names bridge on S.R. 62 in Morgan County in honor of the late SFC Scott James Brown, U.S. Army. -
Constitutional Conventions - As introduced, enacts the "Uniform Limited Convention Act." - Amends TCA Title 3.

Special License Plates - As introduced, imposes identical registration fee for special purpose license plates issued to enlisted members of the National Guard and cultural license plates issued to active members of the United States military and military reserves. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 2.

Business and Commerce - As introduced, requires a health, housing and educational facility corporation to file with the state board of equalization a report listing leased properties and details of the lease and payment in lieu of tax (PILOT) agreements by October 20 instead of October 15. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 101, Part 3.

Taxes, Real Property - As introduced, requires the governing body to certify the tax rate after 20 days instead of 15 days from the date the proposed certified tax rate and supporting calculations are received by the executive secretary of the state board of equalization. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5 relative to levy of property taxes.
subjects: Housing and Property|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Education - As introduced, urges that the course of instruction in public schools include instruction on the state symbols, their importance and meanings and appropriate display of the state flag. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
Sentencing - As introduced, includes murder as the result of gang activity as an aggravating factor for purposes of death penalty sentencing. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 2.

Criminal Procedure - As introduced, permits person whose first offense is a Class B or C misdemeanor, is granted probation, successfully completes probation and has not been convicted of any other of offense for five years to have all public records of the conviction expunged. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 32, Part 1.
Capital Punishment - As enacted, adds random killings to the list of aggravating factors for imposition of the death penalty. - Amends TCA Section 39-13-204.

Ethics - As introduced, prohibits ownership or financial interest in, or employment by, a privatization enterprise by specified public officials and employees. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10, Part 1; Title 3, Chapter 6; Title 8, Chapter 50, Part 5; Title 12, Chapter 4, Part 1 and Title 12, Chapter 3, Part 1.

Consumer Protection - As introduced, requires sellers of products or services pursuant to automatic renewal or continuous service agreements to disclose specific aspects of agreement and obtain consumer consent for automatic charges.  - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18.
Health, Dept. of - As introduced, creates the "Music Therapy Practice Act." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 63 and Title 68, Chapter 1.

Education - As introduced, requires LEAs placed in Corrective Action to extend the school term by 10 instructional days and if subsequently placed in Restructuring 2 to extend the school term by an additional 10 instructional days.   - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

Public Records - As introduced, requires chief administrative officer of custodial agency to sign records request response form if furnishing records will take more than 10 days and include statement as to why it will take more than 10 days. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5.

Election Laws - As introduced, allows person voting in county where no driver license station is located and who does not possess photographic identification to execute affidavit of identity at county election commission office during early voting and have digital photograph taken there prior to being able to vote. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7, Part 1.
Criminal Offenses - As introduced, includes drug felonies under felony murder. - Amends TCA Section 39-13-202.
Education - As introduced, creates the access to educational technology program, which provides laptop computers to all seventh and eighth grade students at participating LEAs. - Amends TCA Title 49.

State Government - As introduced, broadens preference for Tennessee products and services by allowing for 5 percent cost differential. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3, Part 8; Title 12, Chapter 4, Part 1 and Title 12, Chapter 4, Part 8.
Alcohol Offenses, Sales - As introduced, creates Class A misdemeanor for sale of beverages with alcohol content of greater than 60 percent by volume. - Amends TCA Title  39 and Title 57.

Education, Higher - As introduced, requires postsecondary institutions authorized to operate in Tennessee under the Postsecondary Education Authorization Act to make certain financial disclosures to prospective students who will finance all or part of their education with military benefits.   - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

Telecommunications - As introduced, creates certain requirements to protect cell phone users from the unauthorized intrusion of cell phone companies into the users' personal information stored on their phones.  - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 6 and Title 40, Chapter 6.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, creates offense of manufacturing, selling or possessing a controlled substance analogue and punishes offense the same as the controlled substance for which it is an analogue. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

Manchester - As introduced, subject to local approval, revises charter to have elections for the county legislative body and school board coincide with general August election and to declare a vacancy in the office of alderman when the person qualifies as a candidate for election to the office of mayor. - Amends Chapter 74 of the Private Acts of 2005.

Education - As introduced, requires a virtual public school to be closed, if the school, establisher, operator or manager fails to meet certain accountability and fiscal requirements.   - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 16.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, establishes K-12 Teacher Compensation Commission. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 5.

Traffic Safety - As enacted, requires members of the highway patrol investigating motor vehicle accidents on interstates to note on the accident report whether physical barriers are present at the site of the accident. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10.

Clerks, Court - As enacted, authorizes certain counties to levy a $1.00 litigation tax on each petition, warrant and citation to fund victim-offender mediation centers and initiatives. - Amends TCA Title 16, Chapter 20, Part 1.

Public Health - As introduced, requires the department of health to develop and implement a program to provide colorectal cancer screenings for uninsured individuals between ages 50 and 64 and for any other uninsured individuals determined to be at high risk for developing colon cancer; requires health insurance companies to cover colorectal cancer screenings. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 68.

Local Government, General - As introduced, permits any municipality in the state to adopt child curfew ordinances upon majority vote of the municipal governing body. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 17.

Education, Higher - As introduced, defines "Tennessee resident" for purposes of tuition paid to public institutions of higher education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7; Title 49, Chapter 8 and Title 49, Chapter 9.

Education - As introduced, clarifies that teachers are not prohibited from participating in religious practice, including those with a student organization, if the participation is in connection with an event not held on campus. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 80.

Education, Higher - As enacted, exempts the UT board of trustees and board of regents from the requirement that a physical quorum be present at the location specified in the notice of a meeting as the location of the meeting in order to allow participation by electronic or other means of communication for the benefit of the public and the governing body in connection with any meeting authorized by law. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1.

Election Laws - As introduced, requires a voter to present qualified photographic identification before voting; voters without proper identification shall be allowed to cast provisional ballots. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7, Part 1.

Traffic Safety - As introduced, prohibits a state or local governing body from installing or maintaining surveillance cameras to enforce speed limits after July 1, 2012.  - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

Education, Higher - As enacted, requires that an application for a position of chief executive officer of a public institution of higher education, materials submitted with an application, letters of recommendation or references concerning an applicant, and any other records or information relating to or arising out of the process of searching for and selecting an individual for a position of chief executive officer of a public institution of higher education be treated as confidential and not open for public inspection, if the records could be used to identify a candidate for the position; enacts other provisions regarding information for such candidates. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1.
Charitable Solicitations - As introduced, requires 25 percent of the proceeds collected by charitable organizations for veterans be donated to veterans. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 101, Part 5.

Mental Illness - As introduced, permits county with mental health facility, hospital or resource center in it to enter into annual agreement with another county to transport persons from the hospital to the original county for a flat rate or per person fee rather than billing for costs each trip. - Amends TCA Section 33-6-901.

Emergency Communications Districts - As introduced, requires approval of courses of instruction in CPR and AED by the commissioner of health in addition to the emergency medical services board. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 140, Part 4.

Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As introduced, requires the executive committee of the state veterans' homes board to file quarterly reports concerning the operations of each state veterans' nursing home with the chairs of the government operations committee of the senate and the house, in addition to the present law requirement that such reports be filed with the fiscal review committee. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 58.

Taxes, Sales - As introduced, requires the commissioner of revenue to make a study of the fairness of the present distribution of local sales taxes in counties of population less than 300,000 that have more than one school district in meeting the needs of funding the school districts.   - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 49 and Title 67, Chapter 6.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes
