title: State Government - As enacted, revises various provisions regarding the Tennessee Local Development Authority and its authority to allocate on behalf of the state the portion of the "national qualified energy conservation bond limitation," as defined in federal law, that is allocated to the state. - Amends TCA Title 4.

Special License Plates - As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked license plates honoring Tennessee's veterans; allocates 50 percent of revenues produced from the sale thereof to state veterans' homes in Bradley and Montgomery counties. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Water - As introduced, requires manufacturers of products added to public water systems to verify the safety of such products to the system operators. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 1, Part 1 and Title 68, Chapter 221, Part 7.

Open Meetings - As introduced, ensures that any member of a governing body who participates in a meeting by electronic or other means of communication timely receives copies of all documents distributed and discussed at the meeting. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 44, Part 1.

Taxes, Inheritance Gift - As enacted, increases the maximum allowable exemption from the inheritance tax incrementally over next three years; eliminates the inheritance tax beginning in 2016. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8.

title: Taxes, Sales - As enacted, reduces the state sales tax on food and food ingredients from 5.5 percent to 5.25 percent. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

title: Maury County - As introduced, subject to local approval, sets the number of members of the Maury County Board of Education at 11 to be elected from school districts coextensive with the county commission districts; sets staggered four-year terms for such school board members.  - Repeals l Chapter 44 of the Private Acts of 1973.

Rutherford County - As introduced, subject to local approval, requires that the boundaries of the road districts of the Highway Commission conform to those of the County Commission districts established by 2012 redistricting; increases, from four to six years, the next term of office for road commissioners elected from road districts two and seven. - Amends Chapter 55 of the Private Acts of 1951; as amended.

Rutherford County - As introduced, subject to local approval, adjusts election cycle for county road board districts to coincide with elections for school districts. - Amends Chapter 55 of the Private Acts of 1951, as amended.

Rutherford County - As introduced, subject to local approval, reapportions, after the 2010 U. S. census, Rutherford County school districts. - Amends Chapter 454 of the Private Acts of 1968; as amended.

Election Laws - As introduced, requires citizenship status to be proven prior to registration to vote and requires certain procedures to ensure identity and citizenship status prior to voting. - Amends TCA Title 2.

Hamblen County - As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the charter of Hamblen County to allow the clerk of the circuit and general sessions court to be the clerk of the juvenile court, while maintaining the business of the juvenile court separate from the circuit and general sessions court. - Amends Chapter 337 of the Private Acts of.
Franklin - As introduced, expands power of the City of Franklin regarding the construction, maintenance, and repair of public sidewalks.  - Amends Chapter 79 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.

Franklin - As introduced, subject to local approval, prohibits candidates from running for more than one elective office in City of Franklin elections. - Amends Chapter 79 of the Private Acts of 1903; as amended.
Franklin - As introduced, subject to local approval, clarifies charter provisions involving the office of Vice-Mayor in the City of Franklin. - Amends Chapter 79 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.
McMinn County - As introduced, subject to local approval, dissolves the Woods Memorial Hospital District Board of Trustees in McMinn County. - Repeals l Chapter 13 of the Private Acts of 1965.

Elkton - As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the charter of the City of Elkton relative to the requirements for becoming chief of police and to correct a typographical error.   - Amends Chapter 431 of the Acts of 1907; as amended by Chapter 49 of the Private Acts of 2007.

Sequatchie County - As introduced, subject to local approval, divides Sequatchie County into nine school districts, which are identical to the county legislative body districts, rather than eight districts. - Amends Chapter 83 of the Private Acts of 2002.
Greeneville - As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the charter to provide for a city administrator and for the appointment of a city judge. - Amends Chapter 563 of the Acts of 1903.
Criminal Offenses - As introduced, increases the fine for assaulting a sports official of a school sponsored activity to $5,000. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1.

Oakdale - As introduced, subject to local approval, reduces size of Town of Oakdale board of aldermen from three to two beginning with the August 2014 election; requires the board to designate one board member as vice-mayor. - Amends Chapter 587 of the Private Acts of 1911; as amended and rewritten.
Bradley County - As introduced, subject to local approval, establishes a common-docket system in Bradley County. - Amends Chapter 17 of the Private Acts of 1955; as amended.

Dickson County - As introduced, subject to local approval, decreases, from 12 to six, the number of county highway commissioners beginning in the August 2014 regular election; requires commissioners be elected from the same districts as county school board members. - Amends Chapter 53 of the Private Acts of 1985.

Maury County - As introduced, subject to local approval, authorizes remainder of proceeds from county wheel tax after all indebtedness for road paving projects has been paid, to be paid into the highway capital projects fund for highway and bridge capital projects. - Amends Chapter 119 of the Private Acts of 1995.

Maury County - As introduced, subject to local approval, authorizes remainder of proceeds from county wheel tax after all indebtedness for road paving projects has been paid, to be paid into the highway capital projects fund for highway and bridge capital projects. - Amends Chapter 119 of the Private Acts of 1995.
Weakley County - As introduced, subject to local approval, abolishes the Weakley County highway commission. -

Rutherford County - As introduced, subject to local approval, removes requirement that persons be issued wheel tax decals for display on license plates as evidence of having paid such tax. - Amends Chapter 329 of the Private Acts of 1970; as amended.

Morristown - As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the selection procedure for vacancies and expired terms of commissioners of the Board of Electric Light and Waterworks. - Amends Chapter 392 of the Acts of 1901; as amended.

Morristown - As introduced, subject to local approval, expands authority and supervision of the Board of Electric Light and Waterworks, with prior approval of city council, to include sewer in addition to telecommunications, natural gas, ISP and CATV services.  - Amends Chapter 392 of the Acts of 1901; as amended.

Rutherford County - As introduced, subject to local approval, removes requirement that persons be issued wheel tax decals for display on license plates as evidence of having paid such tax. - Amends Chapter 329 of the Private Acts of 1970; as amended.

Mental Illness - As enacted, revises provisions governing the transportation of certain persons to mental health facilities in regard to responsibility and costs. - Amends TCA Title 33, Chapter 6, Parts 4 and 9.

Harriman - As introduced, subject to local approval, moves the city election to coincide with the August general election beginning in 2014; extends the two-year term of office of officials elected in the June 2011 election to the first day of September 2014 following the August election. - Amends Chapter 49 of the Acts of 1891; as amended.

Jackson - As introduced, subject to local approval, amends charter relative to the seeking of multiple positions in a single municipal election, vacancy and removal of council members, adoption of a redistricting ordinance, city judge and city court clerk salaries, and other charter revisions. -
Williamson County - As introduced, subject to local approval, creates a special juvenile court in Williamson County pursuant to the Juvenile Court Restructure Act of 1982. - Amends Chapter.

Hamilton County - As introduced, subject to local approval, increases the board of the Chattanooga-Hamilton County Hospital Authority from 11 to 13; the legislative delegation is to appoint the two additional members upon the recommendation by the Hamilton County Medical Society. - Amends Chapter 297 of the Private Acts of 1976.
Overton County - As introduced, subject to local approval, enacts a hotel/motel tax. -

Harriman - As introduced, subject to local approval, moves the city election to coincide with the August general election beginning in 2014; extends the two-year term of office of officials elected in the June 2011 election to the first day of September 2014 following the August election. - Amends Chapter 49 of the Acts of 1891; as amended.

Lexington - As introduced, subject to local approval, revises various provisions of the charter related to residency of department heads; gives control and supervision of the electric plant to the board of mayor and aldermen instead of an electric utility board.   - Amends Chapter 402 of the Acts of 1901; as amended and rewritten.

Cookeville - As introduced, subject to local approval, incorporates by reference for Cookeville officers and employees present general law language related to conflict of interest and contracting. - Amends Chapter 223 of the Private Acts of 1961.
Portland - As introduced, updates charter for the City of Portland. - Amends Chapter 288 of the Acts of 1905; as repealed.

Special License Plates - As introduced, specifies that no registration fee will be charged for special purpose license plates issued to enlisted members of the National Guard, cultural license plates issued to active members of the United States military and military reserves, and plates issued to Tennessee State Guard and the United States reserve forces. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 2.

Local Education Agencies - As introduced, prohibits an LEA or school within an LEA from conditioning a student's attendance at an activity or trip upon whether the student made a lump sum contribution to the school or sold a required amount of fund-raising products or merchandise. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 1.
Atoka - As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the town charter. - Amends Chapter 373 of the Private Acts of 1911; as amended.
Monroe County - As introduced, subject to local approval, reapportions, after the 2010 U.S. census, Monroe County school districts. - Amends Chapter 117 of the Private Acts of 1963.

Taxes, Hotel Motel - As introduced, subject to local approval, creates Tourism Board for Blount County, Alcoa and Maryville and allocates portion of the Blount County occupancy tax to such board. - Amends Chapter 102 of the Private Acts of 1979; as amended.

title: Johnson County - As introduced, subject to local approval, repeals the road commissioners. -
Washington County - As introduced, creates a new general sessions court and county attorney position for Washington County. -

Spencer - As introduced, subject to local approval, moves the city election to coincide with the November general election beginning in 2014; extends the four-year terms of office of officials elected in the May 2009 election to the first Tuesday in November 2014, and the terms of officials elected in the May 2011 election to the first Tuesday in November 2016. - Amends Chapter 179 of the Private Acts of 1923; as amended.

Cookeville - As introduced, subject to local approval, revises authority of the board of trustees of the Cookeville Regional Medical Center to take certain actions subject to approval of the city council; removes limitation that defines the hospital campus as land owned by the City of Cookeville regardless of where that land is located. - Amends Chapter 49 of the Private Acts of 1999; as amended.

Millington - As introduced, subject to local approval, rewrites the charter; creates the position of "city manager" to be appointed by and serve at the pleasure of the board of mayor and aldermen.  - Amends Chapter 238 of the Acts of 1903.

Sumner County - As introduced, subject to local approval, creates the "Financial Management Modernization System of the County of Sumner, Tennessee of 2012"; repeals Chapter 113 of the Private Acts of 2002, in certain circumstances. -

Sumner County - As introduced, subject to local approval, creates the "Financial Management Modernization System of the County of Sumner, Tennessee of 2012"; repeals Chapter 113 of the Private Acts of 2002, in certain circumstances. -

Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As introduced, authorizes a sales and use tax exemption on purchases made by any veteran with a 100 percent permanent total disability. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

Westmoreland - As introduced, subject to local approval, specifies that persons elected as mayor and aldermen be installed into office on the first day of December rather than the first day of January, beginning with November 2012 and 2014 elections. - Amends Chapter 306 of the Private Acts of 1951.

Bluff City - As introduced, subject to local approval, revises method for filling vacancies on board of mayor and aldermen; allows for recall elections of mayor and aldermen. - Amends Chapter 24 of the Private Acts of 1997; as amended.

Scotts Hill - As introduced, subject to local approval, sets 30-day residency requirement to vote in the municipal election; authorizes property rights voting limited to one person per parcel. - Amends Chapter 105 of the Private Acts of 2004.

Oliver Springs - As introduced, subject to local approval, moves the date of the city election to coincide with the November general election; extends the four-year terms of office of the mayor and councilmen elected at the regular city election held in June 2009 and the councilmen elected at the regular city election held in June 2011 to expire on the first Thursday in November in 2013 and 2015 respectively. - Amends Chapter 247 of the Acts of 1905; as amended and rewritten.

Shelby County - As introduced, subject to local approval by both the City of Memphis and Shelby County, changes the name of the Memphis and Shelby County Convention Center to the "Memphis Convention Center," changes the name of the commission to the "Memphis Convention Center Commission" and provides for the appointment of the commissioners solely by the Mayor of the City of Memphis. - Amends Chapter 420 of the Private Acts of 1917.
Clarksville - As introduced, subject to local approval, rewrites the charter. - Amends Chapter 252 of the Private Acts of 1929; as amended.

Lake County - As introduced, subject to local approval, reduces number of school districts from four to three; increases Lake County board of education from eight members to nine members. - Amends Chapter 119 of the Private Acts of 2002.

Lake County - As introduced, subject to local approval, restructures Lake County highway commission by increasing the number of highway commission districts from two to three, to be coextensive with the county commission districts. - Amends Chapter 262 of the Private Acts of 1980, as amended.

Transportation, Dept. of - As introduced, revises duties of the commissioner to require the estimated dollar amount needed to implement the long-range and coordinated statewide transportation plan be reported to the general assembly every year or more frequently as the commissioner may determine. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 54.

Highways, Roads and Bridges - As introduced,  requires the chief administrative road supervisor to file a complete inventory of all machinery, equipment, tools, supplies, and materials with the county legislative body and the county mayor within 75 days after taking office instead of 60 days, and thereafter to file a revised current inventory by September 1 of each year. - Amends TCA Title 54.

Public Contracts - As introduced, indexes to the consumer price index as published by the U.S. bureau of labor statistics amount of contracts in excess of $100,000 for public work which require a 25 percent bond of the contract price be executed. - Amends TCA Title 12.
Safety - As introduced, deletes repealed citation from the records disclosure act and clarifies that highly restricted personal information shall not be sold to any person. - Amends TCA Title 55.
Tort Liability and Reform - As introduced, enacts the Jobs Creation Lawsuit Reform Act. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 22; Title 24; Title 28; Title 29; Title 47 and Title 63.
Criminal Offenses - As enacted, creates Class A misdemeanor offenses regarding drawing and filing of deeds without actual ownership of property. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title  66.

Disabled Persons - As introduced, extends the time period that a permanent disabled parking placard is valid from two to five years and adjusts fee from $3.00 to $7.50. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 21.
Psychologists - As introduced, authorizes psychologists with certain training to prescribe medicines to patients. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 53; Title 63 and Title 68.

Courts - As enacted, provides that any revenue generated by county litigation tax for victim-offender mediation shall be used for the purpose of victim-offender mediation or other community mediation matters. - Amends TCA Title 16, Chapter 20, Part 1.

Taxes, Business - As introduced, authorizes department of revenue to contract with private entities, in addition to present authority to contract with county or municipality officials, for collection of delinquent business taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 7.

title: Taxes, Personal Property - As introduced, removes loan companies and cemetery companies from requirements of intangible personal property taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 11.
subjects: Housing and Property|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Highways, Roads and Bridges - As enacted, establishes presumptions of proximate cause of death, injury, or damage for certain motor vehicle accidents occurring within a construction zone; establishes immunity from claims for personal injury, property damage, or death arising from certain department of transportation projects. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 42; Title 12, Chapter 4; Title 29 and Title 54.

Drugs, Over the Counter - As enacted, creates Class A misdemeanor of producing, manufacturing, selling or offering to sell any product containing any of six listed synthetic derivatives or analogues of the Schedule I controlled substance methcathinone. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

Firearms and Ammunition - As introduced, authorizes certain persons over 21 to carry a firearm without a permit; provides endorsements on driver licenses of persons who obtain a handgun carry permit; makes permanent the issuance of a handgun carry permit. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17 and Title 55, Chapter 50.

Firearms and Ammunition - As introduced, authorizes certain law enforcement officers and military personnel to carry weapons on public colleges and universities. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

Firearms and Ammunition - As introduced, authorizes full-time faculty at a public college to carry a firearm on such campus if they have a handgun carry permit. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

Taxes, Real Property - As introduced, revises property tax freeze income limit reference of census data from the most recent decennial census to estimates in the year following the most recent federal census. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-705(f).
subjects: Housing and Property|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Unemployment Compensation - As enacted, excludes periods of temporary total disability under the workers' compensation law from calculation of base period for purposes of unemployment compensation. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6 and Title 50, Chapter 7.

Eminent Domain - As introduced, provides that no more than 20 percent of property taken by eminent domain can be leased to private companies; grants right of first refusal to owner of land taken by eminent domain that is not converted in five years to the purpose for which it was taken. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 31; Title 13, Chapter 20 and Title 29.

Labor - As introduced, requires certain political activities by labor organizations be funded separately through voluntary donations of members and not through regularly collected dues. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 1.
Firearms and Ammunition - As introduced, requires that all weapons seized as contraband that are not used in law enforcement be sold in a public sale. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

Criminal Procedure - As enacted, provides that venue for the prosecution of the offense of promotion of methamphetamine manufacture is proper in any county in which a drug or chemical used to produce meth or an immediate meth precursor is purchased. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, creates the Class C felony offense of endangering a child through the manufacture of methamphetamine which is initiating the manufacture of meth in a residence in which a child under 14 is located or within 200 feet of such a residence. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

Veterans - As introduced, allows veterans to use state park facilities free one day a month instead of once a year; allows commissioner to offer discounted rates to veterans all the time, not just during off season. - Amends TCA Title 11, Chapter 3 and Title  58, Chapter 3.

Military - As introduced, authorizes public employees who are in the military to use five days of sick leave in lieu of annual leave after the employee has received 20 working days of compensation so the employee does not have to take leave without pay when called to military duties. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 33, Part 1.
Highway Signs - As enacted, names bridge in Grand Junction in honor of Dr. N.H. Edwards. -
Highway Signs - As enacted, names bridge in Somerville in honor of Colonel Will Rhea Winfrey, United States Army, Retired.  -

Highway Patrol - As enacted, authorizes a highway patrol member in good standing that retires because the member met the mandatory retirement age but didn't have 20 years of service to keep his badge and weapon and to receive a retired commissioned card. - Amends TCA Section 4-7-110.
Law Enforcement - As introduced, requires training of law enforcement officers introducing evidence of speed or driver conduct detected by automated devices. - Amends TCA Section 24-7-124.
Highway Signs - As introduced, designates segment of State Highway 109 in Sumner County as "Tommy Marlin Highway." -

Veterans - As enacted, extends property tax relief to the surviving spouse of a soldier whose death results from being deployed, away from any home base of training and in support of combat operations, if the surviving spouse does not remarry; solely or jointly owns the property for which tax relief is claimed; and uses the property for which tax relief is claimed exclusively as a home. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-704.

Judgments - As introduced, extends the time in which a foreign judgment may be enforced from 30 days to 40 days after the date a summons has been served upon the judgment debtor. - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 19; Title 20; Title 21; Title 25; Title 26 and Title 45.
Education - As enacted, states that a parent, guardian or other person who has control of a truant student commits educational neglect. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 30.

Education - As enacted, states that attendance laws apply to remedial instruction for students who are determined to require such instruction, including summer school and after school programs. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

Dentists and Dentistry - As introduced, requires the board of dentistry to report to the select committee on children and youth on the availability of dental services to children and the adequacy of the supply of pediatric dentists. - Amends TCA Title 63.
County Officers - As enacted, revises educational requirements for office of constable. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 10, Part 1.
Mental Illness - As enacted, creates a pilot project in Knox County for up to two years for a maximum of 10 patients at any given time to receive assisted outpatient treatment. - Amends TCA Title 33.

Intellectual & Developmental Disabilities - As introduced, clarifies that licensing of facilities for the intellectually and developmentally disabled shall be the sole responsibility of the department of mental health. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 33 and Title 71.
Health, Dept. of - As introduced, clarifies the legislative committees designated to receive information concerning TANF and Medicaid. - Amends TCA Title 68.

Senior Citizens - As introduced, requires the executive director of the commission on aging and disability to provide appropriate advice and support to the bureau of TennCare concerning the Long-Term Care Community Choices Act of 2008. - Amends TCA Title 71.

Health, Dept. of - As enacted, prohibits any licensed physician or osteopathic physician from performing or attempting to perform any abortion, including a medically induced abortion, or from prescribing any drug or device intended to cause a medical abortion, except in the physical presence of the pregnant woman; no drug or device intended to cause a medical abortion may be administered or dispensed to a pregnant woman except in the physical presence of her physician. - Amends TCA Title 63.
Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As introduced, allows creditable service for military service used to establish credit in another retirement system. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 34, Part 6.

Taxes, Inheritance Gift - As introduced, phases out the inheritance tax over a two-year period by reducing the amount of the tax by 50% for decedents dying in 2012, and for decedents dying in 2013 and thereafter, no inheritance tax applies. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8.

title: Motor Vehicles - As introduced, authorizes department of transportation to specify by rule unpaved county roads on which the use of off-highway vehicles will be permitted. - Amends TCA Title 55 and Title 70, Chapter 9.

Motor Vehicles - As introduced, defines the term "rickshaw" to exclude bicycles built for more than three persons and also to exclude any type of motorized scooter used by a disabled person. - Amends TCA Title 55.
Salaries and Benefits - As introduced, authorizes deduction of amounts owed to an employer from an employee under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 2, Part 1.

Cooperatives - As introduced, adds costs of certain printing equipment to current list of costs for which municipal electric plants may charge for production of certain maps as a public record. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 52.
Parks, Natural Areas Preservation - As enacted, designates Old Forest in Shelby County as a Class II Natural-Scientific Area. - Amends TCA Section 11-14-108.

Parks, Natural Areas Preservation - As introduced, specifies that senior citizen discounts offered at state golf courses apply to persons who are at least 55 years old. - Amends TCA Title 11, Chapter 3, Part 1.
Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As introduced, improves retirement benefits of certain Tennessee public employees. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 36.

Litter Control - As introduced, under certain circumstances, broadens the Class E felony offense of aggravated criminal littering to include littering in areas designated as no dumping zones. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 5.

Dickson County - As introduced, subject to local approval, grants the county legislative body broader authority to set compensation for county highway commissioners, rather than setting a specific compensation in the charter. - Amends Chapter 53 of the Private Acts of 1985.

Welfare - As introduced, prohibits persons convicted of a felony drug offense on and after July 1, 2011, from being eligible for receiving Families First benefits [TANF] and food stamps. - Amends TCA Title 71.

Special License Plates - As introduced, extends time for meeting issuance requirements of Fisk Jubilee Singers new specialty earmarked license plate until June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As enacted, prohibits charging a teacher with a day of leave for any day on which the teacher's school or school district is closed because of natural disaster, inclement weather, serious outbreak of contagious illness or other unexpected event. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 7.

Sales - As enacted, revises provisions governing reporting of aviation fuel sales; makes failure to file the aviation fuel sales report punishable by a civil penalty of $500 that may be abated by the commissioner instead of being punishable by a civil penalty in an amount set by the commissioner.

 - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4 and Title 67, Chapter 6.
Correction, Dept. of - As introduced, prohibits inmates from accessing personal identifying information of state residents or employees through prison work programs. - Amends TCA Title 41.

Local Education Agencies - As introduced, provides for re-establishment of elected office of school superintendent for counties or cities upon two-thirds vote of governing body; any such ordinance or resolution once approved is not operative until approved in an election; provides for qualifications of candidates. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-203 and Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 3.

Education - As introduced, requires state board of education to modify uniform high school grading system to allow for the awarding of pluses and minuses on letter grades. - Amends TCA Section 49-1-302; Section 49-6-407; Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9; Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1; Title 49, Chapter 8, Part 1 and Title 49, Chapter 9, Part 1.

Tobacco, Tobacco Products - As introduced, clarifies that the fact that an object has not yet been used or did not contain a controlled substance shall not be a defense to a charge that the object was possessed with the intention for use as drug paraphernalia. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 67.
Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As enacted, establishes certain requirements regarding netting agreements and qualified financial contracts. - Amends TCA Title 56.
Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, broadens the definition of NAIC to include any successor organizations. - Amends TCA Title 56.
Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, redefines "NAIC" to include any successor organization. - Amends TCA Title 56.
Insurance Companies, Agents, Brokers, Policies - As introduced, broadens the definition of NAIC-SVO to include any successor organization. - Amends TCA Title 56.
Abortion - As introduced, requires all physicians' offices that perform abortions to be licensed as ambulatory surgical treatment centers. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.

Workers Compensation - As introduced, provides that failure of a drug and alcohol test, or refusing the test, in a drug-free workplace makes the injured employee ineligible for workers' compensation benefits related to an injury; removes requirement for proximate causation. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6 and Title 50, Chapter 9.

Election Laws - As introduced, requires terms of county administrators of elections to expire when the commission's term expires and allows county election commissions to consider political party affiliation, knowledge and experience when hiring administrators; prohibits county from revising or restricting line items in the election commission's budget. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 12.

Welfare - As introduced, requires TANF recipients to be tested for illegal drugs; restricts eligibility for benefits for one year after testing positive for an illegal drug. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 12; Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 18 and Title 71.

Insurance, Health, Accident - As introduced, prohibits a health insurance carrier, and any subcontractor of the carrier, from making changes to policies, procedures, payment methodologies, or claims processing edits that have the effect of lowering negotiated rates unless agreed to by the hospital. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 10.

Uniform Commercial Code - As introduced, increases from 30 to 60 days the period in which a purchase-money security interest in goods, other than inventory or livestock, must be perfected in order to maintain its priority over conflicting security interests in the same goods. - Amends TCA Title 47.
Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As enacted, enacts the "Annual Coverage Assessment Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.
Hospitals and Health Care Facilities - As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Patient Safety and Quality Improvement Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11 and Title 63, Chapters 1 and 6.

Education, Curriculum - As introduced, prohibits the teaching of or furnishing of materials on human sexuality other than heterosexuality in public school grades K-8. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 10.
Alcoholic Beverages - As enacted, allows Woodlake Golf Club to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.
Courts - As introduced, specifies that it is the court's discretion whether to approve a transfer of structured settlement payment rights. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 26.
Fairs - As introduced, removes requirement that Tennessee state fair be held annually in Nashville. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 9, Part 1.

Obscenity and Pornography - As introduced, prohibits the possession, promotion, sale, distribution, transportation, purchase or exchange of material that includes an adapted or modified depiction of an identifiable minor engaged in sexual activity or simulated sexual activity that is patently offensive. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

Redistricting, Congressional - As introduced, requires compliance with state and federal constitutions as well as judicial decisions in passing congressional redistricting plan. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Municipal and County Issues

title: Newspapers and Publications - As introduced, requires the delivery of unsolicited newspapers and tabloids be suspended or terminated upon request of the owner or occupant of the property upon which such newspapers or tabloids are left. - Amends TCA Title 62.

Tennessee Wildlife Resources Agency - As introduced, requires executive director of agency to submit report to commission and governor by September 30 of each year; extends effective date of regulations for cooperative agreements with federal agencies from 30 to 45 days after publication. - Amends TCA Title 70.

Boats, Boating - As introduced, increases from 30 to 45 days the time in which persons cited for not wearing flotation device must provide proof of legal age; extends from 30 to 45 days time for proving age may be extended at discretion of officer. - Amends TCA Title 69.

Controlled Substances - As introduced, adds six stimulants that are compounds of methcathinone and used to make plant food and bath salts to list of Schedule I controlled substances. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

Medical Occupations - As enacted, requires health care practitioners licensed in the healing arts to affirmatively communicate proof of licensure to patients; expands list of practitioners required to post proof of licensure at their place of practice. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 1.

Solid Waste Disposal - As introduced, requires any permit issued by the department of environment and conservation to specify the types of waste a facility is prohibited from receiving for disposal or processing; prohibits any person from knowingly accepting for disposal or processing certain nuclear or radioactive materials in any landfill. - Amends TCA Title 68.

Orders of Protection - As enacted, allows the court to assess court costs, filing fees, litigation taxes and attorneys' fees against a petitioner seeking an order of protection if court does not issue or extend order of protection and makes certain other findings. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6.

Firearms and Ammunition - As introduced, authorizes full-time faculty and staff at public colleges and universities in Tennessee to carry handguns if not otherwise prohibited by law. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

Commerce and Insurance, Dept. of - As enacted, requires counsel for claimants reporting to the commissioner regarding medical malpractice claims to include information as to whether the health care provider received payment from TennCare; requires the commissioner to include such information in the annual report on medical malpractice claims. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 54.
Uniform Laws - As introduced, enacts the "Uniform Electronic Recordation of Custodial Interrogations Act." - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 38; Title  39 and Title  40.

Alcoholic Beverage Commission - As introduced, requires commission to suspend or revoke a license or permit instead of imposing a fine after the third violation of certain offenses within a two-year period. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 1.

Criminal Offenses - As enacted, imposes criminal and civil penalties upon persons who have hepatitis and who do not tell persons to whom it could be transmitted. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1.

Civil Procedure - As enacted, establishes provisions governing survival of certain rights of actions in regard to a surviving spouse who has abandoned the deceased spouse. - Amends TCA Title 20, Chapter 5.
subjects: Legal Issues|Civil Liberties and Civil Rights

title: Controlled Substances - As introduced, adds certain persons to the controlled substance database advisory committee; requires the committee to release certain database information to the Tennessee bureau of investigation and to a manager or prosecution unit conducting any investigation, adjudication or prosecution that involves a controlled substance. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 53, Chapter 10; Title 63 and Title 68.
Firearms and Ammunition - As introduced, authorizes eligible persons who own real property in Tennessee to obtain handgun carry permits. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-1351.

Taxes, Sales - As introduced, lowers tax rate on retail sale of food from 5.5 percent to 5 percent. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 16; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 61; Title 62; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.
subjects: Business and Consumers|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Taxes, Real Property - As introduced, increases annual income amount of certain elderly taxpayers who are eligible for property tax relief from $24,000 to $26,500 for tax years 2011 and thereafter. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 16; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 61; Title 62; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.
subjects: Housing and Property|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Revenue, Dept. of - As introduced, requires commissioner to report to comptroller any penalty waivers and taxpayers whom special investigations found violated criminal tax laws but were not reported to district attorney; requires comptroller to report annually to finance, ways and means committees waived penalties and amount of lost revenue from failing to prosecute; corrects incorrect code reference. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 14 and Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 8.

Traffic Safety - As introduced, prohibits a traffic citation in Knox County for not coming to a complete stop before turning right on red at certain intersections that is based solely on evidence from a traffic surveillance camera. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-198.
DUI Offenses - As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Administrative License Revocation Act." - Amends TCA Title 40; Title 50 and Title 55.

Veterans - As enacted, provides that a Tennessee Distinguished Service Medal may be awarded on behalf of the people of the state of Tennessee to an individual serving on active duty who has been killed in action, while engaging in certain military service. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 1 and Title 58, Chapter 3, Part 1.
Taxes, Exemption and Credits - As enacted, exempts not-for-profits owning and operating water companies from 3 percent gross receipts tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 4.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, requires certain prospective recipients of the Tennessee HOPE access grant to enroll in an eligible postsecondary institution no later than 28 months following graduation from high school. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 31; Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 8, Chapter 4; Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 49.

Disabled Persons - As enacted, requires that each business that provided disabled parking spaces prior to April 25, 2006, provide van-accessible parking spaces as soon as such provision is readily achievable; specifies that each business that provides only one specially marked parking space must convert such specially marked parking space into a van-accessible parking space when such conversion is readily achievable. - Amends TCA Section 55-21-105.

Alcohol Offenses, Motor Vehicles - As introduced, prohibits both the driver and passenger of a motor vehicle from consuming an alcoholic beverage or possessing an open alcoholic beverage container within the passenger area. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

State Employees - As enacted, requires longevity pay for eligible state employees who previously worked for health departments of home rule municipalities; establishes eligibility criteria. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 23.

Eminent Domain - As introduced, requires county and municipal legislative bodies to conduct a public hearing on necessity of condemning property and approve the exercise of eminent domain by a majority vote prior to any property being condemned and taken by such bodies. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 17.

Eminent Domain - As introduced, grants property owner, or a deceased owner's heirs or assigns, whose land is taken by eminent domain the right to repurchase such property if the condemning entity does not use the property for the purpose for which it was condemned or if the entity sells the property within 10 years of condemnation. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 17, Part 10.
Highway Signs - As enacted, designates "Gold Star - Blue Star Memorial Bridge" on U.S. 321 in Loudon County. -

Annexation - As enacted, requires municipality to notify affected property owners by mail of proposed extension of corporate limits under certain circumstances and requires publication in newspaper. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 51 and Title 6, Chapter 58, Part 1.

Licenses - As enacted, requires licenses issued by the department of commerce and insurance and licenses required to work as athlete agents, lobbyists, and K-12 public school teachers to be denied, suspended, or revoked, if student loans are not paid. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 49 and Title 56.

Anderson County - As introduced, subject to local approval, reallocates proceeds from the hotel/motel tax from the general fund for county general revenue, with 90 percent being allocated to the tourism fund and 10 percent, minus the trustee's commission, being allocated to the Anderson County chamber of commerce for economic development purposes. - Amends Chapter 193 of the Private Acts of 1990; as amended.

Public Records - As enacted, allows Anderson County register of deeds to redact social security numbers on recorded documents maintained on computers; also allows register of deeds to redact social security numbers on recorded documents at request of certain persons if practicable. - Amends TCA Section 10-7-515.
State Employees - As introduced, mandates that civil leave and compensation be provided to state employees when they are subpoenaed to testify at trial. - Amends TCA Title 24, Chapter 4.

Alcohol Offenses, Motor Vehicles - As introduced, prohibits both the driver and passenger of a motor vehicle from consuming an alcoholic beverage or possessing an open alcoholic beverage container within the passenger area. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

Criminal Procedure - As introduced, provides that court or jury may take into consideration the defendant's personal income and ability to pay when determining the amount of criminal fine to assess, if any. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 35, Part 3.

Domestic Violence - As enacted, authorizes magistrates to require a defendant to wear a global positioning monitoring system as a condition of bail in any domestic violence, stalking, aggravated stalking, or especially aggravated stalking case or in any case in which the defendant is in violation of an order of protection; the defendant must pay for the use of such system if able.  - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6; Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1; Section 39-17-315 and Title 40, Chapter 11, Part 1.

Education - As introduced, requires a written memorandum of understanding between a law enforcement agency and a LEA for school policing to include employment standards, hours of training, hours of work and assignment to specific schools; requires under such agreements that alternative schools be staffed by school resource officers who are full time. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 8, Part 1; Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 34 and Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 42.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As introduced, mandates loss of sick leave benefits by teachers who falsify medical information submitted to the sick leave bank trustees. - Amends TCA Title 49.
Highway Signs - As enacted, designates segment of S.R. 135 in Clay County as "Jerry Lee Denton Memorial Highway."  -

Traffic Safety - As introduced, prohibits information relative to violations captured by unmanned traffic surveillance cameras from being transmitted to credit reporting agencies. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-198.

Unclaimed Property - As enacted, requires the treasurer to hold any abandoned military medal until the owner or owner's heirs or beneficiaries can be identified for the return of the medal; allows the treasurer to appoint a custodian such as a veterans' organization to hold such medal; imposes other requirements related to such medals. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 29, Part 1.
Courts, Chancery - As introduced, extends jurisdiction to chancery courts for certain claims against governmental entities. - Amends TCA Section 29-20-305.
Courts, Chancery - As introduced, extends jurisdiction over claims against governmental entities or governmental entity employees to chancery courts. - Amends TCA Section 29-20-313.

Courts, Chancery - As introduced, provides that circuit and chancery courts shall have exclusive jurisdiction over claims filed against governmental entities, and provides that general sessions courts have concurrent jurisdiction with those courts. - Amends TCA Section 29-20-307.

Special License Plates - As introduced, extends time period for additional year for Memphis Rock 'n' Soul new specialty earmarked plates to meet initial issuance requirements. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Education, Curriculum - As introduced, requires high school curriculum to include courses on Tennessee history and the free enterprise system, as approved by the state board of education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 12.

Workers Compensation - As introduced, allows individuals to be exempt from the workers' compensation requirements if such individual is a member of a recognized religious sect or division and is an adherent of established tenets or teachings of such sect or division by reason of which such individual is conscientiously opposed to acceptance of the benefits provided by the workers' compensation laws. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.
Banks and Financial Institutions - As enacted, includes lineal descendants of original owners of private trust companies among those who may control a private trust. - Amends TCA Section 45-2-2001.
Appropriations - As introduced, effectuates additional employee longevity payments conditionally included in FY 2010-2011 appropriations bill. - Amends Chapter 1108 of the Public Acts of 2010.
Telecommunications - As enacted, adds state government telephone subscribers to do not call registry. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 4, Part 4.
Election Laws - As introduced, permits any registered Tennessee voter to vote absentee. - Amends TCA Title 2.

Capital Punishment - As introduced, specifies that if Tennessee's lethal injection protocol is held unconstitutional, defendants sentenced to death by lethal injection shall be executed by any lethal injection protocol upheld by the United States supreme court versus "any constitutional method." - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 2 and Title  40, Chapter 23, Part 1.

Insurance, Health, Accident - As introduced, revises certain provisions concerning payment of claims to non-governmental, nonprofit healthcare research institutions. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 23.
Insurance, Health, Accident - As enacted, mandates that group and individual insurance policies cover hearing aids for children covered by the policy. - Amends TCA Title 56.
Local Government, General - As enacted, authorizes local governments to establish community gardening programs. - Amends TCA Title 43, Chapter 24, Part 1.

Traffic Safety - As enacted, authorizes the use of flashing white and/or amber lights displayed to the front of a motor vehicle operated by an organ procurement organization or a person under an agreement with an organ procurement organization when transporting an organ for human transplantation. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 9, Part 4.

Medical Occupations - As enacted, removes the six-year limitation on the duration of non-compete agreements between a healthcare provider and an employing or contracting entity; applies the present law limitations on non-compete agreements for physicians to such agreements for osteopathic physicians. - Amends TCA Title 63.

Children - As enacted, directs the perinatal advisory committee within the department of health to study issues and policy options relating to hospital discharge and follow-up care procedures for premature infants born less than 37 weeks gestational age to ensure standardized and coordinated processes are followed as premature infants leave the hospital from either a Level 1 (well baby nursery), Level 2 (step down or transitional nursery) or Level 3 (neonatal intensive care unit) unit and transition to follow-up care by a healthcare provider in the community.  - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.

Election Laws - As introduced, permits persons to be listed on ballot as a candidate of a partisan organization if such organization has filed with the state election commission a petition with 2,500 signatures of registered voters and a copy of its bylaws. - Amends TCA Title 2.

General Assembly - As introduced, directs the general assembly to appoint a committee to review all federal laws and regulations for constitutionality; requires the committee to submit for a vote of the general assembly all federal laws and regulations it deems to be invalid under the Tennessee or federal constitutions. - Amends TCA Title 3.

Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, exempts manufacturers from certificate of compliance requirement when applying for retail license; allows manufacturers to sell certain merchandise. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 3.

Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, allows common carriers to accept for shipment and to transport the products of manufacturers to points within the state. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 2 and Title 57, Chapter 3.
Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, allows manufacturers to obtain license to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises. - Amends TCA Title  57, Chapter 3 and Title 57, Chapter 4.

Special License Plates - As introduced, extends time period for meeting initial issuance requirements for T.C. Thompson Children's Hospital new specialty earmarked license plates until July 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
Highway Signs - As introduced, "Historic Rock Castle", I-65 at Vietnam Veterans Parkway and State  Route 386 at Indian Lake Road. -
Pensions and Retirement Benefits - As introduced, adds emergency medical services personnel to mandatory retirement provisions. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 35 and Title 8, Chapter 36.

Animal Control - As introduced, prohibits the board of veterinary medical examiners from requiring a certified governmental animal control agency to have a full-time licensed veterinarian on staff in order to obtain a certificate to perform chemical capture. - Amends TCA Title 44 and Title 63.
Judges and Chancellors - As introduced, requires appellate judges be retained by 75 percent of persons voting rather than by a majority of voters. - Amends TCA Title 17, Chapter 4, Part 1.
Civil Procedure - As introduced, requires persons serving process to not have been convicted of a felony. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 21, Chapter 1.
subjects: Legal Issues|Civil Liberties and Civil Rights

title: Tort Liability and Reform - As introduced, restores sovereign immunity from liability for dangerous conditions on unpaved county roads where OHV use is permitted. - Amends TCA Section 29-20-203.

Prisons and Reformatory Institutions - As introduced, allows state building commission, attorney general and commissioner of correction to proceed on proposal or contract for correctional services if select oversight committee on correction, fiscal review committee and state and local government committees have not reported any comments in 30 days after receiving the proposal or contract. - Amends TCA Title 41, Chapter 24.

Public Health - As enacted, directs the genetic advisory committee to develop a program to screen newborns for critical cyanotic congenital heart disease; the screening program must make use of pulse oximetry and be developed by January 1, 2013. 
 - Amends TCA Title 68.
Highway Signs - As enacted,  designates certain segments of I-24 and I-75 in Chattanooga as the "Sgt. Tim Chapin Memorial Highway." - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Title 54, Chapter 21.

Civil Procedure - As introduced, removes judicial discretion to apportion costs based on equity and permits recovery of certain litigation costs by the successful party to certain civil actions. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 25; Title 27; Title 29, Chapter 11; Title 29, Chapter 34 and Title 29, Chapter 5.
subjects: Legal Issues|Civil Liberties and Civil Rights

title: Welfare - As introduced, authorizes drug testing for reasonable cause of persons who receive public assistance benefits; authorizes termination of benefits of persons testing positive for controlled substances who do not enroll in a drug treatment program. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 12; Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 18 and Title 71.

Abortion - As introduced, requires all physicians' offices that perform five or more abortions annually to be licensed as ambulatory surgical treatment centers. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.
Housing - As introduced, authorizes certain property to be classified as affordable housing rental property for tax assessment purposes. - Amends TCA Title 13 and Title 67.

Driver Licenses - As introduced, decreases from 30 to 20 the number of days following a conviction for a traffic violation that a commercial vehicle operator must notify employer of the conviction. - Amends TCA Title 54 and Title 55.

Safety, Dept. of - As introduced, requires department to notify TDOT's division of multimodal resources when any county is designated as a "citizen transportation area." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 10; Title 38; Title 39; Title 55 and Title 65.

Special License Plates - As introduced, requires department of revenue to study its administration of the new specialty earmarked plate program and report recommendations to reduce unnecessary administrative burdens to general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54; Title 55; Title 65 and Title 67.

Special License Plates - As introduced, authorizes issuance of hummingbird awareness new specialty earmarked plate; allocates 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to wildlife resources fund. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54; Title 55; Title 65 and Title 67.

Highways, Roads and Bridges - As introduced, removes provision providing that certain highway signs are paid from the highway fund subject to appropriation by the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 65.

Transportation, Dept. of - As introduced, revises duties of the commissioner to require the estimated dollar amount needed to implement the long range and coordinated statewide transportation plan be reported to the general assembly every year or more frequently as the commissioner may determine. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 47; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 65.

Highways, Roads and Bridges - As introduced, requires department of transportation to prepare a long-range transportation plan that includes state-controlled bridges and highway improvements that will be revised and submitted annually to the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 47; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 65.

Transportation, Dept. of - As introduced, urges commissioner to use wildflowers native to each grand division in new wildflower plantings. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 8; Title 54; Title 55; Title 65 and Title 67.

Special License Plates - As enacted, authorizes issuance of various special license plates; extends minimum order deadline for certain plates and redesignates certain plates. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Motor Vehicles - As introduced, increases the distance of the required unobstructed view of stopped vehicles upon any highway outside of a business or residential district from 200 feet to 300 feet. - Amends TCA Title 55.
Motor Vehicles - As introduced, extends sight distance required for certain parked vehicles from 200 feet to 250 feet. - Amends TCA Title 55.
Traffic Safety - As introduced, defines "surveillance camera" as used in the rules of the road. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 54 and Title 55.

Motor Vehicles, Titling and Registration - As enacted, clarifies that persons who reside in counties that do not require the display of a motor vehicle privilege tax decal on their license plates are not required to display any such decal. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title  54 and Title  55.

Public Contracts - As introduced, declares that bond requirement for all public contracts in excess of $100,000 is subject to change based on the consumer price index for the previous calendar year. - Amends TCA Title 12; Title 54 and Title 55.
Firefighters - As introduced, provides for certain reemployment rights for volunteer firefighters injured in the line of duty. - Amends TCA Title 50.

Transportation, Dept. of - As introduced, requires TDOT to provide supplemental report of progress of Tollway Act pilot program to general assembly by January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 12; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 67.

Special License Plates - As introduced, increases from three to five years moratorium between time plate has become obsolete and invalid until re-authorization by the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Highways, Roads and Bridges - As enacted, provides for the naming of certain roads and bridges in honor of certain specified persons and provides for the placement of other certain signage. - Amends TCA Title 54.

Special License Plates - As enacted, extends deadline for Civil War Preservation special license plates to meet minimum order requirement; authorizes issuance of Music City Alumni Chapter of Western Kentucky University; names segment of State Route 68 in Monroe County the "Bob 'Single Wing' Harrill Memorial Highway". - Amends TCA Title 54 and Title 55.

Motor Vehicles, Titling and Registration - As introduced, increases from three to five years the period of time that must elapse before an obsolete new specialty earmarked plate may be re-issued; specifies the type of plates that may not be re-issued in this period. - Amends TCA Title 54 and Title 55.

Transportation, Dept. of - As introduced, revises duties of the commissioner to require the estimated dollar amount needed to implement the long range and coordinated statewide transportation plan be reported to the general assembly every year or more frequently as the commissioner may determine. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 54.

Special License Plates - As introduced, provides for issuance of Cave Salamander special license plate; proceeds to be deposited in the wildlife resources fund. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title  54 and Title  55.

Highway Signs - As introduced, removes provision providing that certain highway signs are paid from the highway fund subject to appropriation by the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 65.

Special License Plates - As introduced, authorizes issuance of hummingbird awareness new specialty earmarked plate; allocates 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to wildlife resources fund. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54; Title 55; Title 65 and Title 67.
Special License Plates - As introduced, requires department of revenue to issue dealer plates with distinctive numbering system. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54; Title 55; Title 65 and Title 67.

Law Enforcement - As enacted, clarifies that money deposited in the police pay supplement fund can only be used for the payment of police pay supplements and such other payments as may be authorized by the police pay supplement statute. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 2 and Title 38, Chapter 8, Part 1.

Attorney General and Reporter - As introduced, decreases from 10 to five days the time for the supreme court clerks to deliver to the attorney general and reporter the supreme court opinions; decreases from 60 to 30 days the time for the attorney general and reporter to publish reports of such opinions. - Amends TCA Title 8.
Highway Signs - As enacted, designates bridge on S.R. 96 in Rutherford County as "James C. McKnight Bridge." -

Local Government, General - As introduced, prohibits counties and cities from imposing more stringent regulations on a lawfully operated private or nonprofit ambulance service than the regulations imposed on the county or city ambulance service. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title  6 and Title  7.
Physicians and Surgeons - As introduced, requires license for a facility to perform outpatient elective cosmetic medical procedures or treatment. - Amends TCA Title 63 and Title 68.

Local Government, General - As introduced, authorizes municipality or county that compensates counsel for county election commission to select that counsel instead of allowing the commission to select their own counsel. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 12, Part 1.

Teachers, Principals  and School Personnel - As enacted, requires the state board of education, in consultation with the department of education, to review current policies, rules and regulations pertaining to transitional licensure options and make recommendations relative to certain items. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Sexual Offenses - As enacted, provides that offense of soliciting the sexual exploitation of a minor can be prosecuted in this state against person located outside the state if the person solicited a law enforcement officer posing as a minor located within this state. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 5.
Criminal Offenses - As enacted, increases the penalties for discharging a firearm into a habitation. - Amends TCA Title 39.

Sentencing - As introduced, imposes higher classifications for certain violent crimes that are committed by three or more persons; sets the presumptive sentence for such crimes classified as Class A felonies at the maximum within the range; describes indictment parameters. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

Sentencing - As introduced, increases the penalty for possessing a firearm if the defendant has a prior felony conviction involving force or violence from Class E to Class C felony and from Class E to Class D if prior conviction is for drug offense. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title  40.

Prisons and Reformatory Institutions - As introduced, provides that the department of correction cannot incarcerate a prisoner in a private contract prison facility if the security classification for the prisoner is higher than the private facility is designed to house. - Amends TCA Title 41.

Malpractice - As introduced, prohibits recovery in a medical malpractice case for negligent diagnosis or treatment that decreases a patient's chances of avoiding death or any other adverse medical condition when the death or other adverse medical condition would have occurred even if the defendant had not been negligent. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 26.
Criminal Procedure - As introduced, eliminates post-conviction relief at the state level. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 16; Title 29; Title 38; Title 40 and Title 41.

Damages - As introduced, requires that any award of punitive damages in a civil action be divided equally with the plaintiff and with the state. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 20; Title 22; Title 23; Title 29; Title 33; Title 36; Title 39; Title 45; Title 47; Title 49; Title 65; Title 66; Title 68; Title 70 and Title 71.

Hawkins County - As introduced, subject to local approval, authorizes possession, storage, use, manufacture, transport, and sale of fireworks in Hawkins County. - Repeals Chapter 617 of the Private Acts of 1947.

Judges and Chancellors - As introduced, requires the popular election of state trial court judges, appellate court judges, and supreme court judges; makes other revisions for filling vacancies. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 5; Title 17, Chapter 1, Part 3; Title 17, Chapter 4 and Title 17, Chapter 1, Part 1.
Gas, Petroleum Products, Volatile Oils - As introduced, extends biodiesel manufacturers' incentive fund one additional year, until June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 3.
Traffic Safety - As introduced, prohibits the use of cell phones in school zones while warning lights are flashing. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

Food and Food Products - As enacted, requires that honey sold or offered for sale in Tennessee must be labeled as 100 percent pure or not pure; authorizes any person who suffers an injury or death, or an ascertainable loss of money or property, as a result of a violation of the bill to bring an action individually to recover actual damages. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 15 and Title 53.
Public Employees - As introduced, allows certain local governmental entities to enter into memoranda of understanding with employee representative organizations. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 50.

Tort Liability and Reform - As enacted, includes certain nonprofit entities in Davidson County which operate in conjunction with a metropolitan hospital authority within the definition of "governmental entity" in the Governmental Tort Liability Act. - Amends TCA Title 29.
Sexual Offenders - As enacted, authorizes public library directors to reasonably restrict the access of any person listed on the sexual offender registry. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title  40.

Education - As introduced, requires the consortium for cooperative innovative education to evaluate annually the need for legislation to assist in development of programs enabling high school students to earn college credit and to present its findings and conclusions in its annual report; changes date annual report is to be made from February 15 to January 15. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Lottery, Scholarships and Programs - As introduced, deletes two definitions that are not used in the lottery scholarship program and deletes an obsolete provision. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.
Mortgages - As introduced, provides additional exceptions to the Tennessee Residential Lending, Brokerage and Servicing Act. - Amends TCA Section 45-13-201(b).
Public Health - As enacted, requires the governor to designate one day each year in April as Autism Awareness Recognition Day. - Amends TCA Title 4.

Public Employees - As enacted, creates a presumption that HIV acquired by emergency medical worker was suffered in the line of duty unless the contrary is shown by preponderance of the evidence. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 51, Part 2.
Child Custody and Support - As enacted, makes various changes regarding child custody determination for a mobilized member of the armed forces. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6.

Child Abuse - As introduced, clarifies that before returning a severely abused child to the home where abuse occurred the court must find by clear and convincing evidence that the child will be safe from further abuse, including written findings of fact. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-130.

General Assembly - As enacted, abolishes certain statutorily created, legislative oversight committees and assigns certain responsibilities to certain legislative standing committees. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 9, Chapter 4; Section 36-5-112; Title 37; Section 39-13-530; Section 40-34-107; Title 41; Title 49; Title 50; Title 68 and Title 71.

Education - As introduced, extends the 25 percent tuition discount at state operated institutions of higher education that is presently available to children of full-time public school teachers and technology coordinators to children of public school support personnel who are employed at least 25 hours per week. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1.

Local Education Agencies - As introduced, abolishes all special school districts on July 1, 2012; requires municipal school districts and county school districts to attempt to consolidate by July 1, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 49.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, creates a Class B misdemeanor, punishable by a $2,500 fine and mandatory driver license suspension, for operating a vehicle with the intent to obstruct certain private or public property. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, creates a Class A misdemeanor, punishable by fine of $2,500, to knowingly produce, manufacture, distribute, sell, offer for sale, or possess with intent to produce, manufacture, distribute, sell or offer for sale any product composed of any amount of methcathinone that is not lawfully prescribed or approved by the FDA. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

Mental Health, Dept. of - As introduced, requires the chief officer of a hospital or other residential service facility to provide notice of admission to a recipient's attorney-in-fact acting under a durable power of attorney for health care; prohibits a treatment review committee from overriding a decision made by the attorney-in-fact. - Amends TCA Title 33.
Alcoholic Beverages - As enacted, revises the provision regarding the sale of alcoholic beverages in certain unincorporated areas.  - Amends TCA Title 57.

Alcoholic Beverages - As introduced, prohibits the sale of energy drinks at a business with a license or permit to serve or sell liquor by the drink; designates the offense as a Class A misdemeanor, punishable only by fine and suspension of an offender's license or permit to serve or sell liquor by the drink. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title  40 and Title  57.

Economic and Community Development - As introduced, requires the commissioners of economic and community development and revenue to conduct a joint study, to be presented to the general assembly on or before February 15, 2012, on the impact of the expiration of federal renewal community incentive programs on urban municipalities and the implementation of other economic development and tax incentive programs for urban communities. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 67.

Criminal Offenses - As introduced, adds to Schedule I controlled substances: 3,4-Methlyenedioxymethcathinone (Methylone); 3,4-Methylenedioxypyrovalerone (MDPV); 4-Methylmethcathinone (Mephedrone); 3-Methoxymethcathinone; 3-Fluoromethcathinone; and 4-Fluoromethcathinone. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

Criminal Procedure - As introduced, adds enlistment and active duty service in a branch of United States Armed Forces as a possible condition of pretrial diversion for a defendant who is 21 years or younger and eligible for military service. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
Taxes - As introduced, enacts the "Tax Cut and Job Creation Act." - Amends TCA Title 67.
Motor Vehicles - As enacted, prohibits a passenger whose feet are not on footpegs from being on motorcycle. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-164 and Section 55-9-303.
County Officers - As enacted, permits a county to pay the cost of obtaining and recording the bond required for constables. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 10, Part 1.

Taxes, Personal Property - As enacted, specifies that a personal property schedule may be amended only for certain reasons and that the failure of a taxpayer to receive the schedule would not excuse the taxpayer from filing the schedule by March 1. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.
subjects: Housing and Property|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Comptroller, State - As introduced, requires the comptroller to conduct a study of the statutory law and cases involving the manner in which delinquent property taxes are reported by the trustee and collected by delinquent tax attorneys. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.
subjects: Federal, State, and Local Relations|Budget, Spending, and Taxes

title: Public Funds and Financing - As introduced, specifies that the comptroller will serve as vice chair of school bond authority, in addition to serving as secretary; specifies authority may prescribe its rules and regulations and govern its proceedings as it deems advisable; specifies that a majority of authority constitutes a quorum and confirming vote of three members is required. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3.
Public Funds and Financing - As introduced, removes obsolete reference to the public deposits task force. - Amends TCA Title 9.

Zoning - As enacted, defines "quarrying" as the extraction, removal and mechanized processing of any mineral, including clay, stone, gravel, phosphate rock, metallic ore, limestone, marble, chert, sand, dimension stone and any other solid mineral or substance of commercial value, except coal and deep metal mining, found in natural deposits in the earth, for barter or sale for purposes of county and municipal zoning. - Amends TCA Sections 13-7-101 and 13-7-201.

Election Laws - As introduced, clarifies necessity, requirement and statutory responsibility of the county to fund all county election commission expenses including compensation of its employees and election officials, expenses incurred in holding elections, and all fees incurred due to the filing or defense of a lawsuit. - Amends TCA Section 2-12-109.

Motor Vehicles, Titling and Registration - As introduced, prohibits county clerk from registering or renewing registration if owner has parking tickets within such county that are more than 60 days past due. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

Election Laws - As introduced, requires all documents, petitions or papers filed to be examined by the appropriate election official prior to accepting the items to ensure accuracy and that filing deadlines have been met; if accepted then it is conclusively presumed that all requirements have been met and the document, petition or paper is timely filed. - Amends TCA Title 2.
Notary Public - As introduced, enacts the "Revised Uniform Law on Notarial Acts." - Amends TCA Title 8.
Education - As introduced, clarifies terms and policies associated with harassment, intimidation and bullying. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

Aircraft and Airports - As enacted, clarifies provisions for creation, operation and governance of certain regional airport authorities. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 9, Part 1 and Title 42, Chapter 3, Part 1.

Public Funds and Financing - As introduced, requires state treasurer to study current efforts of depositing state funds that provide specific assistance to eligible state depositories that are community banks, and recommend enhanced efforts to the senate and house finance, ways and means committees. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4.

Tennessee Wildlife Resources Agency - As enacted, authorizes TWRA to enter into partnership agreements with nonprofit organizations to promote agency goals and objectives including the development of marketing opportunities. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 1, Part 2 and Title 70, Chapter 1, Part 3.

Tort Liability and Reform - As enacted, removes a statutory reference to notice provisions of the Governmental Tort Liability Act that are no longer in existence; establishes certain immunity for local board of education and school official in regard to entry or use of school property by others outside of regularly scheduled school activities. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 20.

Environment and Conservation, Department of - As introduced, revises membership of the solid waste disposal control board, the water quality control board, and the air pollution control board. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 69.
Housing - As enacted, revises certain provisions of the "Neighborhood Preservation Act." - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 6.

Municipal Government - As introduced, transfers regulatory authority over municipality operating electric plant that provides cable, video programming, Internet or similar services to Tennessee Regulatory Authority for such services. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 52, Part 6.

Tennessee Student Assistance Corporation - As enacted, changes the number and qualifications of students, the selection process, and term length for appointment to the board of the Tennessee student assistance corporation. - Amends TCA Section 49-4-202.

Immigration - As introduced, enacts the "Lawful Immigration Enforcement Act." - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 29; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 49; Title 50; Title 55; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.

Election Laws - As enacted, revises the pilot project requirements for convenient voting centers in certain municipal elections; extends pilot project to be in Knox, Hamblen, Shelby and Rutherford counties. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 3.
